reviews.description: George was amazing! We took went out to the Willam Chris Winery for the day and had the very best time going there and coming home with George. He is literally the best, nicest, and most fun driver we've had and will only use his services when we do trips like this. Thanks George!

reviews.author: Candy B.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb are an amazing duo. Very personable and easy to work with. They aim to exceed your wildest wine tour expectations! The transportation (van) was very clean and well-taken care of. We had the van to ourselves on the couple's tour but it can easily fit a big party!  Booking a couple's wine tour on their website was super easy (and I'm sure it would be for big groups too)! The date availability, cost estimate, and customizability is spot-on. The moment you book, they send you a comprehensive list of wineries and distilleries (!!!) with rankings of the view + wine. They also have great options for add-ons, such as a charcuterie board or stopping by for lunch mid-wine tour. Love that.  There's no doubt I would choose and recommend 830 Elevated again for any future wine excursions in Hill Country. Thanks again, Brayden and Deb :)

reviews.author: Emily H.
reviews.description: WOW....Just WOW!!!!  We had so much fun celebrating my sisters bachelorette weekend in Fredericksburg and 830 Elevated Wine Tours exceeded all of our expectations!!!  Deb (co-owner and our tour guide) was absolutely AMAZING and she made sure that we had everything we needed!!!  Seriously can't wait to book again next time we are in Fredericksburg and we have already decided it needs to be a yearly trip for us!   They were so informative and helpful with picking out which vineyards would be best for us and answered all of my questions quickly and with helpful details and suggestions!!

reviews.author: Viviana V.
reviews.description: 840 were so easy to work with from website to actual tour. We had the most courteous tour guide Brandon! He was a gem and treated us well! Will book with them again!

reviews.author: Nicole Y.
reviews.description: We had the absolute BEST time with Brayden on our tour. From start to finish everything was so easy and customizable to what we were looking for while planning our annual girls trip. Prices are incomparable with Five Star treatment on a PRIVATE tour. Right after booking we got an email with a list of the area wineries and restaurants that had notes and ratings so we could choose where we wanted to go. This is a private tour so Brayden picked us up right in front of our Airbnb and we were off. We toured four wineries and he kept us on schedule but never rushing us. After the tours we opted for the night service so he dropped us off on Main Street so we could grab dinner, sing some karaoke and when ready to be picked up to end the evening just had to shoot him a text and he was there. We just cannot say enough good things about this company. Do not second guess - book with Brayden and Deb

reviews.author: Kim M.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb did a FANTASTIC job hosting our small girls group! They offer private tours for the same price most other charge to fill up a limo or bus. They were on time and very accommodating, went as far as going to buy a stool for my friend who has trouble getting up and down the steps to the van. The wineries they took us to were exactly what we asked for. We never felt rushed and they handled everything for us and we never had to lift a finger to do anything. I would 100% recommend them and will definitely be using them again!

reviews.author: Kristin D.
reviews.description: We had a group of 10 girls book a wine tour through 830 Elevated this past weekend, and I could not more highly recommend this company!! They made the trip so easy, worry-free, and fun! Brayden and Deb were super communicative and gave us a wide variety of wineries to choose from. We ended up going to Baron's Creek, Signor, and Augusta Vin. Deb was our tour guide and took care of absolutely everything and was such a joy to be around. If you are headed to Fredericksburg and wanting to visit the wineries, you won't regret choosing to book through 830 Elevated!!

reviews.author: Laura H.
reviews.description: I came across 830 when our bed and breakfast cancelled our room and wine tour reservation (due to remodeling) a month before our 10 year anniversary trip to Fredericksburg. I believe they were on the city website as a recommended tour, but also Google directed me to them. Either way, I am so glad it happened this way - our experience with 830 was indeed elevated!!! The customized tour that Deb set up with me over the phone was exactly what my husband and I wanted - a distillery, a brewery, and a winery that made you feel like you were in Napa. Without even knowing us, Deb helped picked the perfect places for us to enjoy. Communication up until the tour and the day of the tour was prompt and courteous, always with our best intentions in mind (example: Deb texted us and offered to pick us up even earlier than planned due to the heat at one of the outdoor locations). The drive in between locations was full of great conversation, and we were thankful they provided cold water for us. The van was immaculate and the drive was very comfortable - I didn't know the luxury that a private vs public tour would offer! Deb was so knowledgeable (she's a local, of course!) and so sweet with helping us newbies figure out what to do. Her service went above and beyond, and she made us feel like celebrities. It was an absolute pleasure to work with them - do yourself the best favor and book with them!!

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: We toured Fredericksburg with Brayden and he was very friendly, knowledgeable, and flexible with our requests. We were able to customize our winery stops which was not the experience we had previously with a different wine tour company. We spent the day with our group of four instead of getting shuttled around with strangers to fill seats (which I really prefer)! We requested a charcuterie board in the vehicle and Brayden picked it up while we were at one of our stops. We will definitely be back and use 830 Elevated for all of our future trips!

reviews.author: Pierre P.
reviews.description: Brayden and Deb were amazing! We will for sure book with them in the future. They made the whole wine touring and tasting experience so easy. Great conversations and excellent customer service. If you are going to go Wine Tasting in Fredericksburg, BOOK WITH THEM!

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: My friends planned a bachelorette weekend for me that included the wine tour with 830 wine tours. We had such a blast and everything was above and beyond our expectations! Each stop was beautiful and the tastings were great! This was the highlight Of our trip! The owners are super nice and accommodated all of our requests and even had good suggestions for things to do and place to eat! We absolutely love them!! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Jonathan Y.
reviews.description: I like their hustle. Wife and I wanted a private custom tour (because COVID). But the best we could find was a limo driver that would charge us almost what it would for 4 people. Then we found 830 Elevated. They're filling a niche most tour companies aren't by providing an affordable private tour option for couples. They were great. Small, young company. They don't have deep knowledge on wine like veteran companies but they are personable in that they also tour wineries themselves and can share their inputs.

reviews.author: Casey C.
reviews.description: The worst experience. Here's my story-   I booked with this company over a month in advance prior to my trip to Fredericksburg for my fiancé and I's anniversary, as well as his birthday. After booking, the company was very communicative for the first few days. After the first few days, I did not hear a word from them until the week of our trip. I had told them a month in advance which places we wanted to go. The week of, they inform us that Augusta vin is not taking people for reservations. Which was fine, we went ahead with the other vineyard they had suggested. We had booked for a Saturday. That Friday at 3:00AM, they had informed us of a change of driver due to a family emergency which we completely understood, and now that our pickup time had changed to 11:30AM instead of 1:30PM. I wake up to that email Saturday still understanding, and we changed our plans to be at the pickup destination by 11:30AM. We are waiting there over 15 minutes for them to show, and no one does. We call, leave voicemails, and still hear from no one. 30 minutes passed, they send a TEXT MESSAGE informing us they aren't showing up for the entire time and that we are on our own for the entire day. LEAVING OUR PLANS FOR THE ENTIRE DAY RUINED. Incredibly horrid communication from this company. DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY!!!! I seriously am understanding that situations happen in life, but they had guaranteed us a driver for the day regardless of what had happened. I was truly heartbroken to have not received a personal phone call from the company, instead they just send us a text that they are not coming. I have NEVER written a review for a company before, but this needed to be shared. We discussed the situation with multiple locals in the town, no one had ever heard of this company. Whatever you do, save your money and time.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: Super friendly service and great wines.  A nice place to hang out outside or in, and good pizza on Saturdays!!

reviews.author: Paige T.
reviews.description: OMG! My husband and I are making a road trip to Marble Falls during Covid and made a detour to this amazing winery! The service is 5 star! Allison took amazing care of us and Dan, the owner, gave us the history and was very congenial! Besides wine they distill and age vodka,  whiskey, and bourbon. I did wine tasting and my husband did whiskey tasting and of course,  we bought wine and vodka to take home with their signature wine glasses!! We so enjoyed our visit to the Thirsty Mule Winery! It is a must see and a place to stock up on all your wine needs! Not to mention their distilled and aged vodka, bourbon, and whiskey!! Check them out! It is worth your time!!

reviews.author: Anders N.
reviews.description: Let me tell you, I've been to so many wineries in the area surrounding Austin and this one by far is a true gem.  Do not judge this place by its exterior. Immediately when we came inside the tasting room we were met with a warm welcome. The menu here is deep and they have something for everyone here. Saturday's they have wood fired pizzas which we were told people come out here just for that. We will definitely be back for it!  We are in the middle of our tasting as I write this review and already I'm blown away by the Cabernet they have here. Beautiful and oaky; my first sip I just know I'm in trouble with this one! The Tempranillo has a wonderful nose to it and is nice and clean, easily could drink a bottle of this in a sitting. The Tannat was just lovely. Here are the stand outs though that we were pleasantly surprised with: Sweet Dreams, the port wine which is absolutely delicious and the Sparkling Muscadine (Sassy Mule) which is dangerously good! Fun fact, the Sparkling Muscadine is made with a local wild grape.  Amazing hospitality, zero pretentiousness, incredible wines, please visit this place!!! You're in for a real treat here.

reviews.author: Kasie M.
reviews.description: This is my husband and I's favorite winery in the area. The staff is very knowledgeable and nice and the owners are amazing people.   We have been wine club members for a couple years now and the Tannat is my nightly wine of choice!!

reviews.author: Tim Y.
reviews.description: I really wanted to enjoy this place more, because I love supporting local businesses, but it was just ok. Nice outdoor area with goats, donkeys and chickens and plenty of space for the kids to run around, but the whiskey and bourbon were very young and just didn't taste good. The women said the wine was average, but nothing amazing. The jalapeño margarita was good, but the Old Fashioned was the worst one I've ever had and couldn't drink more than half of it. 3 stars may even be stretching it, but since their local, I felt obligated. Truly a 2 star. ‍

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: A decent spot to stop and try a couple of the locally produced wines.  Another spot north of the Colorado that goes for the 'homey' approach to wine making and serving.  Pretty, family friendly atmosphere on the outside, with a photo-ready spot next to a life-sized fiberglass mule. (To my surprise the mule does not have a name yet.)   Inside, it looks like someone's house that's been converted to a tasting room.  That's a net plus, and there's a nice gift shop, but hopefully the management will get rid of the bright and ugly banks of fluorescent lights!  Service was fast, but the ladies behind the counter profess little knowledge about the wine and are surprisingly brusque, even while serving relatively few customers.  I've noticed this same critique from a couple other Yelp Reviews, making me wonder if this is just a personal style of theirs that's off-putting to some.  Regardless, it's oddly out of place in such a friendly area as Central Texas.  The wines are a mixed bag.  A chardonnay made from California grapes tastes surprisingly sharp and 'raw', but that may be the intent since it wasn't aged in oak.  The sweet blush is passable at best. However, the sparkling cranberry is excellent.  Worth a visit if you're in the area, but save room for the vastly superior Pillar Bluff and Pilot's Knob fare.  Some tips:  1) Watch for the turnoff from 183, it's pretty sharp and takes a downward jog!    2) The flights, which run $10 for 4 tastings, are half off on Wednesdays and Thursdays.  An excellent bargain all around.

reviews.author: Julia C.
reviews.description: Love all the outdoor space! Staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. The wood fire pizzas (I believe they only offer it on Saturday) were delicious, we had the brisket and pepperoni pizzas and it was the perfect amount to split between 4 people. Lovely gift shop, too! The wine is delicious and they have just about something for everyone including a stocked bar. Donkeys/mules and goats on the property are definitely a plus for the aesthetic. Will definitely be visiting often from now on!

reviews.author: Robyn G.
reviews.description: Really cool spot. I found it just by looking for a winery near I was. The wine is delicious and outside seating was relaxing.

reviews.author: Mikel K.
reviews.description: We drive into Austin quite a bit on 183 and finally decided to stop in when it was not over 100 degrees.  Typical Texas winery decorations and gift shop, however "Distillery" was added to their location recently.    We gave the distillery a shot, or tasting.  Of the 5 we tasted, none were remarkable.  If you like that "moonshine" taste, this is for you.  They've tried to infuse maple and peach into a couple of their distilled spirits, stir clear of those.  The shop was okay, typical winery gag signs, towels, Pinterest type stuff.  Quiet a few people were there enjoying the weather, which leads to this: Get More Waitstaff when it's busy.  Two ladies selling gift trinkets and doing a full bar of tastings is S L O W.  We couldn't get the person doing our tasting to come back and acknowledge us, so we dropped cash on the bar and walked out.

reviews.author: Robert P.
reviews.description: Love, love , love this beautiful winery and distillery. Saturday's are our favorite day  for the fresh, wood oven Pizza and live music. Love all the staff. So friendly. The Old Fashioned is excellent and every wine is a delight. Can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Ashley I.
reviews.description: I came here for the first time over the weekend with some out-of-town guests. I did enjoy the bottle of wine I bought, but the employees were not very helpful. I don't know much about wine, so I asked them to pick out the closest wine to Pinot Noir as that's usually what I drink. Now I at least know the difference between white wine and red wine, and was surprised that their response was for me to order a white wine...  The ambience is decent, but they are limited on their indoor seating which is a shame because I'm sure more people would come and enjoy the live music.

reviews.author: Molly E.
reviews.description: The only reason this winery deserves three stars in my book is because it is located semi-underground as it is built into the side of a cave.  You can get the feel of voyaging underground without having to pay an extortionist fee for this privilege. You will not be seeing the stalagmites and stalactites. Nor will you find a sleeping bat.  However, you can get a little buzzed and feel a lot of hometown love- although you might want to turn a blind eye (and ear) when they try to explain where their grape varietals are from, or when they try to up-sell you into their wine club.  Another neat feature is a glass-cased collection of old and unique wine openers. Think of this place as a grown-up quirky museum with a corkscrew twist and you will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: This winery opened up last week in Liberty HIll. A mere 18 minute drive north of Cedar Park, Thirsty Mule is bringing the wine country closer to home. The owners are the same owners as the popular Georgetown winery.   The building once was a home that was built in 1979 and before Thirsty Mule Owners got a hold of it, it sat empty for many years. The tasting room which is backed up to a cave is on a nice plot of land which backs up to a creek. The completely remodeled the building and now has a long bar, several tables for enjoying a glass of wine and a banquet room that can accommodate about 50. Outside they have lots of picnic tables shaded by tall trees.   The wine portfolio is well rounded. Currently they have 2 whites, 4 reds, 4 sweets and a dessert wine. We ordered a flight each which runs $10 for 4 tastings (2 ounce pours). You can also purchase a glass of wine for $7 or buy  bottle to enjoy on the property or to take home. Between the two of us we tried the Pinot Blanc, Cabernet, Merlot, Malbec, sweet blush (strawberry) and the dessert wine which is called sweet mule. My four favorites were the Pinot Blanc, Malbec, and Cabernet. The Pinot Blanc was fruit forward at first but has a dry finish. The Malbec had some spice to it, we liked this one enough that we bought a bottle. The Cabernet had hints of bell pepper both on the nose and by taste. The blush makes for a good patio sipper but a tad sweet for my liking.   They plan to have live music soon and the patio is dog friendly. We had a great time meeting Scott during our tasting and enjoyed the tasting. If you stop in make sure to peak out the windows to get a glimpse of the limestone "cave" and the etched in date from the original owner.

reviews.author: MICHELE V.
reviews.description: Pretty bad wine.  Nearly all of it.  I can't bring myself to go back.  I've gone to most of the pre-2007 wineries in Central Texas.  One star for the building.  The inside is really nicely laid out. One star for the impromptu musicians giving the patrons a nice selection of sounds.  Zero stars for the uneducated staff.  Seriously.....they rinsed my glass with water when going from white to red.  NoOOOOOOO!!!!  Don't do that!!!  I guess I didn't believe that after several reviews condemning that action, they still did it.  I would have protected my glass a little better.  Did a white or two.  Not good Did the Tempranillo.....not good.  Much better at any other winery I've tried. The 'ports' were like syrup.  Now, I know that Port is going to be on the sweeter side.  But when it pours practically like corn syrup, then I just can't do that much sweet.  Disappointed.  I had hoped that a winery closer to my house would be a fun getaway.  Not.  I WILL still buy the ports at the shop in downtown Georgetown, though.  Those are good.

reviews.author: Marianne B.
reviews.description: After passing this winery on Highway 183 several times, my husband finally surprised me with a spur of the moment decision to stop. I was very curious about a central Texas winery that offers a Malbec. I was not disappointed. It is a dark inky glass with a nice strong spice. The finish is long and jammy. It is not the best Malbec I've ever had, but for a local Texas winery, I am impressed. The Malbec is what convinced me to purchase the membership. The Cabernet did not disappoint either.   The grounds are lovely and the underground tasting room is nice when it's not shoulder to shoulder crowded. Most wonderfully, this winery is pet friendly and welcomed my Chihuahua with open arms and a savory dog treat. She liked it there as much as I did. They also offer a vast array of vinegar and olive oils. I have not tried them yet, but it is on my 2016 to do list.   When I am craving a weekend in Fredricksburg, but can't get away, the Thirsty Mule Winery is the perfect way to spend a Saturday.

reviews.author: Ken C.
reviews.description: One star for the musicians. Rude staff. Aweful wine. Drive a few more miles to Florence...You won't be sorry.

reviews.author: Ashley J.
reviews.description: I am obsessed with this winery. I love in Round Rock and make by weekly trips to this place just to pick up bottles of the pear white wine. It is by far the best wine I have ever had. The scenery around the winery is beautiful, the staff is super friendly, and the wine is incredible and delicious. They have types of wine from the dry reds to some sweet white and there "sweet dreams" wine is to die for! Everything is reasonable priced and has impeccable quality. I have to say if you are looking for a beautiful place to hangout and drink some great wine. You have to check this place out and inquire about there wine club it is SO worth it.

reviews.author: Cecelia L.
reviews.description: I heard lots of good things about Thirsty Mule so I finally tried it. So far, I've liked the wines that I have tried there. I recommend you try this place, it's awesome! Thanks Rory, great service.

reviews.author: Victoria S.
reviews.description: Came by on a Saturday afternoon. They had live music and the place was pretty packed. The staff was friendly and prices are good.

reviews.author: April H.
reviews.description: We came here after buying some wine at the Harker heights beer and wine festival. But we came for the distillery and not the wine. Enjoyed the tasting and ended up buying a lot. The knowledgable and courteous staff made the trip very enjoyable!

reviews.author: Nicolle M.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this Winery. They source grapes from California and Texas, but stick to what grapes from those regions do best. My favorite was their Russian River Valley Pinot and they had a special white from the green valley sub appellation I LOVED.   The tasting room is down to earth and simple- and expect a drop in by the owner! Great wines, friendly crew- recommend for the wine lover.

reviews.author: Viviana M.
reviews.description: Family owned and operated the atmosphere was really sweet with pictures of the family hung on the walls. If you're a Cowboys fan reserve the Cowboys table. At my tasting favorite was the 2018 Chardonnay. If you try Bent Oak you will not regret it so check it out! Joanne and Bryan were the best hosts.

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: Wow I was blown away by Bent Oak. It really does not look like much from the outside but my boyfriend and I decided to give it a try based on the reviews and we were not disappointed! We easily made a reservation on the website and came in at 2pm on a Saturday. They took out temperatures at the door and we were seated quickly.   We decided to go for the wine tasting first, 5 samples for $15 plus a stemless logo glass to take home! We really enjoyed trying the wines and enjoyed all of them. Our favorite was the Blanc du Bois because it was light and crisp but had a unique fragrant flavor from the floral notes and the apricot.   My only gripe was the reservation was only 45 minutes. I wish it could've been around an hour, we didn't get a chance to finish our wine or our charcuterie but it's not too big of a deal since we just took it back home. We also got another bottle of the Blanc du Bois to take home and they gave us a cute wine bag for the two bottles.   We will definitely be back again to try the rest of the wines!!

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: What a wonderful discovery on a lazy pre-Xmas Sat afternoon. Who would have thought you could find a boutique winery that rivals any that I've visited in Sonoma.   Do not despair as you pull into the generic industrial park hard off of Anderson Mill Road in the CP. Walk-in past the small lobby area and step into their beautifully decorated tasting room.  Since we were the only patrons we received VIP treatment from start to finish.   We opted for their premium tasting menu and selected all reds. I'm not a TX wine fan but Dylan, our sommelier, expertly guided us through our tasting and as we concluded our wonderful stay my mind was changed.   My favorite was the Alexandar Valley Cab will more than suffice if you enjoy a big traditional Cab with a strong finish.   Their Spanish Mourvedre version is deep and rich and has a surprisingly strong finish,   There are a number of "light" reds as well. We were not fans but appreciated the flavor and balance of these wines.   Bent Oak does offer cheese plates and other small plates to accompany your tasting. Check their social media as they have live music on certain days.   Wonderful wine, an intimate setting, and passionate knowledgeable folks equals a 5 star experience.

reviews.author: Claude W.
reviews.description: This was a real treat.  We looked for winery that was open before 4pm. We were staying in San Antonio and wanted to visit Austin TX. We found this place by searching best wineries near Austin. When we 1st arrived, it looked like a little store front in a strip mall. When we entered it was a whole different story. We were greeted by Debbie and Bryan who both turned out to be extremely gracious hosts.  They have wines grown in TX and CA. The TX grapes are grown in the High Plaines near New Mexico where it is warm during the day and cooler at night. I decided to do a tasting with only the TX wines.   The TX wine menu had 5 wines for the tasting menu. Started with the Chenon Blanc (quite nice with a buttery smoothness), proceeded to the Blanc de Bois, then the Roussanne (my least favorite), then switching to the reds starting with the Sangiovese and finally to the tempranillo.  The Tempranillo was my absolute favorite.    What really made this experience so nice was the wine Ambassador Debbie. She is just the nicest person who took good care of us. She also has a very nice sense of humor. Bryan was also very nice. He helped me pick out a few stainless steel wine stoppers. Bryan gave us great restaurant suggestions for Austin and San Antonio.  Do not be fooled with the entrance on the outside. It is misleading in the size and the value you receive on the inside.

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: The wine selection is truly delightful in an abundance. So happy to have this treasure in our community. Perfect for a low key date night or a nice peaceful book. Will absolutely be coming back.

reviews.author: Pat M.
reviews.description: Very nice atmosphere inside.   Help was very friendly.  Pizza bread was out of this world.  I would recommend

reviews.author: Vipul T.
reviews.description: Good luck with the attitude at the front desk and the fact that they won't pick up the phone for a reservation. Waste of our time driving here, if you are passing by I would look at other places for wine tastings.

reviews.author: Samantha C.
reviews.description: My experience with this winery has been amazing to say the least! Took two of my really good friends here today both who require wheelchair accessibility and felt very comfortable in the atmosphere. The reservation made ahead time was set up easily and the communication was quick and efficient through email. They were able to recommend a table that was best suited for us all to feel comfortable. It is very rare to actually be able to talk to the owners/wine makers about their products but they were the ones serving us the tasting! It really was a special experience not only for me but for my friends that have not gone out socially since the pandemic. Thank y'all so much for the inclusive atmosphere and making it such a memorable experience, we had a blast!

reviews.author: Brandon K.
reviews.description: What a hidden gem! We were sitting at home on a Friday night, trying to find something to do. After a quick yelp search, we saw there was a winery up the street and open late. We decided to take a trip and check it out.  Driving up, you start to question if you are going the right direction but just keep going.   You walk in to this office center and are welcomed to the most friendly staff and environment.  Rarely do you get to sit down at a winery and speak to the head wine maker.   What really makes this place different is the fact that they have California and Texas wines. I'm no expert, but I've been told Texas grapes just don't compare.    The prices are great, and the options are plenty.  This will definitely be the family visit spot in the future.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: Wine: Only tried one wine, the tempranillo. It was fine, not as bold as they usually are. I smelled some of the whites, and they smelled very sweet so I passed. Didn't even look at pricing because of what the snacks cost.  Snacks: wow, expensive. Tried a bunch of them with a group, overall not worth the price. Particularly the truffles. It was $27 for a teensy box of 9 pieces of terrible chocolate. Waxy texture, did not melt when you eat it, chalky, bad flavor. Dark chocolate is my fave, so that's not the issue. Who knew chocolate could actually be yucky? It came from next door, glad we didn't go there after.   Service: very good, sweet ladies.  Ambience: not good. Outside it just looks like a store front, inside is super dark, no windows, and looks like a Kirkland's from the 90s.... everything is red, has fringe, pretty cheesy. Not eclectic, just ugly and full of stuff.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: Living in Austin, this winery is located in our backyard. It's nice to be able to drive just 20 minutes and enjoy a good glass of wine, and meet the people who made it. I now have a place for out of town guests just spending the weekend to take a sip of Texas wine.  They focus on creating quality wines sourced from Texas and California grapes.  They do not blend grapes sourced from the two states together.  When you drink a bottle of Texas sourced wine, it is 100% Texas, and vice versa. Bent Oak has been around for about 3 1/2 years, and from what I have heard they are starting to find their stride.   When you enter the space, you will walk through the front gift shop to the back tasting room and production area.  They have gone to amazing strides to make a warehouse space homey. It feels like a Texas hill country family home.  We were warmly welcomed, and they even let us take our three well behaved dogs into the back area to sit and enjoy a tasting with us.  Everyone here was friendly and knowledgeable.    I was pleasantly surprised by the consistent quality of all their wines available to taste.  You can taste up to five wines from their menu.  The Blanc Du Bois was one of my stand out favorites.  There wasn't anything I didn't like on the menu.  I am not a fan of Chardonnay's but their California sourced Chardonnay was good.  Their reds were a bit young, but the Mourvedre from the Texas High plains was tasty and my favorite of the current options.  Medium bodied but with spicy fruity rich tones.  The Sangiovese was satiny smooth, but just needed some time.  I actually enjoyed their Texas wines more than the California options.    Clearly there is a reason why their wine club membership has a waitlist.  It's just a great group of people to hang out with.  It felt like being with family, and enjoying a great conversation over a nice glass of wine.  They are located next to Delysia chocolates towards the back of a warehouse area.  Wine and chocolate neighbors?  Yep, it's an amazing pairing.

reviews.author: Cindy L.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday. Always welcoming and we felt so safe especially with all the precautions they are taking. And if course great wines, can't wait to share the Cuvée with friends!!!

reviews.author: Jasmine M.
reviews.description: Great Winery with awesome wine! John (wine maker) was amazing! Super nice and attentive. We came here celebrating a bachelorette party, we arrived a bit late, but they were so accommodating. Definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Nanette L.
reviews.description: Great wine accompanied with paired bites...comfortable atmosphere  too come on my own and listen to music...would recommend for all ages.

reviews.author: Havalah W.
reviews.description: Whoa! what a cool find! we loved this place. the staff was awesome. the wine maker was around to say hey and make sure we were happy! we did a 5 wine flight and we were pleased. the cab was our favorite for sure. kids got a meat and cheese plate w some crackers. we will be back!

reviews.author: Carrie H.
reviews.description: Very friendly atmosphere and very close to 620 in Anderson Mill! Very nice wines from the Russian River area in California.  Kid friendly and lots of fun knick knacks and snacks to keep them entertained.

reviews.author: Dana O.
reviews.description: We pulled up to this winery and sat there dumbfounded for a few minutes as we had never experienced an "urban" winery!  We finally mustered the courage to go have a look inside this warehouse looking building.  What an incredible surprise!  We were warmly greeted and led into the tasting room where our eyes grew wide with wonder.  Themed tables, lounging areas, decor and a scuttle of people enjoying some of the most spectacular wine ever!    Everyone in there was so nice and the server we had was very knowledgeable.  My daughter promptly made sure everyone knew I was celebrating the 20th anniversary of my 30th birthday!  Our wine expert quickly informed the wine maker "John" and he came over to wish me a happy birthday and give me a taste of a special "not on the menu" wine.  All I can say is every single wine we sampled (8 in total) was superb!  I walked out after buying 4 bottles and was extremely happy!

reviews.author: Anders N.
reviews.description: Cozy winery in an unexpected place. Great service and excellent selection of wines. Highly recommend stopping by here! They even have live music while you enjoy your wine.

reviews.author: Andrew L.
reviews.description: We finally made it to the wine club.  Wines here are delicious.  Never overly sweet (no added sugar), and always served with a smile.  The owners are very kind and welcoming.  We were brought on a tour of the facility on our second visit and given numerous samples of fresh wine.  The atmosphere is pretty amazing as if you couldn't tell by the other reviews

name: Flat Creek Estate Winery and Vineyard

reviews.author: Jeff N.
reviews.description: Our party of 4 visiting from the Chicago area. We booked a 3 course meal and wine tasting.  Our server Katie was well versed and very personable. The founder of the winery, Madelyn, visited our table and we chatted for quite a while. Great plans for the future! Our meal was incredible. One person in our party said it was the best meal  she has ever had. That is quite a statement! We asked to see the chef.  Executive Chef Shawn graciously accepted our kudos and applause. We walked the property and will always remember the great experience and fabulous property views. Well done!

reviews.author: Susan E.
reviews.description: My daughter gave me the gift of her time, along with a 3-course meal and wine tasting, to honor a special occasion. We decided to make this a weekday outing, to minimize traffic and the possibility of large groups being at the winery.  We were promptly greeted and seated upon arrival. The dining room was largely empty, and we had superb service. This was our second visit to the winery, and we plan to return.   We tasted 7 wines in all, 3 of which were paired with the November menu of panzanella (a bread salad), fennel-crusted pork tenderloin, and cannoli. The wine pairings were excellent.   We were not big fans of the panzanella. It seemed to need additional ingredients to make it more interesting and less dry. The main course, however, was fabulous. The pork medallions were crusty and flavorful. The linguine accompaniment was wonderfully garlicky, making it almost possible to ignore that the pasta was overcooked. And the cannoli was excellent. I think of cannoli as a finger food; these mini cannoli were made pretty with their presentation but more messy to eat because of the chocolate sauce. The cannoli were served with a very good port wine.   All in all, we had a very nice meal and enjoyed the wines... which we drank. No spitting for us! We are not connoisseurs, but certainly enjoy good quality wine. Some of Flat Creek's are very good indeed.   This was not a cheap excursion, but the 2 hours we spent there were worth it. This would be a great place for a romantic date, and also worked well as a mother-daughter excursion. Flat Creek has other dining options that include pizza, and there's a disc golf course on the premises. Do make advance reservations for your visit, as this isn't a large establishment and can be a long (but pretty) drive from the Austin area.

reviews.author: Ileana P.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Totally worth it to do the tasting, food was amazing and the employees provided above and beyond expectation. All were so knowledgeable, gave great suggestions for the pairing with dinner. Can't wait to come back

reviews.author: Nancy C.
reviews.description: We always take our visitors here. Beautiful and the wine and food is very good. We also frequented the outdoor bistro during the height of the endemic as it is spacious and just a lovely and peaceful setting. They also have vegan cheese for their pizzas :)

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: Yes please choose the appropriate experience for your family, because apparently my family did not ‍ we ate outdoors at the pavilion, there was no wine tasting involved....My advice  this place is not family friendly, possibly they aren't even friendly.......really we did not know that disc golf was available for children under 12, this might have been something that was mentioned to us when we asked what do you have that it family friendly. In addition your apology seems very condescending and not genuine at all.  How do you know that what we were envisioning? We just wanted to have a nice time with our grands, and we were talked down to, and you're still talking down to us....

reviews.author: Jayla M.
reviews.description: Had an amazing experience with friends. The food was good as well. We signed up for the 6 wine taste testing and it came with pizza and side salad. I really liked how Our host gave each different wines that fit us, therefore we weren't all forced to test the same stuff. We also got the opportunity to step outside and watch the sunset. Would definitely go back.

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: If you're visiting Marble Falls add this to your MUST DO list!  My girlfriend and I made our first trip to Marble falls this past weekend and are very happy to say we started the weekend off here at Flat Creek Estate.   We enjoyed the "Chef's 3 course experience" which was one of the best dining experiences we've ever had! 6 glasses of wine and a 3 course meal that took us on a  flavorful journey. At one point we felt like Remy in that scene from Ratatouille, the one where he pairs the strawberry with some cheese and feels fireworks... yes, it was really that good!  Carmen was a priceless part of the already amazing experience, she was so friendly, enthusiastic and helpful! Ask for her to be your server if you can!  We can't wait to come back to marble falls and visit here again, looking forward to next seasons wines and Chef's 3-course! Thank you guys!

reviews.author: Dee Y.
reviews.description: It hurts me to write this review. We truly want every small business to thrive. My family and I went to the Vineyard on a Friday afternoon for an intimate celebration of my husband's birthday with our mom, dad and children, it ended in my 5-year old little one being verbally attacked by a man in the pavilion, who identified himself as 'the owner'.   We decided to try the disc golf course, and we loved our experience with Casey, he is a gem! Very knowledgeable about disc golf, and very accommodating. We let him and Madelyn (the owner's wife) know we were celebrating a birthday. The course was fun, but ridden with fire ants, red ants, sticker burs and bull nettle. It was not the polished experience we were expecting. But still fun for our family.   We finished disc golf, and returned to the pavilion around 6:00pm.  We ordered a large dinner, but since we were not offered to sit in the main seating area, we sat under the outdoor pavilion. We were in the pavilion for less than 5 minutes, and the adults arranged tables so our family could sit together (there is no waiter in the pavilion so we had to move tables on our own). During those few minutes my two small children were playing under the pavilion, not causing any harm or damage, just laughing and trotting around like kids do outside (he is 5 and she is 7).   Out of no where a man started verbally attacking my 5-year old. This man who looked to be in his 70s, was sitting at a table drinking bottles of wine with 2 other people. He continued to yell at the top of his lungs scaring me and my babies. They came running to me asking me why the man was yelling and whistling at them. It broke my heart. A complete stranger was attacking them for no apparent reason.   After protecting them, my dad and husband approached the man who was yelling the obscenities. This is when he identified himself as 'the owner'. He told us our children were 'out of control' and we needed to get them under control. I asked them what they were doing to display out of control behavior, and he didn't say a thing, besides he had guests with him and they were disrupting his evening. My father let the man know if we were going to be patrons of his business, we would not tolerate his verbal abuse of our 5 and 7 year old children. My father also told him, "We don't yell at our kids like that and if he had a problem with the way our children were behaving he could have stood up and walked over while we were arranging our own tables and told us in a normal tone of voice the problem he saw."  After the incident, the man sat at his table continuing to drink wine for 45 minutes, and sadly never came back to our table to apologize to our children for scaring them because of his obscene behavior. As we left, both of my children continued to asked why he was so angry.   We now understand this pavilion is in 'the owners' front yard. On this evening Rick (the owner) had been drinking with friends and our family was interrupting their evening. His behavior not only made us feel the most unwelcome as paying customers, but was abusive and completely out of control, especially as 'the owner'.  We should have been able to have this conversation with the business owner. Unfortunately, he left the pavilion to go back to his house, and did not return or offer an apology.  ***Update in Response to Owners Apology Below***  Your apology ends with 'resolve any confusion or fears the children had regarding why they were reprimanded'. The main point of why this experience was so horrifying: No one should ever reprimand a 5-year old child, except that child's guardians. If there was an issue with a child's safety, that concern should have been directed to the guardians who were standing between the children and the owner. Never should a stranger, much less a 70-year old man who is consuming alcohol ever 'reprimand' a child, ever! Of course of case the outcome was severe harm to the child, in this case, our 5-year old was not in severe danger.  Regarding the excuse that you 'witnessed dangerous behavior, and you had to immediately intervene': If there are components of your business that are dangerous to patrons, you should immediately remove these hazards, so that they don't become a safety issue. If you feel your deck boxes are not safe, you should store them in a storage facility where patrons do not have access.   Regarding your comment that 'you wish to leave discipling to parents but are forced to intervene when there is a safety concern': We were a party of 4 adults, and we were less than 10 feet away from our children. While we were bussing our own tables and arranging furniture, we were not aware my 5- year old sat on the 'deck box' and got down by jumping off. This type of 'danger' (i.e. sitting on a sitting area, and jumping off something that is no more than 2 feet off the ground) should not elicit the response of 'discipline' by a stranger, or 'immediate' intervention.

reviews.author: Dave H.
reviews.description: A hidden gem in the hill country with beautiful grounds, friendly staff and an amazing array of wines and dishes. We tried the 3 course chef's dinner. We started with wine tasting followed by a spectacular wine pairing with each course. We hadn't really considered Texas wine as equivalent to Calif wines but we were wrong. All of the wines we sampled were great and because of that we ended up heading home with 14 bottles! The owner even stopped by to ask us about our experience which we gladly shared. Definitely worth experiencing this adventure.

reviews.author: Cyndi M.
reviews.description: My husband and I were staying in Marble Falls for a few days and this winery was suggested. Flat Creek Winery had a nice outdoor patio.  The inside seating was small and very loud so we chose to sit outside.  There was only one guy taking orders.  He was very nice and tried his best.  But, he needed help. My husband and I each chose wine tasting (we got 4 samples, but we didn't get to choose what we wanted to try), a glass of wine, and a pizza. We got our wine tasting and glass of wine immediately. We waited about 45 minutes before we got our pizza.  The pizza was delicious, but our wine was already gone.  Probably will not go back.

reviews.author: Kaitlyn L.
reviews.description: This was a great lunch spot for a Saturday!! Even though it's a ways off of the beaten path, the ambiance and food is amazing!!! The 4 of us did the pizza and tasting package which is the way to go! Sherry was delightful and chose our wines based on what WE like, not a set list. The chicken Florentine and the sundries tomato artichoke pizza are both recommendations. 10 out of 10

reviews.author: Chelsea Benny C.
reviews.description: Horrible service! Was told we could sit inside in just a few minutes, had us wait outside for 45 minutes and told us they forgot they had other tables to take care of, clearly had 3 empty tables. Been to a lot of wineries, worst experience ever at this one though!

reviews.author: Danielle R.
reviews.description: My friend and I went to celebrate my birthday. The service (Casey) was fantastic, but I wasn't crazy about most of the wines we tried. The food was okay. Service I'd rate 5 stars, but food and wine 2-3 stars.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Covid/"reopening" June review.   Signage not great, and cell reception can be spotty, so be sure to download the map to your cell phone in advance.   Beautiful location and building. Plenty of parking.   Inside tables by reservation only. Nicely separated, no issues being close to other guests. Not the same for reception or table service.  Server was pleasant, but had zero concept of social distancing, no mask and was right in our faces each time we had an interaction.   Menu/tasting a little confusing. Basically you prepay $40 each and get whatever you want from the menu, including wine to drink there or to go. Most wines were available for tasting pours, but not all. Some wines good, some not so much. Liked the primitivo the most of the many we tried.   Very nice for the setting and service. Great set up for limited capacity, but they really need to work on wait staff protection.

reviews.author: Amber H.
reviews.description: We went for a wine tasting during a girls weekend but decided to just sit and have dinner instead. The baked Brie was great, but the "roasted" Brussel sprouts were truly just steamed and served on a sizzling cast iron skillet -- definitely NOT roasted. It honestly was a let down as "roasted" truly didn't mean roasted. The wine was great, service was great.... But food was just mediocre for the price.

reviews.author: Melanie G.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a fantastic experience at Flat Creek! During a weekend getaway to the Marble Fallas area from Dallas, we planned a day of wineries in Hill Country and Flat Creek was at the top of our list based on recommendations from friends. We wanted to experience the 3-course lunch but due to social distancing rules, reservations were hard to come by. We figured we'd take our chances and arrive as soon as they opened, and we were in lunch! We were able to be seated indoors right away by Madeleine who was just a delight! There was just one other party enjoying lunch, so we felt very catered to. Our server, David was also wonderful.  Even after our lunch, Madeleine brought us over to the outdoor patio area and gave us a couple of complimentary tastings of her a few of her fave white wines.  Hands down, our best winery experience. We bought two bottles and will be back soon!

reviews.author: Ann B.
reviews.description: We have been members at Flat Creek Estate for several years now and have been very pleased with their many offerings. However this past Friday, the owner and staff went way over and above! Our son wanted to propose to his girlfriend and he wanted it to be a surprise! She loves pizza and wine so we "planned" that day to have a late lunch at the winery. It had been inclement out the previous few days and the day of the weather was looking iffy. The staff worked with us on a variety of scenarios just in case. The afternoon turned up sunny and warm! We were to "meet up" them a little later so they headed to the winery for lunch. The chef made a heart-shaped pizza (one of the surprises) and the staff came up with the idea of putting the ring into a small to-go box so he could bring it to the table without her knowing. I had also dropped off a bouquet of flowers for staff to bring out after he had proposed to her. The photographer found a great vantage point, the pizza was made, he picked it up along with the ring, he set the pizza down on the table and opened it, got on his knee and proposed to her! After she said yes and they hugged and cried a bit, the staff brought out the bouquet, we showed up and the photographer took more photos, onlookers awww'd and cheered! It was really an over and above day for everyone working at Flat Creek Estate! Thank you for helping to make my son's proposal so special!

reviews.author: Corey F.
reviews.description: The staff was extremely nice and accommodating. One of the owners came and introduced herself which was very personable and we appreciated that. Our host was very knowledgeable and attentive. The winery was beautiful and the food was amazing. We will definitely be back and recommend friends.

reviews.author: Dianna G.
reviews.description: We enjoyed the 6 winewine tastings, salads and shared Pizza. We especiallylly like the petite sirah.

reviews.author: Kirk W.
reviews.description: I thought I had reviewed Flat Creek back when we first went there not long after they opened but I just realized that I hadn't, so better late than never.  Flat Creek is a special place for us as we saw the sign for it during our Miata club drive back in 2007. I contacted them a few days later, set up a tasting for the club, a bunch of us drove out there and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The vineyard itself and the architecture are fantastic, and it has grown a lot since they opened.   Everyone who works there is extremely friendly and helpful, the food was always tasty, they have a lot of fun events, and the wines are truly delicious.   We enjoyed it so much that we kept going back, became friends with the owners, and got married there in 2011. Flat Creek was very accommodating as we wanted it to be on a specific date that was the Sunday after Thanksgiving, and they made it work.  Our wedding video showcases the vineyard extremely well so if you want to watch it, you can click here. https://vimeo.com/34645652 We are biased of course, but our friend did an amazing job on it and we love to revisit it.

reviews.author: Clare S.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed my recent visit to 7 Creeks. And so thankful I stumbled upon it. They don't advertise on the Texas Hill Country Wineries website (where I normally research wineries to visit) so I was very lucky to come across it. Really great wines and super friendly staff. Not to mention a ridiculously sweet winery dog named Blondie. Misty took great care of me and I had a lovely time sitting on the property enjoying a glass with my picnic lunch.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: First time here and definitely not the last!!! Walked in and we were greeted by the friendly staff!! Ashton took care of us outdoors on the patio. We did a red tasting and loved all 5 of the wines! Our favorites were the first and last! Everything ranges from a Pinot to a heavy cab... they have charcuterie broads to munch on while tasting. They also have live music on certain days... The vibes were friendly and so relaxing! Ashton was super friendly and knowledgeable about the wines. She made our whole visit pleasant with her bubbly personality.  We will be back this weekend to hang out more and drink more wine!  Everyone inside behind the bar was nice and friendly! Super refreshing since we live in the city. Texas hospitality at its finest. My husband had so many questions about the origin of every wine and sweet Ashton took her time answering all the questions and didn't once act bothered or in a hurry. Thanks Ashton! We will be back!

reviews.author: K.A. L.
reviews.description: Just went there a few days ago on recommendation from a friend.  I was surprised at the coziness of the place.  Loved the outdoor seating areas under the trees.   Very friendly and knowledgeable about their wines.  Now, at the moment their wines are imported mostly from California as their crops are coming in and from what I understand they lost their crop to the snow storm this year ... it was still good wine!  Their charcuterie board was to die for and they did not chintz on any of the selections!   Bought two bottles of the wines I tasted during the wine tasting.  Will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Riley T.
reviews.description: Jerry the owner is awesome! Wine is great and the property is very peaceful and pretty. Recommended!!!!!

reviews.author: E B.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this winery today after pivoting from a bad experience over at wedding Oaks winery in Burnet. We are so glad we left the other place and found this place. This is everything we look for in a winery-vineyards, beautiful oak trees, plenty of seating outside, spacious porch that overlooks the vineyards, Good wine, and friendly customer service.  It checked all the boxes and we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: This was our first trip and it is not the last.  Every wine We tasted was great.  I did not have one bad taste.  It was so good I became a member.  Don't pass this winery up!

reviews.author: Don N.
reviews.description: Wonderful winery and staff. The veranda with mist fans overlooking a picturesque Oak was very comfortable, even on a 90+ temperature day. My wife liked Robin's Cuvee (Texas rose'), while I liked the Barbera (CA red). Nice options on flights. We will definitely returned for scheduled music performances, such as flamenco guitar and big band, later in Fall.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: Lucky enough to stumble across the previous review and find out about this place.  Owners are completely down to earth and pleasurable to visit with.   Been to several vineyards and we always have a few we don't care for mixed in with the ones we do.  NOT the case here. Every one we tried was very good and worth getting a bottle of.  After doing the samples my wife and I enjoyed time under the tree outside to drink a couple glasses from the selections.   If you're close by or even if you're not, check with place out. One of the very few wineries we have visited where EVERYTHING on the menu was enjoyable.

reviews.author: Miranda B.
reviews.description: Great vineyard. Amazing wine with a wide and deep flavor palette. Trie their new food and wine pairing and was extremely impressed! A must visit!

reviews.author: Sarah G.
reviews.description: Our first ever vineyard experience, and I don't think anyone would be able to top it. The owner himself came and introduced himself as we arrived on the property and gave us all kinds of info. Inside was very comfortable and so romantic for a rainy day. Sampled the red flight and had each wine explained to us in detail. They even gave us other vineyard recommendations! Super sweet people.

reviews.author: Jordan B.
reviews.description: A new vineyard, that's starting to bottle their own wine now. The owners are so sweet and personable. I'm a wine-o and haven't heard of some of the wines but they are all SO SO GOOD. The Malvasia Bianca is the best white wine I've ever had.   Must try!!!!

reviews.author: Nancy A.
reviews.description: Visited for the first time over the weekend and loved it. Smaller winery with plenty of seating, quiet, dog friendly, and just our thing. My husband and I did the 7 wine tasting and they were all great. Will be visiting again soon! :)

reviews.author: Cliff P.
reviews.description: We went for the grand opening. Their wine and wine selection are both excellent. Very friendly family operation. Highly recommend giving them a try.

reviews.author: Valerie M.
reviews.description: My In Laws live in the Hill Country. That prime location means that we have drank our way through plenty of Texas vineyards. Texas wine is much like people's opinion of Paris, France: you either love it, or you abhorrently hate it. With that being said, this vineyard is loved and adored by my family. The staff is welcoming and down to earth...unlike some tasting rooms, that we've been to, that judge us based on how we pronounce vognier (pronounced vin-yay) we say: Vog-Nerrr. The charcuterie board is seasonal and contains goodies from patrons who hunt and family members who dabble is chocolate making. Come and sit out back with the beautiful tree and take tons of Instagram pictures to show off to all of your friends. 7 Lakes is a firm 10/10. Come for the tasting, and stay for the chocolate and red Zinfandel.  Update: I went to the bathroom, note to self..drink more water, and they have Meyers hand soap and lotion! Some may shrug and say, "so what?" But those that understand what Meyers is, will appreciate what I'm saying :)

reviews.author: Laura G.
reviews.description: If you are looking for a relaxing break from your hectic day look no further! It's worth the drive out to the country to visit this vineyard. The owners live on property and are the absolute best. They even remember your name when you walk in. It's a little slice of heaven in a wine bottle

reviews.author: Mike And Robin C.
reviews.description: With soft openings since July, this tucked away jewel located north of Bertram is going to stand out as a top quality fine wine destination in the northern Texas Hill Country.  Jerry and Janis Horne's path to a winery career began many years ago with a casual conversation and visits to California wineries. That passion and love for what they do has matured into a beautiful estate vineyard and wine tasting room. The vineyard itself has been a work-in-progress for that last two years.  They currently have about seven acres (hmm, seven again...) of grape vines with a mix of Mourvèdre , Tannat, Vermentino, Alicante Bouschet and Souzao planted.  Tasting some of the grapes from the Souzao vines was an 'OH MY' and then some experience! Bob Young and Ron Yates are some of the winemakers helping them out on their first start.  Current wine selections have grapes sourced from California and Texas.  For the whites, the 2017 Chardonnay (Lodi) is aged in stainless still and exhibits great minerality, good acids, and a clean crisp taste! For reds, 2017 Mourvedre is sourced from the Texas High Plains AVA and shows off some great earthy notes. If you like Zinfandel, then you'll do somersaults over this Lodi 40+ year old-vine 2016 vintage. It smooths out quite well with lingering notes of jam.  Got Alicante Bouschet?  7 Creeks does with their 2017 High Plains release. The garnet color is wonderful to gaze at with a touch of leather aftertaste. Don't forget to also try their Alta Mesa AVA sourced Souzao.  If you love red wines and appreciate great meat parings, the 2015 Souzao vintage will have you hooked!  Scheduled for release in the fall, will be a Tannat, a Muscat Blend, and a superb Syrah Rose'....worth a return trip! And what's a quality wine tasting with the bubbles? The 2014 Cuvée Blanc de Blanc is sourced from Lodi Chardonnay and made in the "Méthode Champenoise" way.  You can taste the greatness in every bubble! With some nice estate homes being built nearby, as well as, proximity to the booming Liberty Hill area, wine traffic will not be a problem here.  Stop by and enjoy their great hospitality!

reviews.author: Adrienne D.
reviews.description: Always enjoy a glass here. Beautiful atmosphere and friendly staff. Nice for pictures too.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: The service here is always top-notch always friendly people welcoming us and the wine never disappoints we were big fans of the aura but now muscat is our go to white wine highly recommend coming here for food and drinks!!

reviews.author: Shauna H.
reviews.description: Absolutely beautiful and stunning Texas Vineyard. Have lunch or dinner or just simply drink wine and get a beautiful Meat and Cheese charcuterie board. Sit on the outdoor patio overlooking the beautiful vineyard. Peaceful and quiet surroundings with a wonderful and friendly staff. 5 Star reviews all around.

reviews.author: Hilda M.
reviews.description: On October 7 at 4:30 pm, we were invited to the winery for our dearest friends when visiting Austin! They used to visit that place very often! What a surprise when our friend was denied to have a beer( he brought it before with the staff permission). Manager and waiter approached us in louder voice. Our friend decided to leave and when passed along the waiter, he said our friend spitted on him! I doubted! He suffers from aphasia and is unable to speak! The waiter acted in the most unprofessional manner and told us to leave the place! He was rude, and humiliated us in front of other visitors!  It was my worst life experience ever! Please, be careful when you choose to have a beautiful day at this winery! It is a very unpleasant place!

reviews.author: Teresa D.
reviews.description: My friend and I went to the tasting room yesterday to sample wines and have lunch. We were so excited! First time there. Well there was no outdoor seating. There were lots of empty tables but I thought people must have reservations. We were seated in a room with wine barrels everywhere. We were the only ones there. We were brought water and the server said she'd give us time to look over the menu. Another lady was seated in the room. We told the server we were ready to order. She walked away. A few minutes later she seated a group of ladies        She ignored us. She came back to the group of ladies and took their order ignoring us and the other lady that was seated after us. We had been waiting 20 minutes. We gave her another 5 minutes and walked out. The other lady that was seated after us walked out also. She got tired of being ignored also.

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: Beautiful property and friendly staff but do not go until the renovations are completed.  You will be disappointed in the limited menu and seating.  Also, if you are a first timer, NEVER order wine by the glass.  We did and at $14/glass for their cab, the pour looked light.  We ended up buying a bottle, taking it back to the room and pouring each glass exactly to the fill line they use.  We got just barely shy of 6 glasses out of one bottle!!  It is ridiculous that they are charging $14/glass and pouring under 5 ounces.   If you end up drinking a full bottle by the glass, you are paying about $80/bottle.  As nice as the property and staff are, we will not be back because of how they are cheating guests without their knowledge.  If you want to make it right, either change the glasses or put the exact pour on the menu.

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: My company hosted a work offsite/ retreat here and it was awesome!  They had great meeting space for a group of 12 and we had the necessary AV/ conference call support one would expect for meetings.   However all the other benefits are what made this place stand out. First, we got to stay overnight and the rooms are stunning. They are super comfortable and look very high end, and the morning and night views are amazing.   Second, the food is fabulous. The chef is top top notch. Seriously every meal was amazing. Fresh, seasonal, tasty...did I mention it was amazing?  Third, the grounds are stunning. The patios, walking trails, picnic areas, outdoor spaces and the pool area are gorgeous. This place has a country feel to it, so it's perfect if you need a break from the city and it's not a far drive from Austin.   Finally, our team building activities were so fun!  We had a private wine tour and tasting. We also had a team building "cook your own dinner" event and it was so fun. The main chef was there to teach us and of course the food was amazing.   While my first visit was work related during the week, they do offer brunch, wine tastings and tours. They also have a stone oven pizza that smells heavenly when it's fired up with pizzas. I am definitely coming back with my girlfriends for brunch!  Give it a try!  I think you will love it.

reviews.author: Tracee W.
reviews.description: Best staycation venue in Austin area! Great Staff and food! The views of the vineyard are amazing and the wine is wonderful? You can't go wrong staying here fir a weekend or even longer.

reviews.author: Jamie O.
reviews.description: My husband and I visited the Vineyard at Florence last weekend while we were visiting family in Georgetown. They had given us good reviews about the place, so we were excited to try it. Upon arriving, we were thrilled about the beautiful buildings and landscape surrounding the vineyard. As we walked inside, things took a turn for the worst. There were about 5 people standing around the bar talking. A women with pink hair (I assume the bartender) was standing behind the bar with another worker(a man with a beard) leaning over the bar WHILE SHE WAS RUBBING HIS HEAD! I was immediately disgusted, not only by the unsanitary action but also by how unprofessional this was. A young girl walked over and sat us, and I watched through the window as the bartender made drinks after without washing her hands. We ordered a bottle of wine, so we didn't have to worry about her dirty hands making us drinks (although our server, a tall man, WHO WAS GREAT, offered us the new house cocktails). The food was great, the wine was delicious, and our server won us over, so we would try again, but the staff needs to be trained on both professionalism and health codes.

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: I loved my stay at the Vineyard at Florence. The room was spacious and comfortable, and the property is well maintained. We especially liked the gym and the pool facilities.  They had a limited menu because the restaurant is under renovation. However, the food (and wine) was delicious.  Every staff member we interacted with was pleasant. The waitress that served us for dinner and breakfast was fantastic and gave good recommendations.  I would like to come back in the spring or fall when it is not too hot so I can explore more of the property. Keep up the great work!

reviews.author: Kathy M.
reviews.description: I made a reservation for inside and when I arrived was told I did not have a reservation for inside.  The Hostess was very confused and keep trying to seat my party outside on a picnic table in the hot sun.  It was not crowded therefore I was confused on why they would not work with me.  They finally set my party outside.  The wine is great and the menu for food is slim and very costly.  I will not go back.

reviews.author: Jill S.
reviews.description: We wanted to come here for some wine and grab a bite to eat, so I called about an hour before we planned to come and asked if it was ok for us to come with kids, and if they served food. They said kids are more than welcome, and they have small bites to eat until their full menu becomes available in 2 weeks. So we hopped in the car and drove 45 minutes to get there, only to be told that the entire property was closed to the public for a wedding and there was nothing at all available for non-wedding guests. If you've ever been a parent to hangry toddlers after a 45 minute drive, you'll know how upset this made us. It's a beautiful property and we were looking forward to spending some time here, but this has left an awful taste in our mouth and has de-railed our entire day, so we will certainly never be returning.

reviews.author: MK S.
reviews.description: Excellent laid back atmosphere with love music (not sure if all the time but did on Saturday April 10, 2021).  All staff members were friendly, and attentive. We were served by Janea and she was amazing. Wines were delicious and you and wine flight options- we did the build your own (four for $22) and loved it. Would recommend!

reviews.author: Jacqueline S.
reviews.description: It's a really cute property but I have to say I'm disappointed in my service when ordering food to sit at the picnic tables. I was really looking forward to the charcuterie board. My friends and I ordered 3. I saw them all come out with everything on them. One of the guys working there said they had to box them up for picnic seating. That's fine but when we got back to our picnic table I realized the olives and Brie cheese were missing from all of our orders even though they were on the plates before being boxed up (which took an extra ten minutes). When I went back to ask I was told they ran out. I mentioned they were on our plates to begin with and then I was told "yea but it was a small amount." I was then walked away from. I guess they decided to put part of our order on someone else's plate that was getting more formal service. Considering we were the first ones to order  and paid the same price as any customer, it was pretty crappy.  We also paid $10 per slice of quiche and it was super tiny.

reviews.author: Saleen D.
reviews.description: This vineyard is absolutely stunning!  Love the Mediterranean style!  Aside from the main house, there are several houses in the back that people can rent out.    They have a delicious selection of red wines, white wines, only 1 dessert white wine, and sangria.  They also have a café that serves pizzas, cheese boards, and more.  We sat in the back where there was a live band performing, rolling hills for the backdrop, and a nice breeze during a hot, humid summer day!  Perfect!

reviews.author: Becki J.
reviews.description: Absolutely horrible customer service. Waited 30 minutes to be acknowledged and after that the weight just continue to intensify. We spent more time waiting and then we did anything else

reviews.author: Robert K.
reviews.description: Beautiful vineyard located in the heart of CenTex. Friendly staff made running the 5K here a wonderful experience. The oven baked pizza tasted fresh.

reviews.author: Andrea C.
reviews.description: I have long loved this place, the wine is nice, the outdoor area is nice, and in the past, they had a totally lust-worthy cheese and meat tray that made us happy-happy EVERY visit.   The last couple of visits, the cheese tray has become smaller. Less interesting g, and 100% skimpy. Today's wine tray, now on a much smaller board, was a sincere rip off at $20.   Wine club free glass of wine each visit perk has now dwindled to a glass of wine (simplified selection) at $5/glass.   They are clearly having financial problems or simply greedy, and do not value their guest experience. No more will I recommend. Asked hubby to cancel the wine club: I gave sour grapes. There are WAY too many wineries to choose from.

reviews.author: Tedd K.
reviews.description: What's not to love about this place.  First off, the staff is super top notch, really professional and friendly.  Accommodations were clean and upscale, worth staying the night for sure.  We liked all the wines, especially the whites, rose' and the Cab's.  And food was simple choices, but solid.  However, they are renovating a main building that I belive might be house an expanded the menu.The rolling  vineyard with tuscan buildings was a great setting. Decided to do some corporate events here after our stay.

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: What a beautiful place. Came here with my mom and sister on such a beautiful day. We really enjoyed the wine and the views. We had an excellent time. The wine tasting was nice. The tour isn't really worth it in my opinion as it seems it was al about trying to get people to book the venue rather than giving us a history of the wines. We took a tour in Napa valley and this one was vastly different. So don't do the tour but definitely do the wine!

reviews.author: Jim N.
reviews.description: Good wines, excellent Argentinian cuisine.  Outside with live music, perfect Saturday afternoon.

reviews.author: Cesar V.
reviews.description: Please answer the phone. We've been trying to make a reservation since October, 2021, but haven't been able to speak with any of your employees. We also tried on line, but got no response.

reviews.author: JP C.
reviews.description: Good views... good wine... ok empanadas... ok customer service... and great cheesecakes.... was looking forward to having food but they were not cooking during our visit.   They had a two ban band which was perfect for the setting! Great outside seating!!! We got their at 3 and stayed for a few hours because of how it was nested in the hills with plenty of trees and shade.   Great place for a date, family, kids, dogs or a glass of wine for the day. We will be coming back and hopefully have traditional Argentine bbq next time.   Suggestion: serve espresso and/or coffee

reviews.author: Jane G.
reviews.description: Favorite place ever! Amazing food - come for the food and the wine is a bonus.  Argentinean beef grilled on open coal grill.  The atmosphere and hospitality are top notch.

reviews.author: Christine A.
reviews.description: This is a gorgeous spot with fantastic Argentinian wine!  Met an old friend here tonight who I haven't seen much since she moved to Austin while I was here for a work trip and we had a fantastic time!  The wines are tasty and the winery has some great indoor and outdoor seating with fantastic views, way up on a hill. Definitely go check them out!  I've also reached out to the management to see if I can get wines shipped back to my home state of Georgia!!!

reviews.author: Camila G.
reviews.description: As soon as we arrived we were kindly greeted by the owner who suggested a few of our favorite types of wine. We hung out outside and enjoyed the beautiful weather while watching the lovely scenery. We ordered the center cut ribeye and it did not disappoint. Also, best truffle mashed potatoes I have ever had! Adrian, the Chef, was beyond magnificent- he took the time to listen and we really enjoyed his cooking and conversation

reviews.author: Arianexys A.
reviews.description: Wonderful views! The wine tasting experience is great. The chef is very enthusiastic and the food was delicious! Great spot for couples, and also pet friendly (saw some families with their dogs). Would come back!   Of note, during the afternoon there might be some mosquitoes in the outdoor area, but they were kind enough to provide us with insect repellent.

reviews.author: Michelle N.
reviews.description: When we first arrived here, it was a bit confusing on where we were allowed to park as there were to signs indicating a designated place for cars - we ended up just driving all the way up the hill and parking alongside the roundabout next to the entrance of the winery cabin.   We had a reservation for right when they opened, and luckily so - it became extremely busy later on in our visit, so be mindful if you're planning on coming here that it's popular!   Staff is extremely friendly and attentive - they accommodated our group and let us even switch some tables around since we were the first there.   El Gaucho has a smaller wine list than other wineries I've been to, but they also had a food menu that was unique to others.   Provoleta ($12.50, +prosciutto $2.00): Comes out on a hot skillet plate with some slices of bread on the side. Really flavorful in provolone, obviously, but the chimichurri gives a nice addition to the dish. Felt like the addition of prosciutto wasn't worth, however.   Empanadas (2pc - $12.50): They have an option between beef empanadas, or a black bean and plantain empanada. I tried both and they were delicious in their own ways. Some people may stray away from the non-meat option, but I quite liked it! I believe they served this with the same chimichurri that was on top of the Provoleta.   Light Flight  1. Chardonnay: Their description is 100% correct, if you don't prefer Chardonnay, you might change your mind after trying this! Super light and refreshing, really easy finish. 2. Chardonnay Reserve: Huge jump from the Chardonnay - seemed to taste more full.  3. Malbec Rose: Really great end to tie the first two together, the sweetness is subtle but still noticeable.  They have a lovely outdoor courtyard/backyard patio where more seating is available, but unfortunately the day we went, it had just rained meaning most chairs were wet. I would highly recommend trying to come on a sunny day as I think it'd be beautiful!

reviews.author: Ariel D.
reviews.description: Amazing location with warm hospitality and fantastic food.   If you want a taste of true Argentine flavor, this is the place to go.  Gracias, Chef Adrián!

reviews.author: Jeanne L.
