reviews.description: This spot is one of my favorite places in the surrounding Austin area. It has unbelievably beautiful views, the owners and staff are so nice, and the wine is delicious. Sometimes they also have amazing live music. I've taken many friends here and my family as well and they all love it too.

reviews.author: Arlene G.
reviews.description: I never leave reviews. My husband and I came here for our honeymoon from Dallas, Tx. We were very excited, since we read great reviews. Honestly, I wouldn't spend the money on it, nor ever come here  again. There was only one lady working and no one helped us out at all.  They were originally going to set up something "special" since it was our honeymoon and it was not special at all. They were charging us $175 for literally a bottle of cheap champagne and a bowl of crackers and cheese. For what we paid for and what we got I don't recommend it at all.

reviews.author: Cathy L.
reviews.description: Very beautiful winery overlooking a gorgeous scenery of lush green trees and magnificent hills. Perfect place to come and relax with friends or family. The back area has an array of different seatings from couches to tables. There was also live music with, I think, the owner singing (who has a great soothing voice btw bravo).   There wasn't too many people when I went (Saturday Father's Day weekend) which I liked as everything was a lot calmer.

reviews.author: Cole U.
reviews.description: Don't sleep on this place! As we pulled up I had my doubts but was so surprised!!! They have an awesome selection-- got the sav blance and it was so refreshing. The food menu looked good but we didn't try any. The outdoor space is amazing!! So much space and awesome views.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow do I love this place! It's also on the way to pace Bend Park so I love to stop and have a bottle of wine and then go to pace Bend. I went during Covid so it was only bottle service but we absolutely love the bottle we got and the gentleman working with so sweet. Amazing views, relaxing atmosphere, I can't wait till everything is fully open and we can experience their food and wine tastings!

reviews.author: Sarah C.
reviews.description: I was introduced to this winery by an Argentinean friend and I have to say I am pleasantly surprised. This winery is not only very scenic but also has excellent wine. I've been to many Texan wineries that are pretty but have terrible wine so this winery was a surprise to me. I'd love to bring my friends back there!

reviews.author: S P.
reviews.description: Great "winery" with a beautiful setting. Food and service was amazing. Note that the wines aren't local to Texas but were tasty. Kid and dog friendly. Loved the live music.

reviews.author: Ryan C.
reviews.description: This place is magical! Chef is amazing, food is amazing. Real food not that crackers and cheese stuff. Peaceful and great outdoor space. Really recommend!! Great wine selection from Argentina. Winery on a hill with a deck patio that overlooks country side. If you listen carefully you can hear Willy Nelson serenading the mountains.

reviews.author: Melissa A.
reviews.description: This place was amazing! The view was great and the owner (Bennett) was very welcoming! The live music by a beautiful sunset is everything we needed.

reviews.author: Dory W.
reviews.description: We had an outdoor celebration of life during a rainstorm at El Gaucho Winery this past weekend. With out-of-town guests, no rain date, florals, and catering coming hell or high water, we had to roll with it.  I can't say enough good things about the team and how we worked together over a couple of weeks.  Everything from planning to last-minute setup changes (from the outdoor patio to the covered patio) and serving exceeded my expectations. Their willingness to do whatever they could to make our rainy day 25 person event a success and smile while they were doing it was phenomenal and refreshing. Our guests had a good time and loved the wine!

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: I love this place!! Beautiful winery located at the top of a hill in Spicewood, TX. This winery offers Argentinian wine and the owners are just fabulous. One of my favorite places to visit in the hill country.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: We did a wine tour of the dripping springs area, with hawks shadow being our last stop- it was absolutely our favorite. The view is unbeatable, it's absolutely gorgeous. They also have a dug out cave under the property where they store their wine. Contact them about setting up a tour for a really unique, awesome winery experience. They wines were great and cheaper than if you go further down 290 to Fredericksburg. On another note- Sam took AMAZING Care of us. He was super knowledgeable, personable, and made sure our glasses didn't go empty. We absolutely will be back!

reviews.author: Mitch M.
reviews.description: Beautiful views nice building but did a tasting every wine tasted like vinegar and cherry juice. The service was great!

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: The wines here are really good. They are produced here - true production (not just buying finished goods). Some with a smokiness - delicious! Vineyards ON SITE. Lots of great photo opportunities here too. There's a cellar downstairs where they have the barrels. Get a tour to understand the careful decisions they made to make these amazing wines! Owners are also on site and so knowledgeable. It's hard to meet people that are so dedicated to high quality grapes and quality oak. I've been to a few wineries around lake Travis and this one is my favorite by far. The wines are dry wines. They are not sweet!  Definitely worth a drive here!

reviews.author: Camille L.
reviews.description: I echo other reviewers in that this place is a gem. They have a great selection of wines and even better views. The chenin blanc and rose had enough buttery and/or spicy notes to be enjoyed during the winter. Their reds are impressive as well. We liked the Temptation. They do tastings and will throw together a mean cheese board. The day we went we got a spicy pepper jack that was lovely. There's plenty of outdoor seating, abs that's where you really want to be to soak up the Hill Country views.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Perfect place to sit back, drink some amazing wine and enjoy the view. The staff was amazing, they were all wearing masks. There was plenty of sitting outside and pretty spaced out. I can't wait to make another trip here especially when the weather is nice.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: Have visited twice. Yep. The first one was so good we came back.  It is very remote and takes some time getting to, but that is a plus for me. The staff are laid back and not pushy. We usually enjoy one bottle on their awesome deck. It sports views of the hill country and on a nice day is tough to beat. They also allowed us to bring our own snacks and set up our own charcuterie board. This is a major plus for me as some wineries don't allow this. Don't change this please; for me it easily earns 2 stars on its own.  Really can't think of anything bad to say. Great experience and hoping to make a third visit!

reviews.author: Kristen W.
reviews.description: If I could give this winery 10 stars I would ! We had an amazing time there! Enjoyed flights of wine with our "sommelier" Sam telling us all we needed to know and more ! What a wealth of knowledge ! He gave us an impromptu tour as well which we all thoroughly enjoyed ! Amazing amazing time !

reviews.author: Kaitlyn L.
reviews.description: If you are anywhere in the area, definitely stop by Hawk's Shadow. We had just left a different winery and had a poor experience, but Chip and Sam turned the day around! Even though their patio was pretty full, they both were quick and attentive and made us feel like we had the place to ourselves. They have a variety of wines and each one was very unique and tasty! The patio is lovely and the 6 glass wine tasting is a must!

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: We went on the wine makers tour and absolutely loved our time at the winery... I'd personally never been in a wine cellar like this and it's comparable those in Europe. Wine was delicious!

reviews.author: Chantal A.
reviews.description: My family visited the winery to celebrate my parent's wedding anniversary. They are wine lovers so my siblings and I wanted to take them on a wine tour discovering what the hill country has to offer.  We came across this winery after searching numerous lists and reviews, and can I say we were more than delighted by our experience.  From the start we were amazed at the breathtaking location.  The cliff side view evoked a sense of peace and tranquility that we thoroughly enjoyed while sampling the delicious wines. Chip had such an infectious personality introducing us to the different blends while also interweaving many funny anecdotal stories related to each bottle.  It was a very different experience from other tastings, where our guide gave a more dry delivery of the wine selection not invoking as much feeling toward specific blends.  Not only was Chip a great ambassador for your vineyard, but the pièce de résistance was Doug's tour of the barrel room.  Doug's breadth of knowledge and true passion for wines made us appreciate more not only the wine but the vineyard as well.  It is always so exciting for us when we encounter other individuals who have such heartfelt passion for what they do.  We were a captivated audience from start to finish, and truly felt like we were talking to an old friend about our love for wine.  The years of hard work and family incorporated into growing the winery shows and was so refreshing to witness.  We drove back home and couldn't seem to stop talking about the winery and how great of a time we all had. My parent's loved the trip and now have a wonderful memory for their anniversary.  We've already been discussing future trips to come and enjoy dinner in the barrel room, so we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Dani S.
reviews.description: I don't know where to begin on how amazing this experience was. I was helping a friend propose to her girlfriend. They wanted a dream proposal as they are a dream couple. From the first interaction to the last, the Hawk's Shadow team was superb. They were friendly, COVID conscious, and just a delight. They allowed for us to sneak a projector and photographer into the right spot. They were delighted to take home some of their wine. My friends loved it and cannot wait to go back!

reviews.author: Shawn D.
reviews.description: My wife and I went here with a small group for a tasting yesterday and had a great time! Very nice selection of wine made from 100% Texas grapes. The Riesling was one of the group's favorites. Our server was very nice and did a great job explaining each selection to us. Highly recommend stopping here!

reviews.author: Don J.
reviews.description: They say getting there is half the fun! That's definitely true of Hawk's Shadow Winery, accessible only by narrow ranch roads that wind through some of the prettiest parts of Texas Hill Country.  The end of the drive is just as pretty - the patio offers plenty of shaded tables with sweeping views of the surrounding hills.  Since it was 100º when we visited, we opted to sit in the equally impressive, air-conditioned tasting room with high ceilings and glass doors that roll up in more temperate weather.   The premium tasting will set you back $14 for six wines.  I enjoyed the white wines the best.  The 2016 Juliette Riesling and 2015 Luna de Oro orange Muscat blend were both clear and crisp. The 2014 Temptation tempranillo was on the hazy side.  My server also gave me a bonus tasting of the 2013 Wild Child, a syrah blend that I really liked.  I ended up taking a bottle home.

reviews.author: Carolina R.
reviews.description: This is a beautiful winery with delicious wine! I went with my partner during the week right after Christmas and the owner and staff are excellent. Very knowledgeable and took time to explain and answer any questions. We tried over 8 different wines. Their tour of their wine cellar was very informative. It's also pet friendly and they have an adorable dog Emmett who greeted us. Definitely will return!

reviews.author: Shannon R.
reviews.description: Good variety of wines. Beautiful views and nice venue.  Great place to just sit with a glass of wine and relax.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: I wanted to visit Hawk's Shadow due to the highly rated reviews on Yelp. Could this place really be as good as they all say?! It is! It just may be my new favorite winery around Dripping Springs/Driftwood.  TASTING: Tasting menu offered good balance of 3 whites + 3 reds ($14 for 6), all distinct in flavor. All were high quality - smooth, dry, great finishes and easy to drink. I was impressed with every single one! The Cab Blend (Fortitude) was my fav. Pours were a decent size and several different people served us; each gave a detailed flavor profileandhistory on the wine, which I always appreciate. What I enjoyed here that is different from other wineries is that they give you time to enjoy your tasting and savor each wine. Not once did we feel rushed. It was relaxing to simply chill on the patio, feel the nice breeze, take in the view, and slowly sip while chatting.   ATMOSPHERE: 10/10. Its a bit of a drive and more secluded than other wineries in area, but SO worth! Views are top notch. You can enjoy the panoramic picturesque Hill Country backdrop from indoors (glass windows from top to floor) or outside on the covered shaded patio. You feel like you're out in the middle of the country on a nice retreat away from the hustleandbustle of the city.   SERVICE: From the initial email where I made a reservation to the minute I left the winery, I felt well taken care of. Hawk's Shadow offers excellent customer serviceanda warm family feel. Staff is really friendly, courteous and engaging. I loved the personal touch of the owners walking around to greet customers/chat- definitely tops other wineries in terms of service.   Everyone in our group loved Hawk's Shadow and I will definitely be back. They offer the same gorgeous panoramic views as Driftwood Estate Winery (arguably, even better), but have WAY better wineandservice. So, if you're thinking about checking out Driftwood Estates, skip the crowds and check out this hidden gem instead!

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: I want to move here. Really enjoyed this beautiful and secluded piece of property, where you can sit our and enjoy the views of the vineyard. Service was great, everyone seemed helpful and knowledgeable. The dog was hilarious, he kept coming by and looking for food. The atmosphere was relaxed and very conducive to enjoying a nice glass of wine. We enjoyed the Tempranillo and suerte rojo. They had a great selection of wines. Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Joan P.
reviews.description: The greatest hospitality! Feel like I just allowed to get tips, education and experience without being put down. So many of the "wine road 290" wineries feel they are too busy or prestigious to speak common "wine" language. Not here! We called ahead, as recommended by website. The GPS was accurate. A beautiful hilly route- just trust it!!! We were greeted -Sunday afternoon-as the Hawk shadow team was just cleaning up after a grape stomp. They invited us in to the warehouse to see the 14 vats at different stages of processing. It was very interesting to see the D stemming and the foam on the top of the juice. Sam then gave us a tasting. $16 for 4 wines and $20 for 6 wines.  Very Good blends with the different combinations from regional wines and Canadian Texas grapes. I loved the " tuck under " cellar. You take the spiral stairs down to the basement to get the "barrel room" experience.  The name Hawk Shadow is very heartfelt as well. The winery is named after their horse, hawk shadow who passed away in 2007.  In addition to the very spacious tasting room they have two different levels of patios and you can have awesome events there as well overlooking the beautiful Hill country. It's really worth the drive from San Antonio. Thank you Sam and Hawk shadow. I wish more wineries would realize that your total experience is based on not only the taste of their wines but how you are treated! Thanks and we'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Melissa A.
reviews.description: Best wine tour ever! We loved Doug and all his interesting stories! Can't wait to get my fall box of wines! #wineclubmember #wob #girlstrip

reviews.author: J F.
reviews.description: My new BFF.  A friend suggested we stop by while we were in the area.  This vineyard exceeded all my expectations; what a wonderful experience we had. Perfect patio for sitting and sipping some of the best wine Texas has to offer. We sipped a good deal and it was all great. Had a hard time choosing what was coming home with us.  This just ensures that we have to come back to get the rest, and then some. Barbara was a gem, very knowledgeable and easily shared that knowledge.  Sam , another asset to the team; great enthusiasm for his craft.  Chip is a delight, and I must say best shirt award! If you are in the area, this is a must; you will be glad you visited

reviews.author: Nikki M.
reviews.description: Went in before dinner for our anniversary and it was above and beyond what I expected!!! This place was an absolute gem! Went in for a wine tasting and left with so much more. Kevin gave us the most in depth wine tasting and I learned SO Much cool information! He's also funny! Lots of jokes... My husband did the liquor tasting and absolutely loved all of it. Wines were really great as well!  We will definitely be back!  I'm recommending to all of our friends/ neighbors!

reviews.author: Kirk M.
reviews.description: Great place to check out.  The whiskey is on another level.   This place is a must!   Love it and you should make the ride to this place.   See this place soon!!!!!

reviews.author: Paul G.
reviews.description: If you want to get your Irish on...or just get it on with wine and spirits I can think of no better place and space than Flanigan's.  We recently stopped there because of curiosity and commonality.   You see my wife's maiden name shares the unique spelling of Flanigan, usually written as Flanagan.  What's in a name?  Everything!     The warm and open interior belies Flanigan's outward warehouse like appearance.   Turns out the space was a set location for The Newton Boys, repurposed to look like a 1930's era hotel.  Yes, you too can walk in the footsteps of Matthew McConaughey!  Beyond the atmosphere in abundance the lovely Mrs. G reports the wine was fabulous, good enough to compel her to buy two bottles of their Chardonnay.  We shared a deliciously diverse cheese plate, reasonably priced at $14.00.    The venue offered live music with a troubadour alternating between Irish folk songs and cowboy tunes from trail.  So if you find yourself somewhere between Liberty Hill and Llano, consider a stop at Flanigan's in Bertram.  Flanigan's is fantastic!

reviews.author: Patrick D.
reviews.description: Great spot for a stop-in for distilled spirits. Kevin Flanigan took great care of us and was an excellent host. Spirits are quite good and the place is straight out of the Old West. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Grandmas E.
reviews.description: The Grandmas are working their way through the Texas Hill Country Winery Map and are having the time of our lives.  Recently, we went "off map" and discovered a delightful gem, Flanigan's in Bertram, TX.  Flanigan's was built in 1904 and still has intact its beautifully crafted grand staircase.  The rest of the building contains movie set modifications from the movie, "The Newton Boys", which starred Matthew McConaughey.   The true charm of Flanigan's is Ted, who lead the guided wine tasting.    Through most of the wine tastings we have tried so far we have gotten the run of the mill run down of the various wines and then left on our own.  Ted led us through an informative and delightful wine tasting experience.  We learned the history behind each wine as well as the shape of the glass can alter the taste of the wine, (riedel.com/en-us/shop) which is something we has not learned in our previous wine tasting adventures. Ted also told us about the history of the wine, the story behind each wines name, history of the building, the movie that was shot there, and so much more.    We also were delighted to met the owners of Flanigan's, Drs. Kevin and Dana Flanigan, and had the pleasure of spending a few moments with them talking about their business and our mutually favorite vacation spot, Alaska.  Unlike other wine tasting venues, Flanigan's also offers a guided Spirit tasting which one "regular" sitting at the bar near us warned, "It will put you on the floor".  Flanigan's also serves custom cocktails and tasty, made in house appetizers and sandwiches.  Be sure to treat yourself to a wine tasting paired with a special Sunday Dinner.   Take a look at their menu here: flaniganspirits.com/wp-c...  Flanigan's is a must visit for wine or spirit lovers. While you are there make sure to ask Dana about the significance of the hummingbird in their logo and found throughout the building.  don't forget to go upstairs to checkout the Hollywood set modifications and to checkout the cozy lounging nooks.  We simply have not experienced a better wine tasting venue than Flanigan's.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: Fantastic place, and while we came for the local potato based spirits we got a lot more than we expected.   Old fashioned decor and historied (get them to tell you about how the place started). Nice little flower and herb garden out front. We came on a Friday around 5 so it was pretty quiet.   We ordered the spirit flight and an Irish Whiskey Smash (tasty!). Our server (who was the head gardener as well - neat!) was personable, professional, and very knowledgeable while he guided us through the flight of neat/bloomed/rocks tastings. We also talked with one of the Flanigans on the liquors themselves when we had some more in depth questions on the processes and techniques. Ask about their water and filtering!  We've been burned with some Texas distillers and winemakers before, and with something so unique I frankly was expecting a semi-pretentious bust. But this is great stuff and a good price to boot. Give them a try if you're in the area!

reviews.author: Gabby B.
reviews.description: Great place to visit! Beautiful inside and the staff was incredibly friendly. They told us about the movie filmed at this location and we needed up watching it a few days later. I enjoyed it much more having visited this place. The whiskey was delicious, unfortunately is was a Sunday and we couldn't purchase a bottle. The food smelled great! We just had breakfast so we had an appetizer that was perfect for us.  Highly recommend. Also, there is a market beside the distillery that is very cute. I got some plants from there.

reviews.author: Jeremy A.
reviews.description: They just opened for their soft opening and don't have any hard spirits ready for sale yet but I'm told they will be ready in a couple weeks before the grand opening.  Flannigan's is partnering with nearby Pilot Knob winery for the wine offerings and likewise the quality and service is excellent.  They have limited food options for now but I'm sure those will be expanded as they grow as well.

reviews.author: Denise K.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great wine and spirits, also food. Beautiful building.  The employees are fantastic and they are very knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Kathy W.
reviews.description: Disappointed,  was good for the tasting, but expected more info or tours/ details on the process.

reviews.author: Lindzi N.
reviews.description: Such nice people. Almost a mom and pop feel. My family was driving through town on our way to camp at Inks lake park and we came across an old timey looking town. We saw signs for a distillery and said "let's pull in and see if we can use the facilities on our long road trip".  To much a surprise the place was like an old saloon from the western daysand had a whole wall of fun board games. We decided on a whim to let the kids stretch their legs and we'd have a bite to eat and a little drink !  Wow! The people were so knowledgeable and the food was delicious b try the grill cheese!

reviews.author: Orlando V.
reviews.description: Such an amazing experience!! You must try both the wine tasting and the distilled spirit tasting. The people are extremely pleasant and knowledgeable of their products. The food was very delightful and the atmosphere was enjoyable. It is a must see!

reviews.author: Tl S.
reviews.description: I really enjoy this place.I have taken family and invited friends from Austin.  It is a bit pricy in the food department  but well worth it. I love the wine,  atmosphere and excellent service.

reviews.author: Richard M.
reviews.description: What an incredible find.  Upon our arrival today at noon, the experience of the 1904 building in Bertram, Texas started.  We were greeted by Kevin and Dana Flanigan (owners) as we walked up up to the beautiful old-fashioned wood bar and the beautiful surroundings of the former home of the Griffith Lumber Company, where you get lost in time with the a slight feel of the old west.  Quit an exquisite location, where the owners made us feel special that included a lesson in fine wine tasting by Kevin that will forever leave a lasting impression on us.  We have been to wineries all over the US, but Flanigan's is by far the best one thus far.  Just a short driving distance from our home north of Austin, we will definitely bring our friends and family for wine and a snack.  A hop and a skip just northwest of Austin, it is a must visit location.

reviews.author: Otis M.
reviews.description: Unique and special. Nothing like Flanigan's anywhere near anywhere. It's the only Spirits and Wine tasting room anywhere in Texas.  Get Ted to do his Spirits tasting show - taste 4 unique products of the distillery across the street. Nothing like it anywhere. Food with a truly world-class presentation. Gotta try it. Well worth the trip to the exotic climes of Bertram.

reviews.author: Kelly H.
reviews.description: A ladies trip. We decided to stop in and were pleasantly surprised by the special history of the building and then the hospitality. The owners were not there and we were told it's even more amazing when they are. Hard to believe because the whiskey tasting was exceptional and the lesson on how to do it was so fun. The distillery is across the street. This place is a Texas gem. They are warm and friendly and knowledgeable. A definitive must visit if you like whiskey. Will try the wine tasting next time.

reviews.author: Laurie L.
reviews.description: A cute little winery off Hwy 29. Very nice decor and renovation to the building. The wines were nice and cannot wait to see their growth and expansion. Not a whiskey fan but my mom is a whiskey snob and said the whiskeys were very nice. Her least favorite was the grappa but she says it's all about a personal taste preference. Her definite favorite was the Texas American Gothic. Very nice staff as well. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Mike And Robin C.
reviews.description: Nothing like an early 20th century building in a small town to help set the mood for your wine tasting experience.  "Iron Star Hall" is the location of owner's Kevin and Dana Flanigan's winery.  Over the years, the two building sites have been a lumber store and post office.  It also served as a setting for the movie, "Newton Boys".  The interior is quite spectacular and does have that 1920's feel and look of the movie set hotel and bar. They've been opened since September of 2016 during the last Oatmeal festival and have been serving up some good wine and spirits along with some great story telling.  There are currently five wines available for tasting.  During your tasting session, Kevin will guide you through his sommelier experience and make sure that your sight, smell, and tasting experience is well done.  Along the way, he may tell you some interesting stories and jokes to help keep things lively.  The 2015 Viaggio is a dry white blend of 50% Muscat Blanc and 50% Muscat Canelli.  It's loaded with citrus aromas and some tartaric acids.  Ironically, as you let it linger, it does smooth out for a nice finish.  The 2015 Rose' is made from Mourvedre.  It has honey and cranberry notes and is perfect for these 100+ degree days in Texas.  The Bear is a 50/50 Merlot and Sangiovese blend using old world style techniques.  It is tannic with a long finish.  The Slainte is a new world style of 35% Malbec, 35% Mourvèdre, 9% Petite Sirah, 12% Petite Sirah, 6% Tannat, and 3% Alicante Bouschet.  Everything but the kitchen sink, right? It is quite fruit forward with some tobacco notes and is well balanced.   Last is the Marmalada.  It's a sweet blend of Chenin Blanc, Viognier and Merlot.  Chilled, this makes a great light bodied wine that is smooth and refreshing and delightful for summertime sipping.  In addition to the wine tasting, there is a spirit tasting to do, as well.  Trust us, Kevin won't let you out without trying them.  We might have to setup a separate blog for these, but you will get the level of quality tasting experience as you do with the wine and some good stories from Kevin.  This is a nice addition to the Bertram area and is worth the stop on your way out to the Hill Country.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Hannah R.
reviews.description: Flanigan's is fantastic :) Loved the wine, loved the atmosphere, loved the people, loved playing the board games

reviews.author: Joshua H.
reviews.description: GF and I both came in at 1pm on a Saturday afternoon via a prior RSVP to meet Ron Yates himself and do a full tasting experience with him as our server. This experience was amazing!  The indoor tasting room is large and open, welcoming and chill. Adorned with many award-winning wines of theirs that number beyond what I could count.   We got front-of-house seats together and begin our tasting journey through several whites and reds and sparkling wines. After what had to be 10-12 wines, we honed our picks down to the 'cabernet claret' for my GF and the 'tandem' red for me. However, not one of the wines we tried did we both truly feel we hated or disliked. Normally 1-2 are an easy pass but frankly, every wine we had was very good. My GF prefers sweeter wines across the board so the fact that nearly every wine she had still pleased her was saying something.  Ron was a top-notch host and server for us. His passion and love for wine is all but very clear in his conviction to his craft, knowledge of wine science and methodology, history of the business origins, name creations and labels to the wine bottles... all of it is an adventure with him as the animated storyteller of his wines and how the grapy goodness in the bottle got there and what you can expect to experience when it hits your lips.  I have to mention that they host an annual chili cook-off event every last Saturday of Feb with live music, 15+ chili contenders, and wine tasting all day long. It's their most successful event to date each year. When he spoke of that I made plans to be there for that for sure!  Ron and the team have a solid handle on this wine thing that is for darn sure! We only barely looked over the vineyard grounds so next time we come back, its gonna be charcuterie board, wine and time out in the vines for sure!

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: I am working on a plan to visit all of the Hill Country wineries at some point. I purchased the Christmas Wine Passport to help me with this in December, and Spicewood was one of the vineyards I passed through. The experience was good. The facilities were beautiful, and it was a peaceful place to chill and relax. I got there shortly after opening, and there was only one other couple there, so I was able to get my tastings quickly and easily. The wines were good, especially their dry sparkling, but I was not moved to come home with anything. The selection I was offered was more heavy on bolder reds, and as a matter of preference I would rather have a good mixutre of reds and whites. Nevertheless, this wouldn't be a place I'd cross off my list. Their tempranillos were quite tasty, and I did like their dry sparkling wine.

reviews.author: Priya K.
reviews.description: So glad we stumbled upon this beautiful winery while we were visiting the horseshoe Bay Area. Walked in on Sunday afternoon, they took us without reservations. Beautiful outdoor patio seating or you can sit inside. They have 2 tasting menus to choose from for $15 each. Hubby went for the bold reds. They don't have all white tasting but our amazing server let me taste all the sparkling wines which was so fun! The sparkling Chardonnay was my favorite. Hubby's favorite was independence and tandem.  They have charcuterie boards ($25)  or you can bring your own food. We got the charcuterie board and had a great selection of cheese.

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: Upon arrival at this gem a couple years ago, we had our doubts. The few Texas wines we had tried were subpar in our view. Spicewood's offerings opened a whole new chapter in our wine lifestyle upon completing that first visit.  When we first entered their tasting room, we noticed a plethora of wine award medallions on display. Being a volunteer on the Houston Rodeo, I was especially pleased to see many Rodeo Houston awards. But that wasn't all - Spicewood has awards from wine contests all around the country! Hmmmmm...  As we proceeded through our tasting, we were immediately impressed. Texas wine? This good? Yes, indeed! So good, in fact, that I joined their wine club without hesitation and remain a member to this day.   We visited again yesterday and enjoyed complimentary tastings of six nice wines and picked up our wine club orders from the past couple of quarters. We sat on their patio overlooking the vineyard and remarked how we are so happy to have found this spot. Oh, and the people working here are gracious and genuinely friendly.  Spicewood is a tad off the beaten path, but definitely worth the trek.

reviews.author: Mop P.
reviews.description: Out of the way a bit but worth it. Staff treats each guest like their experience is important. We came out on a Sunday morning got a couple of tables for our family and did the $15 tasting--6 pours but all around 14% Alcohol. Most are only sold on site from what I heard.  Great for families. Nice slow pace; bring whatever food you want they welcome it.

reviews.author: Tiffany C.
reviews.description: I've visited many Texas Hill Country vineyards and this place was just okay. Sure, the tasting is cheap but the wine was nothing to leave me desiring more. Atmosphere and scenery itself was also nothing to boast about. Sorry, not for me. Pass.

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: As long time Spicewood Vineyard members we always enjoy our trips to the vineyard On this visit we brought our two sons and his family for a picnic at the vineyard. Of course things were a little different with Covid going on but everything was spaced out and carefully planned out for everyone's safety. When we arrived Ron was in the porch helping the guests with their wine selections. He is always very nice and makes everyone feel at home. It's always nice when the owner with everything he has to do remembers your names. After our picnic we got to sit in the Wine Cellar which was awesome. Highly recommend visiting, enjoying the scenery and trying out all the great tasting wines.   Hats off to Ron and Crew!   Adrian and Cyndi

reviews.author: Jim F.
reviews.description: This premier Texas Vineyard has been around for 20 years now. Their customer service is excellent and their wines are some of the best in Texas.

reviews.author: Michae A.
reviews.description: This review is based on their $15 tasting menu which is a great deal for 7 wines.   We love wine and enjoy going to new areas to try tastings so was really excited to try this place based on their reviews but my husband and I were sadly disappointed.   I will say however that they do have an option for an estate tasting that goes for $30 which could be amazing but we decided to pass on it.

reviews.author: Layle M.
reviews.description: Hmm...it has taken me over a week because I hate to say something bad about someone's business. Last Monday we stopped here after a fantastic visit to Marble Falls. We felt...tolerated...at best. We were met by 3 huge dogs who barked incessantly upon our arrival and throughout the visit. When the host finally came out he didn't offer up options for the tastings like we've experienced at other wineries. I'm pretty clear on what I like and had some ideas of wines I'd like to try with the intent of buying enough bottles to make a case of assorted bottles upon departing. The owner, who has great reviews on Yelp, either wasn't there or was busy. We didn't see this person. But we pushed through the tasting, cut it a bit short, and left much, much sooner than we'd ever imagined we would. My intuition upon arrival was to just leave. We should have done that.  This is our experience. And it just wasn't pleasant. We were the only guests yet felt we were in the way.  Hopefully, for others, their visits will be more aligned with this place's other more positive reviews.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: This vineyard has a broad range of varietals for producing their many wines.  Some are very surprising like their Tempranillo Rose, Mourvedra, Cab, and Pinot.   Since they seemed to blend grapes from outside of Texas with estate, gives their wines a different character than most I've tasted from Calif and Washington for the same grape varietal.    For non-wine items to consider, the staff is super friendly and knowledgeable, dog friendly, indoor and outdoor seating with a nice babbling brook adjacent.   They do have an event facility and would make a nice venue for any type of occasion.  They have a hearty cheese plate that won't disappoint.  I would not use the spicy cheese however.

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: I was pleasantly surprised by Spicewood Vineyards.  Spicewood was originally founded by the Manigolds.  Their vision was to make wine only from estate grown grapes. They were smart when they planted their vineyard.  They analyzed the soil and only planted grape varieties that would thrive in their soil.  Nine of the original 17 acres planted by the Manigolds are still producing fruit. For Texas that means something. That means wine sourced from grapes growing on vines that are now 24 plus years old.  Ron Yates took over from the Manigolds and is now the owner of Spicewood, and with wine maker Todd Crowell is making some good Texas sourced wines.  They now have thirty two acres planted on site, and partner with other Texas grape growers.    I like that the tasting room is a bit off the common path. That means it is away from the hustle and bustle of other Hill Country wineries.  The tasting room is spacious.  It has a homey lodge like feeling that is very inviting. They also have a beautiful tree shaded outdoor space.    The staff here are like family. They are knowledgeable and friendly.  I tasted through a selection of their vast options available. I found them to be well balanced.  Surprisingly I liked their Sauvignon blanc along with other of their wines.

reviews.author: Jenn M.
reviews.description: I only put a one because it isn't there anymore. We drove 20 minutes to it and it was closed, I'm assuming. Darn.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: We love this place. Wine and service is always good. Pretty awesome place to hang out for an afternoon. They have live music sometimes also

reviews.author: Lance M.
reviews.description: My experience was a 4-5 like many of those you will see here. However, our lovely day was ruined when one of the resident dogs or a customer's dog charged us aggressively while I was walking with my 10 month old baby in my arms. I cannot be sure if it was a resident dog or a guest's dog, but it was one of the gray colored Blue Lacey's).  Regardless, the dog was unprovoked by us. I had to hand my baby to my wife while I tried to protect them from this aggressive dog, hair bristled up and darting in at me aggressively as if to bite. Luckily it didn't bite us. The dogs owner chastised me for reacting strongly in defense of my wife and baby, which really frustrated me. We immediately left and I will not be returning. I wanted to post this in case a child is attacked by a dog on their premises in the future. It is documented and the owners have been informed that their aggressive dog or lack of leash laws are creating a liability and awful experience.

reviews.author: Sherry W.
reviews.description: This is better wine and value compared to Stone house winery.  It is $10 for seven tastings and only one wine was not from Texas. They have indoor and outdoor seating. There is no view at this vineyard. Staff is friendly. There was a friendly house dog wandering around.  They have t shirts for sale.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: The Good Guy. Wow. It's an excellent red wine. It's smooth and tasty. It's not cheap. It's $42. I couldn't care less. I'll pay for wine as long as it's delicious and this one is fabulous. I like the patio outside. You can bring your dog and  kids if you'd like. The ambience inside and out is relaxing and fun. It's an excellent place to chill out with loved ones. I'll be back.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: I'm badly remiss in not posting a positive review for almost a year; what's more this is one of my personal favorite wineries in Texas Hill Country.  It's time I corrected this.   Spicewood has one of my personal favorite tasting rooms; while on the inside it's nothing special, the outside grounds and seating mimic an upscale, modern country house that I could see myself living in (*cough cough* once I win the lottery *cough cough*).  There's also a cool little stream they have running through the place so you can hear the sound of running or falling water when you sit to have a sip.  Nice touch.  Spicewood's won a bunch of awards for various wines but the two standouts IMO are their 2013 Syrah and their Riesling, which has a fruity taste and a magnificent green-apple crisp bouquet.  Note: As of May 2016, their site does not show the Riesling for sale, so I'd call ahead if you want to taste it.  As an added bonus, it's only 10 minutes away from It's All Good and Opie's, both of whom have some of my favorite BBQ outside the Austin area.

reviews.author: Bob P.
reviews.description: Great place.  We enjoyed a really nice Cabernet while sitting in comfortable armchairs; it felt like we were sitting in someone's living room, and we had a great time.  Not only will we be back there soon, but we bought wine to take home, a bottle of which I will be having this very night.

reviews.author: Carrie H.
reviews.description: Spicewood vineyards is a very sweet place just off the road in Spicewood. The staff is very friendly, the facility is very clean, and the wines are superb! Our sommelier was such good conversation!  Great events space as well!

reviews.author: Kait C.
reviews.description: MINDBLOWN! These ladies came out to La Cantera mall and I could not be more impressed with them. So happy to have this new business near us!

reviews.author: Howard E.
reviews.description: WOW!  This is truly an experience that's TOTALLY different from any traditional winery.  Their mixers are not what you might think - they are made with wine and real fruit - no "sugar water, artificial flavor" here. It's the real fruit that makes them not too sweet, and you can blend it exactly how you want just by adding anything from straight water to spiced rum! My wife's favorite is the passion fruit for the summer - she mixes it with HEB 1877 mineral water. We also picked up a spiced dark chocolate and raspberry - to mix together!  The staff is very helpful and super friendly!  They can show you how to mix different cocktails for different tastes - like a raspberry Moscow mule, or a grand sangria.  If you are looking for something truly out of the ordinary, this is your place!

reviews.author: Liza M.
reviews.description: Amazing wine bar in Steiner!  And they are open during this winter storm from 4-6 today.  They saved my day!  Hope they save yours too!  Shop local!  Everyone that works there is nice and helpful!

reviews.author: Niki S.
reviews.description: Where's my sixth star, I mean, glass of wine?! ;) Tucked away in the north Austin hills, this place is a gem, worth trekking over for if you have any excuse to be anywhere near it.  This is the type of place that a group could enjoy, a wine beginner wouldn't find intimidating, and a wine snob could also find something to please their pallet. Good selection of all types, but not intimidating.  THE STAFF ARE ALL SO FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL! I was given a few suggestions from the owner, and they were all so spot on, I loved every one I tried.   Love the clean but welcoming decor, and how everything feels approachable and interactive (Glasses for sale, books, etc) and there's even some outdoor seating for those feeling a fire pit (if memory serves correctly, but the night I was here, the rain kept everyone inside).   Bring some girls, a group, or just stop by on your way home for a friendly wine bar with the coziness that makes you want to curl up and order an entire bottle and chat with folks.

reviews.author: Sara S.
reviews.description: Steiner Ranch has been slow to develop despite its rapidly growing population so I was so happy to see a new wine bar open up. Sloan + Parker was the perfect place to catch up with my girl friends. We shared a bottle of Napa Cab, a charcuterie board and delightful conversation with the hosts. The decor is great, ambiance is fun and it was overall a nice experience. Sloan + Parker is a much needed addition to Steiner Ranch!

reviews.author: Jen R.
reviews.description: What an amazing experience and we can't wait to come back... weekly!  I'm from Indiana, husband from California. We moved here about 15 months ago and haven't found any amazing wines we enjoyed until today! Don't know if anyone else has had this issue in finding great wines, particularly Cabernet, in Texas, but we have! We came in and were welcomed with open arms and amazing conversation! In depth information of wines and tasting until we found the right glass to order.  After 15 months of living here we have finally found our "home" in regards to wine and friends! We will definitely  be back and can't wait to experience all they have to offer! Down to earth people and an experience you won't regret.  P.S. the decor is amazing!

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: A friend of mine that knows the owner and lives in Steiner invited me to a ladies night at this establishment. It was extremely loud and busy.  It is obvious that this area needs something like this.  As a woman owned business, I am happy to see it thrive.  Deep into Steiner Ranch, I am not sure people who live outside of the area would be seeking it out but worth the trip if you are into wine and want to check out the space.  Could be a good place for a celebration.  Steiner probably has enough people to support.  Rose, white, red, bubbles and brews.  Cheese plates.  You can buy bottles to take with you with various mustards, jams, etc in their pantry. Glad I got to experience this location and wish them all the luck moving forward.

reviews.author: Dani K.
reviews.description: Absolutely love Sloan + Parker. I'll admit that I'm pretty easy to please in the wine department, but I really do love all the wines I've tried! I appreciate that the wine list is ever changing and that the employees all do an amazing job with recommendations and descriptions. There is also a pretty large price range so you're able to choose a glass based on how much you'd like to spend, which is great for their range of customers. Now about the decor/atmosphere: I'd like to have my home designed to look similar to S+P. It's fun and new and modern but elegant and sophisticated at the same time. I wouldn't change a thing!   My favorite time to go is on a chilly evening. I love to be curled up by the fire on the patio with blankets (provided by S+P) and a big glass of cab with live music playing in the background. Come on! That's heaven!   Do yourself a favor and follow them on Facebook. They host great events, my favorite being Sip In SWEATS. You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Kerry S.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! Peyton was an amazing host and knows the name of everyone that walks in. Incredible hospitality and ability to pinpoint you pallet to recommendations that will resonate with you. Hands down, five stars!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Fantastic place. They have a really nice wine selection plus a solid draft list for those seeking beer. Service is fantastic and they bringing in rotating local musicians as well. Highly recommend S+P.

reviews.author: Eric N.
reviews.description: Locally owned business that knows wine!  My wife and I love coming here for a drink and a bite then leaving with a bottle.  Our go-to place in the neighborhood

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: I love S+P! It has a chic yet comfortable atmosphere and stellar wine and beer selections. It's a great place for a night out with friends and also perfect for date night. The owner really knows her stuff too! If you need a recommendation she can give you so many amazing suggestions.

reviews.author: Nate P.
reviews.description: Love coming here to relax (inside or outside on the patio) and get some glasses of wine. There are delicious beer options as well. They also have some snacking plates (cheese, charcuterie) and some other treats. If you're feeling indecisive, you can taste a wine before buying a glass (I find their descriptions to be spot on and helpful), and there's usually a few wine flight options on rotation.

reviews.author: Dan S.
reviews.description: Came out for a networking group and had a great time. Will be bringing my wife back. She would love this place!

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: We often stop here for a glass or 2 of wine.  The people here are always welcoming and kind.  The wine selection and good and prices are reasonable.  If your hungry they don't have a full menu but they do at least sell finger food snack items. They also sell great local spices, maple syrup, olive oil, and other great items.  Great stop at Georgetown square!!

reviews.author: Vandesha L.
reviews.description: My sister came to visit so we were on a little adventure. She wanted a souvenir so we stopped into some of the shops downtown. We landed in this wine room and ended up sitting for a wine flight, good conversation, and lots of laughs. While we didn't get a wine membership we did buy 2 bottles and cigars for Dad. The staff was lovely and their COVID practices made us feel safe.

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: I left Grape Creek and now I come here. They are always friendly, and their wine is very unique. Forget California and embrace Texas here! Their holiday cranberry wine was a huge hit with family, and there are so many wonderful wines. You will love it here.

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: Fun place to stop in, grab a glass, and walk around the square. The lady we spoke to said the owner is going to add more seating in the future. You can do the wine tasting but have to be seated. I had a red blend and my husband had cranberry. They both were sweet and light, which is just what we were in the mood for. I didn't want to carry bottles around the square but next time I'll take a few home.

reviews.author: Christina G.
reviews.description: First time here on a Saturday during Market Days. I love this place and look forward to becoming a member when I move to Georgetown this summer!  Super friendly staff! My friend and I were greeted promptly and given an overview of the wines for our flight-sampler. We scored a small table. This was a huge win as there are limited seats, I believe up to 25 seats. The staff checked in on us as we tasted our way thru the wines. When we finished tasting, we bought a glass of our fave wine and continued to walk through market days on the square.  Anywho, if your walking the Georgetown Square, stop in for a tasting and or a glass or 2. Cheers.

reviews.author: Vaughn O.
reviews.description: The wife and I visited Georgetown Winery for our second tasting of the day on the square. After a more upscale experience in a different tasting room on the square, it was pleasant to ease into this more relaxed space. We were promptly greeted by the hostess, who became our server, and perused the menu of wines. $10 each for a sampling of 4 wines. Nice price, and fitting to the setting which would have been appropriate for beer as well. Neither of us remembers which wines we ordered, except for my two port samplings, but neither of us was overly impressed either. My ports were good, if extremely sweet and fruity, and the wife liked 2 of hers. She was disappointed in her first choice, which was the most expensive wine on the menu as priced by the bottle.  We didn't buy a bottle, nor would we return if we ever visit Georgetown again, but the ambience and carefree environment did add to an overall relaxing day on the square.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: I love the ambience. Had a glass of cabernet Sauvignon and walked around. The shop is quaint and the service outstanding. In addition to tasty wines, they sell fabulous trinkets. I can't remember the last time I laughed so hard!  I took photos of the towels and signs that made me laugh. Check them out. BTW, I'll be back.

reviews.author: Nicole E.
reviews.description: Nice chilled laidback spot for a spot or two to wine tasting. Room and tables to seat 1 at the bar to larger groups in the back. Lots of fun wine related plaques, signs, wine toppers, shelves full of bottles and every imaginable gift item for wine lovers. Nice indoor garden feel from the string lights lining above your head. Very rustic and cozy feel with all of the wood from wall to wall shelves to tables and chairs and floors. They serve wine in plastic cups. In the back there are olive oils to try out.

reviews.author: Julia G.
reviews.description: Georgetown Winery is an adorable little handout in the heart of Georgetown. This is a great spot for a date night, girls night, or just an afternoon with a small group of friends or family. The actual vineyard is located in Rockdale Texas- this is just a small tasting room right on the Georgetown Square.   For $10, you can taste 4 wines. My spouse also got 4 tasting, so in total- I got to sample 8 wines. My favorite was the Big Tex which is aged for 9 months in oak. A full bottle will set you back only $24. Create price for the quality.  I also love their Viognier, I love white wines- and this was so light. I would casually sip this on any warm summer day. One thing I didn't love their fruity wines. The Blueberry and Blackberry wines tasted like they used artificial flavoring. The couple next to use was absolutely loving the blackberry, so maybe it just wasn't for me. Totally fair.   They also have cheese and crackers available. I feel like any wine tasting isn't complete without a good cheese plate. Unfortunately, we had dinner plans right after, so I enjoyed my wine cheese-free.   I absolutely plan on coming back here soon for some wine + cheese.

reviews.author: Denis A.
reviews.description: Laurie and Heather were wonderful today! Even in quarantine, they managed to provide a wonderful (socially distanced) experience. We are wine club members and LOVE this place ($50 per quarter gets you 2 tastings, 6 full glasses, and 2 whole bottles of wine). The perfect spot to enjoy some quality wine and some quality time with friends and family. We always bring cards or a board game and have a blast.

reviews.author: Bonnie G.
reviews.description: Went here on day trip on our way to Austin. Stopped into the winery and the two ladies were not helpful. We had to ask all the questions about the winery and their response was short and curt. We we the only people in the winery and yet they felt as if it was an inconvenience to talk to us. Will not return. Will continue to visit  the other Georgetown in South Carolina where people are more welcoming to all.

reviews.author: Joey G.
reviews.description: We are club members, and we love going to get our wines. The peach wine is amazing. They also have a lot of very good reds. We love all the little knickknacks in the store also.

reviews.author: Littledebbie9959 N.
reviews.description: This winery is awesome! Friendly ladies, very personable, you feel like they're your friend and they are!  Prices are more than reasonable and membership even better! They observe the rules over and beyond! Owners are great! The music is wonderful!

reviews.author: Erin T.
reviews.description: The best winery for friends.  My friends and I have only been members of this winery for about a year, but this is honestly one of our favorite locations to consistently come and visit when we're all together. They have sweeter drinks and wineritas for people who aren't fond of dry wines and their wine club memberships are literally built to be shared. There is table seating inside where you can sit for hours and catch up. Laurie and Heather in particular are so sweet with their service and their recommendations. I can't think of where else I would rather spend my weekend.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: My favorite winery!  I feel like family every time I walk in the door.  Chelsea and Lori give the absolute best service, and I love bringing friends in to try their wine.  Chelsea and Lori can describe every wine and recommend tastings, glass, or a bottle.  Always a fun time at Georgetown Winery!  Thank you for making my family, friends, and me feel so special.

reviews.author: Roxanne T.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a second visit during a crowded weekend event, and thoroughly enjoyed both the service and our wine-tasting. My partner liked two of the reds so much she bought a bottle of each.  This is a long narrow shop that has lots of knick-knack items displayed so we did not move around much, but it was fun to read all the funny quotes on the signs and towels and glasses, etc. The folks at the bar were helpful and friendly, and we enjoyed this visit much more than our first.

reviews.author: Kristen V.
reviews.description: This is the perfect meet up spot with your girlfriends. That's not to say that I don't see plenty of men in here, too. It's a great spot for day drinking. Any day of the week. And I know from experience.   I don't bother doing the tastings here - I know exactly what I like. Their unoaked chardonnay is butter and smooth. After that I move over to their pinot noir - which isn't too sweet but not so dry that I need to carry in my own water bottle. I do not drink fruit wines but my sweet lil granny does and she swears by the pomegranate and blueberry.   You can buy gifts and chochskies here. I always like to pick up a few bottles of wine before I had home to visit family. Their wine club is probably the best you can be apart of in terms of benefits.   I would really like if they would provide bread so that we can try the olive oils. Probably smart that they don't do that or else all of us winos would use that as food. :)

reviews.author: Robert P.
reviews.description: This is hands down the best winery in Texas. From the amazing staff to the wonderful owners, they are top notch when it comes to customer service, wine knowledge and selection. One of the things we love about Georgetown Texas. Georgetown Winery. Thanks for all the fun times.

reviews.author: Becky K.
reviews.description: This review is for the tasting room in Georgetown Square. The location closes at 6 and wine tastings end at 5:30. The room is quaint with many cork decorations and tables made from wine barrels. There is a good selections of whites as well as reds. My favorite was the peach wine. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly.

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: Well my accidental tourist day continues and I ended up here, alcohol y'all!  Never knew anything about Georgetown except that it was an annoying mile marker on Interstate Hell-35 indicating after driving north for an hour you have gone nowhere.  Low and behold there is actually an ancient town square buried in there somewhere. So what else to do but gravitate like a bee to flower and find the alcohol. It's here and it's called wine.  The place is filled full on a steamy June Saturday afternoon. Saddle up to the bar and start in on the tasting. I was in a red mood and took 4 tastes.  The chambourcin was an interesting new grape for me and it was deeply dark in color yet light on the tannins. It was nice but I like tannin and the Tempranillo delivered on all counts.  It was a nice pit stop and I recommend it if you accidentally end up touring the square of Georgetown.

reviews.author: Steven D.
reviews.description: One of our favorite places on the square! If you like wine at all, come here. Anthony and his crew makes it so fun. I learn something new every time we visit and I've never felt that "wine snob" view at all. Just great wines a and even better people.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: It's a lovely wine room.   Our wine guy was terrible. I'm guessing he was having a bad day. Or maybe we looked like we weren't big spenders. Who knows. He was very unwelcoming. We had to ask him questions he just didn't give us any information about the winery at all or the wine club. Must have been a bad friday for him.   I passed on getting a flight b/c of the wine guy. I got a glass of a red blend to go so I could shop around the square. The wine was fantastic. I was going to buy a bottle but found another place on the other side of the square.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: We've been through a handful of wine rooms and wineries around Central Texas this is a nice little quiet spot never really super crowded and delightfully not very loud so we could carry on a conversation the wine selection here is great but be prepared to spend a little bit more than you normally would we spent $28 for a bottle of Muscato which is pretty reasonable, But the people here we're super friendly and the service was great so for that price I must say I could do that again

reviews.author: Vaughn O.
reviews.description: Barons Creek was our first stop on a planned wine tasting adventure around the square. We were greeted by our sommelier Tom, seated, and the tasting process explained. Tom provided a charming mixture of highbrow wine knowledge and light humor as he took us through our tasting journey of 5 red wines. The wife liked all of the wines, and I liked all but one (a tempranillo). Never fear! Tom is here! Tom saved the day (and the Tres Primos reputation) by pouring us an extra taste, but instructing us to first chew a chocolate-covered coffee bean before pouring the wine across that bean in our mouths. This somehow transformed the flavour into something amazingly pleasing for us both!  We also ordered chicken empanadas, which were surprisingly delicious! For some reason we did not expect such flavor and complexity from a wine bar's kitchen. The empanada crust was crispy and flaky, with a filling of chopped chicken, onions and seasonings that burst into the mouth with each bite. This was no Tex-Mex kitchen empanada. Hats off Barons! Hats off!

reviews.author: Meghan A.
reviews.description: Visiting Georgetown...Was on a search for a search for a romantic day date and ran into this place. I am more than grateful to have walked into this place.   Chris was behind the bar and he welcomed us right away! The place provided social distancing and comfortability. Hubby and I just absolutely loved the service and feeling of what a wine tasting is meant to feel. Chris was so wonderful with the wine process.   Will be back for sure!

reviews.author: A H.
reviews.description: I'm so glad we chose Barons Creek over all the competition on the area. Anthony truly rolled out the red carpet and made our experience rememberal . Seven of us had the pleasure of tasting six different house made wines and delicious appetizers.

reviews.author: Anna-Maria C.
reviews.description: This place is a must-go on The Square. Not only are their wines delicious, the staff working there are amicable and knowledgeable. Chris especially helpful as he knows a lot about their wines and brings charisma to the already-inviting atmosphere. Definitely have to stop by for some vino!

reviews.author: Kim D.
reviews.description: We called ahead to see if they were open before driving an hour. They said they were open but neglected to tell us that their services were limited without reservations because of it being Valentine's weekend. We are new wine club members and felt like we were treated very rudely when we arrived. We loved our experience at Barons in Fredericksburg but would not recommend the Georgetown location. Our plan was to buy a case of the Boots wine but after they way were treated, we left our Boots behind.

reviews.author: J. S.
reviews.description: We spent an hour of fun here tasting wine but did not much care for their selection of provided wines. Barons had more of an uppity vibe to it, so maybe I wasn't picking up what they were putting down from the jump as I tend gravitate toward a more casual atmosphere... especially when it comes to wine tasting.   They were nice and helpful here and poured us a cup of Tempranillo and Crazy Train on our way out, to drink while we walked around the square. Both good wines but did not justify the price tag for us.

reviews.author: Josh O.
reviews.description: We love Barons Creek. Anthony is amazing and constantly ensuring guest have a great experience.  Thankful to have this in Georgetown.

reviews.author: T R.
reviews.description: Absolutely delightful service and atmosphere. It's so great to have a place on the square to enjoy wine. The bottles are a little pricier than expected (I think maybe you need to join the wine club?) but if you are looking for a solid enjoyable afternoon or evening out with friends, a nice cheese plate or a bite from the restaurant next door, and knowledgeable sommeliers who can find you something you will enjoy - you can't go wrong.

reviews.author: A. J.
reviews.description: Awesome place to have some wine.  Friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Ask all the questions about wine you want and they will have the answer.   Has piano in back.   Decor is nice and the place is super clean.   It's definitely a fun stop around the square.  Go have a glass or two!!!

reviews.author: Elizabeth K.
reviews.description: I don't know what I was expecting when I walked in, but I was blown away. It's beautiful inside. The wine counter/bar is long. There was live music. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. We did a wine tasting and then sat down with a glass. I'm really glad this is here. It's perfect.

reviews.author: Bailey B.
reviews.description: This place is super cozy and perfect to go to on a cooler rainy day, and not crowded at all; the server was polite and made a good choice when I asked him to surprise me after informing him I preferred drier spicier reds.

reviews.author: Kelly O.
reviews.description: Chris is amazing. He made our very first wine tasting experience incredible. We went as two couples and had a great time conversing with Chris and learning about the wines we were introduced to. 100% recommend.

reviews.author: Marco Antonio G.
reviews.description: Love the new location and all the wine hosts. Friendly, kind and eager to share their knowledge of wine. If you happen to stop by say hi to Anthony, he's an awesome person who knows a lot. And lets not forget the wine! So far we love all the wines and location and will keep coming back. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Blane W.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere. Cool vibe walking in. Presumptuous personality behind the bar. Extravagant prices. $15.16 for what looked like maybe 6 oz.  Wine was decent, yet no desire to return.

reviews.author: Travis H.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere.     However the wine was terrible.   The first red flag should be when the bartender says "we tell all our customers not to smell the wine".     Who says that?    Now I know why.    It smelt like, well I just cannot describe it.  I am a member of 6 wine clubs and have tasted my share of wines.   Definitely would not recommend this place especially when most of their wine is significantly overpriced at $40+ per bottle.

reviews.author: Mindy W.
reviews.description: We loved this winery! Chris hosted our tasting and was knowledgeable, friendly, and fun. He even made recommendations for local hot spots and wines to order at each restaurant. The wine was delicious and ambience was fantastic. They had live music when we went that really added to the atmosphere. I recommend and will go back!

reviews.author: Reynaldo B.
reviews.description: Wonderful atmosphere! Great wine! Keri was amazing at explaining all the tasting and we realized we had a very similar palate. Very friendly staff and welcoming. I'm enjoying it here!

reviews.author: Diane S.
reviews.description: If you saw the pics online and thought you'd be sipping wine in an Adirondack chair by the lake, you will be disappointed. You have to be a member of their club to be enjoy that.   However, despite this, you won't be disappointed you made the trip. The suburbs are approaching but there is enough open area on the drive there to make it relaxing. They greeted us as new visitors with a tasting of their Cuddles Cuvée, light and refreshing. We decided to get a couple of glasses of wine and sit outside. They have cheese plates available too. Their Chardonnay and Red Blend were very good.

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Ok, it's a little off the beaten path from all other wineries in the area, but well worth the visit. They do require reservations, so don't forget to do that! They have a beautiful set up with great views and allow dogs on the outdoor patio. The staff is friendly and the wine is really delicious. We left with a couple of bottles!

reviews.author: Jim F.
reviews.description: Be aware that these people do not do anything without a reservation. They were nice enough to seat us but it was obvious there would be minimal service. The staff present were quite nice, just busy. We were allowed to buy wine to self serve on the back porch and were welcomed to be inside the tasting room or outside which was near the vineyard - very nice out there.  Their vineyard was planted in 1999. That may be a little unusual for the immediate Austin area. The vines and the grounds are very well maintained.   As far as the place, it is beautiful. It has the feeling of Napa but with Austin-area live oak trees.  The property borders Lake Travis though it is barely visible from the tasting room area. There's an exclusive members only area that is on the lake.  We purchased the Claros Reserve which is a Norton grape (hybrid) and is the grape grown on the estate. The wine was surprisingly excellent and cost $35.   I think that, with a reservation, this would've been a superior experience.

reviews.author: Sabrina R.
reviews.description: Our visit to Stone House Vineyard was a true highlight of our anniversary vacation and and a delightful way to cap off our trip. The property is absolutely gorgeous - I mean you can truly just sit and relax for hours while you take in the stunning view. I had made reservations but we arrived a tad bit early and Liz was happy to accommodate us sooner. I'd like to take a moment to offer my sincerest appreciation for Liz as she made this experience so memorable for us. It was our first proper wine tasting and she truly took the time to explain every single wine to us - notes/scents to look for, best food pairings, explaining the difference in textures, where the grapes are from - I mean the whole nine yards. She even showed us the safer, beginner way to swirl the wine to really delight your senses before tasting. I had added a cheese board to our reservation which we thoroughly enjoyed! Liz was patient with all of our questions on the wine (and cheese), had a wonderful sense of humor, and just a lovely personality to deliver a phenomenal package of customer service. Every single wine we tried was delicious! We took home a bottle of Claros but we seriously wanted to take home one of each. If we weren't relocating soon, we would 100% have signed up for their membership. If we get to visit the area again, we will definitely stop in. I highly recommend visiting!

reviews.author: Gina F.
reviews.description: Had an amazing time visiting Stone House Vineyard! I wish I had known about it before. A short drive from Austin and well worth it. The wines were excellent with a lot of variety and worth the cost for the tasting. The property is stunning and did I mention the view of Lake Travis? They graciously let us sit in the members area and explore the property after our tasting and I'm seriously considering joining the club. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Natalie S.
reviews.description: DON'T COME HERE WITH KIDS. Can't speak of the wine, because we didn't have any. No tastings, just by the bottle. No glasses and no kids aloud anywhere on the grounds. Disappointing, because we drove out of our way and had our young daughter with us. Were hoping to have a nice little picnic. Waste of time. It would have been nice if it were posted on the website. It was a beautiful vineyard!

reviews.author: Shannon R.
reviews.description: Good wine and great people!!!! Went to a few wineries in the area and this one is definitely worth the visit.

reviews.author: Shannon F.
reviews.description: Absolutely beautiful and handling COVID well. You need a reservation but we found that there was plenty of space and it was quiet and we really enjoyed that. The wine is delicious!

reviews.author: Sherry W.
reviews.description: This vineyard has a nice view of the water. You get five wines for $20. Only one wine was from Texas. A few of the wines were very poor in taste. It is table seating inside or  they have tables  outside. I prefer Spicewood winery.

reviews.author: Nikita D.
reviews.description: Came here for wine tasting and was very impressed with the vineyard. We were staying at Horseshoe Bay Resort and were deciding between several vineyards to try in the area. I'm really glad we ended up trying Stone House. We decided to sit on the patio for our tasting. I tried the classic tasting and my dad tried the reserve tasting. The wines were mostly from Australia. They had one of their house wines on my menu. I thought the quality of wines was very average. We also got a cheese board which was really good.  The area was picturesque and we were allowed to go down to an area for wine club members. They had an enclosed outdoor area for members only with a view of the lake.  Overall, if you want to go to a vineyard with great views, this is the place to go.

reviews.author: Chassey W.
reviews.description: This is a fantastic little vineyard tucked away on the south shore of Lake Travis. Sit up on the patio or down by the lake. The employees were super attentive and very kind. The cheese plate a great compliment. And they let us have our fur baby on the patio too . The special reserve Pinot noir is excellent!

reviews.author: Kelli C.
reviews.description: A beautiful hidden treasure. The atmosphere is fantastic- views of Lake Travis and grape vines sitting under a covered patio with a blanket and fireplace. It is definitely off the beaten path, but that is what makes it so serene. We enjoyed our wine tasting, and purchased two bottles of the Shiraz.

reviews.author: Ben G.
reviews.description: To start - what an absolutely stunning property! The service and entire staff was incredibly warm, friendly, helpful and engaging. We came with our 2 dogs and had a truly special, romantic early evening on my fiancé's birthday. The wine and tastes were exceptional and we will definitely be back! Thank you!

reviews.author: Lindsay M.
reviews.description: Had such a great experience here with my family. We came on a rainy Saturday and they were nothing but accommodating. We had the best welcome with Jaramy, she was so informative and polite. We were greeted with a welcome drink then walked through their wine selection. We decided on a bottle to share with an amazing charcuterie board. The outside patio was covered with great views of the estate. Overall a great vineyard with great staff.

reviews.author: Amanda H.
reviews.description: This is by far the best winery around the Austin area.  Great staff and there isn't a wine they serve that I would drink.  That's hard to say for most Texas wineries.  They have beautiful lake views for wine club members.  I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: Excellent vineyard. The winemaker is from Australia and they have wines shipped from their Australian vineyard.

reviews.author: Amy K.
reviews.description: Champagne and Rose' Lake Travis views. Absolutely beautiful and relaxing. The service is friendly. Dogs are allowed. Lake views. Relaxing lounges. Champagne is delicious and rose is more on the dry side. Love this place.

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: From the minute we walked in, Jaramy made this a special experience for our group, me especially. She welcomed us and gave us a nice toast of something bubbly and told us about the vineyard and its owner, Angela. The wine of the month was Angela's Wish. I was having a particularly emotional time with it at this point because my beloved grandmother, Angela, passed away recently and had wanted to visit this area. I, of course, had to get the wine of the month so I could keep that bottle. I told Jaramy of my grandmother and the significance of the name of the bottle and she listened with an open heart. My group also got a nice charcuterie board and sat outside. Though it was pouring down rain, we still had a lovely time conversing with others and enjoying the view.

reviews.author: Brittany A.
reviews.description: Warm atmosphere and welcoming staff. Andy was very accommodating of my family and I. The wines were delightful and the charcuterie boards were delicious and had a good presentation. They really made sure we had a pleasurable experience. I will definitely be back in the future!

reviews.author: T W.
reviews.description: The wine was wonderful and the view was amazing!! Bo was our sever. He was great! He took his time telling us about the place and each wine. We almost didn't come because of the reviews about the lake being blocked off , a benefit for members only. We asked and they let us go down and check out the place, no problem at all. We were there for hours!

reviews.author: Annie T.
