reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Came, drank, conquered (ok stretch on that last one)  We came for the Yelp elite event and tasted our heart out! The original location off 35 is so so cute the moment you walk in. I will say the location at first struck me as odd - but the moment you walk through the doors you are transported into this little artsy wine oasis.   The wines on tap are so fun to browse and the wall art is so Austin it makes you think you can buy them (i mean maybe you can?!). The seating is ample indoor AND a outdoor to give you any desired vibe. Will absolutely be back!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Found this place by chance. Stopped since we saw it served wine. We were happy to see that it was a serve your own wine type of place. Wine on tap is such a great idea.   They give you a card that you use to get your wine. You get charged by the ounce. They do have happy hour. They have a good selection of wines. For those that don't like wine, they have a handful options (margarita, old fashioned)   The place is cute and they have a nice outdoor patio. They had a food truck the day we went.   Con:  - the wine comes out pretty fast, so you have to be careful as it can add up quick. If you want to taste first, be quick at closing it.  - there's no way to figure out how many ounces you are serving yourself.

reviews.author: Damaris C.
reviews.description: This is the perfect place to try a new wine experience. When you walk in you're give a wine card which lets you self pour from a variety different types of wines! I recommend going on Wednesday for 1/2 glasses of wine!

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: From the moment we walked in we felt welcome! They were very friendly showing us how the process works. You could tell they were glad we were new.  They truly have great enthusiasm for their jobs and this business.  A new product even arrived and we were informed we came at a terrific time!   It was so easy to tap my Wanderlust card and release the wine. There's a great variety of wines to choose from, including wines from France, Spain, some sangrias and hard lemonade. Warning: make sure all the taps are closed before you insert your card. I didn't see that one was turned a bit and wine started trickling and money ringing up on my card.  Because it's not very bright, I didn't see the wine flowing. Lesson learned!   There's an interesting room off the patio for private events.  I'm jealous I couldn't pop in!   Happy to see the food truck. Mmm: truffle fries and bruschetta!  You MUST come visit this location!

reviews.author: Xiao Z.
reviews.description: Have been here for the elite event and saved this great place to hang out with friends. We went there for some wine and found out that they also have a food truck in the backyard serving cheese board. Perfect! We had a great night talking and enjoyed the drink with snacks!

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: What a cool little concept and space to drink wine in downtown Austin. Came here during happy hour last weekend with some friends and was overall impressed with the wine tasting here. There whole gimmick is you you can try any of the wines on the wall tap and your charged by the ounces you drink. I will warn you use a light touch on the taps as I learned the hard way the first try. Most of the wines were half off during happy hour which makes for a great deal and I also liked that there was a range of wines from across the globe and wasn't specific to one region. They also had patio seating an Italian food truck in case you get hungry. The only downside like most places downtown is the parking but I heard that's less of an issue at their east side location which I'm excited to try next!

reviews.author: Christina V.
reviews.description: I love a serve yourself wine bar! Wanderlust charges by the ounce and although it adds up pretty quickly, if you're able to pace yourself, you can have a whole evening of fun. I got out of there spending well under $50 for two people, so we really didn't go all that crazy.  Try a million different wines and mixed drinks! they give you a card at the entrance and it just rings up your total, then they charge you on the way out. We had an issue with a bunch of cork settling into one of our glasses and they were able to remove that pour from our tab. The only thing is that it's hard to keep track of your favorite pours because there are so many options.  There is also a ton of space to sit. They have inside seating/lounge tables, there is outdoor seating and there's also an additional event space which you can sit in. We sat in the event space with a large group and it was so comfy. I would love to return!

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: I love Wanderlust Wine Company! It's such a fun environment, and they have so many excellent wines to choose from! The downtown location is the perfect spot to hit up if you're transitioning your night from the east side to hanging out downtown. If you haven't been to the new Eastside location, it is seriously one of the coolest buildings in Austin. There is so much local art there!

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: Wanderlust is an ATX gem for sure. They have outstanding service and a great wine selection. I also really like their cocktails on tap, especially the lemonade seltzer that they have. Every time I have come in, Blake has always provided excellent customer service and understanding of the wine offerings. Overall, I will be back many more times to this place for their superb wine and service!  2 pro tips: Come in on Wednesdays for half off and make sure to try heal of the boot food truck.

reviews.author: Maurice H.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and great wine!! My go to on Wednesday's and any other day I want some good wine. The live performances makes my night I swear. If you're in the city and want some good wine, want to vibe with cool ppl and bob your head to some good music just stop by and grab your wanderlust card.

reviews.author: Kerri M.
reviews.description: I love the wine on tap concept and enjoyed choosing between all of the different wines at Wanderlust! When you walk in, they give you a separate card that you swipe before each one of your pours. I liked it because you could pour as much or as little as you wanted and it gave you the opportunity to try different wines without being committed to a full glass. Honestly, it reminded me of those self-serve frozen yogurt places. I also really liked the outdoor area - it was a great place to hang out with friends and we had a great time taking photos at the photo booth.  The only downside was that it was more expensive than I was expecting. They give you the price per ounce on the screen, but once you start pouring, it adds up VERY quickly. I could have spent the same amount of money on a way nicer and fuller glass of wine.  Overall, I enjoyed the concept and fun vibes. Would love to come back during their happy hour or something when things are half-priced!

reviews.author: Mark A.
reviews.description: "Froyo for wine"; Fun idea, smooth process, nice spot, bit pricey.   It's a charge by oz place, like Froyo with all of the taps requiring an RFID card that you get by associating with a credit card at the front desk. Place the card on the reader and pour what you want into your glass. They have over 50 different styles, including mead, white, red, dry/sweet, and some wine-based cocktail style drinks.  They typically range from $1-3+ per oz so you'll probably come out with a $5-10 glass (4 oz) which is pretty comparable to most places.  There is both indoor and outdoor seating; interior is mostly couch seating and outdoor is patio/bench with faux grass. You can also bring dogs. The outdoor is a bit noisy, especially since it backs to another bar and is right under 35 so it was nicer indoors than out.  I don't usually drink wine because it gives me headaches and I certainly felt it the next day even after just 2 small glasses; possibly because of tasting so many different kind, so beware! Nice for trying something new but possible to get sick if you're mixing so much.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Stopped into this downtown location after already visiting the location on Shady ln earlier in the week. I definitely enjoyed both locations for different reasons. I appreciate the way the wines are labeled in clear groupings so it's easier to just walk up and find what I'm wanting more quickly. They also have an Italian food truck in the back patio area. The truffle Parmesan fries were great and the pasta dish was a good portion. Lots of cute photo ops and decent areas of seating. I will say this location is much smaller and literally off the busy highway but still the experience they offer is worth checking out.

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: I came here not knowing what to expect. I knew there would be wines on tap, but didn't realize you poured your own. When you come in you get a card with your name on it that unlocks the tap. As you fill your glass it shows you how many ounces and the cost in real time. I loved this idea because I got to try many wines before committing. You're allowed as many glasses as you want at a time so I recommend doing a flight! There's indoor and outdoor seating with a food truck out back. I signed up for their rewards program and will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Courtney S.
reviews.description: What a fun place! It's not every day you come across a place with wines on tap. Wanderlust has so many options of all different kinds of wine. Red blends, dry white blends, bubbly, mead, etc. You name it, they have it!  When you arrive they swipe your card and give you another card, something like a hotel key card. You use this key card and swipe it before each self serve wine glass pour. The screen next to the tap will show you how many ounces you've filled up your glass and how much for the whole glass. The screen also shows how much each ounce of wine costs. Maybe I'm getting old and outdated but this was some cool technology! Probably the coolest, unique payment system I've ever seen!   There is a food truck on site with some seriously good pasta and appetizer types.   I can't speak to the parking situation since I walked from my location but I do believe there was a small parking lot.

reviews.author: Sarah F.
reviews.description: I came here for the first time and the hospitality of the (im assuming) manager was really worth writing a yelp! The energy and the vibes were immaculate and everyone was very accommodating for my dog!   5 stars :)

reviews.author: Van N.
reviews.description: This place can be dangerous if you are by nature have slow reflexes and/or have a heavy hand. You my friend, are in charge of how much wine you drink. The fun part is you get to see how much you are spend at the same time! The funny part is if you're focusing on your glass pour (just to get it just right) you might look up after a while and notice your tab is $$$ after many many "maybe just a little" drinks. I love everything about this small space as well. It is very cozy and perfect for a girls night or a date night. We will 100% be back.

name: The OASIS on Lake Travis
accommodations: Garage Parking, Private Lot Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: sara h.
reviews.description: We were happily suprised at the upgrade in the quality of the service and the menu. We went three years ago and we were so disapointed with the food. We remember saying that even the french fries were horrible.  We had not been back since. We went tonight and the food was fantastic! The service was spot on.  It is now on our list of favorites. Nice job on turning things around!

reviews.author: Jackie G.
reviews.description: The scenery 10/10. The food 10/10 even though there is not much variety, the food was SPOT ON! Melissa was our wonderful server and she made the experience 10x better! She even took the time to go find us outside while we enjoyed the view so our food wouldn't get cold! I will most definitely be visiting on my next Austin trip! Dishes we ate that were very tasty: Beef fajita quesadilla, shrimp quesadilla, the super nachos, and a cheese burger

reviews.author: Jenny F.
reviews.description: Paying for the view  Place: It's a good place for family trip or just get together. The restaurant is surrounded by shops like coffee, ice cream, clothes , candies, photo hub and a lot more. BUT the most magnetizing place here is the view of the lake and the sunset.   Food: The food was not that special but became one because of the view and people/person you are with. Honestly if only the food we rating here, I'll give 3 not bad but not good as well.   Also expect long wait/line for the restaurant. While waiting we roamed around so we didn't really got bored. There's lot of shops and artist that offer their services like, caricature drawing.

reviews.author: Terri B.
reviews.description: Oasis, oh how I love you.   I've been coming to the Oasis for years, literally my whole life. It has always been amazing, and they have expanded it considerably since the fire. The outdoor decks are sprawling, so many places to take in that view. And y'all, it had the absolute most stunning view of Lake Travis.   I just lost my father and was in need of an escape and some fresh air. Today I brought my dad's convertible mustang out (I MAY have gone kinda fast) to have lunch on this perfect blue bird day. I definitely felt his presence out here with me.   My server was so friendly and had the best customer service. I really enjoyed her serving me. I ordered a swirl margarita and chips and queso which were delivered quickly. For lunch I had a mixed fajita with steak and shrimp, refried beans and the fixings. Food was delicious.   I love the art they have installed around the restaurant. Really gorgeous bronze sculptures and we'll appointed gardens.   Thank you for a perfect experience.

reviews.author: Jim H.
reviews.description: The Oasis is great for outdoor dining and has an amazing view of Lake Travis, especially during a sunset.  A couple of weeks ago, I visited Austin for a quick weekend getaway.  A small group of us came out for lunch and we didn't have to wait long because it was an early lunch and the weather was a bit cold.    PROS:  Even though the water level was a bit low, the view of Lake Travis was AMAZING!  Make sure to sit outside to be able to enjoy the view.  During the summer, it's worth it to make reservations during the sunset to get the most out of your experience.  The wait staff are super friendly and are attentive to all your needs.  CONS:  I will echo some of the other reviews on here and say the food is mediocre Tex-Mex at best.  We ordered the shrimp tacos, fish tacos and beef fajitas.  The tacos are decently seasoned, but the rice and beans are a bit bland and the dish overall was a bit cold.  The fajitas did come out nice and hot and the meat was seasoned well.  I will definitely be ordering the fajitas for the next time.  The drinks and desserts we ordered:  an Irish coffee, the Fantasy Chocolate Cake (which is a flourless chocolate) and the flan.  The Chocolate cake was surprisingly delicious while the flan was a bit too thick for my liking, but the flavor is really good.  The area surrounding the restaurant also has eclectic artwork to look at as well as small retail shops to explore.  Due to Covid each store has limited hours so you may want to call ahead to see if they're open.  Overall, it's a great area to sight see in Austin.  Especially if it's your first time.

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: ON LAKE TIME!   It was my last day in Austin and my brother wanted t show me something a little out of the ordinary. We had just been going shopping oh and drinking. I wanted to experience the nature side of Austin.   The Oasis on Lake Travis was the place for us to venture out too. My brother said he had not been to it before, but wanted to try it.   To my surprise it was something grand. Absolutely gorgeous views of the lake and the more upscale houses Austin has to offer.   My brother and my parents had had a bite to eat prior to coming here, but I had not. I went shopping a the Domain and they had gone eating. From what I have heard, The Oasis is good for drinking, but not so good for eating. Their food is honestly sub par at best.   We ordered some drinks and chips and guac for the table. But I wanted something a little more in my stomach. I got the grilled shrimp tacos. They were good. But I have definitely had better. The only thing was that they were super spicy. I was not expecting them to be that spicy. All of a sudden my tongue was sweating and I was uncomfortable with that.   This is a must stop for the views. The views are outstanding. But the food was not the best. The mojito I had was strong. It was like one sip and I was already feeling it.

reviews.author: TJ H.
reviews.description: The Oasis on Lake Travis is one of those tricky places where you have to average out the good with the bad to get a good idea of the place.  The good:  No question about it, the sunset is second to none, awesome views, awesome picturesque scene, and just about all of the outdoor seating has a great view of the scene. An additional positive, is the parking.  Easy to get to, plenty of free parking for the complex they are in, and even has valet parking if you prefer not to walk the 100 yards to the restaurant.  The not so good: I don't want to say the food was necessarily bad, it was just mediocre Mexican cuisine with a relatively small selection compared to your normal Mexican place.  To go along with the mediocre food is a price of about 1.5-2x what you would typically pay, but again you are here for the view not the food. The service also was not bad, but I think "nonchalant" would be the best way to describe it.  So the real question, would I recommend it? Yes I would but just go into it with the right mindset that you are going for the view, you are paying for the view and you will not be disappointed!  I would probably not go back if I am in Austin, but I am glad we went once.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: I don't get the hate. Are the prices high? Yes, but you're paying for the view/ambiance, not necessarily the food. Having said that, the food quality is pretty good and the service has always been good for me (though we are admittedly only there for weekend lunch service since we always have kids).   My shrimp tacos were well flavored and a good (yet not overflowing) portion. Menu wise they could definitely work on their beer selection - need more craft beers and some varied selection of beer styles.

reviews.author: Kristina B.
reviews.description: My friends and I wanted a nice dinner on one of our last nights in Austin. We got to Oasis on a Sunday night about 45 min before sunset and were told the wait would be about 30 min for outdoor seating. We ended up getting seated in like 15 min. The views here are truly unmatched and pictures don't do it justice.  We went to Oasis with the mindset that we were mostly going for the views and not really the food, given the reviews. However, we were actually pleasantly surprised that the food wasn't that bad - overpriced, yes, but not terrible if you get things other than the tacos.  We got quesadillas and burgers. The quesadilla was very tasty and came with some guac, salad, and even queso! My one friend got the burger which was good but a little overcooked. The fries it came with were perfectly crispy and seasoned.  Service was good - our server was running late initially, but sent someone over to give us some waters. Afterwards, they were attentive checking in on us.  Overall exceeded our expectations, especially on a busy weekend. Would definitely come again!

reviews.author: Courtney P.
reviews.description: The place was eclectic and fun. Customer service was great, the view was great. The food came out quickly but it was bland, fries were old and kind of cold. Not really impressed. If you want to eat okay food with an amazing view then this is the spot.

reviews.author: Kristin L.
reviews.description: The views you get from this restaurant are incredible! I highly recommend sitting outside.  I've been here a couple of times, but for some reason today was extra tasty! I just ordered a cheese quesadilla, with all the toppings on the side, and some chips and queso. Both were delicious! Honestly, they were the best cheese quesadillas I've ever had, and this is coming from an extremely picky eater who lives off of things like cheese quesadillas and cheese pizza; I've tried a lot of different cheese quesadillas and these were THE best. Tons of cheese, and the blend of whatever cheeses they used work so well together. The queso was creamy and rich. I couldn't get enough of either!!  The service was super quick and I didn't have any issues with rude behavior, like I see a lot of in the reviews. I guess it just depends what day you go? I came on a Sunday at about 3pm, and there were plenty of tables along with fast and friendly service.  The only reason I didn't give this place 5 stars is because I do agree with other Yelpers on the pricing being a little high. But only for certain items. (Check the menu out online beforehand if you're curious)  I definitely recommend you try this place at least once and judge for yourself on whether it's worth while or not; it definitely is to me!

reviews.author: Thao N.
reviews.description: The views of Lake Travis from The Oasis make the trip here worthwhile. Definitely seems like a touristy spot serving very average Tex-Mex. Our server was excellent despite the kitchen messing up our order and how hectic/busy it was even for a Thursday night. Food came out before the drinks, and the children's' food came out much later than the adults' food. The shrimp tacos were surprising good (4/5). The fajitas weren't bad (3/5) but due to the current onion recall, it was missing onions and just didn't feel the same. I had the frozen mango margarita which was strong and not too sweet.   Food: 3.5/5 Service: 5/5 Views: 5/5

reviews.author: Scarlett T.
reviews.description: At Oasis on Lake Travis the view is absolutely breathtaking and super relaxing to enjoy the Sun and view. First time here and this place is jam packed with people before dinner rush. I came here around 4:30pm and all of the outside tables were full. The wait was about 45 minutes. I went to get a strawberry margarita at the bar and walked down to the below deck to enjoy the view. It was so relaxing!!! (The strawberry margarita mixture was extremely sweet and over priced. Personally I wouldn't order that again.)   Skip forward to being seated to our outside table.... Everyone was packed in the area with tables and seats like sardines in a can. I had to be careful not to hit the person sitting behind me when fulling my chair out. It was not a comfortable setting at all. I ordered a cheese burger with fries and queso with chips and salsa. The salsa was pretty tasty and the chips were super crispy! The queso needed to be more cheesy. It's melty but oddly isn't cheesy enough. Very strange. The burger was a one star. Not well seasoned and lacking of everything. It was very very very sad. The fries were crispy but came out cold. Service was really great! Our waiter was top notched and provided excellent service. He was attentive and checked on us often. Five stars for service but the food was subpar for such a beautiful view. If you are a foodie and came here for the food.... You will be disappointed. If you don't care to eat and just want to get a over priced snack and drinks to enjoy the view ... this maybe your place.

reviews.author: Randi J.
reviews.description: Atmosphere was a bit chaotic so many tourist and was at change of shift. Very noisy. The service was slow at first then once waitress came was very attentive. Food was not bad, much better than expected and frozen margaritas were really good. Food came VERY quick which was surprising. Obviously a cool place to come being on the lake and a gotta try if in area. Food cost pretty pricey.

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: We stopped by here for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon. The mixed fajitas were amazing and they came out super fast after we had ordered. The view of the lake during our meal really made our whole experience beautiful!

reviews.author: Thomas M.
reviews.description: I have tried to reach out to the Oasis.  Via email, phone, voicemail, LInkedIn.  I have received no response, no acknowledgement over the past two weeks.  I will not go into details here, but I witnessed a very serious health and safety violation during my visit.  Cannot recommend.  Gorgeous setting, however, and I really, really wanted to write a great review for this place.

reviews.author: Lohgan S.
reviews.description: I'd give 5 stars for the view! Definitely worth visiting if you're in the area and want to feel like you're by the beach. The food isn't the worst but it's not the best. I'm sure time of day matters. We went earlier in the day so I'm sure that's the best the experience gets. The server was nice and attentive. The fries came cold which was surprising as they just opened less than an hour ago. However, the ambience is good and I know the pandemic tanked many businesses who are struggling to provide staffing which impedes service. When we visit restaurants we have to remember we are still in a pandemic and businesses are recovering.

reviews.author: Glenda W.
reviews.description: The place is absolutely stunning because of the view. Other than that, it really doesn't have much else to offer. The food was average, at best. The menu is small and pretty basic, similar to Tex-mex diner food. We had guacamole and queso for appetizers and shrimp tacos, classic burger and steak fajita for entrees. We also had drinks Tropical Depression and Margarita. I was not impressed by the menu, the taste of the food (lacked flavor) or the drinks (lacked liquor). The service was good and the view. I'd recommend only for the experience but I would not go back.

reviews.author: Cristian S.
reviews.description: The place has amazing views to the lake and the food is ok. We had fun here at night.

reviews.author: Jane M.
reviews.description: The only reason anyone would come here would be for the views! The restaurant was empty when we walked in on a Tuesday evening. The food dint look appealing and the drinks seemed over priced. The outdoor is really good overlooking Lake Travis. Awesome view but the food and drinks are not that great. Service is okay. It took them a while to realize we were seated and waited to be attended to. I would recommend skipping this place, bring your own food and enjoy the free views from the adjacent building!

reviews.author: Guy H.
reviews.description: Not happening. Sorry guys. I dont want to waste much time on this and neither should you. We were greeted with a "I could care less attitude" The place is obviously struggling  Merchandizing almost non existent We tasted all 4 of their products and theyre almost undrinkable When I asked where the bottles are she said, back here and pointed to some bottles laying behind the counter No offer to let me see one until I asked!   Its also a vineyard and winery but, I wasnt motivated to "pull that out" of the clerk also!!!  Seems like something shady about this place  Really  Dont waste your time

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: What a cool little family-owned distillery/winery hard off of 183 in Liberty Hill. They have bottle sales, a tasting room, and a spacious shaded outside patio. There is limited seating inside in the AC.   If you are a fan of the Netflix series you will get the "don't worry it's his sister" statues that greet you as you arrive.  Their bourbon is on point and it makes for a good old-fashioned. Plus 1 did not care for her initial cocktail a Cosmo. Her second drink was a Cab that for the price point was an excellent wine. It had legs and a smooth finish. It reminded her of a Josh Cab.  There is a pizza parlor on site. We did not partake but it looked like a pretty darn good thin crust pizza.  Barkeeps are friendly and knowledgeable. A return trip is definitely on the horizon.  Pro tip: It's a hard turn at their entrance on a fast stretch of Hwy so use your blinker!

reviews.author: Hilary C.
reviews.description: As so as I saw the name of this place I knew it would be on my must visit list. The atmosphere was fun and little cheeky but also very beautiful. The bar manager was polite and very helpful. We bought lots of merchandise with the distillery name for our friends and family. Since we were on a road trip we unfortunately couldn't partake in the beverages but we would definitely go back to enjoy the full experience!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow! I can't believe I forgot to review this place.  Drinks are great, atmosphere is chill. All outdoor seating but they have fans, fire pits, outdoor games and the owner has a ranch with cool animals next door.   A must see!

reviews.author: K S.
reviews.description: Good liquor and good atmosphere. As mentioned, plenty of space to spread out.   However, there's no simple way to just stop by to pick up a bottle. Even if you're not buying a mixed drink or anything that requires work other than handing you a bottle and paying for it you have to stand in the line that's serving cocktails and drinks.   Further, when you do get service, it's been rather dismissive the last few times we went. Expect to spend time there- no way to quickly pop in, grab merch and a bottle and leave.

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Took my second trip out to treaty oak and was not disappointed with the day spent here. Treaty Oak is the kind of place that you want to spend the entire day at, and you totally can! What I love about it too is that it's a massive space with so much to do while on the grounds. It even has a playground where the kids can play, and an indoor space with plenty of TVs to watch football on game day.  We started off with a tasting, which you can either do Gin or Whiskey. I actually highly recommend the tasting, it's only $10 a person but gives some great background on how each different flavor/bottle is created and made. You also can put the $10 towards a bottle if you end up wanting to buy one to take home.  We then went into the bar area and got drinks, which is a huge variety of cocktails! They have plenty of picnic tables, and multiple boards for cornhole on the grounds. The restaurant on site it BBQ and was amazing! We got the brisket sandwich and pork sandwich and loved them both. What I also loved about it, was that there's multiple places where you can get drinks, foods, etc. on the grounds but your tab stays open for everything. Love this place and highly recommend making a day trip out of it if you haven't been!

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Here for a wedding reception. Top notch facility with top notch service. Bartenders were great! Exceptional craft cocktails all around. Catered BBQ was spot on.   Highly recommended for your special event. We'll be back for a visit.

reviews.author: Teena S.
reviews.description: A gem in the Hill Country area. Great outdoor seating with plenty of room for kids and adults to run around and play. Pet friendly.  We had the white sangria... which was just perfect for a summer afternoon with some brisket nachos that were yum yum yum! The kiddo had a blueberry lemonade with mac n cheese that disappeared in so little time. He couldn't stop exclaiming how good it was.  We'll definitely be back to try out the cocktail bar for a date night.  They didn't have live music but they were playing music of varying genre throughout the evening. Great way to relax and leave your stresses behind.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Treaty Oak Distillery in Dripping Springs is a great Texas distillery getting most things to make their bourbon and gin from around Texas. It has great covered patios and outdoor space throughout the property with a delicious restaurant- Alice's Restaurant, a tasting room, and a covered bar/lounge as well as an outdoor stage and small playground. We did the tour and tasting which allowed us to see the inner workings of the distillery. Cody was an excellent tour guide answering all our random questions as he showed us around the distillery. And I bought an old barrel, which I have wanted in my house for quite some time. I would highly recommend you get over there...today! Such a great time. Thanks Treaty Oak!!

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: I made a reservation weeks in advance for a tour at this distillery. When I arrived after a 3 hour flight and a 45 minute drive I notice everything is closed. When I call someone Answers and tells me in these exact words " we are closed today and we're refunding everyone there money" without any regard to anyone's time. Not professional at all completely ruined my day after planing our hole day around this.

reviews.author: Liana W.
reviews.description: I want to give this business a better review but unfortunately they had some major issues.  We went last weekend on Sunday and there was a sign to scan the QR code the for menu, we waited in a long line to order food, once everyone got to the cashier she told us that only the brunch menu was being served (it was like 2pm or something).   So everyone had to quickly change their order!   Talk about poor communication!! It should say on the menu very clearly what's being served.   Then, I tried to order vegetarian nachos but my cashier told me they were sold out of beans and that I should just get chips and queso instead, so I did. THEN my brother in law who ordered after me got his nachos which were vegetarian bean nachos (not meat like he ordered). I said "they told me they were sold out!" Again, bad communication.  Then, my brother in law ordered sangria and got a big pitcher, my dad went to order the same thing and they gave him HALF the size. So weird and confusing.   This place seems very confused internally and each worker seems to have their own message.  Also nothing for gluten-free vegans on the menu.

reviews.author: Lance O.
reviews.description: Does Heaven touch earth anywhere? There is a beautiful place in the Texas Hill Country where the grain meets glass and the bourbon is distilled on site alongside a menu that will make any true Texan proud.   Classic features paired perfectly with great service and a family friendly vibe. This is great might, great food and a little slice of Heaven here tonight in the Hill Country.

reviews.author: Amrita J.
reviews.description: Another great distillery to add to the list when in Dripping Springs! This place is huge and perfect for a group or date or even solo! So much space for you, your kids, and your dog! Bring the family! LoL  It was actually recommended to me at my last stop, and I love me some bourbon and whiskey so it was a no brainer. However, if bourbon isn't your thing they also have options for the gin, vodka and non alcoholic lovers in your group! Something for everyone I'd say!   That being said, I took off a star mostly because the line was stupid long. They definitely could have, and should have had more than just one single file line for us to get a drink, I spent half my time in line.   That being said though, once I got my drink and was able to enjoy the drink and the vibe it was great! They have live music and a restaurant if you get hungry and I ended up getting the day tripper drink! I loved it, it was so good. I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: I'm back home in FL whining about how upset I am that we can't just go to Treaty Oak anytime we want! :(   Seriously, grab your gang and head over to this literal farm full of whiskey and great BBQ. If you don't get the brisket nachos, you're making the biggest mistake of your life. But don't eat too much, or you'll be too full for the delicious drinks!   The vibe is relaxed, the food feels almost TOO good for the rustic setting and the live music is pure Texas charm. I could stay here all day!

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: The grounds are very nice. Plenty of room to spread out. Lots of picnic tables available in the shade. A playground. The food at the restaurant was pretty decent, if a little expensive. The staff inside the restaurant are very friendly, but it all seems very inefficient.  The reason for the 3 star review is really that both of the drinks we ordered were cocktails that are premade and then dispensed. They were....ok? A little too sweet and a lot too weak. I couldn't taste the whiskey/bourbon in either of them. For $9/drink at a distillery, I just expected better drinks made to order and I left feeling disappointed. If we had known the drinks we ordered were batch cocktails, we would have tried to order something else, but there was nothing on the menu to denote that.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: I headed out to Treaty Oak pretty reluctantly the other day. I'd been invited out there for a friends birthday and the idea of heading all the way to Dripping Springs on a hot Saturday afternoon to try bourbon (which in general all tastes like burning to me) wasn't really my idea of a great time. Man, I was wrong. First off, they have a wide selection of spirits, everything from gin and vodka to wine and beer. The setting is bucolic with wide open spaces and clusters of shade trees. A friendly staff, great bbq (try the brisket nachos) and some tasty signature cocktails (try the Pineapple Express) made for a great afternoon that turned into a lovely evening. Did I mention they also had live music? I will be back.

reviews.author: Shourjo D.
reviews.description: A really nice setup: good bbq and similar food offerings alongside their own whiskey and gin offerings.  Seriously, the cocktails are worth it, as is visiting the beautiful property and spending an afternoon there with friends.  Each time I've been, I've really enjoyed the Hill Country Dreaming cocktail.  Also, the root beer they make is delicious and will totally hit the spot on a hot day.

reviews.author: Kimberley M.
reviews.description: We love this place!  The drinks are always yummy and very innovative ideas - the frozen ones are my favorite!  And the FOOD!!!  My favorite item is the Cold Trio appetizer!  It is delicious!  But, the atmosphere is what is really cool!  It's spread out - dogs are welcome - and it's beautiful!  If you are in the area - you should definitely check it out!  If not, it's worth the drive!

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: If your looking for some outdoor patio vibes during this gorgeous spring weather then this is your place! Just about 30-40 minutes outside of Austin lies this beautiful distillery. There's so much space and more than enough seating but even on the weekends this place can get pretty busy. As for food you can expect Texas bbq from this place as I tried both the brisket and Turkey which were both very good. If your not a booze person they also have their own in house wines and beer but if you do like a good cocktail I'd recommend hill country dreaming. Im anticipating come back here to check this place out in the evening for some live music or Sunday brunch!

reviews.author: Hannah M.
reviews.description: CAN I LIVE HERE?! I am obsessed with this place. The restaurant had some of the best food I've ever eaten (their Mac is addictive) and all of the staff was amazing. Zach was our main server but they all work as a team so you were never once waiting around. The drinks were great, the bakery items were great and I think I've already said enough about the food. This is first on my list next time I'm in town!

reviews.author: Kaeleigh S.
reviews.description: The perfect spot for a sunny day hang, celebration activity, or date! We came for my best friend's bachelorette weekend and we are so glad we did!!   Parking was ample and so were the picnic tables! We didn't do a tour but put our name in for lunch at the restaurant, Alice's. It was about a thirty minute wait on a Saturday around 1, which really went unnoticed because we just grabbed drinks at the Cocktail Bar and sat in the open seating area until they called us saying it was ready. There was live music, lots of space and tables , cornhole, and you could go do a distillery tour too.   The bartenders were helpful in finding a gluten free drink option for me, as well as our waitress at Alice's. Our waitress was especially friendly and attentive--didn't get her name but a recent HS grad going to UT! She made sure to ask about gluten and dairy free options for me, and there were plentiful. Everyone devoured their food and were happily satisfied. I had a delicious club sandwich on gluten free bread with some salt and pepper chips. SO good. I also loved the white sangria.   All in all, I am so glad we found it and the bride said it was the perfect way to spend our day. We definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Riley C.
reviews.description: Very mediocre place.  There were unsupervised children running barefoot on tables, a bartender who gave me the worst drink in the books after I didn't ask for it, and a sorry excuse for aesthetic with old trucks and a fire pit. Also don't try the food, it's not good. Brisket tastes like it was smoked for 1 hour and nacho cheese was out of a can.

reviews.author: Denniz S.
reviews.description: The food, the cocktails (they are sooooo GOOD!!), the biggy canvas painting. I love it all. Treaty Oak is accommodating to everyone. We bring our toddler and she runs around on the playground while we eat and drink. They have sports on the TV inside a/ indoor dining. A tasting room and tons of outdoor seating.  If the weather is nice and we have friends in town treaty oak is an absolute obligatory stop.

reviews.author: Nicholas V.
reviews.description: Beautiful property, great wine, and equally awesome food + service.   First time here. We didn't have any preconceived notions.   Normally I'm not a fan of Texas wines but their wine was fantastic and unique. The Spot and Love Magick stole our heart.   The food was super fresh. Got the salami and cheese board. Excellent.   Good atmosphere. Good service.   Cant wait to come back!

reviews.author: Danielle H.
reviews.description: Beautiful peaceful spot to enjoy our afternoon after a hike nearby. Wine was lovely too!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: We loved our time at Hamilton Pool Vineyards. The wine was all delightful, the food was delicious, ambience impeccable, and the servers were all as lovely as can be. The drive out was absolutely gorgeous and it was a gorgeous was to spend our Sunday afternoon. (Live music was a great touch.) highly recommend checking this place out.

reviews.author: Keith L.
reviews.description: Great spot after heading to Hamilton pool, met with the owner and had a great experience. The chief and workers were all very nice. They have several Texas wines and a nice area to sit out and enjoy them paired with small plates.

reviews.author: Russ J.
reviews.description: Service was God awful. Our server acted like we were an annoyance to serve and recited his 'script' with a sing song voice. Dropped the bread on the way and then didn't replace it until we we had finished the cheese and fruit. We still bought two bottles. Tonight we opened the more expensive bottle and it had turned. It was like vinegar. So incredibly disappointed. Hard pass.

reviews.author: Pam F.
reviews.description: The grounds are beautiful!  What a great backdrop for engagement photos or a wedding!  Take a tour, attend a farm class, or volunteer!  Have some fun!

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Love this place! The sparkling rose' wine is awesome. Food is awesome. Service top notch . For sure a cool place to come . They for sure are respectful of the covid rules. We will be back!

reviews.author: Kimmie P.
reviews.description: Was so excited to check out this place today. Our server was okay, but describing our wine as tasting like an aquarium was a turn off. Also, there was a kid camp going on and children threw water guns at our table while we dined as well as crawled around by our table. Not the experience we'd hoped for. Our server ghosted during our meal and left us waiting over 30 minutes to pay so we could leave. Wanted to love this place, as it is a beautiful property with so much potential. With a few tweaks, it could be so much more.

reviews.author: Liz H.
reviews.description: Service was poor, but wines were good. We had the basic tasting and tried 4 wines. We enjoyed the wines. They were not very busy, and our sever was not attentive.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: In planning for our day trip, I thought about checking out an olive orchard. Years ago, I had read about Sandy Oaks olive orchard but never quite made it out to visit. On my search online, I found Texas Hill Country Olive Company in Dripping Springs. The timing might not have been the best since the arctic freeze affected the olive trees. We did see both mission and arbequina a year and a half old olive trees. Under the shade of the oak tree and a breeze, we sat to listen to Cara (one of the owners) share the history of how their family business started. With a brief visit with the resident chickens we headed indoors for the abridged version of the mill tour. Finally understood how extra virgin olive oil is made and not to ever buy light olive oil!  After the olive orchard and mill tour, we joined the tasting tour ($10). There were so many varieties of olive oil and balsamic vinegar and flavor profiles similar to wine tasting. I loved getting to combine the balsamic vinegar with the olive oil and tasting with the bread and apple.  It was fun shopping at the store. Goodness with making choices though! I knew I definitely wanted their olive-based products.  Next time we'll have to stay and enjoy some lunch.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: You know how back in the day folks had a milkman? Well, I wanted a piece of that nostalgia but don't drink milk. What I do consume a decent amount of, though, is olive oil, so I went about getting myself a mOOn (yes, I did just combine man and olive oil and no, I'm not ashamed of it).   Really, I was low on olive oil and missed my window for my grocery delivery so took the opportunity to support local and explore Texas Hill Country Olive Co.'s offerings.  The website is super easy to navigate and they have a wide variety of olive oil and vinegars, along with bundles of multiple if you don't know where to start. I received my order within a two-day window during the week from Xmas to NYE, without opting for any expedited shipment, so that was a lovely surprise.  I am a fan of anything chili or jalapeno, so I opted for their jalapeno-infused OO, along with two standard olive oils just to have on hand. The 100ml bottles run $12 each, not including shipping (my 250ml that I usually get from Imperfect Produce is $4.79), so a pretty stark contrast in price. I used the jalapeno on popcorn the other night, as well as toasted bread, and it didn't really have any kick to it, which was disappointing. I was hoping that for the price, it would be a boombastic flavor ball, so I could justify its purchase and continue to patronize from my mOOn.   I am so happy I could support local, and maybe if I visited the estate, I would have a better appreciation for the product, but as a stand alone, I most likely won't be ordering again.

reviews.author: Andrew Y.
reviews.description: The place is really not worth visiting unless you're coming out for the tours. It's a gift shop where you can already buy mostly everything online to begin with. The restaurant menu is terribly overpriced for what you're getting on the plate. Think margherita pizza but at the size of a standard flour tortilla.  My recommendation is to save your money, go straight to the olive oil section in the store, buy in bulk, go home and create your own tray of olive oils and eat it however way you want to enjoy it.   The olive oils are exceptional by the way. Infused garlic, rosemary and sola stella were my favorite. If you're into balsamic, the strawberry infusion was a surprise crowd-pleaser in our house.   3/5 stars for the giftshop/restaurant location. If this was a review specifically for the olive oil, I would rate it much higher.

reviews.author: Jay L.
reviews.description: I don't understand this place. It is basically a gift shop and a small restaurant. I wonder where the olives come from to make their myriad of products? Doest seem like the olive tree orchard is producing enough olives for more than a few martinis! We were greeted kindly at the door but there is really nothing to see here. We were expecting an opportunity to sample some of the products before purchasing but no tastings were offered or on display. So we are back to the fact that you drove here to enter a gift shop. Hmmm  p.s. I see after reading reviews thst perhaps large trees died last winter which is sad. It also appears that tastings are offered here but the kind lady who greeted us did not mention them sonperhaps they are scheduled or have been stopped for covid so check before you come so you aren't dissapointed like we were.

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: I highly recommend trying their award winning olive oil set (my favorite is the verde) and different flavors of vinaigrettes: white lemon, prickly pear, fig, etc.! I bought several gift boxes for friends and colleagues; everyone was very excited to receive them. They also sell pesto artichokes in a glass jar packages with a cute wooden spreader. Shopping locally was a personal goal of mine this year. I thought this place was perfect! They gifted me a box of very delicious butter pecan cookies when they rang me up. I ate all of it in two mins... couldn't even remember what brand it was.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: Beautiful property although the olive trees look like they didn't survive the snowpocypse. You can walk around the property. Staff are very friendly. Supposedly the owner picks the grapes and they have a few types of wine that gets made somewhere else. Can't tell you how it is since I didn't feel like purchasing a glass or bottle. They don't do wine tastings anymore although there is a sign out front.   Their olive oil and balsamic vinegar was tasty on fresh bread. The flat bread was just that... flat. To a crisp. The margarita flavor meant some cheese and basil but not really any tomato flavor. Wouldn't recommend the flatbreads. It was a good idea but poorly executed.

reviews.author: Hal F.
reviews.description: This place is heavenly!  You feel like you have been transported to Tuscany, the scenery, the smell of the food and olive oil when you enter the place is divine.  I am in LOVE with this spot.  I went last week for my Birthday with Brother and Sister-in-law.  It was wonderful.  The olive oil is probably the best I have ever had, I ended up buying a bunch of olive oil after lunch.  We sat for two plus hours, eating, drinking and just enjoying the scenery.  We were so incredibly lucky because the weather was amazing, and there was a beautiful breeze so it was cool and comfortable.  We had a variety of different sandwiches and anti-pasta...everything was to die for!  I can't wait to go back.  What an incredible GEM.

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic time! We were already in the area visiting a distillery. Lots of winding roads to get there from Cedar Park but worth the trip. We bought bread and olives and had a flight of olive oils to taste with small pieces of bread. They serve wine and beer too. The bistro had already closed but we will definitely be back. The staff was friendly and informative. We even walked into the olive grove to see the baby trees up close. The Sicialian olives with garlic are amazing. We also bough feta cheese olives. The caramel sauce we bought went great with Frederick peaches we bought on the way home. We also had some delicious Gelato which was cold enough to take to go.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: This was our first visit to Texas Hill Country Olive company. The employees were very friendly and explained the ordering process. We were able to snag a couple rocking chairs on their front patio and enjoy the beautiful weather. The Salumi plate was one of the more interesting charcuterie boards I've ever tried. The cheeses were on point, some sharp and others soft with herbs and spices. It could have used a bit more jam and crackers overall. The view off the porch was worth the stop itself. Would definitely recommend trying when in the area and I'm sure a tour would be fun when the trees are in season. I was disappointed they didn't have olive oil tastings going on due to Covid, but I also understand.

reviews.author: Madison P.
reviews.description: I attended the Rockwall farmers market today, and Texas hill country olive company had a stand there. All of the oils and vinegars sounds amazing, but decided to try the blackberry balsamic vinegar. All I can say is wow!!! The blackberry flavor is strong, sweet, and so natural. I can't believe how amazing it tastes. I can't wait to go back and get the basil infused olive oil and the strawberry balsamic vinegar next!

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Came here on a weekday afternoon and bought several olive oils. With the yelp check in offer, you get 2 half glasses of wine to taste. I had a red and a rose - both were excellent. Service was so friendly, and this shop is endearingly charming. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Food was wonderful and great presentation! Management and team really want customers happy.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
reviews.description: Fun experience, not offering tours due to snow storm of 2021 there is no harvest/olives in the field. This is not a winery as listed but can be ordered.

reviews.author: Mallorie T.
reviews.description: This place was simply amazing! Everyone who worked there was so kind and the food and sangria were great! The views were very pretty and they have a cute little porch you can sit on with super comfy rocking chairs. We got the bread and olives / olive oil plate as well as the red sangria, both were phenomenal! I will be coming back soon!!

reviews.author: Hollie B.
reviews.description: FABULOUS. Great experience. Must go. We had the sausage pizza after our tour and tasting and it was PHENOMENAL. The crust was so good. Probably one of the best pizzas I've ever had. The tasting was great and the history of olive oil was super cool to learn. Definitely visit! They don't have many olive trees right now because they lost them in the latest ice storm.

reviews.author: Camille L.
reviews.description: Touring the olive orchards was so much fun and an unexpected stop on our visit to the area. We've always wanted to do olive oil tastings and orchard tours in Italy, so were happy to find this until then. Unfortunately, due to the pandemic they aren't doing tastings at the moment. You can buy all the oils, as well as many other foodie items in their store. They also have a bistro with a nice menu, we came after eating lunch so didn't get to try anything. We tasted a few wines and thought they were okay, a little too acidic for our palates. The highlight was walking through the orchard and seeing the olive trees. I'd like to come back before the olives are harvested.

reviews.author: Gergana S.
reviews.description: This was such a great outing for a Saturday morning! We did the orchard tour which was ~45min of walking around the olive trees and learning more about the process of growing and processing olive oil, as well as the different varieties. Our tour guide was great - very friendly and knowledgeable!  The tastings are cancelled due to the CORONA restrictions but we had a lovely lunch in their shaded outdoor patio. Highly recommend the olive oil and olives platter.  Speaking of COVID, great to see everyone wearing masks and the business itself enforcing the regulations. Felt very safe walking around and eating there.  And, of course, we couldn't leave without purchasing some of the delicious extra virgin olive oil and balsamic (which is not made there but commissioned from the special region in Italy).  Would highly recommend, especially if you have friends or family visiting in town. It's a short 40-50min drive from Austin.

reviews.author: Liz N.
reviews.description: We had the absolute BEST experience here this past week. We arrived for an early lunch and got their charcuterie board to split along with an egg salad sandwich that came with a salad. It was a cold day out, so I ordered a cup of the tomato basil soup as well. OH EM GEE this is the best egg salad I've ever had!! It was Mayo-free and used their garlic olive oil instead. I got a bottle to try and recreate it at home. The grounds were beautiful. There was a pumpkin patch along with all the vegetables they grow on site. The employees were all so friendly as well. If you're ever in the area, swing by and give them a visit! It's definitely worth the trip.

reviews.author: Mele F.
reviews.description: What a special spontaneous stop!  We were thrilled from the moment we drove up into the parking lot. The view of olive trees covered in fruits for an upcoming harvest, the cute shop with must-buy oils and breads and cookies and the super friendly staff set us up for great expectations. And they surpassed them. The focaccia was light and airy and flavorful- a combo of traits i wasn't expecting in bread. The side salad with its basil olive oil lightly coating the freshest greens left me longing for more. So i bought the oil. We split some Flatbread and a muffuletta and both were scrumptious. I tried to talk my husband in going back the next day but we had to get on the road. Make this place a stop. It is kid friendly too. I never knew how beautiful olive trees were but it made me want to grow

reviews.author: Dave H.
reviews.description: What a great little gem hidden in the hill country . Texas Olive Oil company has it all - The store/restaurant sits on an olive orchard. They offer tours of the orchard, many times hosted by their founder John. They offer a wide variety of merchandise including amazing oils and wines. They also offer light meals and drinks inside of the restaurant. We tried the flat bread pizza, the anti-pasta salad, and a grilled cheese. All of it was yummy. If you're in the hill country, give it a try. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Alex L.
reviews.description: The perfect winery does exist! Amazing wine and even better friendly/helpful staff. Felt at home!

reviews.author: Lauren M.
reviews.description: We stopped here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and it was a lovely treat. Apparently not many tasting rooms are open on Sundays, but this one was.   They have a lot of space to spread out and it was perfect for an easygoing afternoon.    We tried two bottles based on the recommendation of the owners. It turns out she was from Houston and went to my old high school. (Go Waltrip Rams!). They also have a tasting room in Houston.   We'll be back again.  The owner mentioned that you can volunteer to help with grape smashing so that might be fun to try.   Cheers and enjoy!

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: The husband and I went to visit while in Dripping springs for a weekend wedding. The tastings are done by reservation to limit the # of people, but the lady was accommodating and let us walk in for a tasting since the couple that booked for that time hadn't shown up yet.  Nice variety of wines. Enjoyed their sparkling and the Tempranillo the best. Very pretty property with a lot of shaded seating outside for you to easily drink a glass and enjoy a summer Texas day.

reviews.author: Xiaoting X.
reviews.description: Enjoyed the Tempranillo and montepulciano. But the value to taste is still low. Complex and Balanced wine but low intensity. Would love to support Austin hill country wine but value is low compared to  Italian reds.

reviews.author: Travis H.
reviews.description: My wife and I stopped by to check out this beautiful place, and it did not disappoint! Robert, the owner, was very nice and helped find my wife the perfect bottle of wine. The grounds are beautiful. Brittany was very helpful as well. I would highly recommend stopping by if you are in the Dripping Springs area.

reviews.author: Katherine S.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere and view, despite the lack of any healthy grape vines.   Service sucks. We sat down with a group of 9 girls when it was not whatsoever busy and were (eventually) greeted with "hey so we can't do tastings because this is a large group without a reservation." We were happy to purchase by the glass or bottle, so this wasn't an issue but we were all taken aback by this greeting and found it pretty rude and uninviting. We barely heard from our waitress/hostess the whole time we were there.   The wine was just disgusting and overpriced. Of the bottles we purchased, the pinot grigio was the only decent one, which wasn't even made by this winery.   There are MANY better options, who actually enjoy and appreciate your patronage...keep driving!

reviews.author: Brittney K.
reviews.description: Organic vineyard + family run + wine OUT OF THE WORLD. It's a must! I've been here two weekends in a row, and I think it'll be a Saturday tradition! So much better than Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Manuela A.
reviews.description: Terrible wine. We had to buy a bottle because they used the Covid excuse when mind you down the road wineries we can do tastings or by the glass. We love big bold reds so we were guided to their 2015 Cab. Worst ever. The boxed $4.99 from CVS is much better. Wow, super disappointed to be conned into buying a $45 bottle of wine plus having to buy their "charcuterie" which was literally some cheese packets and nuts in a white paper bag handed to us for a total of $70. Rip off. Safe yourself the money and taste buds, and hit up Fall Creek or even Bell Springs.

reviews.author: Huong H.
reviews.description: I infrequently write reviews but I feel that this deserves one. Dishonest and shady practice. went there for a tasting with some friends recently. It was our first time there. Tasting was $20 per person. Seems like the price has gone up from recent years based on the prior reviews. Not a big deal. At the end of the tasting, I bought 3 bottles. The staff came over with an iPad, charged me the three bottles plus the tasting, told me to sign on an iPad and asked for my email. She said that she would email me the receipt. I never got the receipt. Saw the charge on my cc bill which did not seem to make sense. I emailed them and then called them requesting a receipt to be sent to my email. Apparently, when they charged me, a 20% tip was automatically added by default to the TOTAL (including the wine bottles that I purchased) . Not just to the tasting. I called and spoke to them Bc I felt that this was not appropriate. I don't mind tipping on the service but on the wine bottles that I am purchasing to take home?? I was pretty much told by the staff tough luck. I have been to many tastings in the past and this was definitely new for me. It's not the end of the world but it's the principles..you know. Definitely will not be back and would not recommend to anyone.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Some of the best red wine i have ever had here. Great place to hang out and they have music on Saturdays .

reviews.author: Asher S.
reviews.description: Beautiful estate. The owner came over and talked to us and was so sweet and pleasant to talk to. The woman, Lauren, who walked us through our tasting was equally as sweet, friendly, and knowledgable of all their wines- which were delicious. Very light reds, European style. So if you're into more California/west coast style wines, it'll be a bit different for you. If you're looking to do a large party I'd recommend giving them a call in advance to help set up for your group to give you the best experience possible. Large space, beautiful building, yet feels very cozy. Definitely a great spot to hit on your day trip through wine country in the Hill Country. (Their Sangiovese and Cab 2015 were incredible.)

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Nice little place but nothing to really write home about. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon and unfortunately there were at least 2 bridal parties there.  It was very loud in the tasting area and it appeared they had only 2-3 people working.  They mentioned they had not expected such a large influx of people.  They did their best, but it was very hard to hear and they were bouncing back and forth between a lot of people trying to pay and split checks and do pours, etc.  Yes, the pours were very small and it was $15 each which is kind of pricey for that size and the wines that to me were very light.  I like bold flavors, not fruity and these were not bad, but not worth the price for me.  If there had not been so many people and it be so loud it might have been a little better, but we will not go back- crowded or not.

reviews.author: Janelle M.
reviews.description: My husband and I both had a wine tasting ($15 each) 1-ounce pours which is fine for just a taste but I agree with the other reviewers that it's a little pricey for what you get. The wines we tried were unique but not to justify paying 28-48 per bottle, yes it's "small batch" but if they're that much the tasting should be comped.

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: Was out in the hill country this weekend with a friend just meandering around during our staycation. We stopped at Jester King before this and just looked for cool places nearby when Solaro Estate popped up on the map. Wine, closeby? Sold.   Since we'd never been there before, we each decided to do a tasting so we could try their 6 best wines. Their whites were crisp and refreshing, but I didn't fancy any of the reds. I usually love pretty much all reds and favor them much more than whites, so there's a good chance my tastebuds were just all out of whack this weekend.  When we finished our tastings, it was raining cats and dogs out, so we decided to have a full glass of white and sit outside to watch and listen to the rain fall on their tin roof patio. It was glorious, even when the rain got so intense that literally everyone else who was outside went inside to hide from the aggressive mist. Since my friend and I are classy AF, we were in workout clothing and makeup-less, so we didn't mind the rain one bit. It was extremely peaceful, and seeing the gorgeous rows of grape vines behind the veil of rain was a memory I won't soon forget.   I'll be back for sure!

reviews.author: Mindy H.
reviews.description: I just recently moved from Switzerland, and was surrounded by fantastic wine tasting experiences.  I was nervous about trying Texan wine, but started my Texan wine experience at Solaro after having read many different experiences about the local vineyards around the Dripping Springs area.   The tasting room is located in the vineyard, which is great. I love that this is a small production place, with a family oriented feeling, and the staff are knowledgeable about the wine and production.  I guess the owners can often be found in the tasting room, but just happened to be away the Saturday we went.  They often have events, and we were enjoying one of their Saturday live music events from 2-4pm.  They have a great indoor and outdoor seating area full of charm.    For $10 per person you can enjoy a tasting of their varietals.  There was nothing that was bad, but from the tasting list, I enjoyed the Miscela Bianco the best. After enjoying all their selections, I signed up for their annual wine club, which was a great deal, and then was able to taste some of their higher quality more expensive wines, which were great.  I look forward to going back and touring the vineyard, as a benefit of being a member.  We also signed up for the grape stomping that will be taking place in the next couple of weeks as they need a bunch of people.  What a great opportunity to be part of a grape harvest!  I could have spent several hours just hanging out here. I only wish they had some food to enjoy with the wine and music.  Next time I will remember to bring my own picnic.    I am very happy to have been proven wrong regarding my concerns about Texan wine! Thank you Solaro!

reviews.author: Lauren V.
reviews.description: Whether you're visiting Austin or a local, pick a gorgeous day and go here. Such a beautiful setting and incredible wines.  Very reasonable cost for flights and if you catch her before she leaves for Italy, you can meet (and very impressed by) the nation's youngest sommelier.   Take a day, order some fantastic wine and exhale.  You've earned it.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Wine is mediocre quality, but the high prices  combined  with the surprise  charges against what was stated sours the experience. Who charges for water during a wine tasting?

reviews.author: Gina H.
reviews.description: Wines are good but not what you expect with a 50 plus dollar  bottle of wine disappointing is that seems to have a name change Barton Springs Winery is kind of like trying to push for more customers to start  fresh.  I would come back again but not to fast for many wineries are available in the area. Very expensive for average wine. I felt my husband and I were having to hear a full explosive bragging about the winery and we didn't have the time to sit and enjoy our wine. We ordered the small plate of cheese and breads very tiny late serving us and felt they are money hungry and desperate to sell you anything over inflated and sadly I have to tell it like it is reason for my review to tell all what is happening at this winery.SO if you feel compelled to come to this winery visit and try to enjoy your wine over a not so interesting view. Furthermore the owner learning I write reviews on Yelp made it clear we are not taken seriously. Wow what a blow.

reviews.author: Jessica D.
reviews.description: I wish I could say this was a winery worth going to, but it just left so much to be desired. At first glance, this place looks promising, but by the end of the day my party of six all felt robbed by the service and awful wine tasting we endured.  We spent less than 10 minutes at the winery and at $16.50 each for five tiny pours, we all wondered if we would have been better off going to Walmart and buying a bottle of $16.00 Yellow Tail. So disappointing. Don't waste your time.

reviews.author: Robert A.
reviews.description: Moved to TX from the wine region in CA. Went to a couple wineries in Dripping Sprimgs area not expecting to much. I was happy to say that Texas has some competitors. Check out Solaro Winery if you're in the area, they have some pretty good wines. And the staff is welcoming and very friendly.  Beautiful views from the patio as well.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Mark S.
reviews.description: Have you ever had something you loved so much that you didn't really want to share it?  Well that's the relationship I have with the Wine Cellar. This place is amazing and we love it but like a good secret,kinda want to keep it to ourselves. Their wine selection is the best in town and their prices are amazing. Stephen, Tim and John all know and love their wines and are some of the nicest people we know. They offer weekly tastings that allow you to explore all sorts of different wines affordably.  If you love wine, this is your place.

reviews.author: Amy E.
reviews.description: Love this place! Excellent selection of wine and small bites featuring local Austin purveyors. Follow their social pages for unique tasting events. The friendliest most welcoming staff- it's no wonder locals frequent this shop and bar.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Best place near Austin for wine. Very relaxing atmospherere, both indoors and out, unique selection. Steven can get anything. The workers and the guests are all amazing. Steven, David and John are the best people ever. You can ask any question and they can always lead you in the right direction. All the other guests will always help you feel included, if you are nice. A great place for everyday wine, party wine and whatever wine. The people here will always help you out. Plz call us if you're heading over, we'll join you

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: OK so this is a hidden gem for the hills of Lakeway. It looks like a little nothing store in a retail setting. You get inside and it's a really warm atmosphere, the bartender wine host was great friendly. There's a terrific selections of wine, there's a nice little bar, there's a private room on the side, I think it can be reserved possibly?  I have to tell you this was a secret spot that people should know about! The prices were reasonable, the wine selection was great the  atmosphere is five stars!  Give it a shot guys!

reviews.author: Melissa T.
reviews.description: After a wonderful massage wanted to have a glass of wine outside with a friend.  I had my service dog with me, however, there was only one table outside to sit at but there was another dog who tried to attack my dog nearby. So when we asked to sit inside, they refused to let us in with my service dog.  After a heated exchange, I was told "F" You" belittled and verbally attacked by several customers and the owner.  I was very appalled and would never recommend this place that was so condescending and refused our service.  I have the right to take my service dog wherever I go.  This is the most shocking appalling and disrespectful situation I've ever experienced at a public place!! Negative stars!!

reviews.author: Tina W.
reviews.description: Ethel's is the ideal place to meet friends for happy hour after a long day's duties.  (It's a great escape just before OR after the a massage appointment from down the walkway as well!) Fantastic selection of wines from around the world. But it's the atmosphere, the PEOPLE and POSITIVE vibes that attract me MOST to Ethel's Wine Market.  Lovely setting. Great selections. Sincere service.  5+STARS

reviews.author: Gina P.
reviews.description: This is the new location and rebrand of Lake Travis Wine Trader. Same warm and amazing staff, but in a modern and beautiful new setting. I love the classy Texas vibe-a perfect blend of feminine and masculine decor. The staff truly treat you like family. The wine selection is superb, with something delicious for every price point. Ethel's is a gift to the Lake Travis area.

reviews.author: Renee S.
reviews.description: Awesome service, fabulous atmosphere and delicious cheese plates.  We had a Galentine's Day group of friends celebration at Ethel's and what a celebration it was!  Their back room is a hidden gem-so cozy.  We shut the place down!  The choices are amazing.  A go to must in Lakeway!

reviews.author: Toni Y.
reviews.description: This is a hidden treasure in Lakeway. Staff was very knowledgeable and extremely friendly. Great wine selection. Warm and cozy atmosphere for one, couples or large group and events. My husband and I went on a day they had free chair massages. So that was a bonus! A must visit place in Lakeway

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: Love this wine market!!  Fantastic place for wine enthusiasts in Lakeway!

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Incredible selection, awesome lounge, great food and service!  The staff is incredibly knowledgeable and the space is perfect for entertainment.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Happy to find this little gem of a tasting room! We've enjoyed CL Butaud wines for a couple of years after discovering it at Antonelli's Cheese Shop. It's a shared space with Wine for the People, just off Fitzhugh Road, which is quickly becoming a brewery/distellery/winery Mecca.   Whether you like white, rosé, or red, CL Butaud has what you want. Light and clean white wines. Crisp, but not sweet rosés. Love the BIG, BOLD reds. The Grenache and Tempranillo are both awesome! My favorite is the Cease and Desist, a 50/50 blend of Syrah and Tempranillo.   We've been tasting wine for years near and far. This is the way it should be done. Best experience ever. Reservations encouraged. Get your own picnic table outside and enjoy your stay. The sommeliers are friendly and knowledgeable. The winemaker, Randy Hester, will likely visit with you and share his philosophy and insight into the process. 100% Texas grown grapes.   Dog friendly. Outdoor games and food trucks forthcoming. Did I mention I'm so happy they've opened a tasting room!

reviews.author: Ashley K.
reviews.description: I soooo enjoyed my wine tasting at Texas AVA, which is a shared tasting room with CL Butaud and Wine for the People.    First, the outdoor space is great.  There are about nine picnic benches, well distanced, and most of them are covered/in the shade so you aren't baking in the Texas sun.  There were also nice design touches and little decorations, such as  tablecloths and flowers on the table, so the space felt very picturesque.  Next, there are three options for tasting: all CL Butaud wines, all Wine for the People wines, or a "duo flight" so you can try wines from both winemakers.  I brought my mother with me to the tasting and we decided to both get the duo flight.  I enjoyed all the wines we tasted, but my favorites were the Sparkling Chenin Blanc (Wine For The People), the Pa Pa French Rose (CL Butaud), and the Carbonic Petite Sirah (Wine For The People) (we added that last one on to our wine tasting, even though it wasn't included in the flight we chose).  What made the tasting even more special, beyond the outdoor space and the wines themselves, is that both winemakers were on site and pouring the wines.  We had the opportunity to talk to each of them, which made our afternoon feel like a very special experience.  You can tell they both have such passion for their wines and their passion is infectious.  We ended up buying five bottles of wine and I'm seriously considering joining one or both of their wine clubs.  If you are looking for a spot to hang out with friends and family and taste great Texas wines, I highly recommend visiting the Texas AVA tasting room.  I've already told my friends about it and I am planning another visit very soon!

reviews.author: Jeff M.
reviews.description: The best tasting experience in the hill country!  You speak with the winemakers/owners who are totally great people.  The wines are second to none and the food truck is at the gourmet level.

reviews.author: Nina T.
reviews.description: Seriously cannot say enough great things about C.L. And the TX AVA tasting room. The ambience inside their building was beautiful and intimate. We tried both CL and Wine for the People and there was not a bad wine to be had. We organized a large group to celebrate a birthday and they took great care of us. We were impressed by both the wine and the service. Thank you so much to the lovely staff and wine makers there!

reviews.author: Brittney T.
reviews.description: So fun! This place is huge and dog friendly.   They have flights and all sorts of different cocktails for you to try. I do love vodka - so this distillery is a lot of fun.
