The staff is fun and knowledgeable. They made a lot of good recs for drinks.    They have a little food stand inside for some small bites.   Would recommend to stop by if you're in Austin!

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Finally I was able to make it out to the distillery with my good friend early on a Saturday so that we could get some direct tasting vodka notes from Deep Eddy themselves rather than me taking shots at bars around Austin.  Parking was easy for us but do note that we showed up around 11:20AM on a Saturday so we didn't have any issues.  The later you arrive parking could be a thing and you may have to wait/stalk someone who is leaving to get a spot. Also as the day got later there were many buses and charter vans parked in the front and roundabout chilling out as the company they are driving around are inside getting down too.  Cocktails in a paper cup runs $8 with plenty to choose from the menu that is thoughtfully laid out in sweet, sours, spicy, etc. A nice mason jar with the Deep Eddy logo is $12 and slightly larger.  Do know that they will not refill your mason jar after you buy your first one so be prepared to be clanking around the distillery with your extra mason jars if you keep going the $12 route. Also be careful with your glass too - I saw many people let that mason jar slip out of their hands and the mason jar just crash on the concrete floor. So sad! Also frozen drinks / cocktails can only be purchased downstairs so be ready to wait in a little line if it is busy.   Loved the areas to sit inside the tasting room and even in the 2nd large downstairs area.  The pillows, decor, and the small touches around the sitting areas on the first floor are super cute and selfie-worthy.  I can imagine in the winter, with the large fireplace going, this space is cozy AF!  We didn't go outside at all as it was super hot in July but it looked like there are plenty of tables, shade, and seating for some large groups both in the front, side, and back areas.  After 2 cocktails in a mason jar we were feeling a good buzz and knowing we still had to trek back home (south Austin) we cut it off there. By the time we left around 2pm the place was buzzing with people, all 3 bars had 10+ waiting to be served, and I wasn't planning on waiting to close my tab in a long line.  I was super surprised to find out you can close your tab at the merch area with the cashier there so don't fret and add in that mug, stickers, shirts, bar additions, and Deep Eddy cool pool lady in red signage to your basket to check out while you close out your tab. You will save yourself some time and be out of there in a jiffy!  We plan to come back especially now knowing they are opened on Thursdays at 11am!!!!

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Deep Eddy Vodka Tasting Room is a great spot to hang with friends while sipping any number of their flavored vodkas. My favorite is probably the peach vodka and they have many cocktails to choose from. We went on a Sunday where there were local vendors there too as well as live music. Head to Dripping Springs for the great tasting room. Unfortunately, the distillery near Buda is not one that is open to the public, so the tasting room is where to go.

reviews.author: Angela R.
reviews.description: We started our bachelorette day here. The Bloody Mary was so yummy! I got it spicy. Sometimes they're a hit and miss but here... not a chance. The bartender made it to perfection! I also loved my souvenir glass I got to bring home with me. The vibe and atmosphere of this tasting room is super chill and cozy. 10/10 recommend !

reviews.author: Valerie V.
reviews.description: Wonderful space for great and unique cocktails. Both indoor and outdoor seating are roomy and spread out. They were already decorated for Christmas when went today 11/6. I loved the Spring Sling and the Ruby Red one with the jalapeño. Definitely a must do in the Austin area if your are distillery and brewery

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: Like I was saying earlier, I find tasting rooms gimmicky and this one is a perfect example of it.   We chose to come here because I have deep respect for Deep Eddy as a company for their commitment and contributions to the local community. They've gone above and beyond again and again. Respect!  The tasting room is a large hall, with flights consisting of tiny cups of flavored vodka. You don't taste the actual spirit because the fruity flavors are so sweet.   The "Colombian" food options on-site is a joke. It's an old school concession stand (movie theater of the 80s style) with heat lamps keeping nacho chips warm on a folding table. Don't expect tacos or empanadas.  The space, both indoors and outdoor, is quite large. And they have a cute performance stage inside.  We stayed a total of 15 minutes.

reviews.author: Kimberly M.
reviews.description: A lovely farewell brunch was held here in the tasting room. There was ample seating both indoors and out. The bartenders were attentive and the drinks were tasty too. We'd like to return and sample other beverages.

reviews.author: Natalia R.
reviews.description: Spacious - great for large groups!  Food - one small food truck  Drinks - the vodka is a bit harsh; personally preferred the cranberry flavored vodka best (smoothest). Bartenders are very friendly and fast but the drinks are simply made and during Covid they are all touching the mint in their hands by smacking it. Id rather a gentle crush/roll in a glass... felt a bit gross (others commented too).  Wish there was live music Saturday afternoon at 4  Games outside like giant connect 4 etc  Parking- gets full on weekends so a bit tight  The decor was cute  Sheriff at the door to handle anyone getting a little too cray

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: My Husband surprised me with a day-date to Dripping Springs, Texas. I am a huge fan of Deep Eddy Vodka and this was an amazing way to try all of the flavors.  The set-up is gorgeous and feels so clean when you walk in. You get a behind the scenes taste of where the best Texas vodka comes from. The staff was kind and knowledgeable. They answered any questions we had about the drinks. I ordered a $10 flight and my Husband got the Orange dreamcicle drink. You have the option to get your drink in a mason jar as a keep sake.  There is a great gift shop on site, so we got matching shirts because we are cheesy like that.  There was a delicious food truck out front that had Vegan and Meat Eater options available. I like that they cater to both.   There is so much to do in the surrounding area. We went thrifting and enjoyed the nature that Hill Country has to offer.

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: Huge fans of Deep Eddy's grapefruit vodka.  Great with soda for easiest of easy beach drink.  Fun first stop before three winery visits nearby.    They have a responsible pandemic process in place managing number of folks going through and requiring masks.    Highly recommend Deep Eddy's as first stop when in Dripping Springs.  Cheers y'all

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed our short visit to the Deep Eddy distillery. We are already big fans of Deep Eddy's vodka and all of their flavors, so we had no doubt we would enjoy our time there. The cocktails they serve at their bar are innovative and refreshing. I ordered the Spring Sling and he ordered the Austin Mule. We both enjoyed the drinks next to the patio where they had multiple groupings of chairs spread out on the lawn. Other than drinking, there's not much else to do here, but it's definitely a lively place to enjoy a drink with friends! Our bartender was also very kind and helped us choose the right cocktails for each of us.

reviews.author: Amanda S.
reviews.description: The Deep Eddy Tasting Room is making some delicious cocktails! We found ourselves here with friends on a Saturday afternoon. The weather was perfect and they have a nice little patio area. The spot is family friendly meaning you can bring your kids, but there isn't a lot for them to do except run around in the patio area. I would have liked if the patio area was fenced off and not open to the parking so I could relax a bit more. I had to keep a close eye to make sure my kid didn't wander off. I enjoyed both of the drinks I tasted and would definitely stop in here to explore more of the tastings, but will likely leave the kid at home next time.

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: No complaints here. You can take home the souvenir cup or jar whenever you order. Try the Texas tea and you won't regret it. Everything here is made to order with frozen drinks being located downstairs. The service is also great! We went on a Sunday and had a wonderful experience. They also have a nice selection of merchandise.

reviews.author: Ara A.
reviews.description: Excellent service, great drinks with all their offerings. They don't charge for mock tails which is very nice if you don't want alcohol.

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: In our multiple trips to central Texas, we kept missing Deep Eddy although we tried each time; just unlucky timing. FINALLY this past weekend we got there when they were open! Oh we were so excited and the place lived up to the hype. The seating atmosphere both inside and out is very roomy and comfortable. All the staff is friendly and easy-going. Everywhere including the bathrooms were incredibly clean. The cocktails... the cocktails are downright amazing. They're inventive, delicious, and fresh. You're going to have a hard decision to make no matter what kind of drinks you like... I actually ended up ordering two at once because I couldn't decide! On the way out, we stopped at their little gift shop and man do they pack that area with goodies! Talk about variety and options. The shirts are awesome and made very well to boot, and they have tons of other merch. I left with a soft tanktop, a wicked fun tin can that I plan on using for a cactus or succulent vase, a magnet, and a collapsible dog bowl! We'll be back every chance we get. Loved it, loved everything, love the vodka.

reviews.author: Garrett F.
reviews.description: Definitely go during the week no crowds. Get as many flights as your table can handle. Upgrade your first drink to get the mason jar!  Merch area needs works, better options, pricing. Looks like the area was an afterthought.  Overall we had a great time. No tours still, Covid.

reviews.author: Kylie W.
reviews.description: If you have the time definitely a cool spot to check out. Indoor and outdoor seating with a little gift shop. Got some flights to taste and a frozen drink

reviews.author: Riley B.
reviews.description: ‼PSA: NEVER go to the Deep Eddy's Vodka Tasting Room!!‼ HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED AS A REGULAR DEEP EDDYS ENTHUSI  My friends and I went out to celebrate Maddy Montgomery's 22nd birthday and were harassed by the manager for being "underage".   The whole group willingly gave our ID's for inspection and the birthday girl's ID was "questionable", so she was taken to a cop car by a Sheriff, put in the back and questioned.  While Maddy was at the cop car getting her ID verified, the rest of the group had our full drinks/cups (that we paid for and were able to take home), snatched out of our hands. We all requested a refund for the drinks and were denied??  After the Sherriff verified that Maddy's ID was real, the manager proceeded to threaten tresspassing charges against us??   I have never experienced anything like this and would love to be contacted/reimbursed for the mistake that was clearly made.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: Our Jeep club organized an event at this establishment, anticipating a fun and enjoyable experience.  Wrong!  I will preface that this whole COVID thing has still, for some reason, has some still on edge.  However, this place has taken it to new heights.  While the great state of Texas has opened to 100%, this place seems to have missed that memo.  We literally got yelled it for actually standing up at our tables and told that if we do stand to have a mask on.  Additionally, we got yelled at for moving a table.  The guys exact words were "I'm picky where our furniture is placed."  Additionally, if you want to get a beverage, you actually have to MAKE A RESERVATION just to go in get one.  That is ridiculous!  By the way, the Hays County police are on site to enforce all of this over-the-top nonsense.  Most of us stayed for a single drink and then left for better and more fun pastures.  It's obvious that this place has forgotten all about who the consumer is and how we should be treated.  Not only will we never go back, but I am never going to purchase any of their products again.  By the way...the Jeep community here in Texas is very tight-knit and we will talk...

reviews.author: Holly T.
reviews.description: This was nice and the drinks were great. It was crowded so keep that in mind and call ahead. No one was wearing masks...including myself. Normally, I would though and as an afterthought, I probably should have.  Just FYI, whatever your choice.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: Yesterday, I decided to do a day trip to Spicewood today. It was first to Krause Springs then found out Iron Wolf would be open lunch time. After a refreshing morning at Krause Springs, we headed to Iron Wolf Ranch and Distillery for lunch and drinks.   They have a wide variety of spirits with several award winning ones. Tiann was great in making our drinks! I had the New Fashion made with Hotscotch (a little sweet and spicy). My husband had the Luna-tic made with vodka and several fruit juices. We enjoyed the drinks while we waited for our lunch from Craigo's. We ordered the specialty pizza (sausage, pepperoni, green peppers, mushrooms and onions) and barbecue wings. Truly phenomenal pizza and wings! We also had the Giddy Up Mary with horseradish-infused vodka and Wild and Tea, an Arnold Palmer with bourbon.   We'll have to come back another time for the tasting and meet Luna, a wolf adopted by the family (she's usually there on Fridays). Most Saturdays they have live music. Definitely check their calendar online.

reviews.author: Michaela P.
reviews.description: Made the trek for a friend's Bday get together. A little off the beaten path but worth the drive.   Beautiful venue. Plenty of seating under the oaks. Playground. Disc golf. Cornhole. Food truck (Craig O's). We had a great time.   Specialty cocktails are a little off (and a little weak). Order your preferred cocktail and you'll be fine.   Didn't do the tour or tasting. Maybe next time.

reviews.author: Stephanie M.
reviews.description: I almost don't wana leave such a positive review because then more and more people will find out about this AMAZING spot and I want it all for myself!! Hahaha kidding but really this place was awesome, even though it was a day with drizzle still enjoyed it! First off the staff is beyond sweet, so warm and welcoming! The drinks were great and good price! Such a fun vibe with good music. Very mellow way to spend a Sunday afternoon. So happy they had a kids area because both my 8 year old and 2 year old had a blast and stayed busy so I could enjoy a delicious Bloody Mary. They have awesome lawn games to keep busy and a delicious pizza food truck parked on site. We will for sure be back!! Do yourself a favor and pay it a visit it was a lot better than most of the distilleries I've visited.

reviews.author: Rosalind C.
reviews.description: I mean what's really hard? It's liquor and a open space. That's all you really need to have a perfect distillery. The service was great and the staff were nice. I would recommend the bourbon and the gin because they were both smooth and delicious. This is definitely a chill and relaxing place to visit

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: This place is not set up to be a serious event venue. They have ONE indoor bathroom and a lousy pizza truck. They might be an ok distillery, but I don't know, that's not what I was there for.

reviews.author: Ken G.
reviews.description: Stopped by here with some local friends, and it definitely was the best spot we went to of the whole night. The bourbon was awesome!!! They had a little fair going on, and that made the whole experience even better. Live music as well! If they had rooms we would have stayed. Haha. Definitely recommend stopping by this spot. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Sepid M.
reviews.description: We got stock there during a storm and they were the best! People are so nice and the drinks are awesome!

reviews.author: N S.
reviews.description: We were excited to go here. That quickly faded. There is almost no shade. I'm sorry but this is Texas. It's hot. You need to put in adequate shade. It has one indoor bathroom and one little pizza truck -which the pizza was Okay- the kids play area is huge tires with again NO shade. Please don't even say you have a play area when the only thing they could climb on are tires that would give them second degree burns. The solo artist singing was probably the only good thing as we also got 3 different drinks and didn't even finish half of it because it was gross.

reviews.author: Rick B.
reviews.description: This is the fanciest metal building distillery I have ever seen!  Very shiny stainless steel still, immaculate polished concrete floors, easily the fanciest metL building I have seen!    And they have good liquor!  The tasting is informative and interesting, even if all of the idetails on the fancy bottles is a bit overwhelming.  But the real wolf is interesting.   Try it al!!  The Giddy'Up (horseradish) vodka is better than it sounds - and it makes a fantastic Bloody Mary!  Several things were good, but you must BUY this - it is excellent!

reviews.author: Christina D.
reviews.description: We stopped by here as one of our stops during a brewery/wine tour. It became our last stop, the owners were super friendly and attentive to us the whole time. We started out with a tasting and even though the weather was not in our favor we still enjoyed our time around the fire enjoying their great drink options. It's a pet friendly family atmosphere and we will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Molly F.
reviews.description: I have visited Iron Wolf many times and never had a bad experience! Staff is very friendly and hospitable. Great environment and drinks! Must try the Hotscotch liquor!

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: Great distillery! I'm actually not typically a whiskey fan but I like theirs! Love both the Hotscotch and Iron Hot.  Plentiful parking. Big outdoor deck seating. Live music stage. Food truck on site. Awesome Hill Country views.  Family-friendly events. Highly recommend Iron Wolf!

reviews.author: Missy L.
reviews.description: This is an amazing venue!  The family is so kind and attentive to all of their patrons.  We have been coming here since they've opened, and enjoy every single minute!  It's a must try!!

reviews.author: Shelby B.
reviews.description: Sought out this lovely facility while vacationing nearby based on the reviews of fellow yelpers. Excellent facility! The owners were super sweet and knowledgeable. My boyfriend and I did the tasting - $8 for a taste of 4 spirits with 6 to choose from:  Corn Vodka - hint of sweetness and great consistency Clear Molasses Rum - not my kinda thing but this was good.  Citrus forward Gin - also not my type of spirit but I actually really liked this. Clean and fresh - perfect for Texas summers! Horseradish Vodka - you really must try the Bloody Mary with this. Yum!  Hotscotch - butterscotch pepper whiskey. We loved this so much we are bringing a bottle home.  Iron Hot - cinnamon pepper whiskey. Good if you're into cinnamon spirits.   We also had two drinks. I had the Bloody Mary with horseradish Vodka and my boyfriend had the wild tea (Arnold Palmer with bourbon). The owners have big plans for this facility and you can tell a great deal of thought and planning has been put into this establishment and spirits. I look forward to watching this place grow and develop. I'll be back next time I'm in the area!

reviews.author: Brian E.
reviews.description: Happened upon this place as we are staying in the area. Great logo, catches your eye and makes you want to check it out. One of us had the bourbon, very smooth. Nice taste. The other had the special, The Irish Wolf, it was good.  Found out there isn't a full bar, so they are making drinks out of the liquor they distill.  They are engaging, entertaining, try to sell you a tasting but don't oversell if you don't show initial interest which is nice. You can take a tour if you get the tasting.  Great areas all around the distillery to just hang out with friends and chat, or play games, chill and listen to live music or wander around the grounds a bit. Beautiful location to be out in nature. Family friendly place, folks were there with their kids and everyone seemed to be having a good time.

reviews.author: Alyse H.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this sprawling alcohol paradise on our drive back to Austin from San Angelo.  We originally stopped because the BBQ food truck they have on the premises is rated very high, but the liquor turned out to be the real star. Hubby partook in a liquor tasting that cost $10 for multiple samples.  They have some very unique flavors that I've never heard of anyone incorporating in a liquor before.  I ordered a bourbon and lemonade drink that hit the spot in the Texas heat.  This was a Mecca for bachelorette parties and large groups of friends.  There is plenty of room on the property to spread out and enjoy the weather.  They also host concerts on their stage next to the tasting room.  They are planning to expand their offerings here, so stay tuned as to what they build!

reviews.author: Laura V.
reviews.description: This is by far my favorite place to visit in the Hill Country. It is a party place. Large group specialty. Large area. Room to spread. Dog friendly. Great patios and food trucks. We had the Ginirita and Cucumber Cooler. We Tasted the butterscotch Vodka and bourbon and the rum. Everything was superb. My Fav Place.

reviews.author: Brian A.
reviews.description: Amazing place and people, family friendly even your Pup can come out and enjoy!  Recommend this place!

reviews.author: Prince H.
reviews.description: I'm rounding up to 5 stars because it is a family run business working hard to make a go of it. Small but nice distillery has tours and tastings with a large outdoor area for hanging out and a stage for occasional music acts. I didn't play but the frisbee golf looked great.  Rum, gin, fireball, and few other mixed spirits to sample.  I personally liked and purchased the gin. Low juniper the way I like it.  Odd wild eye logo is off putting but very friendly staff.

reviews.author: Ashleigh L.
reviews.description: I had a lot of fun here! The drinks were great and I loved the vendor fair they had. The owners were very nice and I hope to return next time I'm in the area visiting friends. Thank you!

reviews.author: Alejandro S.
reviews.description: Amazing vodka and whiskey! We came for a tour one Saturday afternoon and received the best hospitality throughout our visit! Anthony and Logan were awesome hosts and made us really feel welcomed. Their vodka is incredibly smooth and definitely one of the most enjoyable whiskey's I've ever had. I highly recommend you make the trip to visit as you won't regret getting the chance to sample their alcohol and meet Anthony and Logan! Will definitely swing by again, next time I'm in town.

reviews.author: Alan S.
reviews.description: Happened upon this distillery after leaving a day trip in the area, walked in without an appointment just to see if we could get in, and Logan was so welcoming and friendly. Very great backstory, and he was very generous with the sampling, just an enjoyable, fun, warm, gathering. The whiskey and vodka are top notch, I wish these guys the best of luck and hope to see their product everywhere. They really love what they do.

reviews.author: J M.
reviews.description: The best smoothest vodka you can buy in Texas is from Banner Distilling in Manor. The distillery is down a small road off of 973 and once you reach there it is like an oasis. Both Anthony and Logan are great to talk with, and they share their story of the handcrafted vodka and wheat whiskey. Going to visit the Banner Distillary is like taking a little vacation during the day. Thanks guys !

reviews.author: Jennifer E.
reviews.description: A two man operation making vodka and whiskey.  I contacted them via Facebook messenger to set up a time to come out for a tour.  I had no idea how small they were.  I had found them via some post on Instagram.  I am very happy we were able to spend time with them.  Anthony gave us the tour but Logan was there as well.  They give you a taste of both of their products while explaining their history and their process.  They have grand ideas on how to move forward as well.  Both men have full time day jobs.  They have done everything for this company.  Including building the building you are standing in.  Extremely interesting.  We have gone to a few distilleries and the tours can be a tad repetitive but this one was very enjoyable.  We are grateful they took the time to give us a tour.  Every minute they are with you they are not working on their business.  I wish them nothing but success. Worth your time if you are in the area and can get an appointment.

reviews.author: Kierian Q.
reviews.description: This distillery was amazing.  Local guys that are so friendly and accommodating. As soon as you arrive they make you feel as if they've always known you!! Family and pet friendly establishment w GREAT spirits.  Beautiful scenery, bring your camera!!! Their vodka is so smooth!! I'm a vodka "snob", not even the top shelf brands can compete w banner! The tour was great and so were the cocktails!! I took two bottles home and I will be coming back w all my friends and family!!!!!  Thanks

reviews.author: Jim A.
reviews.description: This is our third or fourth time to come to the casitas and now they have a wonderful pool to spend your summer hours enjoying.  Mary and Ron are great hosts and communicators.  The casita is roomy, clean and far enough away from other casitas to feel as if you have plenty of space.  We're planning our next trip there and would recommend it highly to anyone who wants a convenient get away.

reviews.author: Ellen B.
reviews.description: Great spot for a small, intimate wedding especially during Covid. The casitas are perfect---clean and well equipped with style. Wonderful place to get away for a few days and explore.

reviews.author: Dobi M.
reviews.description: I stayed in Casita #5 for three nights and loved it. Wonderful casita (cabin) and was perfect for just me and could make for a nice couples getaway. I had everything I needed and can't wait to come back. It is about 20 minutes from amenities so bring what you need.

reviews.author: Terri C.
reviews.description: We finally got away from home after weeks of Covid shutdown.  We picked a great location and home base.   The Casitas are so comfortable, spacious for a studio and had all the basics.  We enjoyed evenings on the patio.  We checked out the common area and walked the area---bonus we meet the sweet resort cat!  We will definitely return, hopefully this fall when it's a little cooler and we can enjoy the firepit.  We felt secluded, but close enough to wineries, breweries and restaurants.  We cooked steaks on our grill for our Anniversary and enjoyed a wine tasting at Hawks Shadow, literally around the corner.  My only suggestion (not a complaint) bring a sleep mask if you need dark to sleep late.

reviews.author: Sarah J.
reviews.description: While my fiancé and I were planning on traveling abroad for our summer honeymoon, COVID  put a dent in those plans. I am so happy we stumbled upon Hill Country Casitas! It was the perfect getaway and right in our own backyard in Texas. I definitely recommend to anyone wanting to get away for some peaceful and beautiful views! The casita was clean, the bed was so comfortable and the views are incredible! We will be back!

reviews.author: Craig W.
reviews.description: Our family stayed in #8 and #10 (2 bedrooms each) November 19-21, 2016 for our daughter's wedding about 3 miles down the road at Heritage House. We were very pleased. The McRoberts were helpful and kind from the moment we made our reservation in June until after we had checked out.  My wife and I plan to return in the Spring of 2017 for a fun little getaway.  Our cabins had only been opened *very* recently (a month?), but everything was in order with one exception: both showers in #8 were barely more than lukewarm. They just needed a slight adjustment and this was taken care of very quickly (surely we were actually the first guests to stay in #8). The bathrooms had *plenty* towels and shampoo, conditioner and bath gel was provided.  The kitchen was well stocked with cups, plates, silverware, etc.  The beds were comfortable. The heating unit was a little tricky to figure out and so we were actually a degree or two warmer than what would have been ideal but we will know how to operate them next time.  There was little to no landscaping in place yet but we knew we were staying at a very new facility.  The gorgeous weather we enjoyed that weekend made the lack of landscaping a non-issue for us.  However, there is no asphalt on the property.  The roads and parking areas are crushed stone(?).  I don't know if that would be messy or not on a rainy weekend.  The outdoor furniture on the covered patios is very nice and makes for a very relaxing place to hang out when the weather is good.  Another nice touch is the use of keypad-operated door locks.  It's nice to not have to keep up with a key.  The surrounding area is authentic, beautiful Texas Hill Country.  The Dripping Springs area is booming as a wedding destination but the hospitality industry is lagging way behind the demand for lodging.  So, Hill Country Casitas should have no trouble attracting enough guests to be more than a little bit successful.

reviews.author: Mark P.
reviews.description: Stop looking!  These places are beautiful, quaint, isolated in the hills with amenities and beauty that is unmatched.  The owners are extremely personable and made us feel at home, even came by and said hi when I had a small issue.  My wife and I had an absolutely wonderful getaway, I hope you will too!

reviews.author: Sofia S.
reviews.description: My humans and I spent the weekend here. AMAZING.  Beautiful, quiet, private fireplace.  10 miles from Pedernales State Park.  My humans wore me out with the excessive hiking though.  The place was super clean and private with amazing amenities.  DOG friendly... did I say that already??    My humans are already talking about the next trip there...

reviews.author: Jackie L.
reviews.description: Absolutely LOVED this place! We recently got married at a venue nearby and had our guests stay at the Casitas. We ended up renting the entire property, so it felt very secluded and private. The whole property was breathtaking! Each Casita was beautifully decorated with spa-like bathrooms that were stocked with all the toiletries you would need, comfy beds, and private patios. The private fireplaces at each Casita was such a great bonus, they were perfect for the cooler weather. The pavilion had a fully equipped kitchen with beautiful views which was great for our rehearsal dinner. Mary and Rob were so great! They made sure our stay was stress-free and relaxing. We were beyond impressed with everything. We will absolutely be back for our 1-year anniversary! Thank you for making our wedding weekend beyond exceptional!

reviews.author: Lia P.
reviews.description: THIS PLACE. I cannot say enough about how amazing a The Hill Country Casitas are. This place speaks to my soul, it is that gorgeous.  We rented out all 10 casitas for three days for a mini wedding getaway. I had some funky ideas about what I wanted to do for my wedding and Mary at the casitas was a big part of that. She was amazing. The owners pay crazy attention to detail, they responded to my million emails quickly, and made our stay out there super easy. It is the perfect place to stay whether a romantic vacation or a fun weekend with a big group of people. There is a volleyball court, the most amazing fire pit, an outdoor kitchen that is jaw dropping... I could go on and on. Don't miss out on staying at the casitas! I know we will be back!

reviews.author: Kim C.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our long weekend at the Hill Country Casitas!  We stayed in #1 and were very impressed with the cleanliness, décor and fabulous mattress and bedding.  Mary obviously splurged on these things and my husband and I were very thankful for the restful sleep we had because of the quality of the mattress and pillows.  We loved sitting on the porch, exploring the property and playing with Frank, the Casita Cat.  Mary was a wonderful host and even brought us freshly brewed coffee and tea when the power went out during a severe thunderstorm.  We will definitely be back soon for another restful weekend in the beautiful Texas Hill Country!

reviews.author: David V.
reviews.description: Stayed here over a weekend. Fantastic place to stay. The owners are very nice! Had a great bonfire and dinner with them! I'm definitely coming here again. Stayed in a nice studio cabin, very cozy, modern and clean.

reviews.author: John A.
reviews.description: Stayed at Hill Country Casitas when I was in town for a wedding. High style in hill country is the only way to describe it. Beautifully designed, new, comfortable casitas that sit quietly in the Texas countryside!   I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!

reviews.author: Elizabeth R.
reviews.description: My husband and I stayed in the #1 Casita on Honeymoon Hill at the Hill Country Casitas this past weekend (12/2-12/4) and it was wonderful!  The Casita has a ton of windows with incredible views out of each one and this particular casita is very secluded and romantic.  Also romantic is the free standing tub for two and the dual head shower!  The facilities are dog friendly and our dog had a great time.  It was raining over the weekend but it was still a great get-away and we just enjoyed the outdoor fireplace most of the time.  It is only a short trip from Austin but you feel like you're miles away.  Each Casita has a kitchenette, very nicely stocked with essentials, which makes it convenient if you want to cook.  We stopped at the Salt Lick on the way out there; picked up some BBQ and enjoyed that all weekend.  The winery across the street, Hawk's Shadow, has some great wine for tasting too.

reviews.author: Michelle K.
reviews.description: Hill Country Casitas located in Texas Wine Country!  It's a hidden gem...an oasis of tranquility...And, so close to the finest Texas Wineries!  I recently stayed in Casita #7 solo the 3rd weekend of November.  The Casita was an absolute love nest!  Beautifully finished...And, luxuriously appointed.  The Casita begins and ends with a lovely porch - including seating and a wood burning fireplace.  It can be quite the gathering spot or place for quiet reflection.    From the porch the Casita has two double door entries - one to the kitchen and living room and the other to the bedroom.  In the morning I enjoyed drawing all the curtains and opening the double doors from the bedroom.  The views were spectacular.  The kitchen has everything you need - with the exception of an oven (you'll find that in the pavilion - plus, there are gas grills on the property as well) and groceries.  The owners do go above and beyond by supplying spices, olive oil, coffee creamer, tea.  Prior to my arrival - I purchased fruit, veggies, salami, crackers, cheeses, olives, and water.  This was great with my wine!!!  The living room is quite comfortable with a lux leather sofa for relaxing chats....but, I spent most of my time out on the lovely porch.  The bedroom is a dream!  The comfortable bed with bedding that had the perfect weight!  I haven't slept that well in months!  The bathroom is just beautiful!  Dual Sinks and Dual Showerheads...Can I say love nest again?  You must try the wonderful toiletries (the scents are amazing)!  Make it a special day...enjoy a picnic with a glass of wine - I did!  Mary and Ron have placed their heart and soul into Hill Country Casitas and it's easy to see!  I can't wait to visit again!!!  What I loved: The accommodation was self-catering and private.  I enjoyed company and also had an opportunity to enjoy just me!  Absolute relaxation!  It was an opportunity to "check out" vs. "checking in" to a commercial hotel.  Recommendations: Fly into AUS and rent a car and be sure to arrive prior to sunset.  Don't purchase the toll package - it's not necessary.  *When returning your car to AUS stop at the Shell off Hwy 71. https://www.aroundairports.com/map/?iata_code=AUSandtoaddr=2453+Highway+71+E+Del+Valle%2CTXandname=Shellandcat=gas  Stop at H-E-B grocery store for provisions (you will not be close to a store).  *H-E-B is a full service grocery store and pharmacy that happens to be a Celiac's gluten free haven too! https://www.heb.com/heb-store/US/tx/dripping-springs/dripping-springs-h-e-b-611  Recommended Wineries:   Kuhlman Cellars had the most impressive wine tasting.  It was very informative with regard to food pairings - Ask for Oscar.  Special Note:  Call ahead and they will accommodate for food allergies. http://www.kuhlmancellars.com/.  Barons Creek Vineyards had the best tasting wines. Special Note: Picnics are allowed!  http://www.baronscreekvineyards.com/  Compass Roads Cellars has "Charles!" I still have hearts in my eyes! https://store.compassrosecellars.com/

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.description: A last-minute decision to stay at Hill Country Casitas paid off big time. Gorgeous stone cabin. Wood burning fireplace and since they are her favorite, S'mores and coffee. Best bathroom of most anywhere I've stayed. Big comfy bed with a view. Kitchen just the right size. And the pavilion area is gorgeous. Loved sitting in the La Capilla (little chapel). Loved the Hawk's Shadow winery around the corner. I'll come again when I can stay longer!

reviews.author: Gina B.
reviews.description: I recently had the opportunity to spend the night in one of these lovely Casitas. Needless to say the experience was delightful. The small touches throughout exemplify hospitality at its finest, from the binder with local info and hotspots, the ice cold water in the fridge, and to the cream, sugar and coffee so thoughtfully provided, it was the little things that made the stay so much sweeter.  They say the stars are big and bright deep in the Heart of Texas well that is so true out in the middle of the Hill Country. After spending a lovely evening next door at a local Winery (yay, Hawk Shadow!)  listening to some lovely music, I spent some quality time staring into the universe, enjoying the solitude.   I had a wonderful  night's sleep on the most exquisite sheets that smelled so delightful. The silence was quite deafening in its totality out here in the countryside. I know there were other people on the property but it did feel like an oasis. I woke up refreshed and spent the morning watching the sun rise over the hills with a hot cup of coffee in my hand savouring the crisp fall morning. While the property is still in the process of blooming, Mary and Ron were the consummate hosts, making sure I had everything I needed to enjoy my stay. I am looking forward to returning in the future for a much longer visit.

reviews.author: Raul A.
reviews.description: Our experience here was the highlight of our wine tour. Stacey was very knowledgeable about Inwood Estates and about wine in general. It was a pleasure to learn about the wine-making process while also tasting phenomenal Texas wines.   10/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: Darlene L.
reviews.description: The winds are good but expensive. It's a beautiful location. Worth a stop or to stay at the BandB on site. Plus they share the location with the Vineyard at Florence which has good wine and a restaurant!

reviews.author: Melissa K.
reviews.description: I cannot speak for the Florence location, but the location in Fredericksburg offered a lovely experience! Vinny, the GM, shared a lot of information about the various types of wine they had to offer. He was very friendly, professional, and knowledgeable! The selection of wines were very sophisticated, complex, and diverse in flavor, and the wines are made from TEXAS grapes (not something that each vineyard can boast, as some wineries carry wines made from CA grapes). The grounds, bistro, and tasting rooms were beautiful - paired with the service and quality of wine, we will be sure to visit again! offered a

reviews.author: Allison C.
reviews.description: Tammy was a great hostess! It is obvious she loves wine. As a native Californian, she brings a lot of great wine knowledge to the tasting table. The Inwood Estates wines should have a place in your cellar. We purchased the Cornelius 100% tempranillo. Can't wait to slap a rib eye on the grill and open our bottles. Thanks, Tammy.

reviews.author: Keith T.
reviews.description: I purchased a Travelzoo deal in 2013 to come and visit with a picnic for two, and had made a reservation for a Saturday. Friday night, however, our car sprang a gas leak, and we had to cancel. We were pretty bummed to be missing what seemed like a good weekend trip, but what bummed us out even more was that when we tried to reschedule, the staff at the Inwood Estates Vineyards at The Vineyard at Florence told us that they were going to pull the fine print on the voucher and tell us that the deal was subject to forfeiture if we didn't show up for our reservation that day. I know that it was included in the language that I agreed to when I bought the voucher, so that's why two stars instead of one, but really? I know that online voucher customers don't give you the highest profit margin when it comes to customers, but I always thought the whole point of offering those deals as a business was to gain new customers, not lose them. And lose us they did. I don't expect the red carpet, but just a little friendliness and understanding for an unexpected snag. By contrast, we also had to bail on a movie at the Alamo Drafthouse in Austin because of the car, we gave them just 30 minutes notice, and they comped us two free tickets, told us to reschedule for any time we like and wished us luck in getting the car taken care of. That's how you treat a customer like they're wanted, not by telling them they're not welcome unless they pay you again.

reviews.author: Carmen G.
reviews.description: I purchased a groupon for a weekend visit with my friend, who was visiting from Houston.  We had a wonderful time, our host was a wonderful young lady name Amanda. She was knowledgeable and sweet.  The lunch was a chicken wrap prepared by the local çafe, it was very tasty.  This is definitely a winery we will revisit.

reviews.author: Alton M.
reviews.description: Terrible service.  Came with a group, told to sit at tables and we would be poured.  They had one waitress to handle the entire room, and no managers.  Don't get the 2013 Chardonnay, it was lukewarm and almost sour.  We went to 4 wineries today, this was the weakest

reviews.author: Tracie M.
reviews.description: We bought the special deal from Travel Zoo. SAVE YOUR MONEY! Was supposed to have some wine and cheese education( the wine was extra and stated so on the coupon,so we knew to expect that). The event was supposed to start at 11:30 but started at 12:05 so the guy doing the class could joke around with a cowroker and set up what should have been readied for us. The guy knew next to nothing about wine and read from a piece of paper in a monotone. My husband is a cellar master and couldn't believe some of the stuff this idiot was saying. They then gave us a sandwich in a plastic box that I think came right from HEB, since it included one of their brownie bites. Included were 4 old grapes and 6 almonds, 2 ounces of tasteless macaroni salad. I would have thought they would want to showcase their food since they told us they were planning to do some dinners. They do have some nice wines  but you can get much better treatment at many other vineyards in the area.

reviews.author: Chanele R.
reviews.description: This is a charming winery with friendly service, solid wines, all in a historic building in downtown Burnet. (And yes - there are some ghost stories - look for the skull built into the rocks on the wall!) There is a nice outdoor area as well, although it was windy, so I opted to stay inside.   We came on a quiet weekday before Christmas, so I was able to get a tasting right away from a really friendly man who was eager to answer my questions and tell me about the history of the winery, the building, and the wines. My favorite wine was a dry white called Bridal Veil, and there was a big selection for all tastes, including some very sweet wines, which I did not try, as that is not my thing.   The winery has three locations, and I think each are different, so I may branch out and see how the feel is different at each place.

reviews.author: Alexandra P.
reviews.description: This was our first stop during our Austin steam train ride. Anne was so nice and knowledgeable when it came to wine. We did a tasting and we all enjoyed her company and conversation throughout. We liked the wine so much we even took a couple of bottles home!   Will be back for sure!

reviews.author: Janet B.
reviews.description: I love this winery!  Join the membership! Free glass of wine plus 3 guests. Excellent cheese box for at least 3 people. It has 3 great cheeses with mini toast and super jelly! It's a deal!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: Flights here are $15 each and you have a variety of flights to choose from. They explain when you arrive that you have three options to choose from. 1) A flight for a tasting 2) Purchase a bottle 3) Purchase a glass. We chose to do the sweet wine flight and the white wine flight. I surprisingly preferred the sweet wines over the white wine flight. The sommelier was friendly and was working with 3 other groups at the same time until another person showed up to help him. Overall, we had a good time. I can imagine how nice their upstairs patio would be to enjoy a bottle of wine on a beautiful day.

reviews.author: Allegre N.
reviews.description: We took the wine train from Bertram. The train ride was pleasant, it was nice to be able to sample some wines on the way. We enjoyed the three we tasted.   Once we arrived at the winery, however, it seemed like no one had a clue we were arriving even though they had a sign on the door saying they were closed for the event. They were closed specifically FOR THIS EVENT. There was no one to greet us when we arrived. The place looked completely deserted. One lady finally showed up after maybe 10 minutes and started taking orders....slowly. After 30 minutes, a man showed up to help.   Due to COVID there were two boxed options for food - sandwich or wrap, with a choice of chips. For the life of me I cannot understand why they did not just bring out all of the boxed-up food and hand it over the counter as we ordered. Instead they each ran back and forth between the register and kitchen area grabbing one box at a time and then going back for chips and then going to get the wine.   I wish I was joking. It was so disorganized.  We also could not order glasses of wine which I understand (again, COVID). We ordered two bottles, each of which were retrieved on separate trips, two sandwiches (more running around), and chips (more running around). THEN we were told if we ordered a 3rd bottle, it was a 15% discount. Cool. We'll drink that, no problem, add it on. We were cashed out without getting the 3rd bottle and had to ask for it (more running around). Then I asked to use a wine opener so I could open my own wine (more running around.) Really? You're a winery. Why do you not have a wine opener in your pocket already?    We were sent upstairs where "everything is set up already" but without wine glasses or napkins. We had to go back downstairs to get wine glasses. The indoor seating was not sufficient for the amount of people present, and it sucks that part of our group had to eat outside in 105F heat.   There was a representative from the winery on the train. It would have been nice for her to ask us in advance and then call over to the winery and tell them how many food items were needed, given that there were only 2 options.   The wines are good, there's a nice selection. It would be nice to go do a tasting some time but I am really concerned about how they would be able to handle a crowd doing tastings rather than one eating premade sandwiches from boxes and opening their own bottles of wine.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: This is the third location for a great Central Texas winery. This tasting room is amongst the best I have ever seen. Restored building. Back porch with outdoor seating, second floor with both indoor and outdoor seating. Beautifully restored and decorated.   Five tasting flights are available. Our was $15 each. Our host Ray was a delight and he really showed warm hospitality!

reviews.author: AJ S.
reviews.description: The wine is great, but the service is poor. I have been in three times now, and the last two times it has just been an older gentleman working. It took me 40 minutes to just be able to purchase three bottles of wine when there were only two other small groups doing tastings in the room. I stood there at the counter without being acknowledged for 30 minutes and when he finally did acknowledge me it took him 10 minutes to put three bottles in a bag and ring me up. I hate to rate this winery 2 stars because the wine really is great, as well as the atmosphere, and we had great service from a very nice lady the first time we were in. But if you see an older gentleman working and you want to be served within your first 30 minutes, I would go somewhere else.

reviews.author: E B.
reviews.description: We walked in on Labor Day because they were open, many places were closed today, so we thought we'd go in and grab a glass of wine. A little over priced, so we decided to choose a bottle. There was one lady working, Annie, who was definitely caught up talking to some members to our right who were in the middle of a tasting. There was no "welcome to wedding Oak winery I'll be with you in a minute", or anything.   We were disappointed that there wasn't much ambience here to enjoy our bottle. Only one place to sit inside and the patio was Meh.  But whatever, bring on the wine.  We decided on a bottle and we thought she was going to open it right then and there and serve us and be done. But instead, she walked over to the members to our right and proceeded to talk to them for a while before taking them upstairs for a tour or something. We waited downstairs with nobody to help us for what felt like 7-10 minutes.  We were talking about maybe going somewhere else because the customer service was terrible. We waited another five or six minutes and we decided to leave. We're not gonna pay $38 for a bottle of wine, that we can't even get a little taste before hand to see if we like it and where there's no ambience. I get that it's Labor Day and staffing is low everywhere, but come on at least give us some recognition that we're even there!! We ended up over at 7 Creeks Vineyard which was amazing! It had the ambience, it had the vineyards, it had the enormous oak tree with plenty of seating outside, and it also had the tasting of our wine, before buying a bottle. Customer service here was excellent. We're so glad we pivoted!

reviews.author: Chris D.
reviews.description: Bruce and Ben were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable about the wines.  Absolutely wonderful!!! Wines for everyone. White, red and sweet. The wines were fantastic, but honestly my biggest take a way from  this place was how friendly they were.  Kid and dog friendly.  Became members on the spot.   Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Amy P.
reviews.description: Great place to meet friends and enjoy an outstanding bottle of wine. Tastings are fun and informative. Beautiful restored building with interesting history. Try this place - you won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: Howard E.
reviews.description: Great wines and great servers. They always make you feel welcome and very educated about their wines. Brandy is one of my favorites. She always has a smile on her face.  The building is amazing!!!! We became members after the first visit. We love it so much we are there almost every Friday.

reviews.author: Shelby R.
reviews.description: We took a train ride from Cedar Park.  They were totally unprepared for the crowd.  Folks making pizza we're arguing with each other and lines for a glass of wine moved extremely slow.  Not something I recommend.

reviews.author: Carol M.
reviews.description: Great wines, beautiful setting in a restored building on the Burnet square. Nice patio area also

reviews.author: Kim N.
reviews.description: I discovered Ethyl Ambrosia literally around the corner from my house while walking my dog. What a fabulous discovery. I sampled the product and became a believer. All my friends are getting Ethyl Ambrosia for Christmas, and those who have already received theirs are clamoring for more! Their tasty, vegan, alcoholic shots are a hit in 4 flavors (I'm partial to the rosé).   Give these a try and you'll be sold!  They're perfect for events or just kicking back at home. And their patent-pending twist cup makes shots classy.

reviews.author: Jaclyn L.
reviews.description: The workers were very nice and it was a neat place. It is not the best location and was a little hard to find but once we got there we were very happy. There's free tastings and then you can buy individual shots or a box of 20. They are vegan Jell-O shots and the cups they have are super cool. We got the box of 20 and they're 15% alcohol.

reviews.author: Fana T.
reviews.description: Great sotol, hip environment, nice and clean. Kelsey our server was lovely, will come back for the river Rita next time.

reviews.author: Jill C.
reviews.description: First time trying Sotol, and there wasn't a cocktail on the menu that wasn't incredibly delicious. We sat outside in the lovely fall weather, enjoyed some acoustic tunes by a talented duo with a female vocalist, and tried several cocktails -- all of which we enjoyed. My friend tried the frozen Bartender's Choice which was like a frozen apple cinnamon cocktail, and I tried the Comanchero, the Yipping Coyote, and the Rugged Flower. Each were so smooth and well-balanced. This place not only makes a flavorful Sotol with a smooth, clean finish but transforms it into mouth-watering mixology masterpieces!   Aside from the bus loads of out-of-town tourists who looked like they were part of an Instagram filter for an "Ashley/Ashleigh" compilation (complete with brimmed hat, scarf, and boots), this place is a must-visit if you're in Austin. Couple it with a trip to nearby Fredericksburg and you've got yourself an amazing day!

reviews.author: Mahesh P.
reviews.description: This is their Sotol Tasting Room. Which may not seem all that great, but boy howdy, is it ever! They've got their sotol, of course, but also a whole bunch of (sotol and other) cocktails, food, and a pretty cool outdoor space with plenty of place to chill. Best of all, there's pretty much always some sort of musician doing their thing (this *is* Austin after all!)  If only it wasn't a decent drive away....

reviews.author: Rosario F.
reviews.description: My friend who knows all the hot spots invited me here during the stricter COVID times. It's a heck of a drive but I was really impressed with how lovely this place is. Very Instagramable location with the truck outside and the silo.   PARKING I went when it was pretty busy. I found parking but I did have to wait for like 5 minutes so cars could clear the road. It gets pretty tight once the parking spots are all full. It's all free. A lot of cars parked on the road. Just be careful crossing the road.   FOOD When I was here they only had one food truck. The options were limited. The prices were a bit too high for the food options available. I didn't try it out. My friends ordered a few things and they felt the food was just ok. I'm not sure on the current food status here.   AMBIANCE  They only had outdoor seating when I was here because of COVID. I sat on the covered outdoor seating which was great since it was around summertime. It was HOT! Really cute tables, friendly/helpful staff, and live music! I don't remember his name but there was a gentleman playing guitar and singing. He was fantastic!   DRINKS I ordered 3 drinks. The first two were the Comanchero and the third was The Copperhead. I'm glad I stopped there. They are strong!   I'm giving it four stars because I felt like the size of the drinks didn't coincide with their prices. I hope I get to stop by here again. It's a bit of a drive for me. It's a really beautiful drive though. Keep kicking butt y'all! I want to try everything!!

reviews.author: Shelby W.
reviews.description: Finally decided to take a day trip down to dripping springs and had to finally stop at Desert Door. To start, this place is designed so beautifully. I wish I could steal the décor and put it into my own home. Both the inside and out were so inviting, I don't know how someone could go and not spend hours enjoying the ambiance, food, and drinks. What I thought was so cool about Desert Door was that they educated you on what you were drinking and the history of Sotol. What I did not know, is that they are actually the only Sotol distillery in the US.  We started off with the Sotol flight, and two drinks. Although we did enjoy tasting the Sotol by itself, it was a lot to start the afternoon off with! We also ordered the The Copperhead (my personal favorite of the day), the River Rita, and the Sotol'd Fashioned. I loved each drink but the copperhead was definitely the star of the day, which was a Sotol version of an espresso martini. They also have a food truck on site serving out very unique food. We ordered the tacos and vegan "queso" and both really surprised us by how unique and amazing it was. We loved this trip out to Desert Door, and will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Corianne O.
reviews.description: Honestly great environment. Good drinks AND live music. So much fun. Really loved the drinks and the tequila. Nicole gave us our drinks and she had the absolute best service. If you can request her, I would. 10/10 experience.

reviews.author: Deborah C.
reviews.description: So glad we stopped by Desert Door on our way to a Getaway cabin.  The mixed drinks are on point! The entire staff were so friendly. Cozy/desert vibe inside! Huge outdoor covered area with plenty of picnic benches and  lounge seating.  I can't remember who our server was but she was freakin awesome! She brought our pup a pupsicool (bone broth frozen pup treat) to keep cool and occupied lol. Pup also sported a DD bandanna : )  We didn't order any food from the food truck, but appreciated the option to order quick bites.

reviews.author: Shradha A.
reviews.description: I'm generally not a huge fan of tasting rooms and find them gimmicky and far from truly experiencing the spirit of the spirit. See what I did there.   But every rule has its exception, or exceptional. Desert Door is a destination in itself. Beautiful southwestern interiors and stylish furniture. The space is cozy but didn't feel crowded, though every table was full. They do have a large patio for outdoor seating and bigger groups.   Now, the sotol. I had never heard of it and didn't know what to expect. The best way I can describe it is an agave spirit, clear, between a vodka and a tequila in its thickness/smoothness. In plain English, it's delicious.   We did the tasting flight, which was a great way to get introduced to a new spirit, followed by a round of cocktails. The cocktails were excellent and reasonably priced.   They also had a lovely food truck on site but we didn't have enough time to try it.

reviews.author: Meaghan S.
reviews.description: Ended up at Desert Door after a lunch at Saltlick. Doot, the host, got us seated right away at a cozy soft seating area outside. Great patio vibes: chill, mist fans going , and live music about to start. Inside is nice too, super clean and cute/trendy.   The sotol is great and their cocktails are delicious, as well as unique. Had a difficult time deciding which one to get but our attentive and extremely friendly waitress, Nicole strayed me the right way with the Comanchero. Hubs got the ranch water (served in a Topo Chico, gotta love that)!   Nicole our waitress and Erin the bartender are solid assets at this establishment! Thank y'all for a great Saturday afternoon!

reviews.author: CARLA B.
reviews.description: OMG!  Where do I start.  Stumbled across this gem riding to the Salt Lick in Driftwood.    Staff was great with explaining Sotols and provided amazing  recommendations.    The Sotol Flight is great.  My fav was the Gin forward Sotol as I have gravitated towards Gin in the last few months   Love band outside play with amazing indoor and outdoor seating.

reviews.author: Mckenna R.
reviews.description: OMG this place was something we happened to stumble upon and it is a Austin must! This is a great cocktail bar that is modern and very desert chic. We are so so happy we stopped here and will be buy thing their Stool back home to make our own delicious Palomas. Also whatever their berry cocktail is, is a must try.

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Loved hanging out here! Meryl was absolutely amaizing and look after us really well.  She made the visit really enjoyable!

reviews.author: Shelly M.
reviews.description: Had an amazing hour enjoying sotol cocktails! Erin and Nicole are amazing. So glad we decided to stop in and can't wait to come back with friends! Facility is gorgeous and has a beautiful West Texas vibe. Can't wait to enjoy music on the porch!

reviews.author: Erin D.
reviews.description: Just left here with our crew! Here for a wedding and this place was recommended to us. It did not disappoint. Kelsey was the BEST waitress. She was so nice, helpful, and friendly. We all talked about her and how great she made our experience. The drinks were awesome and the vibe of the place is great. Highly recommend you come here! Be sure to request Kelsey for the best service!

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: Our favorite spot in the Dripping Springs / Driftwood area. Obsessed with all the cocktails - specifically the comanchero. Obsessed with the interior decor  - please do my house next. Obsessed with all the servers - Nicole, Kelsey + Erin* are WONDERFUL. This place is the best!!

reviews.author: Vanessa T.
reviews.description: Such a beautiful, can't-miss distillery in Texas Hill Country!   We were absolutely shocked by how much we loved Sotol after trying it first as a standalone shot. And they sure know how to do a cocktail, too! I got the River Rita and it legit blew my mind.   Sit and stay awhile, listen to the live music on the patio and if you need to cool down, the interior is a WHOLE mood.   Be sure to visit their gift shop to buy an adorable handmade clay shotglass (SO CUTE) and a bottle of their famous Sotol.   The staff was also astoundingly friendly and the kind of people you want to hang out with.

reviews.author: Hannah K.
reviews.description: This place is great! Good food, great service, even better drinks. Kelsey was our server and she was so friendly and attentive! We'll definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Ang B.
reviews.description: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Love these folks and I know some day we'll go out there and there will be a wait, for now it's still somewhat of an unknown. We've only had wonderful cocktails and bought several bottles of Sotol from them. I like that it has less carbs than tequila! Anyway, the choice of food truck out there is solid (Eden).  I wish I could live next door!

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: If you want a unique drink, great atmosphere and amazing staff.... Go here. We were able to get different but classic drinks and cozy up to fireplace. The food truck made the best fries and quest, perfect for sharing.

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: So glad we finally stopped in to DD! Great distillery with ample patio and outdoor seating! Loved all of their cocktails. They also have live music.  Try the food truck Eden West on site, their quail bites are delish!

reviews.author: Gina F.
reviews.description: Was so excited to try blurred vines and it did not disappoint! First off, the space itself is absolutely beautiful and so chill. There's both indoor and outdoor space.   Major thanks to Malon for all of the knowledgeable information about the wine we tried! All three were really good and paired with cheese that went really well together. Clearly knows his stuff y'all!   I ended up joining the membership and I can't wait to try more hand selected wines. Make a reservation. Try some new wines. You won't regret it!   Thank you to, Emma, for the group pics. We will be back.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: The food here is simple and delicious.  We had the half chicken which was fried in beef fat but no batter. Very crispy skin but tender on the inside. The spinach and mushrooms were well seasoned and delicious.  The Caesar salad was amazing. The dressing was delicious and the chicken on top was perfectly grilled. The flavor tasted like it has been brined for a while--perfectly salty and tender.  The brown butter cake was not very good and the fries were just alright.  Overall, food: 4.5/5 Service: 4/5  Very pricey but you pay for high quality ingredients.

reviews.author: Maddie B.
reviews.description: I was seriously disappointed by my experience here at salt and time which had been highly recommended to me by a friend. They missed pretty much every mark in terms of a good dinner experience. Let me elaborate.  We got there an hour before closing around 8pm, and were going to try to get in and out quick and didn't want to make them stay too late after closing. Well, we didn't have a choice because right off the bat we had to wait for menus for probably five minutes, waited another 10 for the waiter to come take our order, and when we finally placed our order probably 20 minutes had gone by so we put our whole order in at once.  We ordered the little gem Caesar-type salad, a ribeye (MR) and Teres Major (mr).  We waited (literally) 45 minutes for our salad!!! Waiter kept telling us it was coming and at the 40-min mark he asked "you guys still haven't gotten your salad?" Seriously!!!? It's your job to bring it to us and we've asked you about it three times now!  Keep in mind the restaurant was nearly empty by now. When we finally got it there was minimal apology and he seemed very nonchalant like it wasn't a big deal and turns out it wasn't even little gems. I grow little gems and serve them at the restaurant where I work and was super excited for them but this was just a regular iceberg wedge. After 1.5hrs of waiting at this point, steaks came out. Sauces were all wrong and not what we ordered and my steak was over cooked! Clearly medium and not medium rare since my partners was cooked correctly, there was an obvious difference. But at this point, being checked on by our waiter was a ten minute affair so we just shut up and ate it because it was getting late. There were no apologies, no comps, and the waiter kept trying to push us on dessert when we clearly were ready to leave. Dropped the check and proceeded to say "there's no rush!" ... yeah no sh*t I can tell that's definitely a motto here. And on top of that there was automatic 20% gratuity. I usually don't mind that, because most restaurant that do auto-grat have good service where I would've tipped 20% anyways. but it should not be a motivator for the servers to not give a crap about their tables like it is here.   The steaks tasted good but for the price, the horrible service and the inability to get orders right, this place was a total wash. You can get better steaks elsewhere for a cheaper price, where you actually enjoy your dining experience. Maybe in the future if they got new staff or management this place could be a really nice restaurant but for now, I can't recommend it.

reviews.author: Keith C.
reviews.description: Pretty miserable experience. There were at least 5 open tables when we sat down so they were not busy. It took 10 minutes for the waitress to give us a menu and immediately ask for our drink orders. 20 minutes later we get them. We've been here for 30 minutes and haven't gotten to place our order yet.   I order the $52 filet as did my friend. I ordered mine medium rare, he ordered his medium. His looked well done but he likes his meat well done so he didn't care. Mine however was completely raw on the inside. Not "cooked rare" raw. This thing was seared for maybe 10 seconds. It was also very tough. The waitress just dropped off our food and we were waiting for steak knives for 10 minutes until I walked to the hostess and asked for them.   I sent the steak back and it took at least 25 minutes to get it back. At this point so did not want to pay $52 for a reheated steak so I asked another waitress to grab me a burger instead so I could get the hell out of here. They come back with my steak, which was missing a piece, that had clearly been thrown into an oven or microwave to increase the internal temperature.   If you're coming here expecting an artisan or holistic steakhouse experience, go somewhere else. If you're looking for some $15 cocktails to drink in a gentrified strip mall butcher shop, this is the place for you!   My experience was so bad that I considered contacting my credit card for a refund. It was that bad.

reviews.author: Amy M.
reviews.description: One of the best butcher shops in town. Quality pork chops and steaks. Well priced for the quality. Have not seen a NY strip as well marbled as what they have and the pork chops only needed to be seasoned with salt and pepper they were so good!

reviews.author: Ken K.
reviews.description: Great pitcher shop as well as restaurant. Service is a little slow but worth the wait. The burger meat is fantastic. A perfect blend of fat and meat. It is incredibly flavorful. The fries they have are also wonderful. Super crunchy and yummy.

reviews.author: Jinhyung K.
reviews.description: Came here on a burger recommendation. It was a nice little place for brunch. I don't if I was just bad at finding it, but apparently they only have the brunch and dinner menu on the weekend. The lunch menu is only offered on weekdays so if you're wanting to come here for the lunch menu on the weekend, you are out of luck.   But their brunch menu still does offer a burger, the Butcher's Breakfast burger to be exact. It's pretty much the normal Butcher burger but with eggs and bacon added on, and i think cheaper too. I got it medium and it was a nice, hearty burger. It was a juicy, steak-y patty and the brioche bun was quite soft. I probably should've just taken the bacon and eggs out and eaten it separately though. It got a little to big for me.   Beef fat fries are a must try though. Nice soft potato filling, with a slight crisp. I might be wrong, but I tasted a hint of cinnamon and it had a quiet deep fried donut flavor that I am all too familiar with. Very addicting.   Came here on a 1PM Saturday and there was no wait, but I do here it does get crazy busy during dinner times so make sure you have a reservation. Our server was really sweet. The place overall had a calm and chill atmosphere and felt very clean.

reviews.author: Kelly F.
reviews.description: Great Prime Rib for Christmas, we selected the Wagyu beef and it was amazing! Easy ordering system and our order was ready right on time, easy pickup.  We get a little credit for the rosemary and salt rub but honestly you need the top quality beef to start. Thank you and we will be back.

reviews.author: Wayne N.
reviews.description: Best burger in town without a doubt. My friend was singing it's praises for a while and so a group of us showed up all ordering it. Go figure. But it lives up to the hype for sure. It's basically made from trimmings from the butcher shop, so it's ground pretty fresh, seasoned well and honestly tastes almost steak like from the cuts, so highly recommend medium rare or medium on the burger. It's also massive, so no chance you'll leave hungry. Some fresh veg and a nicely toasted bun round off the sandwich. I would also recommend adding some bacon at least to your burger, as it's crisp contrast and who doesn't like bacon.  As if that's not enough, the sides there are also A+. The beef fat fries have a lot of flavor, but also thick enough that you can appreciate the pillowy potato inside. The what I assume house made ketchup adds some needed acidity to all the food but jives well with everything. The shishito pepper app is also really good if you can tolerate a little bit of burn.  Service is a bit on the slow side at the restaurant, so I would definitely recommend getting a reservation if you can but also being patient and just enjoy the decor and conversations with people. The appetizers came out same time as the food too, so waiting an hour for food at 1pm on a Monday afternoon sounds a bit long, but good thing we had good company at least.

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: Everything on the menu is tasty (our group got a wide range) but it's the reverence for the meat that makes this place stand out. Every steak fritte from here on out will be compared to this one. Also butcher shop on one side and wine store on the other. Perfection!!!

reviews.author: Keith K.
reviews.description: Wasn't overly impressed. Actually, we were a little disappointed. We expected much more. The server spoke too softly and mumbled a lot. It was very difficult to hear what she was trying to tell us. Even the younger guest with perfect hearing said they couldn't understand her. Then the food came. It was like the Goldilocks story. Some food was cold, some was overdone, and some was just right. Austin is a big place with many other places to try before we'll attempt to return here.

reviews.author: Jesus Y.
reviews.description: Two stars cause food taste good, my experience the place takes advantage and price everything possible, they charge me in my burger the tomatoes the lettuce, the ice tea 3 dollars and the refill 3 dollars and the small glass of no more then 12 oz has 60% ice .... They charge me the fries and they add a service fee of around 20% on a 2 person 2 meals .  I feel sorry for the waitress I can see she was hesitant about bringing stuff to the table probably cause she knows they charge for everything.... Btw the lobby is close and we had to eat outside with tons flies joining us

reviews.author: Brad G.
reviews.description: They served me a sirloin instead of a ribeye. Lol. Having worked in the industry I politely asked two people if I had been given a sirloin by mistake and they both said no. OMG.  All the servers were in a bad mood ... probably because of something happening with the restaurant. I thought outside would be charming, but it was full of flies.  The catchup was great, though.

reviews.author: m k.
reviews.description: Wine shop staffed by people who know almost nothing about the wine on the shelves and are there to ring up a register that also doesnt take cash.....what a joke.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Brunch today allowed me to check another big name off my list. I heard their Butcher's Burger is the best in Austin, so with nothing else calling to me off the menu, I had to try it. It was ok, I think? It was so tall and hard to eat that it was hard to really process and appreciate the flavor. They cooked it right, but the runny egg made the bun slide everywhere and mayo seemed like overkill. The Beef Fat Fries were pretty good, but not so good that I felt compelled to eat the whole serving. My favorite thing was the Charcuterie Plate that we split before the meal, especially the summer sausage, mortadella, and unidentifiable pink pickles. My friends loved their Steak and Eggs. I tried a bite of a friend's French Toast and would have gladly eaten more! While we were waiting for our food, browsing the butcher shop was interesting, and I liked seeing what products exist even if I wasn't in the market to buy anything. Service was attentive. I'm already planning on coming back again sometime because I know other carnivorous friends will love it. But now it's time for an afternoon nap!

reviews.author: Steven X.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved our meal at Salt and Time. I got their burger and it was fantastic. Cooked perfectly medium rare, juicy as can be, and with a bun that really held up. The reviews don't lie. GET THE BURGER. Oh and the fries were bomb too.   My wife got the BBLT (beef bacon), and I have to say, it was the best BLT I've ever had. On top of favor, the portion was ginormous. Though, it didn't hold up as well as a leftover.   All in all, highly highly recommend, especially once they open dine in. The patio seating is nice but way too hot during the summer

reviews.author: Mary Jane C.
reviews.description: I love look and feel of this place. It's very welcoming. I ordered the butcher's burger with fries and Swiss cheese. The first bite I almost fainted! The flavor was amazing! Wow! I have a favorite burger place in Hawaii called Teddy's and so far I haven't had anything tipped that until today. I normally don't get my burger med rare but damn it was good! From the ketchup and the fries to the burger! I loved it! My first experience was great! Too bad I'm an out of towner! I'd make this a regular spot!

reviews.author: Tatiana T.
reviews.description: Went last night for quick dinner and was absolutely blown away. First and foremost the Beef Tartare is probably one of the best beef tartares I have ever eaten in my life - the mix of flavor was just incredible, and the steak was perfectly diced! I could eat this everyday. Absolutely superb.  We also got the Cesar salad to start which was another hit. For the main we shared the Wagyu NY Strip, side of fries and broccolini, and the sweet corn agnolotti. My ONLY complaint was that there wasn't a larger portion of the agnolotti, delicious stuffed pillows of creamy sweet corn. Service was friendly and hospitable, will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Barbara P.
reviews.description: Salt and Time, in east Austin, is a wonderful butcher shop, as well as a great restaurant.  Covid brought the addition of the upscale butcher shop, complete with many house-made items, terrines and fine meats...very impressive selections.   During Covid they also expanded into a new patio for dining, complete with large overhead fans, which made a very pleasant setting on a warm evening.   My daughter and I enjoyed a really great Charcuterie Board, that included 4 wonderful house-made meats, accoutrements and sauces. We shared it and both loved it.
