We also shared their absolutely delicious Butcher Burger, made from steak trimmings. It was cooked perfectly and served on a brioche bun with all the trimmings, and the best French fries we've had in a long time.    We will definitely return to this east side neighborhood gem!!

reviews.author: Abby A.
reviews.description: Best butcher shop in town! If you're looking for a specialty cut of meat, give this place a look. They'll likely have it or be able to source it for you, with enough notice. Whenever I'm craving a wagyu ribeye or NY strip, this is my first stop.

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: Amazing! Great local grub. Best Berger I've had in a while. I'll definitely be back again.

reviews.author: Debbi R.
reviews.description: A Full and Wonderful Day   Our tour with Dale was fabulous. I wasn't sure what to expect, but it didn't take long to realize that not only is Dale a great tour guide, he's also a very personable and knowledgable man who makes you feel like an old friend.   The points of interest were superb and the last stop we made provided one of the best meals I've had in my life and most likely the best ribeye ever.   The day lasted longer than expected, but it was a wonderful day and ended up being just perfect. We are planning to use his rental venue for a retreat in the coming months and looking forward to it. I highly recommend his services.

reviews.author: Jaylan B.
reviews.description: First I would like to start with the facts.  1. We booked this tour months ago but unfortunately had to reschedule to a later date. (due to Covid19) This was not an issue for anyone attending the tour and the company got all $2800 paid for in full. 2. Yes $2800. We had 28 people in our group, It required two buses that were at their max capacity.  3. I would give a HUGE ZERO if I could.   The buses arrived at the pick up location 25 minutes early and expected us (all 28) to load up. Not all 28 people were even there yet. The male driver already seemed annoyed at this point.  We ended up pulling out at the agreed on time. When trying to leave the 2nd winery we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  But that unfortunately is not why I am writing this review   As we were loading the bus to go home the male driver said that would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilt something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe but she agreed to pay it she sat down. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from Him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off and the other bus also unloaded.  Now it is important to note the other driver said we didn't do anything wrong and that she didn't agree with how he was handling things. He told her he was in charge and that he would make the call. She became quiet after that. They ultimately left us there to find our own rides.  The male driver was rude and didn't speak unless spoken to the entire day. A beautiful day with amazing company was RUINED by this company and I will not recommend them to anyone!

reviews.author: Stacy L.
reviews.description: I booked a birthday trip for 6 people, hoping to add 2 more. Dale told me I could book the trip for 6 and then add the 2. When I called to add the 2 he told me he would have to see if that was even possible. I didn't understand why after he assured me it would be fine and a sprinter van hold more than that. He had given the sprinter van to a larger crowd and downgraded us to an SUV without asking me (same price). I asked him when I would hear back and he said whenever he located another vehicle. I made some calls and found a better business who really wanted to host me and our guests. I called again to cancel with Dale and was told I am not the type of customer he would want. I guess a customer who wants to pay more money to add more people isn't good... very strange. Talking to a woman like that is not ok. I hope that he was having a bad few days and that he doesn't always behave like this, but I was really shocked how rude and unprofessional he was. Pros: I got my money back.

reviews.author: Blair B.
reviews.description: The owner/driver we had was terribly rude and very unprofessional. He only spoke when spoken to and when he did talk he seemed annoyed.  Do not waste your money on this company! I've had Uber drivers converse more than this "tour guide."  Worst experience ever by far!

reviews.author: Marcia H.
reviews.description: We were celebrating our wedding anniversary. The tour was nice. The driver was great! We visited some interesting wineries. Seeing the Texas wine country off the beaten path was well worth it. We would use this company again.

reviews.author: Doug E.
reviews.description: We had a great time.  Well worth the money our driver Laura was great.  She was helpful and was happy to be there.  When I do this again I won't change anything.  I would use the same driver and tour service.

reviews.author: Amanda G J.
reviews.description: One of the WORST experiences I have ever had with a "wine tour" company. I have been on many wine tours in my days, across different parts of Texas, and their unprofessionalism and lack of customer service and just blatant disrespect was appalling.   This "wine tour" had a total of two buses and a party consisting of 28 people. A group of people that I have known for years that have the utmost of respect and common courtesy for any company that they hire or work with.   From the start of our experience, both drivers were incredibly rude and unfriendly. The bus lacked any amenities one would think this "Premier Hill Country Wine Tasting Experience" would consist of.  The first winery.  * We arrived at the first winery at 10:48am to learn that the winery doesn't even open until 11:00am and that they WEREN'T expecting us at all... * Not the wineries fault. They were fantastic.  The second winery.  * Again, wasn't expecting us, causing us to have to sit at a tent down a road from the winery. Again, not the wineries fault, they handled it incredibly.  * When trying to leave the second winery, we couldn't. The drivers HAD LEFT and weren't there to pick us up. We waited outside in the sun outside for 30 minutes before they even got back.  The third winery.  * As we were loading the bus to go home, the male driver said that they would be charging us for a cleaning fee ($300) because someone spilled something on the floorboard. Pretty steep for a small spill that could be wiped up with a Clorox wipe, but she agreed to pay it. (*To clarify, open containers were allowed as stated on their website: "Consumption of alcohol on the bus is allowed unless there are minors present.") Minor spills like this are inevitable when providing a service as they do. Comments started to be exchanged about the steep fee and how the day had been complete chaos up until this point. The man began to get pretty heated and slammed the door. When he opened the door to his seat he said "who the f**k spilt something in my seat." Nobody had spilled something on his seat. Upon looking at the "spill" it appeared to be sweat from him. He continued to cuss and yell and eventually told us to "get off his bus." We all piled off, and the other bus also unloaded.  I know these times are hard, especially for small and locally owned businesses, and by no means and am I trying to make it harder for them; in fact, I am going above and beyond to support them. After yesterday, I do think that they need to take a step back and re-evaluate their actions and really think long and hard about what they do and why they do it. In the end, when providing a service, the client always comes first.

reviews.author: Susan G.
reviews.description: Rick was AMAZING! He is the guide with the mostest - a gentleman with a servant's heart, excellent taste in wineries, and a plethora of knowledge about this  beautiful TX region. He is truly one-of-a-kind and I'm so glad we took this tour with him. Thanks, Rick - see you again soon!

reviews.author: Tiffany H.
reviews.description: This could not have been a better day! We highly recommend touring with Heart of Texas Wine Tours. We were so lucky to have found Dale Fortenberry. He is so knowledgeable about the area, the history and the vineyards. Dale went out of this way to accommodate the entire group of women with different tastes in wine. We all know that is not an easy feat, but he did it! Our next trip to the hill country will find us taking another exciting tour with Dale.  -Tiffany Raye

reviews.author: Christi C.
reviews.description: Absolutely best experience from beginning to end!   From ease of scheduling, picking us up on door step, and bringing us back, worry free.    Our driver Rick was great!  Shared info and answered all of our questions about the area.   He escorted us in to reserved tables at each location, pampered us all day!    Already planning our next trip with www.HeartOfTexasWineTours.com!  Thank you, Christi

reviews.author: Matthew V.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I had a fantastic time on this tour. To be honest, the cost seemed a bit high at first but having never been on a wine tour before and I really had no idea. Afterward I realize it was worth every bit of it. Dale picked us up at our BnB along with everyone else on the tour that day and we were off to the first tasting.  He seem to know everyone along the tour and at each place they were very welcoming and grateful to have our group. It really was a fun time and we had the chance to try many different wines that we would not have normally picked.  Lucky for us it was a beautiful day and everything was just perfect. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone interested in checking out some Texas wines, for a nice weekend getaway, or just to try something different.  It definitely helped that we had a good group of people who were also on the tour that day as well. It was a blast...I just wish we had taken more pictures.

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Heads up - I'm only giving this one star so I can write a review. It would get a huge ZERO if I could rate it that way. First off, Dale is a pretentious, "underpaid monkey" as he likes to be called. He is rude, unprofessional, and has the audacity to 'hate mail' potential clients and I know I'm not the first one because I've seen the reviews! I don't have much else to say but be careful and do your research before spending any money on this place! The owner seems to not have a care in the world if it's not benefitting him. Also, be ready for rude phone calls and emails from Dale if he doesn't get his way. He was hard to get ahold of from the jump, not to mention I live out of town and couldn't wait for days in between responses. After not being able to make it to my appointment because he had failed to get back to me promptly, I proceeded on with my day. The next morning I wake up to the most rude, despicable email I've ever received. Just be careful and read reviews because from what I've read, if you want a beautiful wedding with NICE, FRIENDLY people, this isn't the place. I'll attach one of many emails. STAY AWAY FROM THE HEART OF TEXAS RANCH ALL TOGETHER!!!

reviews.author: Melody G.
reviews.description: Amazing time with a group of 7 of us girls. Our guide was Christy and she was outgoing and made us all feel like nothing was a bother for her. Picked us up at our hotel in Fredericksburg, went to pick up lunch, and then on to first of 4 wineries. She took care of everything. Even loaded up our bottles/goodies in the back of the bus and kept the AC on to keep it all cool.  Christy went above and beyond to keep everything organized, she set up our lunch, picked up our trash, offered to take us anywhere we wanted to go, and she kept us on time to all of our tastings. We bought a bottle of wine at the 3rd winery and drank in the bus on the way to the 4th. Lunch was a boxed lunch bought at local deli (very good). Everything was included. Everything was professional. The bus was large and comfy. Highly recommend this tour company!

reviews.author: Valarie M.
reviews.description: Dale was great getting everything organized and keeping us on track - and then also helping us change the schedule when we needed to.  very accommodating.  thanks Dale! you were a great host!

reviews.author: Erin K.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour celebrating my sister's bachelorette party. Dale was very prompt and polite returning my phone calls. He was also very accommodating as the number of girls going on the tour changed at the last minute. We went to Fat Ass, Six Shooter and Fiesta Vineyards which were a blast and everyone enjoyed the tastings. Our driver Rick was funny and a true gentleman. It was raining that day and he had an umbrella to escort everyone in and out of the tasting rooms so no one got soaked. One of the girls left their phone on the tour bus and Rick came back later that evening to return the phone even after we offered to meet him half way. We had a great time and would recommend this tour to anyone!

reviews.author: Tory H.
reviews.description: What a fun and relaxing time! The tour bus was very spacious and clean and the driver was very accommodating. The tour was carefully selected for us with every winery being better than the last! I cant wait to take another tour.

reviews.author: Keith R.
reviews.description: We paid nearly four hundred dollars and it was a joke. What was supposed to be a winery tour was a tour of places that sold wine. We went to a store in downtown marble falls, an art studio, a grocery store and at the very end an actual winery. This constituted our day.   This is NOT a day of going to wineries in the hill country. Everyone was disappointed on Valentine's day.   The guy who led the tour was nice but they clearly got kickbacks where we went.   When we went to lunch no one got their order and right when we were leaving this sandwich shop the tour guide asked, "everyone went to the tasting room, right?" We're talking about a sandwich place being a stop on the wine tour people.   Horribly disappointed. Considering tastings were at most $10 for each of the four "wineries" we went to, it was a rip off in value.  The company clearly avoided going to respectable wineries and instead went to dead end places where they could maximize their profit margin.   Avoid at all costs!!

reviews.author: Kat S.
reviews.description: We had a great time on this wine tour. I booked it only two days in advance and they took great care of us. I told Dale our tastes in wine and he sent us to three great wineries. We had the bus all to ourselves too! I would definitely use them again and recommend this company for all your wine touring needs!

reviews.author: Monica P.
reviews.description: Dale is great!! He helped us find some Texas wines that we actually like! We went to a few places I never would have thought to stop by and helped us pick out some good wines to try. He kept the ride fun even though we were with 2 other groups of people we didn't know. The van was comfy and well air conditioned and stocked with bottled water. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Dawn N.
reviews.description: Even a rainy day couldn't dampen the amazing experience the Heart of Texas Wine Tours provided.  We visited four wineries and were treated like VIPs due to Dale's wonderful rapport with vineyard owners and staff.  Dale's knowledge of wine and  the specialities and uniqueness of each winery made the tour interesting and fun.  By the end of the day, I had not only made new memories, but new friends too!

reviews.author: Laurene A.
reviews.description: We finally made it to the Wanderlust location on a Tuesday, ahead of leaving for a vacation, as were looking to spend a day just relaxing near home and day drinking. There are tons of choices of wine, and even more places to sit and relax! The staff explains the process to you, but after our first visit, we definitely realized there could have a little better thorough explanation, and notation made about the happy hour each day. My husband and I each received our own card for pours, even though we were on the same tab, so it's VERY easy to lose track of how much you are spending collectively, because your card only shows what YOU have spent so far. The choice to have small, medium and large pours is nice, because even though each wine has a description, you just don't know until you try it! There are several food truck options, but they don't open until later in the day. There are also some mead wines, and some non alcoholic options inside, as well as games to play! There are also dog-friendly areas and water bowls, which are always a plus for us!  Our only complaint was the staff; we arrived just after their posted opening time, but the door was locked. We walked around back, called out to anyone, and got no response. We left for a bit and came back and it was finally opened. We inquired about it with the long staff member after she finally appeared, after about 15 minutes of waiting, and she seemed to think we didn't know what we were talking about. And as I mentioned, the explanation was not very thorough, and we had to wait another 10 minutes to cash out because she kept disappearing. We chalked it up to an one-off thing, and let it go, but it was still quite strange. I would think busier times might be better!

reviews.author: Sara B.
reviews.description: This spot is like the original Wanderlust (put a credit card on file, and you get card to swipe for different wines on what is essentially as a pay per ounce buffet). With this buffet, you're paying more for the nice items, per ounce, though.  This location is larger, though, and more artistic both in the decor and the fact that they have performers there. Additionally, they have a larger selection at this location vs. the original location. That said, while it's a larger selection, there's less variety. At least when I went there they didn't have margarita-inspired wines or mead. If you loooove wine, then, this is the place for you (or if you're looking for a more creative atmosphere), but if not I'd recommend the other location.

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I have been to this location back when it was Infinite Monkey Winery. I was sad they closed due to the 'Rona. Anyway, I am glad it is up back and running as Wanderlust.   Upon entering you can grab a glass of mead from the bar area or head into the winery to pay by the pour with your card. They have tons of wines to choose from to include sangrias. There are picnic tables inside and a small courtyard near the food trucks if you want to hang out outdoors.  They have a few food trucks on-site that will be opening soon. One of them was kind enough to pass out bread samples. I am gluten-free but my husband indulged in some delicious bread which he said was AMAZING.  Overall this is a cool little area with more to come to include a coffee place, brewery, and restaurant. I will be back for sure because the location is chill and the wine was good.

reviews.author: Katie M.
reviews.description: Location #2 for wanderlust wine did not disappoint!!    The two locations are wildly different it makes you do a double take - is this the same company?? But yes - they can do all the vibes with all the great wines.   This location has a huge barn area for massive parties and events, a cozy interior, and another even cozier private room. The bathrooms are beautiful and the place, although huge, is still absolutely comfortable due to the layout.

reviews.author: Jiyoon S.
reviews.description: Came here on a Tuesday, where it was extremely dead (maybe 15 people tops) and despite an awkward ambiance we had a good time! First off, the space is fantastic - huge lofted ceilings, seamless indoor/outdoor (perfect for COVID), visually interesting seating and art. The indoor portion comes loaded with comfy couches and armchairs which I can appreciate! A fantastic venue that I'm sure would've been much more vibrant during peak hours.  The service is great, really enthusiastic and knowledgeable sommeliers accompany with a great playlist. The wine selection here is decent, definitely a more robust and diverse selection than the downtown location.   Great location for large groups or a birthday party. Would totally come again (albeit on a busier night)!

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: Love the art deco! Variety of areas to seat, including a room with artificial grass. Large room has many picnic tables with transistor radios and manual typewriters adorning them.   Excellent selection of wine and sangria. Provides a great opportunity to try a variety of regions of wines that you would be unable to do in a restaurant setting. However, it is expensive.  I had less than a glass and a half and spent over $20.   There are 3 food trucks, but they were closed when we were there (Sunday).  This would be a great place for a group event or just a large group attendance (that happy hour people forget to RSVP for--this is the place to accommodate them!). It is so spacious in the main room.   Parking is an issue.  It's only available on the street: so carpool or rideshare.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: I live right next door to the new Wanderlust and was too excited when I learned that they were doing their soft opening. My boyfriend and I came in after dinner one night to see the new location and grab a few drinks and I can definitely say that we'll be back. The wine isn't on tap just yet since they're still finishing up construction but there's still plenty of options and the staff is eager to help. We spoke to Ashley at the bar and she was amazing, she told us all about the building, the wines, events, and what was to come with the space. Not only was the wine great but the atmosphere is just unmatched. The building is decorated floor to ceiling with murals and graffiti art from local Austin artists. I can't wait to come back when the whole package is together!   COVID Precautions: Masks are encouraged and hand sanitizer was provided.

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: I love Wanderlust Wine Company! It's such a fun environment, and they have so many excellent wines to choose from! If you haven't been to the new Eastside location, it is seriously one of the coolest buildings in Austin. There is so much local art there! Plus, the drag shows on Sunday are Dope!

reviews.author: Angela G.
reviews.description: A great place to try different wines and hang out with friends! They have a ton of seating indoor and outdoor. I tried a Moscato and a Sangria, both of which were very delicious! Check them out on their half off days (Mondays).

reviews.author: Kia L.
reviews.description: The inside of wanderlust is so creative! This location decor has a graffiti, gritty feel? They also play a lot of hip hop/ rap which is not only refreshing but gives this place an authentic feel! There is only street parking at the Shady ln location so keep that in mind! Once you arrive you receive a Pour card that you can use to access each tap. They have white wine (Chardonnay, resiling,etc) and red wine varieties. They don't have food but there are separately operated food trucks! Overall I think the wine is a bit over priced but love this space for studying, exploring a creative outlet or chilling with a few friends. It's a VERY quiet space. There's outdoor and indoor seating. I will be back sometime I hope they host comedy or spoken word here... seems like an appropriate venue!

reviews.author: Xia M.
reviews.description: It's a little complicated pouring the tap in the beginning. But once you get the hang of it, you're in! I like the added perk of having a taco truck outback. The interior space is luxurious, and the outside sitting space is reminds me of a barn. You get the best of both worlds. I come here for the sangria, usually on tap #61 and #63, but by the time you're reading this, they may have changed the drinks. This could seem a bit pricey unless you go during a happy hour. When it's not 50% off happy hour on certain days of the week, then an average day will have 30% off from 3pm to 6pm.

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: What a fun event. I love the idea of wine by the once. I'll go back for sure. I hope they open up a venue up north.

reviews.author: Joseph Y.
reviews.description: Great little spot with locations downtown and on the east side. Have been to both but we greatly prefer the East side location as it is considerably larger. We like to be able to bring our pup and there "outdoor" area is super pet friendly and is conveniently where all the wines to sample happen to be. The addition of 3 new food trucks is just the icing on the cake. Go check it out, you won't be disappointed!!!

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine was a fun experience for my husband and I. As I was reading some of the other reviews, I learned that you could make your own wine. I called ahead to see if there were any open appointments on a Friday afternoon and Jenny answered. She has a very fun, bubbly personality and told us to swing by anytime. We were able to taste several different wines before we decided what we wanted to make. We spent about 1-1.5 hours there. We look forward to designing our own wine bottle labels and returning in 6-8 weeks to bottle the wine.

reviews.author: Jen B.
reviews.description: Absolutely love this place. The owner, Jenny, is the best. She's fun, friendly, thoughtful. All the staff are wonderful.   I've made many batches of wine here. The wine making process is really fun from tasting and selecting the wine you want, to making it and, the  funnest part, bottling. You can customize your wine label and they print it for you to put on the bottles.   You can bring your own snacks and get a bottle to enjoy.   I would highly recommend everyone to try making a batch of wine at water to wine. They make great Xmas gifts too.

reviews.author: Neshia R.
reviews.description: Let's start with how cute this place is! I walked in and felt like I had been invited into someone's home the staff was extremely friendly and knowledgeable im from out of town and im so glad I made the stop here  before heading home! Ambience is nice 3 free wine tasting and the bottle prices are extremely reasonable and you can make your own wine. If you're looking for a place with a good vibe where everyone feels like family this is the place will return every time im in Austin!!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is perfect for so many occasions... date night, girls night, happy hour, a pop-in for a glass of wine, or a night of wine making/bottling with friends. We were sad when the Round Rock location closed down, but found this place to be a million times better. The decor is cute and thematic, with tons of inviting spots for seating, whether you're looking for a romantic spot for two, or some couches for a larger gathering. The best part is the staff - super friendly and helpful while we try to make the tough decision of what to drink or take home. The free samples help too!   Making our own batch of wine is a yearly tradition for us. We get together with friends to start the wine (which of course involves a good time trying the different wines first), design our own labels (or get help from W2W), throw a gathering to bottle the wine, then have bottles to hand out as wedding favors, Christmas gifts, or generic gifts.   We are club members, so we stop by at least monthly for a couple glasses of wine and to pick up our bottles to enjoy at home. Whether you're joining wine club, making a batch, or just stopping in for a glass or two, Water 2 Wine is a fantastic neighborhood gem. I only wish they were in my neighborhood!

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine is best described (at least as they themselves put it) as 'Build-a-Bear for Adults'!    I visited this establishment thinking it was a simple wine tasting spot.  Actually, they also provide services as your own personal vintner and label maker, where you can taste, create, and label your own wine!  While I have yet to try this full service out, the staff was very friendly, the wine (tried the whites only) was excellent, and you can palpably feel how fun the process is.  Definitely coming back to celebrate good times with a custom-made wine!

reviews.author: Joy W.
reviews.description: Ok, but why is this place SO cute?!  I went here for a wine tasting years ago with a girlfriend and as a fun catch up, we decided to meet back here.  What a fun tradition we want to continue!  The staff here is outstanding, they have great thought, and make you feel comfortable.  We had some neighbors at a different table order food in and  thought that was hilariously brilliant!  You are definitely recommended to buy a bottle as all winery's usually do, but this spot doesn't make you feel pushed to - which makes me want to buy another bottle.  I love that this is tucked away in the city and you don't have to go to the city limits to do a wine tasting.  I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this to any and all of you!

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: Came here with friends who decided they wanted a wine baby and we tagged along to help them taste wines. It is a very laid-back tasting room. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Prices are reasonable and tasting is free. You can even make your own wine, which is exactly what we tagged along to do and that gets you 28-30 bottles. Highly recommend this place - Cheri and Jenny are so knowledgeable and make the whole process so easy and fun!  Only downside, no Texas wines... but this isn't necessarily a con -  all their wines are made on-site with grapes from various vineyards.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: The wine they make is so tasty. They let you have three samples so that you can find the wine you would enjoy.  When I come here I always take home a bottle.  The staff is veery knowledgeable and friendly.  They also do custom labels if you buy I case I believe.

reviews.author: Maria G.
reviews.description: What a lovely place to sip some wine and worth doing the wine club membership if you like wine in the slightest even.  The staff are awesome. They make excellent suggestions whether you know what you're looking for or not. They can get you going in the right direction.  Sulfite free wine? Is my understanding. I don't know a lot about wine, but know that's a good thing to be free of. I can say the ports and fruity wines are a good dessert. My family and friends love the other wines.

reviews.author: Natasha C.
reviews.description: I just love this place !! They are so friendly and even if you are new they treat you like family. The wine is good and the cheese platter is huge ! One of my absolute favorite places I've discovered since moving to Austin !

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: Went in not knowing what to expect from the store front but was pleasantly surprised. Personable and knowledgeable stuff and many wines to try! Your first 3 wine tastings are free and then a dollar per tasting after that. Additionally you can make you own wine which is a unique experience!

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: If you are a young couple, or an old couple, or an odd couple, and you decide you want a wine baby, you may be a bit worried about where, when and how to do that.  It's a big step and you should have nothing but the best for your Vino Bambino, so please look no further than Water 2 Wine, and Jenny in particular.  She is the BEST midwife for your wine labor.    We just had the best experience making, bottling and labeling our wine baby.  It was smoooooth sailing and immediately made me want another :)  When you decide to make your own wine, first, you'll get to sample the wines, ALL of them if you so wish.  I spent two afternoons sampling bunches of them and all the staff were generous and enthusiastic in helping me find which wine I wanted.  Then, you make an appt for conception.  It's fairly simple  and pleasurable.  Again, you can grab a glass of wine as you work, mixing the juice and water and yeast in a giant white bucket (Carboy), churning away for about 10 minutes and then your part is done for about 6 weeks!  The rest of the staff will ensure that your baby gestates comfortably and appropriately, testing its ph and sugars until its ready to be born.  Then the magic happens.  As the parent, you'll have full creativity in naming your baby.  In which case, you can pick any 3 images you like, decide the wording and color scheme and font of the label, email all that to Jenny and she'll print out the most perfect labels.  You can then invite a bunch of friends to witness and help in the birthing.  You can bring in all kinds of snack ems and the fine ladies at Water 2 Wine will immediately ply your guests with tastings of their wine and you can buy bottles (and bottles) to facilitate in the birthing process.  Everyone in your party can try their hand at filling bottles, corking bottles, melting the lid foils, and sticking on labels.  In the end, you'll have about 30 bottles of fantastic wine ( I recommend the Gruner!) to share and take home.    They make for fantastic house warming, business, wedding, new baby, Christmas, Hanukkah, etc gifts.  In fact, if you decide last minute you'd like to adopt a wine baby for Christmas, they keep a bunch already made and ready to label for your Christmas party or gifts.    Best thing was, our friends had so much fun and it was such a new experience for all of us that we WIN again as the hostess with the mostest.  And, even though I had grand plans of using this wine at our housewarming party, I doubt it'll last another 8-10 months so we may indeed make another baby next year.    Jenny and the rest of the staff really made this so much fun and interesting with all their cool contraptions and accomodated me with the music I wanted (got to have appropriate Edith Piaf wine birthing music!) and never left a wine glass dry in my group.    So grab your partner, in life, in business, in crime, and get to makin that baby! They're the best kind of babies, they don't puke or shit or cry and instead of causing you stress, they relieve it.  And in the end you'll have the coolest collectible bottles.

reviews.author: Heather B.
reviews.description: I love this place! My husband and I come regularly, and  from the minute we walk in the door, it feels like we're visiting old friends. Jenny, Dustin and Cheri are knowledgeable, friendly and so much fun. Every visit is a good visit.

reviews.author: Stacy S.
reviews.description: Jenny was fantastic! First time here and we had a great time. Wine was amazing and the service was incredible.  Between my in laws and my husband we took a a few bottles home with us. We will be back for sure and would love a Cedar Park location!

reviews.author: Robert W.
reviews.description: Love this place! Great place to stop for a glass of wine and taste a few more after a long day of work!

reviews.author: Kate F.
reviews.description: Visited Water2Wine for my birthday this past December. LOVED IT! Cute, cute tasting room with tons of puzzles and activities, plus adorable furnishings. The menu was huge and the options would suit almost every taste. You can also print out custom labels for your bottles! TONS of fun for a big group, or an intimate outing. You can also bring your own appetizers to come sit and enjoy while tasting some delicious wines.

reviews.author: Jesse D.
reviews.description: Water 2 Wine has taken your normal wine drinking experience and given it a unique spin by providing you the keys to the winery and letting you become the vintner. You make your own batch of wine, create custom labels, bottle it, and best of all, taste the fruits of your labor. By having you do this work on site they are able circumvent certain regulations resulting in less sulfites and other chemicals than store bought wines.  I have been visiting Water 2 Wine for about five years and actually created a batch with my wife and we gave the custom bottles of wine away as gifts at our wedding. The gifts were a hit.   Water 2 Wine imports their grapes and juices from other vineyards. This is not uncommon for vineyards in Texas as most don't grow enough grapes, if any, to meet their own demand. When you decide to make a batch this is where you will start. You will mix the juice, and depending on the type of wine you are making will add flavors like oak.  After you make the wine it will go in the back room for fermentation where the staff will guide the wine along over the next six to eight weeks changing containers around six times.  About two months later you will come back and bottle your wine. You add your label, fill the bottle, cork it and shrink wrap foil around the top. Like a good chef test tasting food a lot of quality assurance goes on during this process. This is a perfect event to bring along a group of friends. Hopefully you end up bottling more wine than you drink.   You don't have to make wine. Water 2 Wine is also a spacious wine bar, with a large selection of wine, where you can stop in just to drink some wine. All of the wine is made on site by the employees. They don't sell food but you are welcome to bring in food to eat with your wine. There are plenty of tasting options or you can buy by the glass or bottle. The staff is very friendly and have been one of my favorite aspects of every visit.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: Very friendly, exuberant staff.....check. Interesting concept (make your own wine!) and fun factor....sure, check. Free wine tasting (5 tastes offered).....check. Their "ready made" wines.....uh well, let's just say I do not believe you can make decent wine out of water; and from the wines I sampled it seems that's just what they are trying to do.

reviews.author: Linda M.
reviews.description: Attended a fun wine pairing class (groupon deal) -- a great time and highly recommended! I have an alcohol allergy (it's an Asian thing! ;-), so it's awesome to learn about and try some low sulfite wines. I'm not really a fan of wine (or alcoholic beverages in general) for obvious reasons, but if I were, I'd buy it all here! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Carie H.
reviews.description: The team at W2W knows their stuff. I'm only disappointed I didn't visit here earlier in life. The crew is helpful, knowledgeable and always friendly.   Whether it's a glass of vino after work, a place to gather on weekends with friends or a fun place to work remote during the week W2W has it all.   I always thought you could only make wine here and was surprised to learn it's also a wine bar and retail destination.   Stop by and challenge the team to find you the perfect glass- they won't disappoint.

reviews.author: Jacob C.
reviews.description: Great wine and a great atmosphere! We joined their membership May 2020 and keep on making the drive out their for tastings and special events. We even purchased their wines for our wedding (white and red blend)!!! Highly recommend going out to do a tasting and hang out. Plus, there are tons of other places to check out for food, beer, and more wine nearby to make a day of it. Adam, the owner, has created a chill place to relax nestled in the back of the property surrounded by trees. Parking is super easy!

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: Semi new winery with very friendly staff and kids friendly. They have 6 wines to taste, 2 whites, 4 reds to include a table white and table red and a port. Favorite was the table white and the cuvée. The biggest reason for the 4 and not 5 stars was none were local grapes or wines.  Props for the kids toys and adult size connect four and Jenga.

reviews.author: Anthony L.
reviews.description: We added this place to the itinerary last minute and I am glad we did.   This location is not a vineyard itself. It's basically an outpost of the parent company in California. Based in Paso Robles, Graveyard Vineyards is a small producer. The wines offered are all grown and made in California.   We opted for the tasting. They offered 6 wines for $15. We enjoyed generous pours of 2 whites, 1 rose, 2 reds, and a dessert wine. All of them were very good! You can tell their not Texas wines (in a good way!).   The staff was incredibly helpful. They offered tastings outside and were very attentive! I would absolutely recommend stopping by if you're in the area.   If you can grab a Malbec, do it!

reviews.author: Andrea L.
reviews.description: Our family was in town from CA and we decided we would go wine tasting locally and try some Texas wines. The wineries prior, all staff wore masks which was nice since we had a couple high risk individuals in our group. When we arrived at Graveyard, the outside was not impressive, not exactly the winery ambience. Once we got inside, the male was not wearing a mask (ok... fine... mask mandate lifted.... ) but he then told me I could take off my mask standing about a foot away, and I told him no I can't, we have high risk individuals. He then said to go outside for the tasting which we did. But honestly, who tells people to take off their masks or suggest they take off their masks during a pandemic? He has noooo idea of our health conditions, concerns or even has the right to even suggest on the matter. I was definitely taken back.  Once we went outside the table was just covered in pollen and debris and leaves. We were all so itchy from all the leaves under the table. Just no grooming or landscaping or care given to the on-site property. It was not a relaxing atmosphere whatsoever, as mentioned prior, a parking lot view/feeling.  The female local staff member had superb customer service, but again, in our faces pouring wine with no mask on. Out of the wineries we went to that day, this is the ONLY place where they were mask free. Although the mask mandate was lifted, we're still in the midst of a major pandemic and felt other establishments honored that respectfully. We felt very safe at all the wineries prior.   Grapes not from Texas.   Pros: Wine was good.

reviews.author: Jon H.
reviews.description: This review is meant as an FYI to those people who are thinking about joining the Graveyard vineyards wine club.  Graveyard expects you to take three shipments and are unwilling to cancel your membership before you pay for, and receive three shipments.  I have received two shipments and did not want any more Graveyard wine.  When I reached out to the wine club, the response was "you are asked to received three shipments; you've had two.  Your third one is coming up."  I am going to be candid here.  I just don't care for the wines.  I know others like them very much.  My sister, who lives near the tasting room in Dripping Springs, loves the wine.  There is nothing wrong with the wine; I just don't care for it and I think two shipments is enough to make up my mind.  I conveyed my feelings to the wine club manager and her solution was to downgrade me from a 12-bottle shipment to a 6-bottle shipment.  I really don't mean to knock Graveyard.  But my suggestion is to buy a case of wine and try it before you join the club.  I want to emphasize that there is nothing wrong with the wine; it just does not align with my tastes.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Graveyard is a brand new addition to the winery community in Drip, having opened in late January. They are an offshoot of a parent winery in Paso Robles, CA. The wines they sell are all produced, bottled and shipped here from that operation. They do yet carry the entire CA inventory but do plan to increase the Texas offerings.   The wines available include a couple of Graveyard's more affordable blends - Paso Tombstone White and the red blend from that line. Both are pleasant, sippable blends at a very reasonable price point. The red was light slightly complex mix of common reds produced at the parent vineyard. They also stock Ascender, a credible Brut. Their estate Cab is actually very good- a lighter Cab with a nice effect on the palate.   The lounge itself is pleasant and airy without being pretentious. The staff, especially manager Adam, are all personable and informative.

reviews.author: Wendy B.
reviews.description: We had a great time at our spaced-out table outdoors. The trees there are gorgeous, but otherwise, the view and ambiance is more of the parking lot. It was a relaxing time playing checkers and sipping wine under the trees, though. Our server was wonderful and covid-safe. Unfortunately, one staff wasn't wearing a mask, even inside, but we didn't have to deal with him much. We really enjoyed the wines. I know they are based out of Cali, but it was still nice to get a decent sparkling wine at a Texas vineyard. They were all good, but that was a nice surprise.

reviews.author: Stephanie K.
reviews.description: Everything is stellar from the staff to the wine to the environment! You feel like you are at home in your living room drinking great wine and chatting with friends. Mindy, Caitlin and Adam are awesome! Scream has to be our favorite red!

reviews.author: Whitney B.
reviews.description: Epic wine! Very nice people! Great way to spend an afternoon. If you are looking for really good wine and a tasting this is your place!

reviews.author: Lindsey U.
reviews.description: Great wine and tasting menu! The staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be coming back soon!

reviews.author: Alyson F.
reviews.description: We were sadly under impressed with this new addition in Dripping. We were given a room temperature bottle of Rose and were told by the staff it was "the usual temperature they sold Rose." I don't know about you, but I crave a cold Rose in this Texas heat. They ship in all of their wines from California so you won't find any Texas wines here either. Without good customer service or outstanding wine, we won't be back.

reviews.author: Jeff K.
reviews.description: Not Texas sourced wines, but absolutely incredible! From their parent vineyard in Paso Robles, Adam and company have some stunning wines. Super nice folks, too! Our favorites are the Chardonnay ( not oaky), the red blend, and their insanely good Malbec. We've been back three times.... they're dangerously close to our home.

reviews.author: DeeAnn M.
reviews.description: Simply the best! Look no further for great wine. Graveyard has the best red wines you will taste in this region. The owners and staff are friendly and knowledgeable. The tasting room is comfortable and inviting. Do not leave without tasting the dessert wine that is like chocolate in a glass! It is all good here so just go !

reviews.author: Melinda N.
reviews.description: I wonder if it's a new winery. The parking lot isn't as big as others but the space is very nice, benches and tables under trees. The inside is small because it's in a cottage so there's a sign saying one group at a time. The wines are from California. You can do a flight for $15 or a glass. We all chose a glass (8oz pour) whereas a tasting is 6 oz. loved our reds. There's a sculpture garden to stroll. Lovely place for convo. Also we tried the fat boy cheese spread w ritz crackers and it's so good!

reviews.author: April K.
reviews.description: We had a very pleasant experience at Parmeson! The wines are super high quality and very enjoyable. We had the Rose and the Sauvignon Blanc, both of which were outstanding. Tom and Katie are wonderful hosts and the garden setting is a delightful place to pause and relax. Highly recommended spot for fellow enophiles! We will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Natasha Z.
reviews.description: Charming little boutique place and a convenient stop on the way to Fredericksburg. However perhaps I will be a bit biased coming from California and having tried some of the best wines, the wine here is not something for a refined wine pallet. It's a cute little spot to check out and try out but not something that would leave you wanting more. Sauvignon Blanc was the best choice of the flight and the others did not leave me too excited.

reviews.author: Jeff A.
reviews.description: Stop by and see Tommy at Parmeson Wines!!!  Super wine at nice prices too...  all good but I really enjoy the red zin, Pinot and the rose in summer time!   The new Alberino is very good!! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Lauren C.
reviews.description: I keep meaning to post a review for this winery. My husband and I visited them a few weeks ago to celebrate a recent job interview. They have only recently opened up, so we had never heard of them before and were excited to try them out. They had a very cute tasting room with nice stone that also felt very homey. The tasting was $20 and you get to try 6 wines. $20 still feels a bit hefty for a tasting in Central Texas for me, but their pours were pretty generous and you're not being served by someone who looks like a teenager who couldn't care less about your experience (like what Becker has become). All of these wines are from Sonoma. Overall, we didn't love the tastings except for the Zinfandel and the Cabernet which were absolutely outstanding, but I don't typically love lighter-bodied red wines or most reds from Sonoma. The quality is great, but a few of the prices were just slightly higher than what we can personally justify - I absolutely loved the Cab but it was $60. The Zinfandel was more affordable at $39. Their Wine Club gives you 20% off purchases which is nice, but it is a 6-bottle quarterly shipment. The winemakers are the Parmesons themselves and we had the pleasure of getting to chat with them while we did our tasting. They are a wonderful couple who were very welcoming and lovely to chat with. We loved hearing their story of how they got into winemaking. I would highly recommend checking this place out!

reviews.author: Lisa N.
reviews.description: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!! We had a group of 11 people going to the wineries in Dripping Springs and Johnson City. Driver was rude from the start and then left us at the winery. Just left us stranded!!! There were no Ubers or Taxis so we had to call friends to come pick us up.  Police came and we filed a report. Stay far away from this limo service as they may leave you stranded too!!

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Express Limo bailed me out on my mid-pandemic wedding.  I needed a last second bus to take groomsmen from Airbnb to venue in Dripping Springs.  They responded immediately and after a few texts and a call, driver was sitting at our door in an awesome party bus.   Really great experience.

reviews.author: Blair N.
reviews.description: Would give 0/5 stars if I could. The guy was rude from the second he picked us up when we asked him to help us set up the Bluetooth. He then refused to take us home from the second winery which was an hour and a half away from where we live?? He said we were drunk even though 1. We hadn't even had 2 regular sized glasses of wine total and 2. Isn't that why you hire a driver?? So you don't drink and drive? He put his finger in my mom's face so close it was basically touching her nose. When my brother tried to calmly speak to him, the driver dramatically told him to back up because he was "dangerous" and started filming. The video he took will clearly show that no one was threatening him. The other people at the winery came up to us after and could not believe how he acted and that he just left us in the middle of no where. He also called the cops on us and then drove away laughing. What if one of us had a medical condition and needed to get home to take medicine? We had to call all of our friends to see if one of our friends could pick us up since there were no ubers / Lyfts. DO NOT EVER USE THIS COMPANY!!

reviews.author: Kaet S.
reviews.description: Absolutely disappointed in this company. The driver was dismissive of us from the start, we needed help setting up the Bluetooth speakers but he was clearly trying to rush us from the moment we got in the bus. At what was supposed to be the halfway point of our trip, the driver came into the winery and told the owner we were 'running late' and they needed to rush us out. This company had over booked themselves and instead of calmly talking to us to resolve the situation, they decided that abandoning a group of people - an hour and a half away from our destination - was the best course of action. The driver had also called the police after escalating the situation himself which was both unprofessional and a waste of the officers time. To add insult to injury, the driver was laughing while he drove away without us. We were lucky enough to have friends drive out and get us, but it was a terrible end to what was supposed to a fun experience. I would not recommend this company if you expect transport to be completed both to and from your destination.

reviews.author: Deanna J.
reviews.description: I was very pleased with the service.  They were prompt and confirmed pick up details along with ice needs a couple of times before service in case any changes were needed.

reviews.author: Pegah E.
reviews.description: Drivers are always courteous and on time, the cars are gorgeous and well maintained. Our driver was mike ; he had great defensive driving skills and quick reactions when needed. My friends and I would definitely choose this Express limo company again, for business or recreation. Thank you mike.

reviews.author: Britt W.
reviews.description: We've used Vine Vault's white glove delivery service for years on shipments large and small with zero issues. First class operation. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Lacey W.
reviews.description: Very pleasant addition to the downtown scene!  This is a perfect place to house an expanding personal collection of wine.  First and foremost a wine storage facility grown into a tasting lounge and concierge service.  Vine Vault staffs a fantastic sommelier, Nicole, who is hands on with personal service and planned events.  Even more interesting is that it happens to be located in the old vault of the Bank of America building.  Inside the facility is the actual bank vault and the exterior vault door is a key piece of the decor as you enter from the garage.  Think of a cigar lounge atmosphere (sans smoke) for wine drinkers....leather club chairs, cozy atmosphere, glassware and some snacking options.  Perfect spot to participate in one of their wine dinners, host a client social hour or simply enjoy a nice bottle before dinner downtown.

reviews.author: John G.
reviews.description: Under no circumstance should you trust this company with anything more than a $20 bottle of wine.  One of my wineries in Napa shipped a case of very expensive Cabs to me via Vine Vault.  It was shipped from Napa on 11/5/18 and received by Vine Vault in Austin on 11/6/18.  Vine Vault then proceeded to sit on the wine until I went searching for it. It was finally shipped to me via FedEx on 12/4/18, almost ONE MONTH later!  NO RESPONSE from company or managing partner, one Elton Potts. I have no guarantee that the wine was properly stored, as temperatures in Austin in November were frequently in the mid to upper 70's and into the 80's on a couple of days.  I intend to return the wine to the winery and will STRONGLY suggest that they cease using this poorly run company.

reviews.author: Doug K.
reviews.description: Great job on pickup, timelines and attitudes of all concerned. Convenience was important and they are.

reviews.author: Denise K.
reviews.description: My sister and I took the Texas Hill Country and LBJ Ranch tour from Austin.  It was a fabulous day!  Our tour guide, Ray, went above and beyond to make sure we had the best experience possible.  We stopped at both the birthplace and childhood homes of LBJ before visiting the Ranch, where we toured the home he and Lady Bird resided, we then spent a couple hours in the quaint German town of Fredericksburg where we enjoyed lunch and a little shopping.  Then a quick stop at Luckenbach Texas, where they were having a food truck festival and live music.  We were impressed with this tour and encourage others to give it a try.  Thank you again Ray for making it a great day!

reviews.author: Dave M.
reviews.description: Spectacular venue.   It's absolutely stunning.  People are great.  Not much else to say.  It's great.

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: Beer was fantastic, but highly recommend not ordering from the food truck.  $10 pretzel was cold and hard, sausage was ok but we'll be eating before visiting the brewery next time.  Brewery has great propery and enjoyed the shuffle board.  **update - left bells springs and went to Nomadic Brewing in Austin, highly recommend that the food truck at bells spring offering cold hard pretzels for $10 to chat with the pretzel making pretzelista at Nomadic...jalapeño cheddar pretzel was amazing...hot, soft and paired with delicious side of grainy mustard for half the price of bells springs horrible pretzel offering

reviews.author: Yvonne A.
reviews.description: Located in a beautiful area. The space is large and both with winery and beer sections are decorated nicely. Games to play both inside and out. Oh, and their IPA was pretty good too!

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: Wow! That is all I have to say. The wine tasting was great, service is outstanding and seating very comfortable. Overall, the environment is very welcoming.  The food truck run by Chef Massaro is a must. My husband and I ordered buffalo chicken, Korean bbq chicken, Cilantro dumplings and waffle fries. The food was beyond what I expected from a lunch truck, it is delicious! My husband and I will definitely be going back to order from Chef Massaro and if you go on Bell Springs Winery website, you will find the food menu and send a text with your order to Chef Massaro ahead  of time.

reviews.author: Jon G.
reviews.description: Great spot great beer.   Great people.  The variety of beer is astonishing for a new place very light and refreshing.  Truly love the cobe

reviews.author: Lukas S.
reviews.description: We spent a weekend at Lucky Arrow for a friend's wedding. It was such a great experience!  Space: There was so much space that we never felt like we were on top of each other. Everything was kept neat and clean, too.   Staff: The staff were all so friendly and accommodating with requests for more fire wood and such.  Amenities/Rooms: SUCH nice bedding with ample room in the courtyard cabins. Loved having the hot tubs too!

reviews.author: Alida R.
reviews.description: I had a lovely few nights stay at Lucky Arrow. We traveled with friends - 3 other couples and their kids - and stayed in a cluster of four cabins. It was the perfect pandemic vacation: we were able to socialize with our friends and still have our own spaces, without being indoors together. I don't think I'd have enjoyed it as much with strangers staying in the cabin cluster with me, especially since each pair of cabins shares a hot tub (which was delightful to relax in!) and all four cabins share a fire pit.  The rooms were clean and modern looking, the beds comfortable, and the air conditioning great. They have basic toiletries and good towels. There's very weak and unreliable wifi at the cabins; I recommend you come here to disconnect. I had good cell phone service with Verizon. The cabins have mini fridges but no kitchens; if you want to cook, you'll have to grill outside. Bring your own charcoal and lighter fluid!  For shared amenities, there's a lovely outdoor pool, and a big space with a large fire pit, grills, and picnic area with tables and swings (and some covered seating if you need shade). The pool has a 1-foot area with lounge seats, and lots of nice floats. We visited during the week, and it wasn't very busy; our group spent a lot of time at the pool and were often there by ourselves. There's a small walking trail, too.  It is quite pricey; I don't normally spend this much on a hotel. I'm not sure if I'd stay again if I weren't going on a group trip (with pandemic friendly housing.) If you're going with a group, call and see if they'll give you group pricing.  Warning for those who are planning to spend most of their time in Dripping Springs drinking: if you visit on a Monday - Tuesday, as I did, most of the wineries and breweries (including Bell Springs, which is attached to the resort) are closed.

reviews.author: Brittney H.
reviews.description: Wow, what a great stay! The yurt that I stayed in was spacious and spotless, the bath house was always clean, and the entire place is well maintained. The staff is amazing; welcoming and very tentative when needed. If you're looking for a peaceful getaway outside the Austin area, this is the spot and worth the price!

reviews.author: Erika F.
reviews.description: Great retreat close to Austin. Connected to a peaceful winery and minutes away from distilleries. Great staff and beautiful cabins.

reviews.author: Felix G.
reviews.description: Exceeded expectations. I love being outdoors, my wife loves luxury hotels. We stayed in one of the cabins and we both got what we wanted. The grounds are really nice and accommodating to friendly conversation with other guests. The cabins are modern and feel like an upscale hotel room. I appreciated the contactless check in and check out process. We look forward to returning.

reviews.author: Gina L.
reviews.description: Phenomenal! Stayed overnight. Happen to book thru Hotels.com. No issues at all. We stayed in courtyard cabin. My two children my husband and I had a great time hiking, relaxing, hot tub,fire pit and more. Already wondering when I can get more time to go again.

reviews.author: Adam D.
reviews.description: Very little privacy and poor management. Had a grounds keeper hop, that's right hop, on to our patio while my wife and I were changing. Wife was and is still pretty traumatized.  Took us forever to find management to let them know we are out and they told us they would pay for our room at the holiday inn. They did not.  Recommendation to LAR:  If you are going to run a wedding at your retreat, maybe consider additional help managing the facility. Only having 1 worker who is trying to run a wedding at your grounds isn't going to cut it.  * to managements response:  You want me to call you again? I'm sorry, but your response to my review makes it sound like this is the first you have heard about this incident. Is this correct? If so, this is disappointing because that tells me you have not taken steps forward to improve.

reviews.author: Liz K.
reviews.description: Came here for a mid-week staycation. We had the place almost all to ourselves since it was mid-week in September. The weather was amazing! We rented one of the breezeway cabins with views+hot tub+fire pit. There was firewood at the cabin when we checked in. We had a fire and hung out in the hot tub to look at the night sky both nights. It was so quiet and relaxing, exactly what we were looking for. The breezeway cabins are beautiful and fun! The pillows, sheets, and bedding were comfy. The breezeway two-seater swing was cute to sit in while sipping coffee. It would be nice if the room with the couch and wet bar also had soap and a couple dish towels by the sink.

reviews.author: Trey E.
reviews.description: Lovely glamping space close to the Hill Country and within an hour of Austin, but ludicrous pricing policies will prevent a repeat visit. This spartan campsite with tiny houses and yurts (with a bathroom space shared with pool guests) offers a close to the city getaway with minimal amenities. But with a per pet fee of $150 PER ANIMAL plus a nightly fee, they don't seem to understand how out of touch they are with pricing policies of similar establishments. With two dogs under 20lbs, you're looking at $350 just in pet fees prior to any rental rates for just two nights, and therefore Lucky Arrow won't be getting any repeat visits from us.

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I just stayed for an incredible weekend at Lucky Arrow.  Not only was the resort gorgeous, it was super clean and the staff was incredibly friendly.  This was the perfect place to unwind and still feel safe during all this Covid madness.  The check in process was all online, so we didn't have to worry about social distancing.    The rooms were so adorable and you could tell they really put time into every single detail to make sure you have an amazing experience.  We were able to sit around the fire pit, have smores and enjoy the quiet starry night with no city noise or much light pollution.    The location was beyond perfect.  It's just far enough away from town that you feel like you are truly on vacation, but there was still an HEB and tons of food options within a few minutes drive.  The gated access to the winery next door was a wonderful perk.  Highly highly recommend staying here!

reviews.author: Kate A.
reviews.description: There are few things more excellent than Texas Spring, and we were delighted to spend a weekend of the best time of year out in the hill country at Lucky Arrow during their opening weekend.  There is a central event space and bar / pool area at the top of the hill with yurts as well as more conventional accommodation tucked into the trees below. We stayed in a 'courtyard cabin' one of four arranged around a fire pit with a hot tub. Which was bright and airy with the squishiest mattress, soft sheets and plenty of space to set up our travel crib for our three month old son (they also have them there if you're coming from further afield and need to borrow one)  We spent the weekend listening to live music and sipping cocktails by the pool, wandering the shady trails, admiring the view and toasting s'mores on the fire pit.   Close enough to Dripping Springs if you want supper /HEB - but far enough out that the stars are super bright and the night is gloriously quiet. They're well-behaved dog friendly, so we'll be back with our (only moderately well behaved) hound. And for a yurt, I only peeked my head inside one but I'm desperate to stay in one soon!

reviews.author: Brittany W.
reviews.description: I will definitely be back here! My group of 6 reserved 3 porch houses and they were lovely! On the inside, they are totally modern and beautiful. There are no TVs which is perfect for a weekend getaway from the world.   The check in and out process is nice, you're provided with a code to a lockbox so there is no need to wait for someone!   There is a communal area with darts, Jenga, connect four, and more by the pool and firepit area. The staff left out snacks, drinks and smore's fixings for us!   This is a peaceful place that I can't wait to return to!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: Had a great time staying in lucky arrow! We stayed in Yurt 3, which was great. Only complaints were that there was no map provided, nor customer service available, so we had to drive around and try to find outlet yurt at 10pm. Which was fine - we found it fairly quickly. Other complaint is that it looks like the person cleaning might of got distracted and left the room, without putting the ac back together or bringing her cleaning towel. Also not a huge issue. Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: April C.
reviews.description: My husband and I chose Lucky Arrow for our anniversary getaway and it exceeded our expectations. The yurt was perfection and beautifully decorated. Even the shared bath house was nice! The complimentary beer and wine tasting was great and the crepe food truck on site was an added bonus. We'll definitely be back!

reviews.author: Yerlan S.
reviews.description: Great location, great infrastructure, everything is new and well maintained. A lot of activities to do within an hour range. Hot tubs, hot pool, hot showers. Great breakfast variety w wine n beer tastings. Amazing staff.  Will come again, great place for a grate value.   P.S. A/C in yurts was nice, Operational Manager George is a great dude.

reviews.author: Marisa V.
reviews.description: I have finally fulfilled my lifelong dream of glamping in a yurt!    This place was such a cool experience. I had everything I could ever want. A pool, beer garden, campfires conversations with s'mores, and even a complimentary wine tasting at the Bell Springs Winery located right next door.   As for the staff, a big thanks to Mike, Michelle and Zach! They were all amazingly friendly, kind, funny, and helpful. Your hospitality was greatly appreciated.   This place is perfect for events or a staycation. Either way, I recommend visiting!

reviews.author: Allie W.
reviews.description: Beware of the cancellation policy.  Extremely deceiving.  The first sentence on the website says they have a 10 day cancellation policy but you actually can't get a refund at all.

reviews.author: Liz W.
reviews.description: What a fun place to stay!  We stayed in a yurt and it was such a fun experience. The pool was fantastic and the bathrooms were clean. Everyone was so nice that we saw. The yurt was a great experience.

reviews.author: Andrea L.
reviews.description: For my birthday we stayed in one of the yurts. Super cute and trendy however our sheets had like possible blood stains in them? It was odd and a bit gross. Maybe rust? It turned into a guessing game. Also the communal bathrooms are quite a hike from where we were. Almost had an accident just trying to get to them. Wish they had a couple bathroom options. They had a complimentary beer and wine tasting in the beer garden, however the bar tender or person pouring our drinks wasn't wearing a mask. I didn't feel comfortable sticking around.

reviews.author: Lori S.
reviews.description: Wow!  We are finished up a 3 day work retreat here at Lucky Arrow and, I cannot say enough good things about our stay here and I am super sad to leave.  We were able to have our team join us here (from Austin) to prepare for fall + 2020 goals.  It was the perfect mixture of pleasure and work-- we were close to wonderful Dripping Springs restaurants, wineries and distilleries.  We stayed at the Ranch House were we could spread out and work on our planning during the day and hit up the pool for a quick break. And,  you will definitely want to hit up the s'mores/fire pits because-- yum!  In the morning, we had wonderful walks on the property and even did a mediation session out on the outlook during sunrise.  Incredible.  It would be the perfect place for a wedding ceremony!  I highly recommend a trip out here- I definitely want to come back for a weekend getaway in the yurts or cabins... they are so cute!  Oh and take a dip in the hot tubs!  All in all a definite 5 out of 5-- we will definitely be back!  A huge thank you to Michele, Eva and team for their wonderful service!

reviews.author: Hannah F.
reviews.description: Wow! From the outside, Hyde Park Market, or the "flag store" as some locals call it, looks like an unassuming convenience store, but inside they have a huge selection. They carry almost anything you could imagine including a HUGE selection of beer - 6 packs, singles, large stout bottles, local brews, imports, domestics, you name it. While the food selection is not huge, mainly chips, snacks, candies, and ice creams, they do offer a surprisingly large selection of vegan options - Daiya frozen pizzas and desserts, Nadamoo ice creams, almond milks, non-diary creamers, Amy's frozen meals, oat milk canned coffees and more. While the interior set up is definitely a no thrills kind of place, it's a fun spot to wander around and find some interesting drinks and eats. Hidden gem for sure. Definitely would return!

reviews.author: Jeff S.
reviews.description: I love this place. Very friendly staff. Huge beer selection. I also like the Jeni's ice cream they sell there. Pricey but delicious.

reviews.author: Jeremy S.
reviews.description: So, if you've been paying attention and have read previous reviews, you know this much: the Flag Store (no one local ever calls it by its long and generally misleading name, "Hyde Park Market, Deli, and Organic Grocery") sells about 1,000 different beers (although it does not, as they sometimes claim, carry every available beer in Austin); it also sells flags, local soap, craft soda, and other weird and sometimes necessary oddities, and does so in a labyrinthine space that defies the laws of physics based on the view from outside.  All of this is true, of course, and weird, and wonderful. How many stores can you go to for a Jester King Farmhouse Ale and a plumbing snake with a grabber at the end to unplug your apartment's AC condensation drain? Probably not that many, if we're honest.  It is also true that you get to listen to Chopin while you shop, and that the owner dude speaks like seven languages and is really cool.  It is, unfortunately, additionally true that every bomber, six-pack, and twelve-pack of beer; every esoteric hardware item; everything that makes the place seem as much a museum/cabinet of curiosities as a store, is priced 25% more than other local places where you can get the same stuff. Unless I'm in the mood for some recondite brew that I can't find anywhere else, I'm just not going to pay $17.99 for a $13.99 box of beer. Their prices are $2-$4 over minimum retail on each and every beer they sell.  So go to the Flag Store, admire its pandimensional awesomeness, buy a beer that you've never heard of in all of your life. But realize that you're there for a show as much as a store, and that they know it and charge admission.

reviews.author: Alexis R.
reviews.description: Young Indian cashier would not refund or let us exchange a defected can with a receipt, within 1 minute. He said it was leaking, well yes this, is why we walked right back in to return it. Totally rude service.

reviews.author: Joseph M.
reviews.description: The best beer selection in the area, friendly staff, and just a cool landmark for the neighborhood.  The younger guys that run the place now have really cleaned it up and made it look nice in there.  Also, right now there's a new vegetarian food truck parked outside, I hope it stays!

reviews.author: Aly A.
reviews.description: Hyde Park Market (Flag Store) is a great place to stop for gasoline. They also have an amazing selection of drinks, snacks, sandwiches, and other items. You will be surprised how they are able to stock so many different goods in a relatively small space. If you are looking for something unusual (birch beer; soda flavored like lemon meringue pie or bacon with syrup; etc), there is an excellent chance that you will find it here. I would give five stars for the gasoline part of the business and for the huge selection, but will take off a star for the often high prices on the food and beverage items.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: Cooler after cooler after cooler of great beer - stuff I've never even heard of, much less have seen elsewhere (and that never happens to me - not to totally toot my own horn, but I kinda know a thing or two about zee cervezas :)  ) Don't forget to look UP - there are even more great beers lining the top of the chill cases. It's a maze with beer around every corner. At the end of that hops and grain funhouse...ice cream! Nirvana.  Apparently the only beer they *don't* stock is exactly the one we were looking for - Austin Beerworks Heavy Machinery Wet Hop - so that was kind of a bummer. And the prices are way high - nearly double - on things that ARE sold elsewhere. (A random dude later in the day was giving us a local perspective on the bottle shop lay of the land, warned me away from "The Flag Shop" and its exorbitantly high prices - I didn't snap til just now that I had already been there and come to that same conclusion on my own. .. duh! I *had* been admiring the flag-lined entrance. Lol, thanks fur putting my mind right, Yelp!)  Definitely worth a visit for uniqueness and oddball beers, if you're not opposed to shelling out a little extra dough for them. And ice cream. .. GO for the ice cream.

reviews.author: Kristen R.
reviews.description: The Good:  Cheap Gas. Nice people. Amazing Beer Selection. Chocolate for days. Cool Card Selection.  The Not so Good:  Pretty much everything  comes with a steep mark up.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: DONT COME HERE. So I was always curious about this place, and I ended up buying those cute flags you can put on your mirror in the car.  The suction cup didn't work, and almost literally 30 seconds after I left, I came back and asked if I could switch. The man goes "I wish you didn't open it" as if it were my fault, and refused to switch it out. Or even give me a new suction cup.   How on earth does anyone not open a product to test it????? The woman who helped me watched as this happened, and didn't help. I bought 3 flags, each over 5 dollars.   This business has no integrity. If they aren't willing to put up with the expected cost of defective products, then get out of business.   Don't come here. Everything is unique, but if you don't like it -- don't expect a refund, much less an exchange. They don't give receipts either, so good luck buy all their expired food.   Cheapskates.

reviews.author: Stef S.
reviews.description: Is it weird that I kind of like going to the gas station here? Okay, so I don't like how often I need to go to the gas station. I'd gladly hang a jolly roger or six from my car's antenna if they'd sponsor my adventures in amateur hooning.   Honestly, though, this is a lovely store full of wonderful things.   This place has a little bit of everything. Food, drinks, hardware, office supplies, candy, etc., etc., etc. I found varieties of Amy's soups that I didn't even know existed. They have local munchies from places like Tom's and the Green Cart. The beer selection is beyond extensive, and that they have build-your-own six packs if you'd like a variety pack. There's a great deal of cokes, teas, kombucha, wine, and other potable potables as well. There are cane sugar cokes I've never even heard of at this place. And the candy? They've got everything from the usual standbys to gourmet chocolate to sweets you thought were only available overseas.   It's a bit jumbled up inside, but it's well worth the time to wander through every nook and cranny and marvel at the variety of stuff that you didn't know you needed in this little building.   There's a 10-cent/gallon discount if you buy a certain amount of stuff inside--excluding alcohol, cigarettes and lottery tickets. The prices for gas are usually pretty reasonable, especially considering that it's a Shell in the middle of Hyde Park. They take all the usual credit cards--at the pump, too!   Then again, I find myself walking inside for some tea anyway because it's a fabulous store and the staff couldn't be friendlier. I feel like the guys behind the counter get to know their regulars here.   The pumps can get a bit busy (and mind the drop-off at the edge of the concrete!), so if you're going inside and it's packed, it's always a good idea to move your car and park in front or to the side so other folks can have a space to get gas.
