reviews.author: Andrew S.
reviews.description: I don't get why people still rave about this place.  I will look at it from a beer buyers perspective.  Yes, they have a large singles wall.  Yes, they have a large selection of beer.  Yes, they have been around for a long time.  With that said, I think the high ratings come from not knowing better and people who have always shopped there in the past.  They gouge on prices all the time.  They do not know their beer and how long beer should be good for.  You can find way out-of-date IPAs there all the time.  You will be overcharged from similar stores (think other gas station/specialty stores that are NOT Central Market or Specs).  When they try charging almost double for Prairie limited releases due to them being "rare" compared to other stores, you know the type of place you are dealing with.  They will gouge customers because a beer is "rare"....they do not care about who they annoy.  They survive based on people not knowing better.  Every 6 pack in there is $2-3 more bucks than anywhere else in town.  And people still will walk in and say how great it is.  There are much better places.  Please spend your money at a place that is not trying to screw their customers.

reviews.author: Diane T.
reviews.description: Could there be a better gas station stop? This place  has so many single beer cans and packs as well. Great place if you just wanna grab a variety. They've also got other good snacks and food. I always come here for gas and beer. The aisle is just entertaining to explore through.

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: What a neat place. First off, their gas is always pretty cheap. (I kid you not, this past week their gas was $0.10 cheaper per gallon than the station on 45th and Burnet that is less than a mile away). Next, the market itself, is just an adventure. They have shelves on shelves on shelves of food, wine, beer, chocolate, nick-knacks, and, oh yeah, the flag of every nation, state, military, and who knows what else. I really could walk around here for an entire hour and not see everything they have to offer. Though, if you are claustrophobic, the walkways are a bit cramped in order to fit all of these eclectic items into such a small space. The staff is incredibly friendly and make the whole experience even better!

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: Good for chocolate-lovers, coconut-ice-cream eaters, and beer connoisseurs.   My husband's been coming here for ages to pick up good beer, and I was okay with it because he would buy me a little conciliatory gift of specialty chocolate when he'd guiltily spend over $20 on beer. They sell so many awesome, delicious chocolate brands here -- Vosges, Love, Toblerone, Justin's, etc. But what makes this place the best is that they sell coconut-milk ice cream in pints. The same brands you can find at Whole Foods or Central Market, but MORE FLAVORS. I'd go into WF and be disappointed that the only Purely Decadent brand coconut-milk ice cream flavors they'd have for sale were Amaretto and plain. BOO! GROSS! There are dozens of flavors here, the hard-to-find ones... cookies n cream, chocolate-chip cookie dough, mint chocolate-chip, chocolate peanut butter, and on and on. Cases of lactose-free ice creams, and not just Purely Decadent, but Nada Moo and So Delicious too.   If you are lactose-intolerant and need ice cream periodically, this is the place to go to, hands-down! Also, they're open super late, so if you miss getting a shake or your vegan ice cream from Sweet Ritual (catty-corner from the Flag store, across the street inside Daily Juice) you can just come in here and take a pint home.

reviews.author: Clay T.
reviews.description: More of a 9/10 stars review, but I rounded down. This place has an amazing selection of alcohols, foods, and miscellaneous things, many you can't seem to find at a typical store. They have amazing gas prices outside... found it to be around 50 cents per gallon cheaper than another location found off of Oltorf... that's a lot of money saved for someone who works on the roads such as myself. They do, unfortunately, have steep prices on everything else inside. I remmeber once buying a small container of ice cream for 7 dollars in here.That's my only complaint, this place is really amazing overall. Nice staff too, seems to care about making sure you find everything okay.

reviews.author: Al M.
reviews.description: I have not fully explored the selection of beer and other interesting stuff at this place, as I was in a hurry, but I went there because I have been looking for a place in Austin that has a selection of GOOD wine, as opposed to overpriced "fine wine" or a selection of whatever their distributor is pushing or what is trendy.    This store is that place.  I'm not sure who buys their wine, but whoever you are, you know your s**t.  This place has a small selection, but pretty much everything in stock is not only good, but a good value.  It is basically what I would buy in California by the case, and bring back to Austin on a road trip.  But without the road trip.  If you want to try some good wine that is different from the stuff the few big distributors are putting in all of the stores here, go to The Flag Store and take a chance.  You are likely to be rewarded.

reviews.author: Lisa K.
reviews.description: The Flag Mart! I love this place. It's one of the more unique spots in Austin.  They have EVERYTHING you could ever want: beer (huge selection), ice cream, incense, duct tape, bolt cutters, candy, candles, combination locks and pretty much anything else you try to find.  I was sad to see the flags on the front the of the store come down due to a complaint from a person with a clearly unhappy, small existence. The flags were awesome and gave the place a lot of character. I hope the flags return soon.  Overall, Hyde Park Market is the best. Go there.  EDIT: The flags are back! Yay!

reviews.author: Andrea B.
reviews.description: I love shopping here! The guys are super nice and I see them a lot and they're always friendly. Also this place has a lot of variety with pretty much everything. Seriously, my favorite gas station. Feels more like a market inside, I guess hence the name.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: This place is AWESOME!!! They literally have every kind of Beer I can think of and More!! The prices are perhaps are $1.00 more expensive than other bigger stores like Spec's but, it's a Convenience Store. So there you have it, everyone Knows convenience store costs a little more because simply, they're Convenient and costs a little more to be.  It is a little crammed inside though...so if you and your buddies weight 300 lbs each; don't expect too much wiggle room!!!

reviews.author: Mary P.
reviews.description: How fun is a place gonna be when on the outside a bunch of flags beckon you to go in? The entrance is a typical gas station door which is confusing after those flags wave at you in the wind. And then all of the sudden you're in a mecca of food, wine, beer, alcohol, gourmet, Austin brands, etc. You can find something that is not that cheap here to consume and say oh yea I bought it at the gas station yo!  The make your own six pack of beer concept is a pretty good idea for the solo beer aficionado. You can try 6 beers without wasting some! But this ish ain't cheap yo. If you haven't seen it somewhere else or you're in a hurry, OR you want to try 6 different beers before purchasing a whole case, pass the flags and come inside.

reviews.author: Danielle Z.
reviews.description: My friends and I went on a wine tour for our friend's birthday party the first weekend in August and it was great!   From the beginning stages of planning, Francesca, (the owner, planner, driver, etc.) worked her hardest to make sure the event was personalized for our group. Fran was also very quick with correspondence and letting me know important information and what she needed from me.   We decided that the Wimberly/Dripping Springs tour was the best route for us since a lot of people had already been to Fredericksburg wineries. Fran picked us up at 9am in Round Rock (she'll work with you on your pick up/drop off site) and she drove us around in an air conditioned mini tour bus! Did I mention that the bus is BYOB?! We brought on our own ice chests and bags for snacks which was great for the 45 minute trip we had! Fran also has a DVD/CD player on the bus but we brought our own speakers for our iPod. She also had tips on wine tasting and a map of the wine country for us to take a look at on the road.   We went to three wineries and an olive oil orchard. It was so hot outside for the olive oil orchard that our group decided to leave early but the rest of the wineries were all inside and all of the staff at the wineries were so nice and informative. One of our friends even bought a case of wine from one of them! Remember to bring money with you in case you fall in love with one or more of the delicious Texas wines that you have to buy a bottle or two!   Fran also arranged for our group to have Saltlick bbq plates for us at one of the wineries! Our group pre-ordered either turkey, chopped beef, sliced beef, etc. We had our sandwich with potato salad, coleslaw, beans (the best beans I've had in awhile), extra delicious seasame seed bread, extra bbq sauce, Tiff's Treats cookies, Sweet Leaf Tea, water, etc. etc.! It was a lovely lunch outside at the winery. We were all so full! But all of that came in the price of the tour! Fran even got us a deal with a cake-maker and we had a birthday cake waiting for our friend along with candles to surprise her!  Fran and her business associate, Melinda, were with us during every tour and let us know when we needed to move on to the next winery. They really made sure we that were ok and having a great time. They even had patience to take pictures of us with our multiple cameras.   We all headed back around 4pm and returned safe and sound (and still pumped up from the awesome day) around 5pm. All in all, it was a great day! Fran really has a great business and will personalize tours for all types of groups. She's very professional and you can tell she takes pride in what she does and will go the extra mile to make you feel your group is top priority! We'll definitely be going back to try more tours with L'Avventura Dolce, especially when the weather cools down! Great job!

reviews.author: Chantelle W.
reviews.description: L'Avventura Dolce hosted 16 Love-A-Bull members as we toured two Hill Country vineyards and an olive orchard. The experience was everything I would want in a day trip - fun, relaxing and informative. Francesca is the outfit's owner, and is also the engaging tour guide. Her commitment to customer service is stellar. She also donated a portion of the day's proceeds to Love-A-Bull, which made the trip extra special. The experience was so positive, I wrote a review about it here: https://chantellewallace.com/2014/02/12/hill-country-wine-tours-with-lavventura-dolce

reviews.author: Keri R.
reviews.description: Such a fun day! We wine toured for a friend's birthday party to 3 different wineries. The owner was friendly and fun and was great to provide lunch for us at our first stop. I would definitely recommend L'Avventura to other groups wanting to check out wineries of the Hill Country.

reviews.author: Kate K.
reviews.description: I'm torn writing this review.  We booked their bus for a winery tour for my bachelorette party, and they unfortunately ruined it (really by no fault of theirs...but still).  We were scheduled for pick up at 1.  At 12:30, they called to say that their bus broke down and that they would be an hour and a half late.  At 2:30, they finally showed up in an old, dirty van.  My group and I were squished together with all our things, and what's worse is that we couldn't really see or talk to one another.  The speaker system rattled and was distracting.  Also, since the wineries close at 6, our tour was cut drastically short, and we had to rush.  We also had someone who had to leave early, so in turn, had to miss the entire tour.    The only redeeming quality was the excellent customer service of the company.  Both the driver and the owner were truly wonderful and apologetic.  I know that these things happen, but I do think that having an acceptable backup vehicle is important.

reviews.author: Love P.
reviews.description: Just went on the Magic of Christmas Lights tour this weekend with a few of my friends.  Our host guided us on a tour of the Christmas lights in Wimberley, TX (at the EmilyAnn Theatre which was 9 acres of amazing holidays lights - one of the best light displays I've ever seen in my life) and in Johnson City, TX.  My friends and I had an amazing time, as did the rest of the bus based on the jovial environment (laughter, singer, and a showing of "The Christmas Story") created by our host and bus driver.  L'Avventura Dolce's Christmas Light tour will definitely be one of my new Christmas traditions.  Hopefully, other special events are in store for the future.   Cheers!

reviews.author: Keri B.
reviews.description: Two years in a row now, me and my peeps have used this company to chauffeur us around the hill country wineries.  Beautiful idea, that.  Depending on how many people you have and what kinda of car you want, they will tote you around in a shuttle bus, a limo, or even a stretch hummer.    What is sooo cool about this company, is that they are so laid back about every event you schedule with them.  They will let you bring ungodly amounts of food and booze on the bus or limo and you can get as loud and unruly as you want, as long as you don't puke in the vehicle.  Last year  got a little rowdy and alll the girls ended up pole dancing in the shuttle bus!    We always bring party trays of sammiches, cheese n crackers, and lots of easy to drink beverages, like box wine or premade mixed drinks. We have them pick us up at my house at 10 am and they bring us back at 6.  And in that time we are usually able to visit 5 wineries.  When you call to set this up, talk to Bob.  He will visit with you on the phone for a long time, finding out where you want to go and making recommendations on new places.  He is a real sweetheart.  The drivers have always been very helpful also in recommending places and in general by putting up with our drunken behavior i.e. pulling the limo into a convenience store to pee several times in route......  One more kindness they extended to me this year.  We had reserved the airport shuttle style bus again as we had 10 people on our tour and low and behold pulling up in front of my house was the stretch hummer.  I was a little nervous about a mixup but they said not to worry, the bus had a flat that morning so we just got upgraded....now that thing was pimped out!  Blue running lights inside, nice stereo system (I bring my own cd's), and glasses and cups lining the backs of the seats.  Only problem with the hummer is it is kinda difficult to get in and out of for older people or anyone with a gimpy leg.  Only 2 back doors and a steep step down.  Gotta crab walk if you are sitting near the front.  Small regrets compared to a great day of hangin with my peeps, sampling wine and enjoying our hill country.

reviews.author: Justin N.
reviews.description: Driver tried to scam us for an extra hour.  My girlfriend and I went on a Monday and got Will as a driver of a sedan.  Everything went pretty well for the trip.  Will was polite and professional and helped us pick out wineries to go to.  We went to five wineries and my girlfriend and I were a little drunk by the end.  We had booked five hours (12pm-5pm) but knew we had gone over that by 30 minutes and were fine with that.  When the driver wanted us to pay for the extra time he said "Well, you went an hour and half over but I'll put it down as an hour and fifteen".  I called him on it and said it was only thirty minutes.  He showed me his watch and for some unknown reason his watch showed 6:30pm.  My girlfriend and I both got out our cell phones and showed him that it was in fact 5:30pm.  He then backed down and charged us for thirty minutes.  At the time, I let it pass and even tipped him quite well cause his service had been good.  Later, when I was more sober, I realized that it was extremely peculiar for his watch to be an hour *ahead*.  I am pretty certain he was actively trying to scam us for an extra hour and don't appreciate someone trying to take advantage of me when I've had some to drink.

reviews.author: Kara E.
reviews.description: Booked a hummer limo for my best friend's bachelorette party--it was fantastic!   We had a white hummer limo pick us up from the home we rented in Austin to take us to four wineries. The driver was super friendly, and even gave us more time at the end of our trip to fit in one more winery.   10 of us fit comfortably in the limo. It was a great experience, I highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: A G.
reviews.description: I wanted to do a wine tour for my birthday and after reading all of these awesome reviews for Bluebonnet, I decided to give Bob a call.   He recommended the 9 passenger limo and 4 of the favorite wineries- Becker, Massina Hof, 4 points and Mendelbaum   Becker was our favorite! The guys working were so fun and the place had delicious nuts, chocolate and live music. The wine was good, too ;)  Our driver, Eric, was awesome and we got upgraded to a hummer limo for free!  Don't forget to bring lots of snacks!

reviews.author: dana p.
reviews.description: Found this company on Yelp. Last Sunday, I booked their party shuttle to take 9 women on wine tours for my sister's birthday. Their pricing is dramatically better than all the other companies I researched.  When they showed up, they arrived with the stretch hummer limo - free upgrade due to an issue with the shuttle radio from the party the day before.  Drive showed up almost right on time. Our driver was nice, knowledgeable and all the part-goers were very pleased.    I highly recommend you visit the wineries n a Sunday instead of a Saturday. We visited 6 wineries and had the place to ourselves at most wineries. In contrast, when I've gone on a Saturday, the wineries were overwhelmed, which meant you received no personal service and had to wait in lines - and thus you visit less wineries. Sundays and Bluebonnet Wine Tours are the way to go.

reviews.author: Stacey K.
reviews.description: If you are looking to reserve transportation for a wine tour, look no further!!  I reserved a party bus for last Saturday to take some girlfriends on a wine tour to celebrate my 25th birthday.  Everything was fantastic from beginning to end!  They were at least a hundred dollars cheaper than any other place I called, and I feel like we could not have gotten better service.    When I made the reservation, I estimated that we would have around 15 girls and Bob reserved the 16 passenger bus for us.  However, a few days before the event I realized that we actually had 17 people.  I called Bob (slightly panicking that he wouldn't have a solution) and was pleasantly surprised that he offered to upgrade us to a larger bus for no additional charge!  Happy birthday to me!  Our driver (Justin or Jason... I think his name was Jason) arrived 15 minutes early and was extremely patient with us the entire time.  I mean, what other guy could put up with that many screaming, dancing, drunk 20-somethings on a long car ride??  Jason was very professional but also very personable.  He even suggested a winery (Woodrose) that was not on our original tour - and I'm so glad he did!  Woodrose was very low-key and had some great live music (it was perfect for our first stop).    We ended up only going to three wineries on our tour (we were slated to go to four) but that was completely our fault - we just spent wayyyy too much time at each stop.  All in all, this was the perfect way to celebrate my birthday!

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: I decided on Bluebonnet because of the price.  It was a mistake, the bus was late, it was dirty and I wish I would have spent the money on a better company.  Next time I will ask the venues for a recommendation.  If the venue has a problem with the transportation company it's a bad sign.

reviews.author: Laura O.
reviews.description: My friend is using Bluebonnet Limo's for her wedding next Sat. so we decided to check their availability for her bachelorette party.  They were available, super nice, and prompt.  We had a hummer limo pick us up Friday night, take us to dinner, and pick us up on West 6th at 1:30AM.  We were staying about 30 minutes away, so it was great to have a ride for all of us girls.  We decided on Sat. to call them again for another night on the town and they accomodated.   A driver picked us up in a party bus and again, the drivers were top notch.  Great price and exceptional service. I highly recommend this for all your transportation needs

reviews.author: Tara F.
reviews.description: the one star goes for the guy that helped me on the phone. he was excellent. however the driver was horrible and when i called to complain come to find out it was the owner. i dont care if you have 1-2 people or 20 in the back of your car. when you pay for something you should get respect. not being told to get out of a limo while your gathering your things. and this was after he started texting an hour before pickup time asking if we were ready. it was obvious he was not happy we paid for pick up and drop off. but bottom line is we paid. the owner of blue bonnet limo turned our new years into a nightmare. NEVER AGAIN. im now scheduling our next limo service by asking first if they are associated with blue bonnet. HORRIBLE SERVICE! small parties beware!

reviews.author: Jo S.
reviews.description: Ordered the 4 passenger hummer and a 15 passenger stretch hummer showed up!  What an awesome surprise!!  Keith was a great driver and knew exactly which Hill Country wineries to visit.  Even though we only scheduled a 1/2 day, we did not feel rushed at all.  Becker and Grape Creek were our favorites.  Can't wait to do go on our next wine tour!

reviews.author: Laurie H.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours made my booking reservation easy and I'm a difficult customer. They worked with me on the wineries and Distillery the group chose to ensure that the time worked within our tour, so everyone could enjoy the tasting and lunch without feeling rushed. Austin Wine Tours also provided us with a great driver. I have to say our driver Charlie was awesome, he called before arriving, he was prompt and ensured we had everything before leaving the pickup spot. Charlie made our tour very comfortable, the ride to and from the wineries and Distillery was amazing. Charlie ensured that we were taken care of.  We will definitely be booking another tour with you folks and requesting Charlie.   Thank you again,  Laurie

reviews.author: Carli A.
reviews.description: 10/10 would recommend Austin Wine Tours! First off, booking and choosing our agenda was super easy and they even let me adjust the headcount when that changed. On the day of, I got a heads-up call to confirm the time and pickup location. We had a larger, rowdy group of gals on a bachelorette trip and our driver Song took SUCH good care of us! She immediately asked us what music we wanted to crank and encouraged all the "wooing" from the back of the van. She also offered to take pictures of us, scouted out the best locations for group photos and even took TONS of candid pics of us while we enjoyed the winery and distillery we went to. She helped with all of the logistics of checking in at each stop and making sure we were taken care of. She also let us make a pee stop on the way home...and overall she was just SUPER nice and was basically hyping us up the entire day, making sure the bride felt special and making sure we all had fun. By the end of the day we all felt like she was part of the crew. Thank you again Song!!

reviews.author: Laura R.
reviews.description: I booked a wine tour for my sisters bachelorette and we had such a great time! The wineries were beautiful and we were able to schedule a stop at the salt lick for our private tour. Kyle was the best tour guide ever!! He was very personable, took numerous pictures for us at each winery and made sure we were having fun! I would def. recommend if you are looking at different companies to pick Austin Wine Tours (ZWay Tours) since I called 5 others and they were the most accommodating with what we wanted for a private tour and their price beat most of the other ones too!  Would def. book them again and request Kyle!

reviews.author: Rakeba S.
reviews.description: Omg! We loved our experience with Austin Wine Tours! Our tour guide Kyle was amazing and made sure we had a great time. Kyle was on time and made sure we arrived safely to both our locations. Overall our experience was amazing and we will definitely book again.

reviews.author: Christopher Jon M.
reviews.description: We had a great time this past weekend with Austin Wine Tours. I initially booked online and didn't know what venues to go to at first but they recommended the ones that we ended up going to even though it was completely up to us where we wanted to go which I liked. We decided after to tastings to go eat at Salt Lick BBQ and the food was amazing and hit the spot in between tastings. After that we went to our final tasting at Fall Creek which was right across the street and the service there was great. It made our bachelorette party very fun and we didn't have to worry about anything other than having a good time which I liked.

reviews.author: Devin H.
reviews.description: The review that I left in regards to the services booked through Austin Wine Tours was in no way false. I will stand firm by what was written.   I even received a call back in May while on a business trip from the shuttle service company asking if we would pay the overtime for Hugo because AWT had not paid them yet. We even tipped Hugo an additional amount for his extra time spent with us.   The response just posted (almost 4 months later) is also extremely unprofessional and misleading. We were promised a great time for a bachelorette party and were let down. Plain and simple. Those employed by AWT that we spoke with were rude as well. Secondly, I never said that AWT hosted prom events/transportation. I was told that the company that is usually utilized was completely full (by Brad) and that prom happened to be a priority and the school bus that was sent was all they could get us even though we were promised a party bus.   At the end of the day we were completely dissatisfied with the services offered by AWT. Calling a client a bridezilla (who in fact actually never spoke to any AWT employee), claiming your company has gotten PTSD from our group and falsely accusing our group to be racist by saying we told "blackie to leave" is unprofessional and disrespectful amongst other things said in response to our reviews. All of those involved would be happy to discuss this event again in a professional manner since you mentioned that we were offered a full refund when that in fact was not true. We were offered maybe $350 (I could be wrong on this amount since we haven't heard/spoken to anyone from AWT for several months) in return if we removed our reviews.  As a company you should take responsibility instead of blaming others for your mistakes that way you can fix the problem and do better for future patrons. Especially since there has been no money refunded at this point.

reviews.author: Julie B.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours is one of the best limo tours to see the wine country we have been on to date!  They were not only flexible with our dates and our last-minute reservation, they even upgraded our package with no additional charge!  We were celebrating four birthdays and  wanted a girls night out  where no one had to drive. The limo driver was prompt and worked with us and our pick up and drop off times.  When one of us left the charger in the limo he even offered to drop it off... We Are definitely looking forward to using them in the near future!

reviews.author: Courtney M.
reviews.description: Austin Wine Tours is amazing! I just had a bachelorette party for my sister this past weekend and it was so smooth! From Sara's communication to Lance's chauffeuring day of, the entire experience was great. I highly recommend utilizing them, you'll be glad you did!

reviews.author: Blythe H.
reviews.description: If I could give this company a negative star review, I would!!! Completely unprofessional and was hung up on!! They sent an incorrect party bus for a bachelorette party, contracted out at last minute to another company (who were amazing), sent us to Deep eddys where we were turned away!!! Brad would NOT let me speak and kept interrupting me. The professionalism of this company was simply awful. And they still have not refunded anything from this trip!!! Disgusted and I will never recommend this company to anyone. Spend the extra money and go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Tara B.
reviews.description: We had such a great experience with Austin Wine Tours. They had everything taken care of for us, and our driver Lance was awesome! We went to Fall Creek and Duchman, Fall Creek was my favorite!

reviews.author: Linda T.
reviews.description: Booking our wine excursion was stress free the moment Sara answered the phone! Sara was very informative and laid everything out, giving us a doable timeline for the afternoon we wanted. The itinerary we received gave us a good idea of how long to spend at each venue. There were only 4 people in our group, so we were able to do a very flexible hourly option, with appointments at the wineries.  Since we had less than 5 passengers, our tastings weren't included (informed that going in) however, that did not deter our experience... it was awesome! Buying a bottle of wine at each venue was very affordable when we split the cost among us.  George, our driver, was professional and friendly; and the limo experience was awesome! You might want to bring snacks just in case someone gets a bit tipsy, but most wineries offer food of some kind. Thanks Austin Wine Tours, for making me look like a champ with my high maintenance friends... I'll be back!

reviews.author: Karen O.
reviews.description: After leaving the previous review, the company finally contacted me and issued a full refund.

reviews.author: Sarita S.
reviews.description: This was a surprise bday gift and it didn't disappoint! Mike was awesome and friendly...took us to some really great spots and on gave us the grand tour through texas hill country! definitely the best way to go if you want to experience the best of the best! well done!!

reviews.author: Ana R.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend! From our initial inquiry to the tour itself they were so accommodating and flexible! I filled out an inquiry form and then was contacted right away. We booked a private tour for a couples trip. Alee was great in providing suggestions and making sure to fit what we wanted as part of the tour. We got to tour Hawk's Shadow, then had a tasting at Duchman and ended our tour with some delicious BBQ from Salt Lick, next to Salt Lick Cellars. Tom, our driver was so nice and flexible with our schedule. He reminded us of how much time we had but did not feel rushed at all. We'll definitely be booking Slowpokes for any future trips!

reviews.author: Alan A.
reviews.description: Amazing tour, Michael was a great host. He was so attentive and helped in every way. The tour was flexible and very fun. The children, 4 and 9, were entertained also. Michael asked many questions as to ensure the experience was what we wanted. Great time thank you so much.  Alan A US Army Ret.

reviews.author: Ana K.
reviews.description: Amazing wine tour. Our group was small but it was perfect. Linda really took care of us and was so much fun. You really need to check it out if you are looking at wine tours.

reviews.author: Ashley G.
reviews.description: This was soooo much fun! We did this for a bachelorette party and we had a blast! Lindsey was our Tour Guide/Bus Driver/Photographer/DJ/New Bestie! She was AMAZING!!!! I would highly recommend this Tour! We did Deep Eddie, Last Stand Brewing Company and Treaty Oak!

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: Linda was fantastic and this wine tour was great! I was with a bunch of rather rowdy girl friends and she was endlessly patient and took good care of us. We had a great time and I recommend this company!

reviews.author: Deryck Z.
reviews.description: Linda is the best!!!! We did a tour for a bachelorette party and it was prefect. The personal touch Linda added made it so wonderful. She provide a very nice lunch and snack trays. Everything about the tour went so smoothly and was planned our perfectly. We even were picked up at our rental house so no one had to drive after drinking. All the girls on the tour said they would defiantly do another tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours!

reviews.author: Thu F.
reviews.description: We have an annual girls trip and decided on a tour with Slowpokes Wine Tours.  There was a total of 8 girls on the tour with a couple that was paired with us and we were the perfect group.  Linda was the best tour guide anyone can ask for.  Our group had a blast and the lunch was an added bonus on the tour!  She kept us informed along the way and gave us the best details of each winery/distillery that we visited.  Linda was very personable and every location we visited had its own special charm!  Thanks for an amazing tour Slowpokes Wine Tours.

reviews.author: Kathy F.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a wonderful day set up by Linda at Slowpokes.  After talking with her she designed a day that was diverse and showed us a number of new things in the Dripping Springs area.  Our day included several of the high country wineries, one brewery and a visit to the quaint town of Wimberly. We highly recommend this group over  other Austin wine tour groups as they create a very personalized day and made sure everyone enjoyed the stops.   Our day started with lunch at Homespuns in Dripping Springs - excellent start to a beautiful day!  The Bloody Marys are highly recommended.

reviews.author: Brit F.
reviews.description: We recently completed a bachelorette party tour with Lindsey as our tour guide and it was the BEST! Lindsey chose our wineries very wisely; we started with lunch at Crowson (whose owner will drop incredible knowledge on you), enjoyed a rainstorm and a glass of red at the beautiful Ron Yates, and ended with cheese and BOOOOM wine at Hye Meadow Winery. It was lovely day of booze, conversation, and sisterhood. And, yes, we loved Lindsey so much she became a part of our wolfpack. Lindsey was fun, energetic, and knowledgeable about the area. I would definitely do this tour again!

reviews.author: April D.
reviews.description: I decided to surprise my mom with a wine tasting tour for her 60th birthday. Linda went above and beyond to make this tour special. She made a wine bottle with me and my moms photo on it with a sweet birthday message and quote.  She took so many photos of us, and really made us feel special. We were able to choose our wineries and she even picked us up and dropped us off at our BNB. She had the most amazing tapas tray, with cheese, mixed nuts, her special dip, crackers, breads and meats. She had this prepared and sat out for us at Wimberly winery,  halfway through the tour. At the end of this stop, she even had cupcakes for my moms birthday. I had actually called around different wine tours in the area and Slow Poke Wine tours offered the best value and I can tell you now, the best service. We wouldn't hesitate to do it again. This trip with my mom was priceless and so special. I thank you Linda for making an amazing memory for my mom and I.

reviews.author: Amanda W.
reviews.description: We used Slowpokes tour for my bachelorette party, Linda was great, she picked us up at the door of our rental house and had a perfect day planned for us. We went to a beautiful winery to begin and enjoyed a lunch spread while there; then we went to a distillery with AMAZING frozen mint juleps, outdoor games and great scenic views; finally we ended at the olive oil and balsamic producer for more snacks and great wine. Linda was very attentive to us and did a great job of keeping us on schedule without rushing us, she picked us up around 10:30AM and we returned around 4:30PM. Hope to enjoy this tour again in the future, a very diverse experience that I think even the guys would enjoy!

reviews.author: Mandy L.
reviews.description: I recently went on a bachelorette party with 9 girls with Slowpokes Wine Tours. It was absolutely perfect. Linda was so sweet and incredibly helpful. We didn't have to worry about anything! As soon as Linda picked us up she took care of everything. We just walked in and started having fun. She went above and beyond to make our day perfect.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: Wow!  What a fantastic time!  Linda was on time, knowledgeable, NICE, funny, and showered us with attention.  She had everything taken care of - all we had to do is get off the van, taste wines and get back on again for the next stop. What service!  I highly, highly recommend Slowpokes and will definitely be seeing Linda again!

reviews.author: Julie G.
reviews.description: I could have sworn I wrote a review on here prior, but I JUST WENT ON MY SECOND slowpoke wine tour and it was just as wonderful as the first.  While a small group, Linda and Dave do an outstanding job of making everyone feel comfortable, no matter what the group size.  This time we went to 3 different venues and what a great experience.  They don't miss any detail.  They make the day enjoyable and relaxing.  Looking for the best wine tour in the Hill Country?  Look no further.  Slowpokes is the tour to book!

reviews.author: Trey C.
reviews.description: I used Slowpokes Winery Tours to go on a Hill Country wine tour on the day I got engaged, and I could not have asked for a better experience.  My now fiancée and I rode in the Model T Ford, which was all-original except for the brakes. I contacted Linda with any questions, concerns, and booking, and Linda picked up my fiancée in a Mercedes van.  We went to a great breakfast, and then David drove us around in the Model T Ford. The route was scenic, breathe taking, and beautiful.  The wineries we stopped at were great, and, the customer service from Linda and David was unbeatable.  They have a unique business that is more than just a van or limo driving you around to distilleries, breweries, or wineries (although they also have a Mercedes van option).  I am now going on another tour with them for a bachelor party, and they could not have provided more prompt replies to my requests for information related to travel, pick up at different locations, types of tours they offer, and pricing.  What a great business run by some truly nice and professional people who offer very reasonable pricing.  I plan to use their services again in the future.

reviews.author: Alex P.
reviews.description: Could not have been better. Mauricio was super easy to reach, arrived on time both times, and was super flexible. He saved our trip.

reviews.author: Jeremy S.
reviews.description: Mauricio was incredible. Gave us a ride to and from lake Travis. Then a ride to COTA next day with no notice. Highly recommend for anyone around Austin.

reviews.author: Brian K.
reviews.description: Mauricio was a great driver. He came through for us at the last minute and saved our trip to the formula one race

reviews.author: Pat C.
reviews.description: We had a great experience traveling from Austin to Lake Travis and back with Mauricio. He arrived exactly when he said he was going to and helped us load up the van with all our stuff. We ended up staying out on the lake for an extra hour, and he was flexible with us changing our pickup time. Also, when someone forgot a cell phone in the car he was willing to meet us to return it. Very pleasant, convenient, and safe experience!

reviews.author: S R.
reviews.description: AJE transportation was great for our bachelorette party!! Did an amazing job, brought us 2 coolers for our boat ride, and was so communicative. Would absolutely recommend!

reviews.author: Sarah H.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a reliable transportation service these are your people. Mauricio communicated with me quickly and clearly picking up 15 of us from the hill country of austin and drop us off at lake Travis. They also offer extra coolers if needed. But what I loved most what getting sent a video slide show of our trip! Excellent service! Thank you! Will definitely be using them again!

reviews.author: Jena E.
reviews.description: I hired Alba for my husbands 36th Birthday - we rented a yacht out on Lake Travis and needed transportation for the group to and from the marina. Alba was a delight to work with through the process- very responsive, friendly and professional. He made sure I understood what the timeline was and what to expect. He will also make a stop for you on the way if you need to pick up additional refreshments.  We actually stayed out past our projected return time and Alba was incredibly gracious and patient with us- I really appreciated that because it can be stressful planning large group outings and he really made it stress-free for me. I would recommend AJE Transportation to anyone looking for easy group transportation in Austin- he was stellar!

reviews.author: Jan M.
reviews.description: AJE Transportation and Mr. Ettie are the BEST!!!  He came to our rescue by going out of his way to provide last minute, transportation service for a bachelorette, winery tour last weekend.  He was on time, accommodating and a pleasure to deal with. Can't go wrong with him!  I would not hesitate to use him again.  5 STARS for sure!

reviews.author: Paul S.
reviews.description: Call AJE first!   Alba went above and beyond to help me figure out a ride for my friend's bachelor party.   He gave me recommendations for the weekend and was very easy to deal with.   You have to move fast though, I waited to book my trip with him until it was too late, but he still helped me and found me a ride with one of his competitors! You really don't see service like that anymore. I'm very impressed by Alba's commitment to customer service. Would absolutely recommend!

reviews.author: Laura T.
reviews.description: Alba was super friendly and accommodating!! We had planned our day for my friends bachelorette party and he was even going to add an extra stop for us! Our plans went south due to the weather and we unfortunately had to cancel our boat outing. He came quickly to our rescue, suggesting numerous additional options for the day. He drove us around to a vineyard and distillery without any additional fees. He was always checking in on us to make sure we were happy and having fun! I'd highly recommend him for his quick and efficient communication, flexibility, and attention to detail when it came to our needs. I'll 100% be booking his services again if I find myself with a large party in Austin again!

reviews.author: Matthew D.
reviews.description: Phenomenal experience with AJE transportation! Alba our driver went above and beyond with accommodating us for our bachelor party. He was on time made sure we were able to stop for refreshments along with breakfast and got us to the lake with 0 problems.   I highly recommend using AJE transpiration for your next trip!

reviews.author: Andrea M.
reviews.description: Alba chartered my girlfriends on a bachelorette party today. He was awesome and quick on his feet to find us solutions when the weather went sour today and changed our boat plans. He checked in so many times if we needed to stop for snacks or other suggestions for places to visit!

reviews.author: Beth P.
reviews.description: We just returned from a day long wine tour with Alba who owns AJE Transportation.  I would highly recommend his services.  He was flexible, attentive, knows the Spicewood area well and was able to give recommendations on wineries, distilleries, and restaurants.  He gave us a sample itinerary for the day and was easily able to modify this based on what we wanted to do.  He was courteous and kind and I will definitely book again with him.  Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Caroline B.
reviews.description: Alba was incredibly helpful leading up to our bachelorette trip to Austin. He was super reasonable with pricing and sent along restaurant and sight-seeing options before our trip.   The day of, he was right on time and beyond courteous in helping us get all of our stuff to the van. He even stopped on the way for us to grab food and alcohol.   Since the weather was iffy, Alba made sure to let us know that he was standing by and flexible with timing so he could bring us back to town early if we wanted.   The van was clean and comfy. I'd absolutely recommend him to anyone going to Austin and hope to use his services again soon. :)

reviews.author: Stephanie D.
reviews.description: Alba was really great and saved the day! We had a bachelorette party and because of the weather we had to change our plans -- not only was he super flexible and nice, but he had lots of great suggestions and helped us salvage the day with a lot of fun activities. He was really friendly, on time, and continuously checked in to make sure we were all comfortable and had what we needed. Not to mention was great about us listening to our own music and helping with literally anything! I would definitely recommend him for any group trips.

reviews.author: Taylor W.
reviews.description: AJE is the only way to travel when visiting Austin, TX! Alba is not only the most helpful with planning, he is also extremely punctual and accommodating, especially with large parties. 10/10 would use Alba and AJE again! Thank you for the memories and great conversation Alba!!!

reviews.author: Julian E.
reviews.description: Alba did a phenomenal job of providing transportation for myself and 10 friends to Lake Travis!  He was prompt, courteous, and very helpful finding a place to rent a boat and get supplies for our day on the lake.  I highly recommend Alba for transportation anywhere in Austin, especially if you are from out of town and value the insights of a local expert! A++ keep up the good work sir!

reviews.author: Adam W.
reviews.description: We can't say enough good things about Alba and his services. He transported me and eight friends to Lake Travis for a weekend boat trip. He was incredibly kind, helpful, thorough and prompt. He showed up fifteen minutes early at our place and helped us load into the car. Alba then brought us to a grocery store on the way so we could get supplies for the boat. He packed two coolers which we were able to bring on the boat - another big plus. And he was prompt and helpful in bringing us back home afterward.  As a bonus, he's incredibly knowledgeable about the surrounding area and was able to offer up tons of great suggestions. Last but not least, he's a really nice guy! 10/10, would definitely recommend Alba to anyone.

reviews.author: Tanya G.
reviews.description: Alba was great - see reviews below. Super accommodating and knowledgeable about the local area.

reviews.author: Amanda N.
reviews.description: Alba was a great driver. Very knowledgeable about the fun stuff to do around Austin. He took us to Dripping Springs and Spicewood for my Bachelorette party and we had a blast. Several girls said it was the best bachelorette party they had been to!! You can eat and drink alcohol on the van. I shopped around, and his 14 passenger van was the most reasonably priced. We went to Treaty Oak, Spicewood Vineyards and Poodie's!! Definitely recommend this company.

reviews.author: James V.
reviews.description: Awesome tour. Ike the tour operator and owner is very knowledgeable and passionate about his city. Highly recommended! Thanks again, good luck and always remember to "Be Kind."  James

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: Great tour today with Jason.  He was very knowledgeable about the history of Austin, the music vibe, the food, the neighborhoods.  We learned a ton and our visit here will be too short to take in all the cool places he spoke about and recommended.  I would highly recommend this tour.  Take it on your first day here so you'll have ideas of where to eat, what to see and venues to check out live music!!   Kudos Jason!

reviews.author: Janice N.
reviews.description: It was an Awesome tour with Martin! My husband and I did the  Hill country wine and bbq tour. Martin was very friendly l, entertaining and provided great information. The only downside was most of the people in the group (we were the only minority) weren't really talking to us and we felt excluded in their conversations, I guess they weren't aware of their racial biases. But overall it was a great experience plus love the BBQ!

reviews.author: Denise S.
reviews.description: What a fantastic tour!  Jason is extremely knowledgeable and shared so much about the area including history, music, eateries and more. Don't miss this tour company!

reviews.author: Lisa P.
reviews.description: This was an awesome way to see the city.  Covers a lot of ground.  Ike was an incredible guide - so informative and asked each person what they wanted to see or learn about.  Provided so many great recommendations for things to do, places to eat and things to see.  Definitely recommend doing this first thing when you get to the city so that you can plan things to do on your trip.  10 out of 10!

reviews.author: Jacky F.
reviews.description: It was my boyfriend and I's first time in Austin and we were so glad to be able to experience a tour to Salt Lick BBQ and 2 wineries along with our wonderful tour guides Henry and Marty! They were both very knowledgeable about the area and had lots of great recommendations about how to spend the rest of our trip. We both felt very welcomed and I definitely recommend this tour if you love wine and trying out Texas-style BBQ! You won't be disappointed (:

reviews.author: Janet W.
reviews.description: We had an awesome tour with Jason at Austin Detours. He was a wealth of information for other venues to visit while in town and very knowledgeable about the music scene in Austin. We stopped at 2 lovely wineries and the Salt lic barbeque. It was a wonderful way to see places outside of the city.  I would highly recommend this tour and Jason!

reviews.author: Janet R.
reviews.description: Visited Austin for the first time with my husband to celebrate our 29th wedding anniversary. Decided to do a city tour and found Austin Detours online. Our experience with Jax, Ruben and Evan was great. They all know so much (interesting things) about Austin and their enthusiasm left me wanting to stay longer to learn more about this great "weird" city that I've grown to love. We rode around for two hours with 2 other couples in a van and it was perfect. The time flew by. I didn't want it to end. I would've loved hanging out with Jax, Ruben and Evan all day. Jax even treated us to gelato at one of her favorite food trucks in Barton Springs. How sweet was that!! We definitely will return someday to Austin to enjoy all there is to enjoy. Thank you, Jax, Ruben and Evan. It was a great pleasure meeting you all...truly!!!

reviews.author: Daniela R.
reviews.description: Chris was the best tour guide! We came from LA and really got to learn about Austin's history, hot spots, best food spots, sports, the Capitol building + so much more. I highly recommend this tour. The van has AC which is nice.    and he was funny! We loved Austin!   Thanks Austin Tours for helping us fall in love with your city!

reviews.author: Kim B.
reviews.description: Great and informative tour.  Trace was our guide.  He was very personable. Asked everyone what they wanted to see or if there are highlights they wanted to achieve. Explain things very carefully and just made it really fun. I recommend this to anyone.  This was my first trip to Austin and thanks to Trace and Austin detours it will not be my last!

reviews.author: Nicole W.
reviews.description: Tour was amazing. I was very happy to see that the groups were very small, about 10 people total including the guides. I really liked how we were able to leave the car and take photos at some of the murals. My tour guides were amazing. 10/10 would definitely do it again.

reviews.author: Jose M.
reviews.description: Amazingly friendly, lay back and super informative.  Jason was our tour guide. He opened my eyes to the city and everything it had to offer.  After I left the tour, I felt like I understood what Austin was about.   Thank you so much for everything.

reviews.author: C R.
reviews.description: Custom tour of breweries and food trucks. Tour guide was Jason.   Exemplary business with extremely nice employees. Everyone on our ten person private tour commented on how unusual it was to have such a convenient and easy way to tour breweries and food trucks - and we are locals to begin with!   One employee (MJ) traveled ahead of group just to order food  and block tables.  This was worth the price of admission by itself.   The sprinter van was very well kept and new.   Jason was a great guide! I will def be using these guys for future adventures.

reviews.author: J J.
reviews.description: We had the most amazing day with Jason Weems as our tour guide xtrordinar!!!!  We started the day off being picked up exactly on time at our hotel. Off we went to arrive a few minutes before opening at Salt Lick BBQ and were immediately escorted inside to order. Jason takes care of everything before hand so all you do is sit back, relax and enjoy. Next stop wine tasting at two different wineries. Fun,Fun, Fun!!! Lots of wonderful commentary all the way. Jason loves what he does and he is a real people person. A trip down South Congress finished out our day with all the fun facts from our personable guide. We had the best day ever!!!   Jason is also a singer and writer and offers purchase of his signed copy of a wonderful book he's written on Austin.   High Five Jason Lindsay and Toni Southern Ca

reviews.author: Dan F.
reviews.description: I don't usually take tours when I visit a destination, but decided to give Austin Detours a try because of their fantastic Yelp rating. If others are saying good things about them, then it's probably worth trying. I signed up  the Real Austin Tour the night before and got an immediate confirmation. Their website says "a city overview in just 2 hours" which was perfect, but with a little mishap and trouble with parking, it ended up being around 2.5 hours. The van was roomy and clean, and a nice component of the tour, well, because less walking. I can imagine during the hot summer, the van with a/c would be the preferred way to tour around the city.   The tour took us through many neighborhoods and major sights around Austin. Enough that, I went back to many of the stops to explore further. There were many interesting facts pointed out and of course, the scary stories and legends make it all very fun and a bit silly. Stopped off at one of the cupcakes food trucks for a tasty treat, all included with the tour. If you're in Austin, this is a great little tour to see many sites in a short span of time.

reviews.author: Cushing A.
reviews.description: Highly recommend! Great overview of the city. Trace was our very knowledgeable and personable guide. We couldn't trip him up with any of our crazy questions. Gelato may even be in your future on one of these tours! We chose to have a small group tour, which was perfect. We had way too much fun. Thank you to the friendly Austin Detours and our very capable guide, Trace!

reviews.author: Anna R.
reviews.description: Marty was a great guide. He was knowledgeable and fun. He fit right in with our family dynamic.

reviews.author: Nancy A.
reviews.description: We took the Austin Detours All About Austin 2 hour tour today with Marty.  We had a great time! Marty was very knowledgeable and accommodating, and we learned a lot in a short time, while also figuring out where we want to go during our stay.  Highly recommend doing this tour when you first get to Austin!

reviews.author: N K.
reviews.description: Had a great tour with Jason. His knowledge of the city, passion for it, wit, and more jokes than a comedy club on a Friday night made the tour enjoyable, informative and increased my laugh lines (booking a botox appt to take care of that pronto). 2 hrs felt like a half hr. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Marcie S.
reviews.description: the tour provided a great overview of downtown Austin, there's something for everyone here, from high-end restaurants to food trucks, it's a foodie paradise. We stopped and walked the grounds of the Texas capital building, drove through UT, passed several of the famous Austin artworks "i love you so much" And learned the history of much of downtown like Rainey St., and S. Congress.  Keep your cool in the van while checking out the city.  Marty was a pleasure as our guide, making our tour interactive and fun. ATX fun, food, music and history.

reviews.author: Brett J.
reviews.description: This business is awesome!! What a great way to make that something special and unique for any occasion!   I placed an order on line...  talked through chat with a representative... up loaded what I wanted it to look like and I was under way.  They sent me back a proof just a day later... I approved it and paid (all on line)... and in just a couple of days I was picking up my special surprise for my wife's and my 10 year anniversary.  They were friendly, did the work exactly to my specifications and were quick!  I will definitely remember this and us them again!

reviews.author: Monda P.
reviews.description: I placed an order for a custom labeled wine in late November. There was an error with the shipping address, which Personal Wine had been made aware of. But I had to reach out to inquire about the status of the shipment. Once I did, she made sure to tell me that I had made a mistake and that they would charge me $19 to reship the package. I assure you, the address I shipped to is correct. Verified by the client and his business website.   Just all around poor customer service. Blame your customer, over-charge your customer, and then dismiss them when you don't want to deal with the issue any longer.   I will never use this company for client gifts again.

reviews.author: Michelle B.
reviews.description: Wonderful service and helpful staff. This was my first time ordering something like this and everything worked out perfectly!   I needed a personalized bottle for a maid of honor on the fly because she was going out of town. They made that happen and she was super excited!

reviews.author: Sara T.
reviews.description: I stumbled across Personal Wine by chance when I was searching for a magnum bottle of Whispering Angel online. I had no idea I could personalize a bottle of wine online. I ordered the magnum with a customized label and the process was very smooth and easy! I never got a shipping confirmation email so I reached out to them and got a response pretty quickly. The package did arrive the morning after they guaranteed it would, so I would recommend giving yourself a few days as a buffer so you aren't in a pickle. The label looked amazing and the bottle was packaged in styrofoam so it was protected during shipping.

reviews.author: Stacey A.
reviews.description: Personal Wine is my go to source for all of my corporate gifts.  I love being able to create my own design on a wine label and personalize them for each client.  The engraved bottles and wood boxes are a big hit.  Everyone thinks they are one of the most thoughtful gifts they have ever received.  On top of it, the customer service is superb!

reviews.author: Elizabeth V.
reviews.description: Ben Myers worked with me to make sure the champagne I was sending to my daughter would get to her and her husband on Valentine's Day. I was very satisfied with the wine and the timely delivery. I will be ordering again.

reviews.author: Troy H.
reviews.description: I am not an avid wine drinker like many I know, but I am an avid person who appreciates unique products and great customer service.  I previously learned about Personal Wine at a local charity event where they had custom engraved wine bottles as gifts to help raise money for the charity; knowing this, it planted a seed in my mind to give them a try.  Recently, while in a crush of thoughts and ideas to get a gift I remembered Personal Wine. Committing to using them for my inspired gift needs, I decided that I wanted a custom label printed on two nice bottles of wine.  So, I went to the website.... and it seems that since the website was far too simple for me to understand [self-deprecating humor and honesty so you can laugh]... then I simply called them so I could speak about options.    In a short timely manner I spoke with their customer service and I was placed in contact with Michael and his customer service focus was a great relief and helped me sort out my thoughts for the logo, design, capabilities they have and much much more.  In the end and in the perfect storm of timing, I was able to get them what they needed and they were able to get me a perfect product by days end. It's not everyday that they can process things in a timely manner so fast, but the staff and team helped me out greatly. Michael even personally cut out the unique shape of the label like a skilled surgeon to meet my needs. (it was unique per my request)  I ended up getting 2 custom labeled bottles of wine and a pine box to present them in. It surely will be a unique gift that will not be expected.  If you are looking for a great gift that displays your personal style, I would try Personal Wine as they can pretty much match your wants and needs for gifts. Remember they are local, but they do deliver around the United States (read the website for details).  Additionally, I learned that they are also available for "venue" opportunities if you would like to have a private event, wine tasting, meeting space, etc. so just contact them for details. The space is really classic, comforting, and reminiscent of old school "speak easy" lounges with the great oak tables and comfortable leather seating.  Personal wine deserves the 5-Star rating for helping me meet all my gift needs when I needed it most.

reviews.author: Grindstick W.
reviews.description: I ordered some custom inscribed wine glasses and was disappointed. The etching was so faint I could barely see it. The font and logos were also very small and badly proportioned. Dealing with Franco at customer service was like speaking with a 5 year old, he didn't listen and just kept repeating what he was trained to say, constantly talking over me and in denial. I didn't feel that the quality or design was worth the cost. The best part was after I told franco the product did not measure up to what was promised he did offer me a discount on future orders ? Again, obviously he wasn't listen. Why would I order more if the product was less than desirable. Denial is a river in Egypt, its a protocol at Personal Wine.

reviews.author: Jen T.
reviews.description: What an incredible company--their customer service is top notch! I work for a software company and head up our advocacy efforts and events. We have sent out a lot of corporate gifts over the years, as well as thank you notes, but the customized bottles of bubbly wine we sent through Personal Wine have been far and away the most popular gifts we've sent.  Ordering was a breeze. Ben Myers was a total gem and walked me through all of our options. We had a huge list of addresses we had to send to, and our order arrived well before the anticipated date. The labels looked beautiful and our customers took to social media to proudly show off their custom bottles of wine.  I honestly couldn't be more please with both the final product and the customer service I received. They are an awesomely rocking company and I would absolutely recommend them to any and every person who's looking for a unique, personalized gift for friends, family, and corporate contacts. Thanks so much Personal Wine!

reviews.author: Melanie M.
reviews.description: Awesome, awesome, awesome! Got a few Pinot Grigio bottles personalized for one of my fav former co-workers for her birthday, and I was really impressed with the end of result. She LOVED it, and I seriously couldn't be more happy from the pictures she sent me after receiving the gift. The only criticism I have is that the templates don't necessarily align with the corresponding event--I picked a label for her birthday that was actually under 'Valentine's Day'--but it was easily remedied by a few font changes and so forth. There were a few templates that were perhaps misplaced or mislabeled, but that aside, the final product was an absolute gem. I definitely recommend this company for anyone looking for a thoughtful gift that resonates with fellow wine lovers!

reviews.author: Fatima M.
reviews.description: I ordered online my customer service representative was very helpful he emailed me right away and guided me all the way to payment I was very satisfied and Devon grooms my customer rep was very helpful I got them yesterday and they looked amazing thank you so much

reviews.author: Kaje Y.
reviews.description: I've ordered 3 bottles of wine and glasses from them online with etching. Their wine selection is really good, and the staff is extremely helpful. The recipients of the personalized wine and glasses absolutely loved them and admired the professionalism and wondered how it was done or where I got it!   They work fast and quality of work is high end. I wouldn't say you get what you pay for - I think that you get more than what you pay for in terms of wine, personalized product and customer service. They work to your needs and are very flexible and very willing to do what they can to get your orders the way you want them.   Highly recommended and will be ordering from them in the near future!

reviews.author: Natalie L.
reviews.description: Was very happy with the product!... it made a really nice gift for a 50th wedding anniversary. Was a little disappointed with the personalized sticker.. I thought the writing was really small and was concerned that they wouldn't notice that we had made a personalized sticker. Another concern was the card that I ordered... it looked like somebody sat on it...it was on very thin paper and came in a sealed envelope all crumpled up... I am so happy that I opened it and took a look. This kind of thing just makes the whole gift look cheap...  I went out at the last minute to buy a card.

reviews.author: Eric D G.
reviews.description: I recently retired and for my special guests I wanted to have some last minute engraved glasses made to commemorate the occasion.  The event was less than 10 days away.  Not only did Personal Wine design the glasses EXACTLY to my specification I was able to receive them in enough time for my ceremony.  The product was very high quality given the timespan I gave them.  I would highly recommend this company to anyone who values exquisite, high quality engraving for their events.

reviews.author: Caitlin N.
reviews.description: I just placed an order online for my friend's birthday present and could not be happier with the customer service. Ben Meyers was very prompt in his email response and answered all of my questions. My friend is moving, so I needed to time my delivery for after the weekend, and Ben went above and beyond to make sure my order will arrive when I need it to. The website itself is very intuitive and the end product makes for the perfect, unique gift I was aiming for.

reviews.author: Shonel G.
reviews.description: Downstairs in the basement is a swanky low key wine bar. Not one of those scenes where people are there to be seen and you have to talk loudly to the person sitting next to you. This is a place where wine lovers go for a glass or two and relax and have some conversation. They have a nice variety of bottles and truly believe a wine expert could find a few that they love. The seating consists of over sized leather chairs and many leather sofas. They have a bar area and one really long table perfect for large parties or tastings. This place has cement floors and walls lined with bottles. No one expects you to arrive in a suit or anything stuff like that. This is a come as you are sort of place. The only prerequisite is that you like wine and are of legal drinking age. Oh one more thing you won't find this place over run by the 6th street crowd, this place is much more relaxed then that.

reviews.author: Wendi R.
reviews.description: I ordered two customized bottles of champagne yesterday (10/27). While it took me some time and Photoshop skills to find photos that would translate to the bottle (the mockup feature on the website helped IMMENSELY), the ordering process was smooth and easy. I was told to expect a pickup date of 11/3, and got a call TODAY (10/28) saying my order was ready. Looks fantastic, as well. Will use again and recommend!

reviews.author: Andrea W.
reviews.description: This is such a great company! I've placed 2 orders and needed to make changes to both and they were so easy to work with. Plus, the labels are so beautiful...really true to the mock up that you see online! I can't recommend them enough!!!

reviews.author: Jenny I.
reviews.description: I just ordered two customized bottles of wine for two friends who recently got engaged. I tried to make them each unique "congratulations" messages on the bottles and submitted my order. Later that evening I realized I put the messages on the opposite bottles that they were supposed to go with so I contacted the website to see if I could pause the orders and switch the messages. I received a very prompt response first thing the next morning asking what they could do to help with the changes I needed. As I chose different labels/designs, they helped me put together a totally new design for each bottle so I could swap the messages. Amazing customer service. Can't wait to see what they look like!!!!

reviews.author: Paula P.
reviews.description: Personal Wine has done a great job for me .  They are a great resource for special gifts for friends, family and clients.  I have even kept some of mine as mementos of special occasions.  It's a nice personalized gift , either a custom label or etching , and great wine all at a reasonable price.  Be sure and ask for Cindy .    Paula P.

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: we visited the Austin area as a group and went exploring the breweries, wineries and distilleries in the area.  We stumbled across Austin Custom Winery and met Steve who provided us with a wonderful experience.  Steve was also helpful in places to visit for entertain and dining.  His knowledge of wines and where the grapes come from was fantastic.  We were not rushed through the wine tasting and he was pleasantly engaging the entire time we were there. Check out Austin Custom Winery!

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: The owner heavily supported the riot and charging of the senate today. She thinks BLM is a sham and is a major supporter of attacking protestors. Also doesn't believe in masks or covid.

reviews.author: Montalvo A.
reviews.description: This owner supports the terrorist who attacked he capitol today! Not a business I will ever support again!

reviews.author: Chuck C.
reviews.description: Just stopped in at this cool place after eating next door...nice wine tasting environment - great bar, good vibe, super cute dog, beautiful mural painted on the wall and a friendly owner.   Bought a bottle of the Tuscan blend on the recommendation of the owner - I will open, taste and add a review later - I'm only giving it 4 stars for now because I haven't tried the wine, but I like the place...more to come!

reviews.author: Marco G.
reviews.description: The owner openly supports terrorism, sedition, and chaos. Dont support this business.

reviews.author: Desiree S.
reviews.description: Sunday afternoon - the OPEN sign is on, we have just had a really great meal next door and I have always wanted to go into this place.   So, we walked in and no one was in there. Thought to myself...maybe they are in the back. Talked a little louder with my husband and daughter and the cute little dog that greated us.  Then this woman walks in and we made cordial small talk.  I asked if they were open because she seemed quite perturbed that we were inside. Confused because I had seen the open sign. I asked "Are you open?"  She said annoyed "We are getting there...."  We quickly walked out and will not grace those doors again!  Rudeness doesn't win! Love and kindness wins!!

reviews.author: Larry E.
reviews.description: I love this quiet oasis away from the chaos of other places! The Barolo is really good and I grabbed another bottle today and also picked up a Pinot Grigio.  The wines do not have the chemicals that I don't think should be added. A wine should stand on its own!  "Custom wine without the chemicals"  Supremely good! I'm a wine snob as I was raised with it and also living and working around the world I was able to have some of the best wines in the world. No, I am not rich . Wines that are sent to the states are really jacked up in price and I was able to get what I wanted and bring it back. One thing I did learn is that you don't drink an expensive wine as a part of the meals but enjoy it on its own. I bought 2 bottles of Barolo to have with an Italian meal. It was a great fit. This little place has fulfilled the perfect fit! The lady who owns the place and makes the wine is quite nice and understand all of the above. I will be back!

reviews.author: Toni A.
reviews.description: Best wine I have had in a long time out of the United States. It has low tannins and robust flavors. Mary is the definition of a connoisseur. They do custom wine bottle labels and build gift baskets. MY FAVORITE!!! Her shop is filled with fun items and the cutest dog ever!!!

reviews.author: Becky M.
reviews.description: First winery on our Mom Daughter wine adventures in Austin.  Called ahead of time to get the scoop.  Immediately fell in love with Mary's sass.  Uber'd over and was not disappointed.  Although they don't serve food, she suggested a few restaurant take outs nearby and allowed us to bring in and eat there.  Mary does it all!  Wine maker extraordinaire she is!  Loved our first wine stop experience!

reviews.author: Joseph R.
reviews.description: This lady was so rude to my friend and I. You could tell she wanted nothing to do with us and tried to rush our tasting as fast as possible. She did not want to answer any of our questions and not once looked us in the eye. I'm not sure if she is a racist, homophobe, doesn't like young people, or all of the above but you could tell we were not welcome. I would never come here again and I continue to tell my friends and family to never come here too.

reviews.author: Nikki J.
reviews.description: I DO NOT like wine, and found two wines I LOVED! My husband who does not like wine either LOVED this wine. Place was small but family owned. I felt real relaxed and comfortable and enjoyed my tasting! Owner was so nice! Going to sign up for the monthly wine club because the wine was SO good. Defiantly recommend this place! Went with a bachelorette party and the owner was accommodating to all 13 of us, and found a wine each of us loved! Go for the GREAT wine!

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: RUDE service and bad wine.  Menu isn't even accurate, i.e.: mislabeled as Italian wines but really French.  There are so many better places in the Austin area. Do not waste your time.

reviews.author: Lisa R.
reviews.description: This place seems to attract a lot of women's meet ups and networking groups, which is obviously why I know of it. The owner is jovial and the atmosphere is good for a casual meet up.

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: I'm not a drinker.  I have a low tolerance for alcohol, and wine hits me particularly hard.  But I attended a group wine tasting here with a friend yesterday, and thus our tale begins...  I got there as the second serving of a six-wine tasting was progressing, and I was immediately struck by the smoothness of the wine that was being served at the moment, a Gewurtraminer.  Shortly after sipping that wine, I mentioned that I had almost no tolerance for alcohol.  Steve, the master of ceremonies for the tasting, told the group that Austin Custom Wineries did not add sulphites, the major cause of wine intolerance, into their wine as most wineries do for preservative purposes.  As a result, though the wines should be drunk within five years, the wines are eminently drinkable for even the lightest of weight drinkers like me.  Seriously, I can't even finish a bottle of beer (Shiner).  So I was able to partake in the tasting!  I didn't drink all of each of the wines, but I had more than I normally would have felt comfortable with (to avoid headaches), and I suffered absolutely zero ill effects.  It was amazing.    Also amazing: ACW's selection of dessert wines--ports and ice wines.  Maybe I'm just not a fancy wine connoisseur, but those dessert wines are drinkable and tasty.  And since they have no added sulphites, all I have to worry about is the alcohol content!

reviews.author: Scott K.
reviews.description: Was glad to finally visit this winery.  Met one of the owners.  He was very welcoming and gave us so much information about the wines his winery makes.  We tasted 6 wines for a $10 fee.  The grape juice is purchased and then the wine maker takes it from there to make several different wines.  The server gave generous pours to ensure we tasted the wines fully.  He used 6 separate wine glasses to ensure we tasted the different wines which I thought was nice.  Most wine places used the same wine glass to sample the wines.  We enjoyed visiting with the owner.  A very pleasant gentleman.  I really recommend visiting this winery with your friends.  If you don't know anything about wine, not to worry because the owner will make sure your wine tasting experience is a positive one.

reviews.author: Lisa T.
reviews.description: Been really happy with this group since finding them several years ago. While the recipes might have changed over the years, they never cease to bring a great selection out every year. The port wines have been some of our favorites, raspberry chocolate port in particular. My husband has always been a fan of their blackberry merlot. We moved north of Austin, but when ever we take a trip to south Austin area, this spot is a must stop! Don't forget to ask about their wine club too; it is a great way to sample the variety of flavors they bring out!

reviews.author: Georgia B.
reviews.description: This is a great place in the Sunset Valley area to stop in and take a break from the hustle and bustle of shopping. We get to sip on our favorites as well as try new ones...Malbec is our favorite so far!

reviews.author: Marian K.
reviews.description: I love this small winery, A great place to sit quietly for a good bottle of wine.

reviews.author: Lauren B.
