reviews.description: We had intentions to get food next door and then saw this winery next door... never made it to the restaurant and stayed here instead. Got more than we bargained for when we walked in. Wonderful people working here, great environment and tasty wine. Will DEFINITELY be back here.

reviews.author: Karen H.
reviews.description: I got hooked on Austin Custom Winery due to the less amount of sulfolamides (I know I mis spelled that)!  Mary and Steve are excellent hosts... I love that they are patient and accommodating.  I also recently became a wine club member... Lots of perks, including getting to create my own wine label with custom picture!  So happy I found this AUSTIN business!

reviews.author: Victoria T.
reviews.description: This was my first time going on a wine tour ever and I am happy to say it did not disappoint. The big charter bus picked us up downtown Austin and we headed to the wineries. I am not much of a wine person but after this tour, found out what wine I actually enjoy. Our tour guide was great and interactive with everyone on the tour and made sure we all enjoyed ourselves. Our bus driver was a pro driving those roads and I felt safe having him as my sober driver LOL. The BBQ lunch was pretty tasty and everything overall was great. I would definitely do it again.

reviews.author: Erica Z.
reviews.description: Texas Wino Boat Tour- Lake Travis  My family found this place on groupon.  Since it looked pretty cool we decided to plan a family trip.  The road trip there was very beautiful however finding the parking lot SUCKED!! Our truck 4WD barely made it down, I do not recommend going any further if you have a small vehicle because the lot is NOT paved.   The wait wasn't too bad. If you get stuck at the end of the line I recommend taking umbrellas!! There is limited seating on the bottom, so if you get stuck sitting at the top it's better to be safe.   The burgers grilled were delicious, the staff was friendly and funny and the music was pretty good.   Overall a very fun experience.   Ps. One toilet per boat and it's tall and nasty

reviews.author: Lisa S.
reviews.description: Just did the Sat tour to Fredericksburg and had a blast! Our tour guide TJ was so personable, knowledgable and very attentive to his guests. He made sure everyone was present and accounted for before we left each winery. You could tell he enjoys his job! Our bus driver Tanagay was amazing the way she maneuvered that bus into the tiniest of spaces!  The wineries we visited.. Mendelbaums,Tejas, FatAss and Vinovium were just so beautiful, fun and so so friendly! Each winery had a rep that made us feel so welcomed when we arrived. The fresh Italian meal was amazing and so delicious! I will definitely book again in the near future!

reviews.author: Brooke P.
reviews.description: I've been on two Texas Wino Tours so far with very different experiences!   2018: First tour I went on was a couple years ago, we had a great time from beginning to end! Bus ride smooth and seamless. Tour guide was awesome and energetic. I left this first tour thinking "I'll definitely come back!"  2021: This second tour was ROUGH. We went for my Bachelorette party for a wine tour out to Fredericksburg with a timeline of 11:30 - 6:30. Within the tour we were supposed to to visit 3 wineries, and Luckenbach.   Sadly, the bus driver ruined the experience by getting lost almost the entire day. Not only was she directionally challenged, but she drove like a NASCAR driver trying to make up for lost time; causing many people to become motion sick.   She somehow took a wrong turn in the morning, then we hit traffic from a wreck up ahead (I understand second part not her fault) we did not arrive at the first winery until 1:30pm. Stayed for about 40 minutes, then onto the next.   Second winery was great, had a BBQ lunch, atmosphere awesome and laid back. Stayed for about 1hr 15 minutes.  Third stop was to Luckenbach, we visited for about 35 minutes, then it was back on the bus at 5:15pm.   This is were it got a little crazy. Bus driver took a wrong turn and started going South, somehow ended 10 minutes North of San Antonio, then we were lost out in the middle of nowhere with no cell service.   It started to buzz around the bus that we were lost, and it took an 1 hr and 15 minutes before our tour guide even said anything over the intercom about us being lost!! Everyone was so annoyed because the tour guide proceed to say we could make it to the third winery even though the winery was about to close. (We would only be able to stay for 10 minutes) At this point it was 6:45pm already well past when we were supposed to be back in Austin.   Get ahold of this, we did not reach our drop off location in Austin until 7:50pm. At that point we were on the bus for 2 hrs a 15 minutes just riding around Texas.   Out of 8 hrs with them only 2.5 were spent outside.  It was sad to spend my whole Bachelorette party (especially on a beautiful day) on a Bus with terrible old music on replay, travelers in a bad mood, and everyone wanting to go home. :(

reviews.author: Lori M.
reviews.description: Great fun!  Was able to get the best pricing for a group event.  The tour leader, Anthony, was engaging and knowledgeable throughout and the driver very cautious and resourceful around a few foolish drivers.  A very well organized event and most certainly fun!

reviews.author: Tori B.
reviews.description: Truly,  I could not have imagined a better adventure. My sister and I wanted some special bonding time, and this provided that as well as many happy memories.  Our guide WAS AMAZING!   Robbie did a splendid job to ensure our safety as well as to make certain that we had fun. He was super knowledgeable and more than hospitable.   The wineries/vineries were ABSOLUTELY  perfect. 290 Vinery was my favorite stop. The people there were fantastic. I loved their selection of sweet wines, and there tapas were a perfect pairing.   Richard has created something truly special.

reviews.author: Andréa Z.
reviews.description: Texas Winos is a sure way to a great time!! From my first Fredericksburg Wine Tour in 2017, to Wino Boat Bashes, and my favorite, Wino Fest. You can't beat having all the organizing done for you and a designated driver. Hosts have always been lively and accommodating and Richard has been great to talk to at several events. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Shell A.
reviews.description: This was my second time booking with Texas Winos. We took the Fredericksburg Wine tour from San Antonio with the Italian meal choice. As always we had a great time! Bus was clean and well maintained. The guide Jordan was a fabulous host! Highly recommend him. The wineries and meal was great too! We even had a bonus stop at Hye Cider!

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Groupon review: I did not end up reserving or going on the tour, so I am giving a three-star rating to give them the benefit of the doubt. However, I went on Groupon to purchase their discounted tour for $200. That comes out to $50/person. When I went to checkout, they REQUIRED additional tasting room fees that came out to $140. (On Groupon, they write: "Wine tastings not included but available for an additional fee", so this is misleading.) In total, that comes out to about $85/person, which is MORE than they are currently charging per person on their website ($73 during their "summer sale"). Let me save you some time!

reviews.author: Frank R.
reviews.description: At first I didn't think it was going to be a big boat, more like a pontoon I was thinking but when my friend and I got there we were amazed by how big it actually was. The boat party didn't have as many people as it usually does but we got to know a bunch of cool people and had a great time! The crew was amazing and our host was the best. Lost a beer in the lake and one of the crew members lassoed it bag to the boat haha.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: On October 27, 2019, I went on a Boat Bash tour with some of my Yelp Elite Crew, "The Plus Ones" (an event created by us not associated with Yelp in any way). We spent the last warm October day on a two-story party barge out on Lake Travis. On this tour we were able to sit back and soak in the sun.  This tour is BYOB so there was no shortage of beverages that my crew and I enjoyed. The vast majority of this boat tour, we were docked, which I did not expect.   Boat Facts:  This is a 4 hour boat excursion.  This boat offered a slide at the top of the boat for those who wished to slip and slide into the waters of Lake Austin. Float Noodles are afforded. The boat is Bluetooth compatible so you can bring your own music to be played on the boat speaker system. Burgers are made on the boat (albeit greasy ones).  At the end of the tour, you and your crew are given Texas Winos Schwag.   Synopsis:  My crew and I had a good time but I would not recommend this tour if you are looking to go around Lake Travis as the tour is fairly stationary. In addition, if you have an aversion to greasy or heavy foods (like the burgers prepared on the boat), bring your own eats like I did. Total spent for this outing (not including tip) $29.00. This tour is what YOU make it.

reviews.author: Gnet A.
reviews.description: Texas Winos is doing great with coming up with great events like the party barge I recently went on. They grill up some food for you and you're on the boat having fun for 4hrs. You can bring your own drinks and cooler with whatever you want to bring in but try not to bring glass. Richard is very thorough with his planning and provides you with all and any info you may need to make sure you have nothing to worry and have everything you need.   This is not the first time I have been to one of his events. I have been to a wine tour that I loved and those that joined me as well. Ive also been to a wino fest which was held at the sterling event venue and that offered so many wineries to taste from along with what you can pair them with. They have so many different events and tours that you cant go wrong with any of them. It depends on what you're looking for and what vibe you want plus you always get some kind of swag/souvenirs.   I definitely recommend you try one of his events. You'll enjoy it all.

reviews.author: Nikki M.
reviews.description: Wanted to book a tour for my upcoming birthday and there were several offers online which confused me about the cost. I submitted an email for clarification and was assisted by Richard, he was AMAZING. He went above and beyond, offering my group the lowest rate, set up a link just for my party, and was very attentive. He was the epitome of true customer service...I can't wait to tour!

reviews.author: Elina J.
reviews.description: I have booked with these guys a few times and love their events! Richard is especially great with accommodating and taking care of anything you need. Highly recommend for any occasion!

reviews.author: Celia G.
reviews.description: The boat bash was so much fun! My group absolutely loved it. We're already planning another event. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Zach R.
reviews.description: Always a blast to cruise out and drink some wine with Texas Winos! If you're thinking about doing a tour with them, just do it! You wont regret it! Richard is the man and has always been extremely helpful when booking large groups. Can't wait until the next one!

reviews.author: Abbey G.
reviews.description: Winos barge was horriblleeeeeee!!!! We asked to be put on aux and they refused even though we sold out the entire boat....playing old songs and nothing we could vibe to and just being rude because we already paid. Just bad customer service in general. The other boat next to us had their music so loud we couldn't even hear our music and winos didn't care to help us make our music louder or even accommodate us. They don't believe in playing swear words or music before the 2000's it just was kinda a bummer bc we had 40 people who paid $29 each for just a burger and a bag of chips and crappy music?????? Idk 10/10 don't recommend

reviews.author: Joohyun W.
reviews.description: Do not recomment and will not return.  I had an amazing experience with Texas Winos in 2014. At that time, the tour was on a nice bus with friendly driver and tour guide. Based on this experience, I had recommended Texas Winos to many people.   Recently (2021) we were looking to do Fredericksburg winery tour so I again recommended to do it with Texas Winos.   The transportion was in a very uncomfortable van with water leaking/dropping out of AC unit that was attached at the back of the van.   The three wineries we visited weren't in Fredericksburg. Two were in Johnson city and one was in a location in between Fredericksburg and Johnson city. Other than the first winery in Johnson City we visitied, the other two wineries we visited didn't have vineyards in sight. They were just two big container area that seemed like where they store wine (so there wasn't any ambience of winery or vineyard. It was just a wine tasting). We didn't even take pictures at those two locations as there really weren't anything pretty or nice to take picture.  The lunch option provided was not the same as what was shown on the web site (there was no salad and the options were different). The lunch was provided at the second winery, which had a dog walking around table to table (begging for food).   Before the third winery, we were informed we will be visiting the brewery since there weren't many people joinning the tour (hence the small van like a super shuttle, the airport transportation van). However, we were only given 20min at the brewery although we were running early.   At the third winery, the driver decided to leave us (and note, there was no guide. So we were all by ourselves without anyone from Texas Winos) to pick up his neighbors from other winery (hence why we were given only 20min at the brewery). We were stranded at the 3rd location (which again didn't have any vineyard in sight to walk around or take pictures while we were waiting) just waiting for the driver to return long after the wine tasting was over. This eventually led us to get back to Austin later than expected.   I regret not checking reviews online before recommending this place. I had an amazing time couple years ago but it was the worst experience this time around. We were all just wanting to get back to Austin. There were many vineyards around that had nice ambience and pretty views but the second and thirs winery we went to were the ones that we honestly wouldn't have gone ourselves as they weren't really vineyards but just container area providing wine tasting.    Overall, not worth it.

reviews.author: Yery C.
reviews.description: First time doing a wine tour and we had a blast. Ronnie was amazing!! His energy is everything wouldn't want anyone else. The wine was sooo good. We had a blast most definitely book again n hopefully we have him again.

reviews.author: Brandy W.
reviews.description: Planned a girl's weekend, and a Texas Winos boat excursion was top on our list of things to do while in Austin. Boy oh boy did they not disappoint! The staff was kind, attentive, and accommodating. When I went down the slide, the captain recognized I had a little trouble in the water. He ensured I was safe. I was impressed by his attentiveness.  We had so much fun we went on the very next tour. I took my rod and reel and some bait.  Here  fishy  fishy

reviews.author: Jackson J.
reviews.description: There bus was great the driver was even better and we had a all around great time I highly recccomend this company if you are looking for a party.

reviews.author: William O.
reviews.description: Complete waste of money. To start they were over a half hour late. Then when they finally arrived the bus was dirty, falling apart and no A/C so it felt like we were in a sauna the whole time. Go somewhere else... anywhere else.

reviews.author: Whitney D.
reviews.description: Definitely recommend Austin Party Bus if you're looking for a party bus in Austin! Our group rented the 18 passenger bus for 13 people so we'd have a little extra space. Bus was on time and communication before hand was clear. Bus was clean and they had water and ice available when we got on.

reviews.author: James D.
reviews.description: We rented from these guys for a Bachelor Party and they were absolutely wonderful. It was a last-minute decision to book a bus so we ended up having two drivers, because they had to scheduled something at the last minute, and both were entirely friendly, professional and helpful. We wanted to find a bar with a mechanical bull and they helped us track one down. There communication was perfect, it was always easy to reach them and they were super flexible at the end of the night, allowing us to extend our trip for as many hours as we wanted for an hourly rate. In the end we only stayed out another hour, and they gave us the extra hour for free. Also, because it was a late booking, they offered us their 25 person bus for the 20 person bus rate.  The sound system was enough to give everyone permanent hearing loss and the dancing pole and hand holds proved to be incredibly robust and secure!  These guys are AWESOME, and I would DEFINITELY book from them again in a heartbeat.

reviews.author: Candyce W.
reviews.description: I booked this company for a surprise birthday celebration and I am so happy I did! Diana helped coordinate the stops and was patient in answering all my questions regarding planning. Kathy, the driver, was so sweet, great with communication, and being on time picking us up and dropping us off. The bus was super nice and everyone had a blast! I would recommend this company to anyone!

reviews.author: Philiph S.
reviews.description: My gf booked this bus for my birthday and we had an amazing time. The bus had great amenities and the driver was awesome! The kicker subwoofer and sound system was incredible. We had a blast and will definitely use this company again!!

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: THESE GUYS ARE AWESOME! The bus arrived 15 minutes early and Peter answered all my questions every time I called. My bus driver was great and kept in touch with me through out the night. And, the bus was great! Good stereo system, cool lighting, and lots of ice and cups and all that good stuff. I will definitely be using these guys again for my next big event! They made my 22nd birthday a huge success (they did all of this on Halloween night!).

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: Do not book with this Bus Company. They are a scam. We booked a bus and they never showed up. They have terrible communication for THEIR mistakes! Very disappointing and terrible service. Christopher is extremely rude and unprofessional. Do not waste your money or your time. If I could give them 0 stars I would.

reviews.author: Gillian G.
reviews.description: This company WILL rip you off. Terrible costumer service and refuses to give refunds for a bus that never showed up. DO NOT USE THIS SERVICE. I would give 0 stars if I could. Just horrible.

reviews.author: Brooke D.
reviews.description: SO MUCH FUN! Our group requested a bus for a river float birthday party! Our driver was extremely nice and funny. He actually gave us his cell number to call at anytime for pickup. We were able to dance and play music as loud as we wanted! The cooler was filled with tons of water and ice. They had Vegas style lights and a dance pole. It was so much fun that I will be booking for my bachelorette party!

reviews.author: randy e.
reviews.description: Terrible communications.  I sent in a request for more info but they never contacted me.  I replied to the email requesting a Yelp review with me telling me them that they never responded to my inquiry and that they didn't want me to post a review.  Now I've received two more requests to review them, so here's their review.

reviews.author: Annessa A.
reviews.description: We took a party bus this weekend to San Marcos for a river float and I am just blown away by how great this company was! Our driver was so accommodating and great. The bus itself was roomy and nice. They also provided ice, cups and water for the bus ride. Overall - everyone in my party was extremely pleased with our trip and experience with Austin Party Bus. We will definitely be using this company again next time we are in Austin! Thanks for making our Labor Day weekend an unforgettable one!

reviews.author: Vanessa M.
reviews.description: DO NOT hire this bus company. They will rip you off. Christopher needs to learn how to run a business and he needs to learn about customer service. He took our money and left us stranded because he never showed up to pick us up. Completely unprofessional and rude!

reviews.author: Sally M.
reviews.description: I called this business to inquire about a party bus rental. When I started to ask general questions, the man on the phone (unfortunately I did not get his name), kept telling me to refer to the website. When i asked him if he could please tell me his thoughts on how long the bus was needed for, etc over the phone because it was easier for me to do as I could not look at my phone at the time, he very rudely said "I just don't understand why you can't just look this up on our website."   I do not think it is too much to ask to provide basic information over the phone, and the snarky, rude comment was completely uncalled for and one of the more unprofessional customer service experiences I have had. Needless to say, I will not be using Austin Party Bus for my transportation.

reviews.author: Tara D.
reviews.description: Booked a limo bus to take 23 people to float the Guadalupe River in New Braunfels, six hours round trip.    Bus: The rate was so much better than every other place I found that I worried the bus would be shabby.  Not so.  Bench-style limo seating, hardwood floors, good sound system, and a pole for dancing.  My birthday guests were all impressed.   Service: Our driver Mike quickly answered every question I had in the weeks leading up to the event (and I had a lot).  He gave us an excellent rate, arrived on time, and was very polite and accommodating.  We were a loud, rowdy birthday crew, but he never seemed to mind.  The first toob place we visited was sold out, so he called another and even got us a group rate!    Overall: Very happy, no complaints.  I plan a few different party buses every year, and I will be using Sixth Street Rides from now on.

reviews.author: dana p.
reviews.description: My last memory of this bus involved a loud rendition of Wilson Phillips "Hold On" while grow-ups swung around the "dance pole." Indeed, this party bus was an excellent party on wheels.

reviews.author: Ari E.
reviews.description: I haven't even used the bus yet, but I've already had an excellent experience in customer service. Mike was incredibly accommodating for me and my group! I'll update my review in a few days once we actually use the bus, but I can definitely speak on the customer service being on point.

reviews.author: Sara W.
reviews.description: We purchased a MooLaLa deal for a 5hr wine tour from Sixth Street Rides for up to 15 people.  The deal was supposed to end before we were able to get the group together but Sixth Street Rides was very accommodating on extending our deal to March (2 months after the deal was supposed to expire).  Mike handled our requests including moving the date and giving us suggestions on where to go with complete respect and professionalism.  I received a confirmation the day before as well as our driver, Chris,  called us 20 mins before our pick up time.  We had a couple hiccups (including running late - as 15 girls tend to do - as well as running late at our last winery stop) but Chris handled it with the utmost patience and ease.    Honestly I couldn't have asked for a better company to use for our wine tour.  I highly recommend Chris and Matt over at Sixth Street Rides.

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: "I had such an amazing 21st birthday party with Austin Party Bus. It's almost a year later and my friends still talk about how much fun they had. They all want party busses for their birthdays/graduation parties. My only complaint was the A/C did not work from the get go of the ride, my birthday was in May so it was pretty hot on that 22 person bus, but no one had a stroke so it was still a good time. Just make sure you get a bus with an A/C. Other than that, no complaints about this company. Driver was on time (11:00), and took us wherever we wanted to go. We had the bus for 4 hours which was more than enough time. Spent an hour or so on the bus, got dropped off down town for 2 hours, then rode it for the last hour and dropped people off back in west campus. It was perfect!"

reviews.author: Zachary P.
reviews.description: The driver was punctual and very accommodating.  This is the first time I have ever rented a party bus but when I need one again, Austin Party Bus will be the first place I look.

reviews.author: Cherie S.
reviews.description: Whether you're planning the most memorable party experience, an unforgettable winery excursion, a super-fun mural tour or an exciting tubing trip down the river, you will definitely have the absolute BEST time with Experience Austin! And, those are just a few examples of their offerings (the ones I have been lucky to experience so far)!   Nancy and her team take care of absolutely everything, and Nancy will think of all the details you never even knew were possible to make your experience an amazing one that you'll never forget!

reviews.author: Destani R.
reviews.description: I've been on quite a few tours (floating the river, wine tour, hiking, Christmas party bus...just to name a few) and I've always had the BEST of times! Nancy is top notch and knows exactly how to create an unforgettable experience. It's a great way to bond with friends, new and old. I highly recommend, you'll leave w a smile and tons of pictures to look back and reminisce. Cheers

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: Nancy helped plan and organize my gf's 40th birthday which was absolutely amazing!!! She set up such a unique and amazing experience for all of us to enjoy while making the process seamless. Highly highly recommend, you'll be impressed!!!!

reviews.author: Brianna W.
reviews.description: My friend and I had a great time on the murals your. They showed us all the hot spots for murals, tourist attractions, and local eating spots. It became a mini Austin tour. The tour included a large number of famous Austin murals all over town with a brief history of each one. We were so happy with our tour, I highly recommend this tour!

reviews.author: Mallory S.
reviews.description: This was the very first thing we did when we got to Austin and I'm so glad we did! We saw beautiful murals, our driver and guide was excellent with helping us take pictures and had AMAZING recommendations for food and activities in Austin (we even went to his recommendation for dinner and it was fabulous). Smalls groups so you don't spend forever waiting for all of the group to get done with the pictures, luxury van to toodle around in, first-timers should definitely do this!

reviews.author: Naomi S.
reviews.description: Look this was so worth the money! Definitely a great girls trip idea for those from out of stay. The driver was amazing and very professional.

reviews.author: Deb M.
reviews.description: Very disappointing experience! We booked the Waco trip on  Monday for Wednesday my husband gave our credit card. They were to text our receipt and confirmation to us. When we didn't receive anything, my husband went back on Tuesday and the tour person said we were scheduled for Tuesday and they were leaving! We only had Wednesday available and made that very clear. My husband was unable to get a confirmation we would be credited or not charged. He was given Nancy Palo to contact and have not heard from her 4 hours later. I wouldn't use this tour company and remember to always get everything in writing by any means before you leave the establishment. Very very poor experience.

reviews.author: Mbolle E.
reviews.description: The staff was amazing. It was a little confusing when it came to finding the buses for the shuttle because the instructions weren't really clear. However, I'm giving this a one star because on the shuttle while performing karaoke the staff allowed a white passenger to say various racial slurs on the mic without immediately removing the woman away from the microphone, they didn't even attend to condemn or stop her. At the very least they could have stoped karaoke or stopped playing songs that allowed people to say those slurs so loudly and confidently. As the only black person on the bus it was extremely uncomfortable and dealt with inappropriately. Don't plan on ever using their services again.

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: It was a great experience doing the mural tour with Veronica! She knew her knowledge as well as adding some personal experiences in it. Or made my girlfriend and I felt like we were from Austin. I'm glad we had the chance to do it. Thank you!

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: We did the day trip from Austin to Waco (Magnolia Market).  Had a great driver (Victoria) who was so sweet and accommodating.  Had a great time!

reviews.author: Nicole J.
reviews.description: Mural tour of Austin was fun, informative, and beautiful! Victoria was our tour guide and she was very personable, attentive, knowledgeable, and accommodating. She offered to take photos for us in front of the various murals and she is an awesome photographer! We had a lot of fun and will use Tour Austin to go on more tours soon!

reviews.author: Jacqueline S.
reviews.description: Our Tour Guide, Markie, was absolutely fun, knowledgeable, and extremely helpful with information and answering questions.  She was flexible with timing and made our schedule to accommodate what we wanted to see and do.  She listens well, makes suggestions, and is an excellent driver.  Book this trip!  You will really enjoy it!

reviews.author: Samantha S.
reviews.description: The Austin Hop On Hop Off was a great way to see the city with added history along the way.

reviews.author: Kevin B.
reviews.description: I had a terrible experience with Tour Austin. We had booked 2 tickets for a bus departing at 3:30 PM. Upon arrival (15 minutes early), we were told the bus was full. We ended up being forced to wait until 5 PM before departing and missed a good portion of the concert we were being shuttled to.  Additionally, we were separated from the rest of our group who had boarded the 3:30 shuttle seconds earlier. The concert began at 5 PM. It was clear that passengers who had booked later ticket times were given our seats on the 3:30 PM shuttle instead of us.   Upon departure from the concert, the bus location changed several times which caused a ton of confusion amongst the passengers.   To top it off, repeated attempts to reach out to Tour Austin to remedy the situation have failed.  They have continued to ignore my emails regarding the issues but seem to be able to still send me emails asking for a Yelp rating, so here it is...  Update: owner has reached out and refunded tickets

reviews.author: Bette L.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our Austin Selfie City tour with driver Dash and guide Cierra.. They were very patient and answered all of our questions, did not rush us and gave us time at the various murals to talk about what was the story behind the mural as well as some local gossip! They were easy to engage in discussions about Texas, history, places to go, etc... we were looking for a street Art tour but we actually got so much more... the tour traversed the city so we got the flavor of how different each neighborhood is. They were very knowledgeable about music venues, restaurants and bars ... well worth taking this tour. Marty and Bette, NY, NY

reviews.author: Jesse R.
reviews.description: We were very pleased with the services provided by the Tour Austin shuttle to the Austin360 Amphitheater July 26, 2019. We felt safe with Ken, our driver. He was amicable, friendly and engaging and entertained us by playing music of the artist we were about to see, Beck.  On the return trip he once again played music, this time it was classic rock tunes that we all sang along with. Thank you Ken and thank you Tour Austin, we will use you again.

reviews.author: Kirsten K.
reviews.description: I went on a private tour of wine country and it was absolutely amazing! Tour Austin put together a wonderful customized tour that included all of my favorite types of wine. Our driver Delisha was knowledgeable and very friendly and the car was comfortable! I highly recommend taking a private tour through Tour Austin!

reviews.author: Rocio R.
reviews.description: It is an awesome experience! I wish they could sell beer at the bus that's the only thing.

reviews.author: Nakeisha I.
reviews.description: The ABSOLUTELY worst!!! Me and 8 of my friends booked the Fredericksburg Winery Tour for Valentines weekend. When we booked the trip no one said there would be an extra cost once you got to the shuttle in Fredericksburg so that was a lil confusing, but ok, disappointed but we can still enjoy ourselves. Wait 1st off, We left a little late but no big deal, then we get there and there is the extra "no tell" charge issues, no big deal. We walk the district have a great time back on the bus we'll within the time frame. However, the tour guide not only made us wait and extra 30 mins for 2 other ppl, but we had to sit through CONSTANT arguing about it. We finally leave and THE MOST repulsive individual strung together profanity from Fredericksburg to Austin in a non-stop fashion. The tour guide never asked him to calm down, or to show a little respect for other people in such close quarters....noooo he joined in. They talked about everything from carrying a knife to giving away 15 different types of "weed!!" I nor my friends and everybody we can tell in AUSTIN will EVER take Austin Tours again. I know we keep Austin "weird" but the amount of $ we paid for this trip should allow a certain amount of customer service. So sad- we are still PISSED!

reviews.author: D C.
reviews.description: Great Experience! We used this service from Austin to Fredericksburg for a wine tour. Driver was on time and very helpful in making sure we made it to all of our wine reservations. Bus was clean and they transported us as if we were precious cargo. Would use this service again.

reviews.author: Sara W.
reviews.description: Here's how I describe my "George" experience- fun, exceptional service and above all else a really caring and wonderful person. I found him while I was searching for a driver to pick us up from NOLA at the end of my husbands birthday trip and he went above and beyond them ever since. Recently he waited hours for me at the airport while my flight was cancelled and I barely got on a standby flight landing at 2 am. George was there to pick me up when I was completely exhausted. I am so grateful! Thank you George.

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: George was awesome!  I booked an all day wine tour for a group of 5 and he made the experience perfect.  Here is what we experienced:  excellent communication, professionalism, great customer service, timeliness, easy-going attitude, clean vehicle, comfort, convenient amenities (charging cords), and fair pricing.  Thanks for an amazing day, George!  I highly recommend him and Watson Limos.

reviews.author: Lynn N.
reviews.description: Great service. Excellent drivers and system. Highly professional. Schedule accurately. Arrive early. Safe driving. Clean vehicles. Completely recommend.

reviews.author: Tony G.
reviews.description: In town for MotoGP weekend. Switched to Watson limo from utilizing random Lyft drivers. Wow. You get what you pay for. Our driver, Denis, was a gem. A true tour guide and storyteller. Let's add friend to the list now.  Denis was able to get us in and out of Circuit of the America's in minutes on Sunday. Whereas, on Saturday, the random Lyft drivers took 30+ minutes navigating through the thickest traffic. There is much less traffic on Saturday versus Sunday. Hats off to George and Denis of Watson Limosine. Great job gentlemen.

reviews.author: Jamie F.
reviews.description: THE ABSOLUTE BEST! George was so awesome for an all day private wine tour for myself and my girlfriends. Had such a great day, I have now used him for 2 work trips group sizes up to 30 people. Which were executed flawlessly the entire work trip. Thank you George and Dennis

reviews.author: Suzanne M.
reviews.description: We recently went to COTA (Circuit of the Americas) for my daughter's 13th Birthday to see Imagine Dragons. Understanding how chaotic it can be parking and then leaving when the event is over, we decided to hire a car service. We secured a nice Suburban with Watson Limousines of Austin. I briefly mentioned to George what we were celebrating. When he showed up to pick us up he rolled up in the Party Bus with flowers and sparkling cider along with champagne glasses for my daughter, with Imagine Dragons playing and lights going. It was so Awesome. It made my daughter's 13th Birthday something she will never forget. For anyone that has ever been to COTA, it is extremely chaotic getting to the stage and especially leaving. Normally, walking very long distances. George took all of that away for us. He dropped us off and picked us up at places that most services are unable to which put are walking to a minimum. He made our whole experience PERFECT!!! Thank you so much to George and Watson Limousines of Austin.

reviews.author: Mark G.
reviews.description: Great 2 Hour tour with Jax as our guide. The bus  was comfortable, and we saw many of the local districts,.  Jax was excellent and gave us all tips on sightseeing, music venues, shopping, eating and unique local drinking establishments.  Highly recommended as the first thing you do in Austin to learn where you want to spend your time!

reviews.author: Annie W.
reviews.description: So very glad we went with this tour!! We were able to see all the main attractions for the city, as well as quite a few hidden gems we normally would have missed on our own. Our tour guide, Ike, was very knowledgeable about the city and had a wicked sense of humor. He was able to get everyone on the tour engaged and even remembered a few things about our home states to tie in to whatever attraction we were visiting. I would highly recommend this tour for anyone visiting Austin for the first time. Well worth the money!!

reviews.author: Feri J.
reviews.description: I took city of Austin tour with Even Ford  Was a great and fun tour with lots of interesting and informative information . Thanks Even

reviews.author: Vivian C.
reviews.description: My friends and I joined Austin Detours through a travel agency on the last day of our trip to Austin.  We met Marty and Tray at the visitor center and instantly felt welcomed for our BBQ and wine tasting tour!  Our group was small and Marty was very accommodating with getting us back to downtown to catch our flight home.  On the drive, Marty shared stories and knowledge of the bats under Congress bridge and the history of Salt Lick.  After our delicious meal at Salt Lick, Marty was able to get us access to the pit for photos.  Our 2 wine tasting stops were awesome.  We had enough time to enjoy each sip and take pictures of the establishments.  Next time I'm in Austin, I'll book another tour!  Thanks for the memories!

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: My husband and I did the BBQ and wine tasting tour. Marty was an amazing tour guide! He explained the BBQ process for various Austin BBQ establishments, which was very interesting, and also explained the wine making process. He gave recommendations for some of his favorites at each venue we visited and also ensured we got pictures. From the moment we met Marty, he was enthusiastic and had a ton of energy, so we knew we were in good hands. After the tour, he took the time to mark events in a local paper which were of interest to us during our remaining time in Austin. Marty and Austin Detours helped start our trip off on the right foot. We highly recommend this company!

reviews.author: Rachel F.
reviews.description: I did the Real Austin tour with Rose and the art tour with Chris. It was actually Rose's first solo tour and she was amazing at including everyone, keeping it interactive, and maintaining interest even though it was freezing. Most tours in other places just kind of lecture you but she was definitely more of an inviting conversationalist :) with Chris i was actually the only person that signed up for the tour so I got a more personalized view of Austin street art haha. His passion is obvious when he explains the stories behind the art and i learned soo much. I definitely recommend both tours because not only was it super fun but a car is the best way to see all of the random spots throughout Austin. Thanks Rose and Chris!

reviews.author: Cat G.
reviews.description: Ike took us on a fantastic Street Art Tour of Austin. He was friendly and pleasant  as well as super knowledgeable about all of the murals we saw. Being an artist himself, Ike was passionate about what public art means to a city. Would totally recommend this tour!

reviews.author: Josh I.
reviews.description: Our guide was Brent Bellinger. He was fantastic. He took us to 3 awesome venues that were all different with great live music. He gave us a ton of information about the city, venues, and restaurants that will help us better enjoy this wonderful city.  Thanks Brent!

reviews.author: Meg B.
reviews.description: Did the 2 hour daily tour with Ike and it was so much fun! You get to see a lot of the classic sights of Austin, but your tour can also be tailored a bit to interests of the group! It was super interactive and a fun way to spend two hours!

reviews.author: Liz S.
reviews.description: Can't say enough good things about the live music tour we took. Bobby S was the perfect guide-full of personality (the right amount), knowledge, and passion for his job. He kept us in time so we didn't miss anything and picked out fabulous music and venues to take us to. I would do this again in a heartbeat if I make it back to Austin.

reviews.author: Sharon W.
reviews.description: Steven was an amazing tour guide.  We took the tour on a Sunday morning and got to see the Capitol building without crowds and got around to many areas of the city with the ease of someone who knows the city inside and out.  Steven knows his stuff so well and adds his own professional level of humor to make the tour even more fun.  We found out about lots of places we will go on our next trip to Austin.  We took his recommendation for where to hear live music and enjoyed the afternoon at Saxon Pub.  After riding through various areas and get the lay of the land I was more comfortable driving around the city which was a big help for us.  I would recommend this tour to anyone traveling to Austin.  Take it early in your stay in Austin if possible.  Wonderful and worthwhile 2 hours.

reviews.author: J S.
reviews.description: We're locals who decided to play tourists for the day.  The 2 hour Real Austin tour was totally worth it  We had a wonderful time.  I was surprised to learn new things about Austin - I thought I knew it all.  Enjoyed seeing the sights and learning the history.  We love Austin but now I realize how cool Austin is. Thanks to Bobby - he has a great sense of humor and made it very entertaining.  Even our picky teenager loved it.  We'll be checking out the other tours to see what's available.  Go, you won't regret it.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: We had an amazing time! We used this party bus for a bachelorette party! Bus was super clean and fun. Our driver, Jonathan was AMAZING! Took us to picture spots around Austin and took our pictures each time with a smile on his face! We also booked this last minute and Jonathan was super accommodating! 10/10 recommend!

reviews.author: Kalena B.
reviews.description: This tour was amazing! I went with a bachelorette party and we had a lot of fun. Our tour guide was Brandon and he made sure that we were great. We got to play our own music on the ride from Austin and he picked amazing Texas barbecue for our lunch. Every winery we went to was delicious. I would highly recommend it to anyone!

reviews.author: Courtney H.
reviews.description: We had a great experience! We booked on short notice, but had a great time, and Brandon was very accommodating of our last minute trip. Come hungry on your tour because the barbecue lunch provided was spectacular! We were appreciative that Brandon was flexible with our tour schedule and ensured that we had a phenomenal time while on our tour! The tour had a nice mix of small, quaint wineries with an individualized experience, as well as more popular spots with an equally enjoyable guest experience.

name: Keep Austin Wet Party Bus Rentals

reviews.author: Nicki O.
reviews.description: We booked for a bachelorette party wine tasting. I would most definitely recommend these guys!! The whole process was very smooth. Easy to reserve. Prompt pick-up on the day of. The bus was clean and comfortable. They took care of arranging all the stops on our wine tour. James, our driver, was fantastic! Most importantly, we made it home safely! Thanks Austin Wet Bus!!

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.description: Santos set up the perfect wine tasting tour for our party.  The bus was so nice and clean.   Great experience.

reviews.author: Randy M.
reviews.description: Had a blast riding around on the Wet Bus! Booming system and watched The Anchorman on the big TV. The driver Pete was safe and fun throughout the trip while our friends were getting wasted-faced!

reviews.author: a j.
reviews.description: Our group of girls had so much fun on a vineyard tour with Keep Austin Wet!  My driver clearly had everything under control, so I was able to relax with my friends and start the party as soon as we got on the bus!  Our kids were so jealous when they saw the cool bus their moms' were leaving them in!  Honestly, the bus could have driven us anywhere and we would have had a good time, but Santos' attention to picking great vineyards and James' attnetion to keeping us on schedule made everything perfect!  Our group was different than most -- in that we wanted to take it slow and just relax and were not too concerned about whether we made it to all three destinations.  We also had some nursing moms and wanted to be sure everyone was accomodated.  James was very accomodating and once I conveyed that we were more relaxed he made sure we had all the time we needed.  I also felt like the driving was very safe and overall the attention to safety was as it should be.  The price was reasonable, as well.  All in All, Keep Austin Wet made our vineyard tour perfect!

reviews.author: Annie M.
reviews.description: What a great experience! I cannot speak highly enough about Austin Wet Bus. Santos was so enthusiastic about hosting our party, which was a welcome relief as that is not always the response you get from tour companies when you tell them you're a bachelorette party--no matter how well-behaved you may be! Our driver, James, was wonderful and so helpful the entire day, especially at the end when we elected to add another hour and an extra stop; he catered his recommendation to our needs (gluten intolerant guests + casual interest in beer and liquor) and we had an amazing experience. You can't beat the pricing, but for what we paid our experience definitely exceeded every expectation. Thank you so much for everything, and we look forward to using you again in the future!

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: LETS MAKE POUR DECISIONS!   I am in Austin this week for a couple days. We are celebrating christmas as a family here in Austin this year.   My brother and I needed to get some alcohol for my parents before their arrival here tomorrow evening.   This store was very spread out and easy to find exactly what you are looking for. The staff is helpful too and they know where things are in the store too.   I have missed total wine as it is hard to come by when in AL due to liquidity laws. But we do have ABC stores.   I must say that they do card if you appear to be under 30. So myself, my brother and his girlfriend were all carded. But I am taking it as a compliment as yes I do look young.   I think my parent will be happy with what we got for them. :)   If you need an alcohol pick me up or a gift they have amazing gift sets too!   Wonderful experience here!

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Total Wine and More has a wide variety of selections. I usually like to get a bottle of really great champagne for Christmas. After calling a few liquor stores in town, I find Total Wine the most versatile and dependable. More options and items in stock. Highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Joey E.
reviews.description: DO NOT USE ONLINE ORDER DELIVERY.  I recently learned a lesson using Total Wine and More's very ill-partnered delivery service.  Someone brought a wrong order in decent time to my house.  We noticed the erroneous bag together at my doorstep and she proceeded to take the delivery back to the store and my order is subsequently cancelled as I am informed by E-mail.  I wait an entire week and receive a refund 13 dollars less than my original payment.  I have spoken to customer service two weeks ago and they initiated a pass of my complaint to higher authority.  On my end, I have seen the same result as taking no action at all.  I am at a point now where it makes no more sense to spend any more time on getting my 13 dollars back as this as a fraction of what I can make spending that time actually working.  Total Wine online orders get all the thumbs down!

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: Thanks to Total Wine and More for being my go-to spirits supplier during the 'Rona.  I've only had need to use them for bottles of wine for special occasion during the pandemic. It's easy to shop online from their website to pickup curbside. Service is typically quick, accurate, and convenient. Curbside is free with a $35 order; otherwise a minimal service charge applies.  They were already my inside favorite based on the wonderful in-store atmosphere and experience. Being a solid citizen and not putting my health at risk to purchase adult beverages during the pandemic has won them a fan for life.

reviews.author: Curtis G.
reviews.description: In general, this is a good store to meet your wine and spirits needs.   However, today I noticed that they have added a junk charge for same day pickup - I am thinking that another store may want my business

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: 5 stars for this Total Wine location where I felt like the manager Robert became my best friend lol.  Came in here during Coronavirus and had a few odd items I couldn't find. An employee directed me to another employee who turned out to be the manager, and he personally walked me around the store and gave me his own personal opinions on which bottles to get. Amazing. This guy was super knowledgeable and helpful. I already love Total Wine as a brand and this location is now my favorite. I just wish this was the closest Total Wine to me!

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: If you are like me my drink of choice changes with the seasons, moods I have, and sometimes based on what holiday(s) are coming up. Total Wine is THE best place to come if you are like me - curious, excited to try something new, looking for some advice on what else I can try, etc then you have come to the right spot for your libations.  Ask any employee, I dare you, on what they suggest after telling them what you like. They will point you to some solid suggestions and even walk you over to that area where it is located. Total Wine has some very knowledgeable employees who are willing to walk you through the entire store if you requested that.   The prices are the best in the area for all of it - liquor, beer, wine, mixers, etc.  It's a one stop shop where you just might end up finding a cooler-than-the-one-you-have-at-home cocktail shaker or wine stoppers too.   Also, if you are looking to put together a gift last minute come here.  They have it all - bags, gift sets, tape, cute decor for bars, and whatnot here. It's super easy to roll up, park, and strut in to get a really cool and curated gift if you ask for some help.

reviews.author: Steve K.
reviews.description: This place is big.  Rows and rows of wines, beer, and liquor.  What I liked best is the hundreds of single beers.  I bought about 10 different IPA beers, and found couple new favorites. Good selection of snacks too.

reviews.author: Meagan B.
reviews.description: WOW! The store was super clean and well stocked. While all of the staff was friendly and asked if we needed help, I need to send a big shout out to Andrew ! He was so helpful with picking out our first bottle I went and searched for him to help pick out the second bottle. He helped us pick out an islay whiskey and a flavored whiskey and I was surprised at how knowledgeable he was on them .   In short nice store and the service was friendly knowledgeable and descriptive. Thanks again to Andrew!!

reviews.author: Harvey X.
reviews.description: A terrific store with (mostly) great selections and prices. I like that they have so many choices for wines and also a huge inventory of distilled spirits... plus quality beers, craft and imports. They've kept up with the mezcal boom, to my joy.  And there's always excellent single-malt Scotch options.  All I'd like to see more of is Greek wines (Kourtaki retsina, please!) and Portuguese madeira.  I still have to go to Spec's for those.     A tip of the hat to excellent and helpful staff. I always look for Belle up front, she is a delight!  I hope she's appreciated, managers!

reviews.author: Paul D.
reviews.description: Total Wine is a pretty nice liquor store where the store layout is very organized.  It also feels a little high end with taste testings and product placements.   They have a wide selection of liquor, wine, and beer.  I even found some exotics like moonshine from the TV show 'Moonshiners'.  And carry many local Austin and Texas brands.   My trip included finding a nice bottle of Rosé, bourbon and a few mini single serving bottles to sample. The staff was very nice.  For Texas residents they have a rewards program and a phone app.

reviews.author: P S.
reviews.description: Of all the wine and spirits store's I frequent, this store has the friendliest and most helpfull staff. The prices are great and the selection is good.

reviews.author: Xavier M.
reviews.description: #1 place to pickup my Beer and Spirits but what brings their score down for me is their shelf pricing on the beer side...seems like I alway get the shaft, getting charged more at the register than the price on the shelf...Beware, don't trust their price integrity, always verify.   I'm sure it's not on purpose, just poor manual processes...no checks and balances and I've seen it many times since they've been open...

reviews.author: Gur A.
reviews.description: Big shout out to manager Robert, who was extremely helpful with my situation, that happened on my last visit. He fully trusted me and didnt question or doubt me. Also your prices are best among the all the chain retailer we have around here. I was glad when Total Wine started in Austin / TX area. It was my fav store when i lived in Plantation FL 6-7 yrs ago.

reviews.author: Kyra H.
reviews.description: I wish I could make it 10 stars, no 20 stars, no endless stars! If I'm not home, I'm probably at Total! It is my home away from home.  My husband and I discovered Total Wine while living in California. Our store there was one that we went to every Saturday with our dog and we knew everyone who worked there. We were sad to be moving back to Austin because we didn't think there was a Total here. After a quick search, we found out there was this one on Brodie. We used to live north, but would make the trek down every weekend to see them. Now that we live south, we are there all the time.  We now have two dogs and they are the store mascots. Their picture is literally on the front door! When we walk in, us and the girls are welcomed with open arms.  Lisa is the best at working the wine tastings. She can tell you anything you want or need to know. Laurie is the sweetest and so helpful! Bob is always giving us the best recommendations. I wish I could name everyone, but will work on updating this review as I remember everyone's names. We feel like family when we are there. Total is the ONLY liquor store in my book. I have brought so many people to Total and they have nothing but nice things to say. They are helpful; if you can't find something they know exactly where it is. If they don't have it, they will see what they can do to get it in store. Their prices can't be beat! They are very knowledgeable; if you ask someone a question they don't know they will work endlessly to find the answer and store it for helping others in the future. I literally can't say enough about Total and their promise to hire amazing employees.

reviews.author: Hannah C.
reviews.description: Popped into Total Wine today to get the provisions for the coming corona zombie apocalypse and was browsing the wine section when I was approached by a very young looking TW team member named Gracie.  HOLY COW! Not only did this young woman have a deep deep knowledge of every varietal and suggestions on labels in a variety of price ranges- but she help me select a case of assorted wines, but wouldn't let me leave without one of her favorite bottles of Syrah.   When I was checking out at the cashier, she asked "Gracie helped you, didn't she? She has an encyclopedic knowledge of wines and impeccable taste."  Well, I just cracked open that bottle of Syrah and BLAMMO. I'm hooked.

reviews.author: Raine C.
reviews.description: Lupe, the front end manager, was SO HELPFUL!!!! I was looking for a small bag that fit the mini alcohol bottles for a gift and he walked around the whole store and gave us a bag that worked perfectly. Such an awesome guy!!! Thanks Lupe!!!

reviews.author: Amanda K.
reviews.description: I use to check out Total Wine and More a lot when I lived in the DC metro area. I even attended a sweet Yelp wine and beer tasting event there in Fairfax, VA about two years ago.Total Wine sold me at that event and I was able to get some of my favorite beers. I love the fact I could do a mix and match 6 pack of anything I wanted.   Anyway, I wasn't feeling like Spec's on this particular day and wanted to see how Texas does Total Wine and more. Texas does it right. I was in awe and bewilderment as I toured the store. I ended up with of course more than I needed but no worries there.   I will note I found something there called a pocket shot. A pocket shot is made of plastic and looks like a Capri Sun container. It would of have been great to take to ACL the other weekend. So if you want to sneak or smuggle booze in I recommend buying those pocket shots.

reviews.author: Monique H.
reviews.description: Everyone has their favorite place to go and stock their bar. I've been a fan of Total Wine and More since they came to Austin. The staff is always friendly and I've never been steered wrong with a wine recommendation. I love that they have lots of tastings on the weekends and most recently, I went to one of their formal tastings with Orin Swift wines. It was more than works the $20 ticket price and I added to my wine knowledge base (and tasted delicious wines).

reviews.author: Ashley V.
reviews.description: Walking into this place can either be exciting or overwhelming depending on who you are I suppose. I had the latter experience. No worries though, Bob came to the rescue. He asked me a few simple questions and then helped me find 3 great red wines all under $20 a bottle.   Had the first one last night and it did NOT disappoint!   Bob rocks. That is all

reviews.author: Erin Y.
reviews.description: Our group had a great experience with 360 Transportation this weekend! We needed rides for our Fredericksburg winery tour and Lake Travis boat party, and Jerral pulled through with punctual transportation at the best prices I could find!   Jerral was easy to coordinate with and even when there was a small hiccup with our ride back from the lake, he was communicative and very professional. He also went above and beyond with helping one of our group members re-park their car after we had already departed for the lake! The vehicles we rode in were also nice and clean.   Overall, our weekend wouldn't have been a success without 360 Transportation and I'll definitely be contacting them for any party bus/transportation needs in the future!!

reviews.author: Karla B.
reviews.description: We leased a mini bus to take us to and from the Rolling Stones show at COTA in November.  Jerral was helpful and worked with our schedule and requirements.  Our driver, AJ, was pleasant and patient and we were all very grateful for and appreciative of their expertise. Recommend!!

reviews.author: Morgan G.
reviews.description: Amazing night out with 360 Transportation. Aron was a wonderful driver and we loved the night out we had thanks to him and Jerral. I would recommend to anyone looking for professional transportation. Thank you!

reviews.author: Peter O.
reviews.description: They were 45 minutes late and didn't bother to communicate. I had to call them then they were late pick us up as well. Lost 30 minutes on the lake due to them being late.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: I can't express enough how great of a job 360 Transportation did for my girlfriends surprise birthday trip. I had only scheduled two places to go but the owner recognized that we'd be very close to one of the best wineries in dripping springs and suggested we also go there as well. It was definitely the highlight of the evening and I'm so glad he recommended it. The driver was on time and courteous, he had no problem stopping for bathroom breaks to and from our destination. I'll be definitely using them for a upcoming business happy hour I have planned in two months. If you are looking for transportation at an excellent price they are a must in the Austin area.

reviews.author: Justin S.
reviews.description: Great experience! Jerral was easy to communicate with, the bus was great, our group of 17 easily fit with room to spare

reviews.author: Phillip S.
reviews.description: We ordered a limo bus for my daughter's wedding. The bus was beautiful, clean, on time and the driver was courteous. I could not of had a better experience for the guests that rode the bus to the wedding and back to the hotel.

reviews.author: Lizzy O.
reviews.description: Excellent service! Awesome driver! On time and super friendly!! Made the drive to us in Wimberly on a last minute basis. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Chris E.
reviews.description: Very nice place, I came from California to try. Staff was nice, bathrooms were clean and the beer was great!

reviews.author: Dana T.
reviews.description: Love this place. Lots of good options. I think 8.5 minutes abs is even better than electric jellyfish.  The people that work there are great! Also they host watch parties for Austin FC. Go Verde!

reviews.author: Nancy Z.
reviews.description: Always a great time here! They have Meade, to hop water to yummy Lovely Day IPA.  Clean place and clean toilets.   Don't forget to check out their food truck!

reviews.author: Rosie J.
reviews.description: Such a fun place to hang out and grab a beer and some food! The hopwater is an awesome option if you don't want to drink but still want to have the brewery experience. The food truck was great too and prices are very reasonable.

reviews.author: Casey M.
reviews.description: Great patio that's dog and kid friendly, complete with the Austin Steam Train behind it.

reviews.author: Jake H.
reviews.description: Whitestone Brewery is a great place to grab a beer and relax after work or watch an Austin FC game. They have a large patio for all their events like trivia and bingo and plenty of seating inside. Head here for some great Texas beers.

reviews.author: Jim R.
reviews.description: Awesome brewery!, excellent selection. Amazing atmosphere!, great service and the food from Van Dams is Awesome with great prices. Just became a Pub Member for these reasons!!!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Wow I can't believe I've forgotten to review here. I LOVE their beer and location. Always great beers on rotation and the flight tray is cool.  Only reason for the 4 starts is today we came for what had to be the 6th or 7th  time and got kicked to the outside patio for having a dog. This is ALWAYS the brewery I go to when it's hot because they allowed dogs inside. I've had every other bartender let my dog in, love on him and have had zero problem sitting inside with him. Even their Facebook has a picture of a dog inside. Today we were told that was never allowed and should have been told to go outside. We have also seen many other dogs inside during past visits. I hate inconsistent rules. Also, super sad that we'll have to find a new brewery this summer. It's too hot to be outside and my dogs nickname is the the brewery dog.  I'll still support them during cooler months-- but dog owners should know the rules have changed. Very sad. Wish they would have posted something about this change.

reviews.author: Ryan D.
reviews.description: A nice flight of light non IPA beers. No food. Only a food truck but nice atmosphere indoor/outdoor.

reviews.author: lea c.
reviews.description: Great beer vibe. Plenty of seating inside and outside. Parking kinda sucks.  The menu has a really good range of beers that I haven't seen anywhere else. Beer is cold and food options are good too. We had nachos and loaded tots. The Austin FC bold game was on. They had green beer and if you wore green you got a $1 off

reviews.author: Ellie B.
reviews.description: Phenomenal - amazing brewery atmosphere. Came on a Christmas holiday Friday night they had name that tune bingo going, was so fun to watch! Wish I had known would've joined ASAP  God I love Texas

reviews.author: Alexandra P.
reviews.description: Pretty good ambiance. Spaced out seating inside and outdoor seating available. Place was visibly clean and also smelled very clean! We got loaded tots from the food truck outside that were yummy. All the beers that we tried were good but the mango one was my favorite!

reviews.author: Joyce L.
reviews.description: I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Whitestone Brewery. The environment felt very relaxed and casual and I loved the outside patio area. We got a selection of beers, I personally really enjoyed the Mango Crazy wheat beer and the Keyboard Gansta IPA. The service was also very friendly and they offered some samples if you are in between choices.   The taco truck outside was also very good! I highly recommend one of their loaded fries. The fries were perfectly crispy and tender in the middle, and super flavorful toppings. The tacos were also yummy and I'm a huge corn lover so the elote bowl was perfect.   I will definitely be back to try more of their seasonal beers!

reviews.author: Manasa D.
reviews.description: It's been a hot minute since I visited Whitestone- I think the last time I was here was in 2016, when it was quieter and a lot more laid back.  Fast forward to 2021 - the city of cedar park and Leander are booming.  There is a huge influx of population. The tables at Whitestone are full, there is a food truck (which is awesome) as a permanent fixture BUT the overall customer experience has left me disappointed.  Maybe because it's a Sunday with lovely weather, the guy behind the bar is done with people, or, he isn't a people person , or, he just didn't like the way I looked? But man was it hard to get him to give me an effing beer without getting hateful glances. Yeesh. Im kinda scared of coming back here now!  That aside, im not really a fan of their beer selection either - the kolsch is OK but I've had better. I guess the biggest advantage is the proximity to both CP and Leander and for the people who live around here.  So, this isn't much of a review rather than a semi rant ?   Also guys- kids have a tendency to move around from one side of the table to the other. They're not capable of sitting still and neither are you. If you'd rather than families stay away, just tell us to our faces.

reviews.author: Nicolette M.
reviews.description: Ambiance - 9/10 Pricing - 10/10 Staff - 10/10 Food - 10/10   Overall, the service is great! The ladies behind the counter are very nice and loaded with insights about the beers. There's a food truck outside that was delish!! (Tacos and burgers) the al pastor tacos were amazing. We did not try the burgers but from what I've seen/heard it's also very yummy! Whitestone is in a great location in Cedar Park, TX. We are heading to Balcones state park to go hiking but saw this along the way and had to stop in. I'm glad we did!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Huge covered patio! We stopped by while we were in the area and what a nice brewery to grab a beer at. I had the Blonde beer and it was light and crisp. They had a Food truck hanging outside so if you wanted to partake that was great.   Suggestions- In the guys bathroom the keg should be a little bit higher. Pretty tough for tall guys lol. But, I love the concept.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: Friendly, on top of it staff and great variety in beer. Love the hop water too! We've been coming here since the opening and it just keeps getting better! Love our Whitestone Family!

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: This is a fun place to hang out in Cedar Park but it is in a busy strip mall. The service is good and you can get some beer flights and the prices are very reasonable. My fiancé and I had a good time here and the live music was awesome!  I would definitely go back!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: Great local brewery!  Friendly and helpful staff, great tasting beers and a food truck out back - what else do you need?

reviews.author: Theresa S.
reviews.description: We like IPAs and we were  able to get a beer flight with 6 IPAs - they were all delicious!  Able to take advantage of happy hour which apparently starts at 2pm.  Seems to be a very popular spot!  Love the beer names too.  Lovely Day IPA and Ray Ray hazy IPA were some of our favorites!

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: For a newer-ish brewery this place is definitely headed in the right direction. Sour beers are freaking delish! I wish that they had more food options when you drink and or a bar that you can walk up to, but all good things come to those who wait!!   My second time around I ordered a cheese tray from a local artist and brought it to eat outside. It was perfect. My husband loves their beers and always asks to go their before our date nights! Keep it up Hedgehog!

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Such an awesome place! It's all outdoors with picnic of tables, umbrellas and a few chairs and tables. Dog friendly- they have dog bowls! Pretty flowers and lots of grass for kids to run in. The beer was delicious. I tried 3 five oz pours, all IPAs they were delicious!! You order the beer online and they call you when it's ready. Quick, easy and safe. Will def be back!  They have different food trucks , check their Facebook to see what's there when you're going.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Great addition to breweries in  CP area. Multiple IPA and Farmhouse Ales. Large open patio with picnic benches and yes umbrellas.   They were also cooking up some awesome looking Pad Thai when we visited. Friendly knowledgeable folks and a great beer selection.   CC payment only via their App.  As an FYI this is where the Thousand Oaks brewery was located.

reviews.author: Amy D.
reviews.description: Clean, nice owners, great beer! I've tried a few beers here. My favorite one is Mango Tango! It is very tasty! Mango with some habanero (I believe) it is so good! Come out, you can order on your phone and relax outside in the nice picnic table/table seating area! Come on out and give them a visit! You will not be disappointed!

reviews.author: Matt P.
reviews.description: Fantastic IPA, Farmhouse, and Saison beers on tap. The beer is really fantastic and the mood is mellow. This place will be hopping once the word gets out.  Thank you for the fantastic flavors. The beer is really above par. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Rob R.
reviews.description: Friendly people, high quality rotating  beers, nice outdoor seating. Like a nice neighbourhood space.

reviews.author: Audrey B.
reviews.description: A great place to go on a summer evening! I tried it for the first time Saturday and loved it! The draft choices were great, Crush ended up being my favorite! Chill vibes the whole night and just overall a fun atmosphere!

name: Red Horn Coffee House and Brewing Company
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: A.J. T.
reviews.description: Stumbled upon this place while walking the area as my car was being worked on across the way. Walking in gave me comforting coffeeshop vibes, with mostly tables of small parties 2-3 drinking beer and socializing.  Having no idea what to order, staff made some recommendations for a flight that were all fantastic. My favorites were the Cuerno Rojo (lightly carbonated and very smooth) and the Continental Breakfast (heavier stout but tastes just like French Toast and Maple syrup). I had to do a double take that I wasn't just drinking syrup but the flavors were spot on!  I'll be back again with friends/family and hopefully get to enjoy the great coffee I was smelling as well!

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: Not sure where to fault this place, honestly. First time here and the three beers we tried were excellent: a nitro double IPA, an black ale, and a Czech pilz. The interior ambiance was dark, cozy, and perfect for an intimate convo, remote work, or even games with friends. I have two small children so helped myself to the outdoor covered and heated patio. The kids enjoyed the chips and salsa while we sipped our stellar brews. Excited to try the Leander location that is actually closer to us. 10/10 plan to come back, especially to try the coffee.

reviews.author: David K.
reviews.description: Just wanted to update this one. Red Horn just gets better and better with age and has really turned into a community institution - especially during the pandemic when they switched to "to go" beers that we could all take out to the parking lot and drink while socially distanced. Fortunately those days are past us but I think I will always have a soft spot in my heart for this place that was a little bit of sanity amidst all the insanity.   As for the fare itself? The beers rotate and you can't  go wrong because they will always let you sample (I'm a strawberry pop-tart ravioli fan - and yes that's a beer). Pair that beer (or wine) with a meat and cheese tray or maybe a panini and you have absolutely nothing to complain about. They even have food trucks on most days...  Thanks for being here Red Horn.

reviews.author: Gerald C.
reviews.description: very cool atmosphere with both a brewery and coffee shop vibe mashed together without clashing. I got the Gordon Ramsey coffee and it was obviously made by someone who knows how to craft a latte. I do wish the flavor complimented the espresso more or punched above the espresso. It was too balanced, if that's even a thing. I will definitely return next time i'm in town to see what pieces of coffee art they come up with next!

reviews.author: Mert S.
reviews.description: I liked the ambience, coffee was good. Outdoors seating is great but the generator of the food truck next door was unbearably too loud to enjoy outside, we did not even bother trying. I did not care about the live music either, we were yelling at each other to get our word across the table. We ended up leaving 30 mins after the live music started. That was a Friday night.

reviews.author: Garrett N.
reviews.description: Love me some Red Horn coffee!   The atmosphere and service are both outstanding.  Any questions I had about coffee were answered, the help was super helpful.  Really appreciate the indoor and outdoor seating.  Really live the tables and decor, rustic hand built feel but comfortable.  Snack food is overpriced but everything else is top notch.

reviews.author: Milton C.
reviews.description: We chose Red Horn Coffee after perusing local coffee spots for some good coffee. Red Horn was very highly rated and the photos looked like they offered genuine espresso beverages. Red Horn offered a number of non-dairy options so I would not destroy my stomach on my pending road trip. We ordered Americans with a half inch of steamed oat milk. The coffee was very smooth. The espresso taste was still solid enough that I knew I was drinking espresso. I.e. Not watered down at all. All-in-all a great cup of coffee that hit the spot.

reviews.author: Vincent W.
reviews.description: Superb beer bat and coffee roastery in Cedar Park.  Convenient to HEB and Walmart.    Great service and great coffee!  We will return.

reviews.author: Jenny K.
reviews.description: I'll be back soon!! One of the best coffees I've had, so good I had two during my short stay here. It's hard to find decaf that isn't boring and the decaf here is strong and full of flavor! I even purchased a pound of decaf beans to take home.   I pulled up and my first thought was that the vibe was more brewery than coffee shop and I was right, but I was wrong that the coffee would just be an afterthought. When I went on a Saturday early afternoon, there was a taco truck and people hanging out in the beer garden. Lots of bicyclists and not sure if it's a popular rest stop or because there's a bike shop in the same parking lot or both or something else. Once you step inside there is a giant section of beer taps and beer menu, and a small coffee and pastry menu. They also sell ice cream here which was tempting but I stuck to my americano and later a vanilla latte.   The inside has plenty of socially distanced seating as does the outside and I lucked out with a parking spot right out front. There's a large lot of shared parking for the businesses.   I want to come back to check out their beers!!

reviews.author: Ann Marie M.
reviews.description: Best coffee house in town. Great coffee and they also have beer on tap. Very laid back atmosphere and nice people. No snotty hipsters. Cheese boards, sandwiches are good.

reviews.author: Mel B.
reviews.description: One of our favorite places to grab a few beer. They always excellent elections, we love the space and the people. So beer....good; but man their roasted coffee! We love using their Roadhouse in our French press.

reviews.author: Carrie J.
reviews.description: Sometime I struggle to decide if I want coffee or beer here, and at happy hour I am definitely know to order both! You will not be disappointed.
