They were out of fried salmon (odd bc they had the other way?) or I would have gotten that since you can basically get a shrimp taco anywhere. I'll definitely be back for taco Tuesday again. It was a little cold, I like my food room temperature so it was perfect for me, but I could see someone being disappointed in the temperature of the food. But I'm not knocking off any stars for that since that's how I like my food.

reviews.author: Melissa G.
reviews.description: Came here for dinner on Tuesday night 6/15/21 with some family. I ordered the El Cesar Chavez salad with salmon and when they food came out the first bite I took I was fishing a bone out of my mouth from the salmon. So I started to inspect the rest of the fish and found 3 more bones. I informed our waitress and she kindly had it re made but when the second salmon came out I once again found 2 more fish bones inside.   At this point I did not receive an apology nor did a manager come by to check in to if everything was okay so I asked to speak to one and inform him. The gentlemen came over and apologized but really did not seem genuine about it after I explained how dangerous it was that I found a total of 6 fish bones that I could have choked on. He also attempted to blame the chef for not cleaning it right and saying "I always tell him to make sure all the bones are out."   Coming from the restaurant business myself and having my husband be on the corporate side of a big restaurant chain - I was very disappointed in how this place dealt with the issue.   Please check your seafood at this place - they clearly are not ordering boneless seafood or properly cleaning they're fish.

name: Leander Beer Market
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Thursday, Friday

reviews.author: Kimberly H.
reviews.description: Amazing Food! I highly recommend the pizza, fried pickles and wings! Normal prices and they have indoor and outdoor seating. Plenty of on street parking. The location is great in the middle of old Leander!

reviews.author: john g.
reviews.description: It's a local watering watering hole in "downtown" Leander. Why the double quotes around downtown - because there isn't much happening in downtown Leander.   Anyway, cannot comment too much on food as we only had an appetizer and it was alright.   Beer and wine are served in a plastic now which is less than desirable. Not sure how it was pre-Covid.   Staff was fast and efficient but I don't think I could describe them as warm or friendly.  They weren't rude either.   Decent amount of variety. It's charm is that is local and has the hole in the wall personality.   We plan on returning.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: My review is mostly based on service.  I came here with the husband on a Monday night because I wanted a post-dinner beer. I marked this place in my bookmarks as a place I wanted to try based off the reviews. I generally try to be open-minded about my experiences at new places, but honestly I was just rubbed the wrong way here. We walked inside around 7 pm and I only noticed the list of cocktails on the wall behind the bar. I looked at the tap handles to see if I could tell what they had and the bartender finally came over. I figured I'd ask for something easy and see if they had Dos Equis on draft and was told they didn't with a snarky attitude that I guess he thought was witty or funny. I asked where the list of beers was and he stared at me and just pointed up...ok where am I supposed to be looking? OH. Apparently I'm supposed to know there are individual beer names hanging not only above the bar seats, but also sticking out slightly over the seating where you have to get up to see them. I tell him I haven't been there before and wouldn't know those were there. I order the beer he suggested (Alstadt Kölsch) based off of me asking for Dos Equis. He asks if I want to open a tab and I say no. His response: "Only one beer?" with what may as well have been an eye roll. You would think with me telling someone that I'm a new patron the attitude would be better. He probably doesn't care since A) it probably isn't his business, B) I'm sure they have regulars and C) he was probably in a hurry to come outside to vape with his friends on the patio that says "No Smoking".  Side note: if you want to sit outside be prepared to listen to cornhole games underneath the same covering as the seating which causes it to echo so loud you can't hear your own conversation.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: On this past Saturday, we made the adult decision to venture out as LB was open. We decided to visit as they were not busy and were following the separation guidelines. The service is always friendly and it was even better on this visit. Our guest puppy was treated to snacks and fresh water. We sat on the covered patio and watched rerun sporting events and just enjoyed being outside.   I've been an LB patron since day 1 and I remember when it was difficult to find a local venue that offered a large variety of craft beer options.  LB has changed a lot of the years as they now serve cocktails and their patio has been expanded. Venues come and go (see Sheas and AJs across the street) but LB has a loyal following and has remained our go-to venue to have a brew or two and some pub grub.   It's a misnomer to call their food pub grub as you can order a pretty darn good pizza, meatball casserole, fried calamari, artichoke dip, or our favorite their homemade fried pickles. Yes, they pickle on site!   Nice folks, great beer, good cocktails (check out their specials), and food.

reviews.author: Corey W.
reviews.description: Amazing food, staff, and regular customer group. The food is fantastic and the pizza is by far the best in Leander. The owners are locals in Leander and always strive to provide a fun environment

reviews.author: Laura N.
reviews.description: Owner harasses people online about politics. He's displayed his misogynistic attitude while bullying of his female staff during meal service. No Covid-safety protocols at all. I miss the sweet bakery that was there before.

reviews.author: Chris K.
reviews.description: This place is great! The prices are set and easy to determine, the staff is helpful and friendly, the food is way better than I expected.  Only draw back is if you go on trivia night seating may be a touch difficult to find, but save that I love this place.

reviews.author: Emily J.
reviews.description: I don't see the appeal of this place but it was busy.   1 bathroom, that smelled like pee and had no paper towels.   The hurricane that I order that was off of there board on drinks that they made was not a good drink.   The garlic bread we ordered was overdone and almost fully burnt on the bottom.   We ordered pizza also. One side was barely done while the other side was burnt. They put a lot of Italian season on top the pizza after it was cooked. Some times you just get a bite full of seasoning, not good.  First bits we thought the pizza had a good flavor but the more you ate the pizza the less tasty it was.

reviews.author: Madi U.
reviews.description: We visited on a Friday night after some late evening tennis because we literally couldn't find a restaurant that's kitchen was open past 10pm. Of course we know that's what to expect from Georgetown lol, but they're kitchen is open until like 11:30 which is fire honestly. Fried pickles were amazing, very nice patio, the music was a little loud but it was busy. Loved that they're dog friendly

reviews.author: Kali H.
reviews.description: Went yesterday for the first time for happy hour. We sat outside had some beers and ordered pizza and mushrooms and the food was fantastic. I will go back

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: The beer selection is always fantastic. The food options are limited, but tasty. I made the mistake of getting an old fashioned here one night-- meh-- but come for the beer and the vibes, and you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Landon O.
reviews.description: I had to post something about their food after all the negative reviews I read before going. We got a pizza, wings, the meatball casserole and a Greek salad. Everything was really good, came out quick and didn't seem like "frozen" meat at all. The meatball casserole was probably the best. The food won't blow you away, but it's great for bar munchies. A solid 4 stars   If they realigned their pool table and got some better sticks it wouldn't hurt.

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: Artichoke dip was great, pizza was just ok.  Nice outdoor area, nice bar.  Would go back again.

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Seek and ye shall find. This tiny hidden spot in old Leander checks off lots of my boxes - but doesn't impress. First off. This is a nice place dont get me wrong. I have been 3 times now just to see maybe it was an OFF day. Good menu , sports , decent tunes. So - those are pretty solid. Let me start with the menu. Pub grub for the most part with $10 pizzas unlimited toppings. So- naturally this is what i ordered each time. Each time it comes out it looks amazing and I'm excited. Like a Pointer Sister ( I 'm so excited ) . But the pizza never tastes cooked. The dough is mushy. Not a big deal. NExt time around I tell them to leave it in a bit longer for me. Comes out -- same. Not a deal breaker. Just need to change what I am eating. My belly prob says same thing. Next lets move onto the staff. For the most part the lady running the joint is on point. Friendly- helpful and witty. The remainder of the staff is quite the opposite. I have noticed this during a lunch visit with us being one of 2 people in the place, and in the evenings like during the sports games and crowds. Just abrasive . Again- I'm not there to make friends. I'm there to have a cold beer ( maybe 3) watch baseball or the slew of people who still have to think if they need to be wearing a mask when they enter an establishment( smh). So - The beer. They have a pretty typical tap list with 1-2 silver and gold medal choices. I saw Aldelberts there last night.. sweet!. But behind the bar is a ghostbuster lunchbox treasure chest of cans and bottles. WARNING! don't try to figure out what's in there. Hard to see them all... and after learning  how friendly the bar staff(see above ) is - I gave up asking and went with an IPA. The crowds are not bad and for the most part follow distancing rules.. but - nothing enforced. This scares me. While I know its MY choice to patron , I would still like to see ppl adhere to the 6ft. Outside- good seating - tv;s good parking and over all fantastic. I will prob go back, just not order the pizza and maybe try and get a spy camera behind the bar to see the other options as -- that's what life is all about. Options. Thanks for eating with me today, and I'll see you next time.  -M

reviews.author: Stephen H.
reviews.description: Fantastic service. Great beer selection draft and cans/bottles. Also have liquor and Red Bull. Lots of TV's and also play sound for the big games. Great food also. Mary is a rock star. TouchTunes could be a bit louder at times but that's probably a good thing based on some of the music selections I've heard. Also have golden tee. Quaint little bookstore next door too. Easy parking.

reviews.author: Ryan T.
reviews.description: Good place fun atmosphere it's like you neighborhood bar with good food good prices too

reviews.author: Erica R.
reviews.description: Wow I'm pretty upset. First game of the season and I was so excited to support my favorite local business. We got here before opening so we were the first to arrive. Sat down at the bar and asked to move because a regular sits there. Ok fine. Told the game was on a certain TV. Once people started arriving the manager said she didn't have enough boxes to play the game I wanted all of a sudden. We had ubered to the bar and now are forced to leave. I guess there is a hierarchy in customers and you have to be important to be treated well. I'm baffled.

reviews.author: Marcus G.
reviews.description: Owner is a jackass who thrives on bullying his staff and customer personnel; have gone a few times to this bar to see him disrespect his female bartenders as well as her clientele while being 'on the job'. A real shame because the place has incredible potential that's obviously being held back

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: This has been a local fav of mine for some years now. The owner is extremely active in the community. The food is great and priced well. Something changed at the spot and for me no longer has that comfortable feel. Seems has if over serving is not monitored as you will have several loud and obnoxious folks who aren't being controlled.   This was the second night in a row that I was ignored while sitting at the bar and watching the bar tender hang at the end of the bar with is buddies.   What was once a nice calm place to eat and enjoy some craft beers is now a place for the high volume drinking and the vocally high volume people.  Bring back Luigi's for the food and leave everything else.

reviews.author: Carly T.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place in Leander.  My husband and I started going every Friday and then our teenagers wanted to join us one night and they love it.  On Fridays everyone in the house is excited for LBM night.  The food is good, the atmosphere is fun, the TouchTunes are fun.  The service is great! We will be regulars for a longtime.

reviews.author: A M.
reviews.description: Staff is always great- its a bar with munchies NOT a restaurant- pretty drinks exceptional service - clean, nice, comfy - whats not to love - just don't go expecting to eat a meal :-)

reviews.author: Cameron D.
reviews.description: Found this bar via reviews when doing an online search. Don't let the fact that it is a hotel bar fool you. Tony is an expert in making drinks. He is super cool and really everyone here is at the hotel as well. We live in the area and will come back for the famous brown sugar old fashioned and margaritas!

reviews.author: Jonathan B.
reviews.description: Come see Tony - had the brown sugar Old Fashioned. Yum!  Cool little place. Have some sweet and savory bites.

reviews.author: Joe R.
reviews.description: Was welcomed immediately. Friendly, attractive bartender. And most importantly, a good drink!

reviews.author: Edward C.
reviews.description: This is a hidden gem in Cedar Park. Tony the bartender is great. A real mixologist.  You MUST try this out.

name: The League Kitchen and Tavern
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Michael Q.
reviews.description: Came here for lunch with a few of my coworkers and it was pretty good.  Lunch was solid service was good but I think that was partially because there were only 4 tables occupied when we were there but the service was attentive.  Menu is pretty large and has breakfast items during lunch so no complaints there because I do love me some breakfast for lunch or dinner.  Overall solid place would come back if I'm in the area not making a special trip here but if I'm here I definitely would come back.

reviews.author: Kasti K.
reviews.description: This place wildly exceeded my expectations.   We are in from out of town, it's a perfect Sunday spot for lunch and to watch football. The Sunday crew in the bar was super fun, our server Aaron was really kind   Their Sunday drink special is $3 mimosa and bloody Mary's.   Their gluten free bun is the best I've had at a restaurant, it is nice and chewy and stays together.   The chicken sandwich was great, a huge chicken breast with lots of bacon and avocado. They do a "first timer" complimentary dessert of their chocolate dump cake, my husband said it was great!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Very unassuming from the outside but walk in and you find a upscale gastropub style restaurant. We came at lunch and though I was initially hesitant to bring in kids, there ended up being plenty off other families in there. The menu was upscale American. Given it was lunch time, we went with hamburgers and sandwiches. The main dishes were all really good and a decent portion (not too big, not too small). The sides we got were a bit under seasoned though. Lastly, there should really be a hamburger on the kids menu.   Overall, really enjoyed this place. Will come back for dinner to try more of the menu.

reviews.author: Ken D.
reviews.description: The League is part neighborhood bar, part gastro-pub and I love both parts!    The bar and dinning areas are separated.  Despite both being relatively small, there's plenty of seating.  Choose from high-tops to semi-circular booths to high-back swivel bar stools.  And they have an outdoor patio as well, but not much of a view.   The League is a great place to meet a friend for drinks, a casual date, weekend brunch, watch Sunday football, or to just to ride the bar solo.    Excellent food with new, weekly specials, including a burger-of-the-week. On Mondays they have 2-for-1 burgers for dine in - can't beat that!  They also have cocktail specials to go along with their food specials (in addition to their menu and drink standards).  I wish they had a bigger beer wall, but the selection is serviceable.   The League is one on my regular spots and I've yet to be disappointed with their food, drinks, or service.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: I was so pleasantly surprised when we stopped here for a quick lunch. Friendly service and helpful staff members greeted us at the door and I loved the Prohibition era style and decor. Lots of variety on the menu. I tried the Society burger which was tasty and my husband had the club sandwich. $3 mimosas and they sent us home with a complimentary dessert- can't beat that.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Overpriced bar food.  Fries were soggy. Burger needed basic salt and pepper to give it flavor. It was medium rare.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: This place is our most visited restaurant since moving here thirteen years ago. As a former restaurant owner / operator, I appreciate the consistency and quality of the menu offerings. The facility is always clean and tables are cleared immediately when a party leaves. They have some really good deals, like burger Monday where you buy one and get one free. They also have a mouth watering prime rib special on Thursday that we can't wait to try.  One more attraction is , if you are into science or astronomy, you might be waited on by Galileo.

reviews.author: Eva Maria T.
reviews.description: We have been going to The League for a couple of years now. I get my hair done around the corner so it's convenient for my husband to hang at the bar. Sometimes we eat here and sometimes not.   Upside; Bartenders are always friendly and welcoming, they have great happy hour prices on drinks and apps. Also weekly food specials.   Food can be hit or miss. Between the two of us we've had everything on the menu. Club sandwich is always as hit and so is the spinach artichoke dip. Burgers sometimes a bit dry. The salmon is usually perfectly cooked. Fish and chips over battered and greasy. Prime rib sandwich is hit or miss.  Burger of the week this visit was Frito Pie Burger. I had the garlic butter grouper, which was a huge portion, but lacked seasoning on both the fish and couscous. Garlic butter was on the side, but was just melted butter with a chopped garlic at the bottom. No other seasonings.   We will continue to come hang at the bar and eat here occasionally.

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: 7/4/21 1st visit.  Already a crowd at opening.   Waitress : Kenza - very attentive, paying attention to details. ( even asked about allergies ) There's definitely a spirit of cooperation- every employee was eager to help out.  Drinks : Bloody Mary's delicious and at $3.00 a bargain. Arron the bartender jumps in to help out in the dining area. Great guy !! Food : Pot pie (basically a biscuit with gravy with a fried egg on top - WOW filling and Delicious!! Wife had the steak salad - steak cooked exactly as she ordered it.  Mother in Law had a breakfast anytime.  All of our food was delicious!!  All and All we had a GREAT experience!! Definitely will come again.  A quality restaurant ! Absolutely nothing negative to report.  As a treat on your 1st visit - we'll show up and ask about it.  Prices were VERY REASONABLE!!

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: The service was great, and the food wasn't bad, it was just meh. We tried several items on the appetizer menu, as well as one dessert.   The beer selection also wasn't very impressive, but it wasn't bad.  Gets the job done; doesn't impress.

reviews.author: Lyla A.
reviews.description: 5 stars for service and 2.75 stars for food. My 4 stars are on the generous side.  We dined here this afternoon. The server was very nice and took care of us. I'd give her service 5 stars.   For our food we ordered the chicken fried pork chop, the full rack of ribs, the southern burger, and the kids Mac and cheese.   Our little guy loved the Mac snd cheese. It was decent and definitely not out of a box. It didn't come with anything else but was only $5.   Hubby had the Southern burger with truffle fries ($2 up charge). The burger was solid. It could have been a slight bit juicer but it was a good burger. The "truffle" fries were not. The fries were limp and soggy and sprinkled with Parmesan but had no truffle flavor at all. Actually when you picked up a fry the cheese all fell off too. Pretty bad fries to be honest.   Older son ordered the baby back ribs and enjoyed them. They were your standard fair. Similar to what you'd find at Chili's but they cost $30 and come with a side of mashed potatoes.  I had the  chicken fried pork chop. It was very over cooked and dry and was topped with jalapeño gravy but there was no heat or jalapeño flavor at all. The gravy made the pork chop less dry though. I subbed Brussels sprouts instead of mashed potatoes ($2). They lacked seasoning or flavor. I like the taste of Brussels sprouts so I ate them but they had no other seasoning that I could detect.   The food was all fine. Not bad but at their prices I would definitely not run back.

reviews.author: Amari H.
reviews.description: Food and drinks were delicious! Tried it out for the first time and I will definitely be back. The food is quality for sure. I had the prime rib sandwich with truffle fries, and OMG! Every aspect of it was amazing and paired well together. I will say I was underwhelmed with the salmon deviled eggs... it just tasted like eating cold eggs with no signature flavor.

reviews.author: Gaye J.
reviews.description: Really good hamburgers and fries. They have a full bar so you can have the drink you want. Great neighborhood vibe

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: Give this place a try!! It's a little hidden gem! They have interesting burgers and I have tried a couple of their dishes and didn't have one that I don't like.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: The League is a cool watering hole and sporting some excellent food for the denizens of Avery Ranch.  Two for One burgers on Mondays is a great deal.  We usually pop in for a late lunch early HH and sit at the bar. Check out their small bites menu the meatloaf is pretty darn good. Fish n chips are AOK there are better fish n chips in the area but you can easily split this bountiful dish.   The League pours a good cocktail and their bloodies, according to Plus 1, are right up there with the best. There are rotating taps for you beer snobs (like me).  There is a patio off to the side and a good-sized dining room. It does get crowded hence our late lunch HH visits.  Pro tip during football season Friday nights are packed pre-game.

reviews.author: Barry B.
reviews.description: I took the family there tonight and was looking forward to having a good hamburger.   It was not to be!    It all started with a very aggressive an unkempt server with a bad attitude. We ordered the burgers which came under cooked and had soggy buns on the bottom.   The server was very rude when we asked to have the burgers redone and later literally threw a to go  box at me !  The manager got involved and was very gracious to comp the meal ,but i will not go back again because of the bad experience with a terrible server!

reviews.author: Jeanette H.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed our late lunch there, delicious appetizers and drinks. Great patio. Right as we we're done eating, a truck pulled up behind the building visible from patio and there was a strong sewage smell, it must've been some kind of clean out. Horrible. Thankful we were done or we wouldn't have been able to finish our meal. The smell was horrible.  We'll be back and hope that won't happen at the very moment we're there.

reviews.author: Sarah M.
reviews.description: Stopped in for lunch on a Friday. Noticed the outdoor seating was pretty full but indoor wasn't busy at all. Service was good and the place was small but cozy and clean.   We ordered the fish n chips and a burger with onion rings. The burger was fine, very average and a little bland. The fries that came with the fish were also ok but a little cold. The onion rings and the fish is the part I wanted to love but didn't. Taste wise they were good. However, they had so much batter on them it made me feel sick after just a few bites. I know these were heavy items to order for lunch, but the ratio of batter was just too much.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Really clean feeling place with a great bar staff. Bloody Mary was solid and $3 on Sunday. Beer selection was on the better side for restaurants in the area. Lots of TVs. Burgers were tasty and I highly recommend ordering a side of the jalapeño gravy to dip everything into it.

reviews.author: Brad T.
reviews.description: My last visit the banana pudding was off, like spoiled milk off. Ordered the cobbler, it should be called a jam as there is no cobbler.  Poppers weren't really cooked, maybe they were just uber cold because they sat out, see below.  Order was to be ready at 6:58 and brought to my truck. I though ok they are behind...at 7:10 I went in and saw it just sitting on a table next to the door.  No clue how long it was there. They said I could just grab it and go.  Disappointing Brussels spouts we're amazing, the only reason they get two stars.   The last visit they brought it to my truck but the food was mehhh.

name: Pour House Pints And Pies
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I've been passing up some awesome food and beers for years.  Don't make the same mistake I did.  I Yelper plead with you!  I also learned two things I've been missing in pizza, too.  I've passed this place dozens of times.  It sits on the fringe of a west Austin neighborhood and several apartments/condos between them and 183.  I believe it is affiliated with a restaurant that has a place in Fort Worth, too, but I might be wrong.  What I'm sure of my first visit there was killer!  I'm planning on going back when I can eat and drink a whole day away!  They have a great outdoor area with plenty of umbrellas and we chose a table.  The server acknowledged us right away.  We QR'd the menu and by the time we'd made a choice of food our beers were on the table and cold (good pour on the Guinness, btw).    We ordered a pizza of our own:  Sausage, mushroom, green peppers and spicy marinara sauce.  Okay, first... You know how some chain pizzas you have the ingredients all coming off together leaving you with less than even a cheese pizza?  Not here.  Every thing is chopped into small pieces and spread evenly over the entire pizza.  Every bite comes with a mouthful of exactly what you ordered.  Second, put some of that marinara on a piece of canvas and I'd eat it.  The spices brought everything together.  We got wings too.  Golden Buffalo.  Perfect heat! Crispy.  Meaty. Those wings were gone so fast I was looking at other tables to see if someone had snatch a couple off our plate LOL  We were licking the hot sauce off the plate.  I'M DOUBLING THE ORDER NEXT TIME!  Great service, cool vibe, good food!  Did I get lucky or find bar food Nirvana?  I dunno.  I'm going to rock a five star and adjust as I need to, but I'm not going to deprive myself of another visit here for sure!!

reviews.author: Steffie S.
reviews.description: Fun Neighborhood joint.  This feels like a place where you'd walk in and they'd say, "Norm!"...if that were your name and you were on an episode of Cheers.  The beer was deliciously cold served in a thick glass to keep it that way. The pizza was generously embellished with toppings, and the crust was above average. The service was timely and courteous. I really liked the outdoor patio. Part of it is covered with fans, and part was uncovered with tables with umbrellas. The only drawback is there's a lot of road noise. We sat at a table as far away from the road as possible, and it was acceptable noise-wise. When our world health situation is better, I hope to see all the tables filled with large groups of friends enjoying pints and pizzas. For now, come check it out with your close friends and/or significant other.

reviews.author: Mickey W.
reviews.description: Visiting from Seattle and went here with my son this week.  We both ordered pizza which was excellent. Tasty crust on the pie and toppings were top notch.  Tried their "West Coast" IPA, not to hoppy but well balanced.  I'll be back!!

reviews.author: Ralph S.
reviews.description: This pizza here is really good!  Ask for Kate! She is the BEST!!! She always knows what we want and is so friendly!...

reviews.author: Russell B.
reviews.description: Still absolutely wonderful after all these years! They remember our order and pay good attention to our table. Will be back soon and often.

reviews.author: Kerra S.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed this place. It was way more laid back then I expected (place is always popping outside!!) which was great, I'm not for the "pay twice what it's worth because we are fancy pants".  Everything was very reasonably priced, and freaking delicious! We tried a few of the drinks (I tried a few of the beers) and it's safe to say I left tipsy and happy! Can't wait to visit this place again and try some new pizzas and beer!

reviews.author: Jana N.
reviews.description: I hope they open earlier again soon. I miss going there at 1 or 2 after work.   The parking lot area on the right is awful. So park in the back for you don't get hit.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: My friends like this place, but I don't see the draw. The pizza is mediocre. Fortunately tonight I discovered their sandwiches are good. I got the Pourboy, with Fries. Everyone else in our group who wanted food ended up being in a sandwich mood, so the Chicken Parm sandwich got good reviews from two of the guys. The fries were well-seasoned and looked promising, but were a little cold and soft. Other times I liked the Fried Pickle Chips, but could only eat a few pieces before they got overpowering. It's not like we'd eat that many pickles out of the jar in one sitting! I think the server mixed up my friend's beer order. The final blow to this spot is that their outdoor chairs are wildly uncomfortable. I even brought my own seat cushion the last few times I came! This time it saved my butt, but my back still hurts. I'd give Pour House a 3.5 but I'm in a generous mood so I'm rounding up.

reviews.author: Darrel R.
reviews.description: This place has RATS. It's a shame because I love eating here, but after seeing a rat scurry across the dining room floor I will NOT be coming back. This isn't even the first time this has happened. On another occasion, I saw a rat running out from the KITCHEN and into the parking lot. It was disgusting. The owners of this business need to have pest control come in so that their patrons can eat without worrying about rats, and so their kitchen staff doesn't have to cook with pests. I've worked in the service industry and know this is no ones fault but the owners. Do better by your employees and your customers and get rid of the rats.

reviews.author: Loren B.
reviews.description: At first glance, the interior of Pour House looked a little un-maintained. But, then of course, Austin. Where everything is underground. I was excited about the local beer list, though the stout selection was a bit thin. I went with Redhorn, a coffee stout that was a little short on stoutness for me. But, the flavor was good.  We ordered three 8" pizzas to share: El Supremo, Hawaiian, and a Veggie pizza, providing plenty for two adults and two children. The pizza was quite good, as in Austin-good. I couldn't put my finger on it, but there was something unique about the flavor.    Our server was very good, personable and informative. We ate a late lunch, during which a growing number of what appeared to be regulars gathered mostly around the bar. The location is a bit secluded from the rest of Austin. But, it's near the technology district, where I was working for the day.  Parking was a little confusing because we approached the building from a side where the entrance wasn't visible. It's a private parking lot with plenty of space. Outdoor seating is available. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Karan P.
reviews.description: Pour house is a pleasant open patio brewery serving delectable pies and the best garlic bread in Austin! I prefer an afternoon visit to enjoy the sun on the patio. The garlic bread has a nice char and is brimming with heavenly garlic flavour!

reviews.author: Pax S.
reviews.description: Wow, what a comeback from Corona this place has had. I've never been happier to see the wait staff and bartenders (especially Justin) return to their jobs. They're really into sanitizing every space that has been used and I've never had a vegan pizza like The Spock. Couldn't be happier with this place's redemption. Come support them, especially at the beginning of the week!

reviews.author: Marcus R.
reviews.description: This was the first trying out this place. My guys from work and I were in training this week so we thought about trying it out. The environment was chill and not too busy during lunch time so that was a plus for us because we needed to be back for training within the hour.  Three of us ordered the Cubano and it was so tasty! I definitely enjoyed the pickles and pork amongst other fine ingredients they packed on that pizza! One of guys ordered the regular pepperoni pizza and he said he liked it a lot. The crust and dough of the pizza was cooked perfectly thoroughly.  There salads were delicious and portioned perfectly. When you arrive the parking is all in the back area pretty much, and you enter through the patio area. They have signs for you and that guide you to entrance.

reviews.author: Lynette B.
reviews.description: The outside patio is nice and has a good vibe.  Unfortunately, Jollyville is busy so you have to speak loudly to each other but there's not a lot Pour House can do about that.  At first, our waiter seemed like he was going to be a lot of fun but we quickly realized he was all show and no action. He forgot to bring one of our drinks the first time around and then we very rarely saw him after that until he was ready for us to pay the bill. We had to find a different waiter to order a second round of margaritas.  The margaritas themselves we're nothing to get excited about and seemed like they had very little alcohol. We ordered two orders of the fried pickles, though, because those were great! (And even here we had to flag down our waiter to place a second order and get extra ranch dip).  We will go back because of the convenient location and nice patio but we will have our expectations set appropriately.

reviews.author: Rachel T.
reviews.description: I just really love this place. Great patio. Absolutely delicious pizza. Good drinks. Great service. Located in an area that really needs restaurants like this and frequented by people who obviously feel the same way we do about it. Comfortable and consistent.

reviews.author: Will W.
reviews.description: My partner and I have been coming here about once a week since we moved to the area(early May). The service is consistently great(shoutout to Kate), the food is awesome(some callouts: fried mozz, chicken parm, veggie pizza, cheese bread), and the seating is wonderful too. They have a large outdoor patio and with how they have it set up, I've never felt too hot in the summer or like there's too much noise from being seated near the road.

reviews.author: Shannon G.
reviews.description: Update. Another amazing dinner here. Hawai'i 50 8inch pizza. Crust is amazing. Thick and light. Cooked to perfection. Flavor in the sauce, and the fresh basil. The Canadian bacon, all so good. Also got a pita bread house made bruschetta. Wow, is that good. Diced tomatoes, with small cubes of mozzarella, and fresh basil. Deliciand shareable. Again I had the cherry limeade drink. It's perfect. The whole meal was fantastic. The waiter we had was super nice. This place is packed. So get there early. It's loud inside, but they have a large patio, but tonight it was chilly. No heat lamps. Parking lot is tight too. Been here twice and I think I took the last parking spot both time UPDATE: I've never been here for brunch, so today is the day! Chicken and waffles it is! I find chicken and waffles such a Southern thing, and I can't get enough of it. If it's on the menu, I'm ordering it. Their waffles are amazing. It's two small waffles with pockets of like brown sugar maybe? They have some kind of crunch to it. I didn't even use syrup because they just had a great flavor already. Chicken is tender and juicy. And it's a big piece of chicken breast. Bartenders are so Southern with their "yes ma'am" and hospitality. I always had a drink in front of me and I was checked in to make sure everything was to my liking. Pour House on Jollyville Road is such a great place to go alone or with a group. Their patio is outstanding, service is Southern as Southern can get. Always had a great meal, an even better cocktail, and the service is hands down Southern and hospitable. You have a great team here, this is my go to place

reviews.author: Priyakshi K.
reviews.description: The pizzas here are simply amazing. Been to pour house several times just for drinks, but every time I couldn't stop myself from ordering a pizza. Very chill ambience and their service is pretty quick.   Their draft beer collection is good too !

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: This place has a great selection of beers for real beer drinkers.  Great pies also.  Bartender is very good at recommending good beers.  Nice neighborhood pub.

reviews.author: Randyf V.
reviews.description: Always on the look out for new pizza spots. Of course you always take your chances. Unfortunately this was one of the bombs. Picked up 2 pizzas for myself and office manager. Her first response was that it seemed to be frozen pizza. I agreed. Pepperroni was sliced so thin it was almost tranparent transparent. Sauce and crust definitely seemed directly from the frozen section. My large greek salad was equally disappointing - very much so.  Counter staff was very friendly and courteous though.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: | Food |  Excellent!  I had the rainbow trout with brussels sprouts and that is some of the best trout I've had in a long while!  It was perfectly done.  The brussels spouts were tasty too.  My friend had the pastrami sandwich and she kept raving about it; the pastrami was high quality.    | Cocktails |  Again, a big win.  They were doing a bartender drink contest with several whiskey cocktails and I went for the Peach Tree.  Although petite it packs in taste and was not light on the whiskey!  | Atmosphere |  The patio is typical strip mall-ish.  It's nice that it is dog friendly.

reviews.author: Desiree G.
reviews.description: Service here was good and loved the bar area. Brunch cocktail selection was above average. The Vietnamese espresso drink and Bloody Mary were great.   Food is what knocks this down a bit. I got the biscuits and gravy which was wayyyy to much biscuit for the amount of gravy given. Getting the chicken added is a must.   The carnitas poutine was super salty. I get that both things are meant to be like that, but this was just too much. I wish there was more pickled onions and jalapeños to balance it out.   The happy hour menu and times looked pretty good, so I'd definitely return to try that out.

reviews.author: Aaron G.
reviews.description: First, this place is perfectly nice and probably worth going to again if I am back in the area but would easily be convinced to try something else.  My evening began with the Ancho Margarita.   Unlike some places this chili inspired drink isn't like drinking hot pepper juice and is delicious.    The fried cheese curds with ranch dressing were tasty but nothing particularly gourmet as a novice home cook could prepare this with the same results.     The disappointment came with the main meal.  The French fries were cold.   From our vantage point we could watch the kitchen workers.  They kept a big bowl of French fries that the kitchen leader would use to place portions on out going plates.   They rarely sitting it under a heat lamp, so they were cold and unmemorable.   This is probably the easiest and cheapest thing on the menu to prepare well.  The rest of the meal was perfectly ok, but noting that stuck out as particularly special.    The ambiance is nice, but extremely loud when there's a full house so you have to raise your voice to be heard across the table.

reviews.author: Andrew C.
reviews.description: Wife and I decided to try this place out for late afternoon brunch on the patio. We had the Bacon Beignets, Reuben, and Pimento Burger. We had a little difficulty finding good selections on the menu. Citrus pancakes sounded good, but they were out of them. The Bacon Beignets were the highlight, warm, freshly made and tasty. Reuben was good, with nicely salted corned beef and delicious German slaw. Pimento burger was too rich for my taste. Service was good. Overall experience was good. Would be 5 stars, but menu was not great for us. If you find things you like on the menu, then you should try it out.

reviews.author: Keilon L.
reviews.description: The meal was much more attractive than it was delicious. Everything was fresh but lacked flair in the flavor department. This is the kind of place I would come to for dinner but I wouldn't bring anyone here to impress them or to treat them. I only say that because the impression of this place I got from the ambiance and the menu was that I would be in for a stellar meal. I ordered the Brie Burger believing the brie and the flavor profile would offer pizzaz but I was not razzle dazzled. It was just the feel of eating a better than average burger.  The carnitas poutine got me a little eager to taste more flavors as I had that to start.  It could have rivaled a couple of poutine offerings that I've had in Montréal aka the poutine capital of the world (sorry Quebec City).  I am happy that all the greens were fresh to round out the meals well.  I felt like portions and servings were well balanced.  If I lived in the area, I'd dine here again.

reviews.author: William Z.
reviews.description: Stopped by last night wi5h friends. After putting in our name we sat in the bar and ordered beers while waiting for a table. We were in no hurry so we had another beer and looked over the menu.  It was obvious that Oast was short staffed and everyone was doing double duty. Thank the pandemic!  Nevertheless, tHe staff was very friendly and the service was adequate.  However our burgers were not very hot and my pretzel bun was stale. The fries were very good. In better times, this will probably be a very nice dinner option.

reviews.author: Sandra B.
reviews.description: Went to brunch here with some friends. This was a great atmosphere for brunch. I have been for Dinner which is lovely as well. However, it's laid back, chill atmosphere, and modern feel makes it a great spot for almost any occasion.  The food was pretty good. I did get something i could make at home. However everything was cooked nicely apart from the bacon. It was a little bit too charred for my taste. Potatoes were tasty, eggs standard, and the rye bread tasted more like a sour dough. But still good.   Mimosas were a good deal as well!   Overall we had a great time and most likely will return again!

reviews.author: Juliana S.
reviews.description: Can't believe it's been a while since someone gave this place a review.   We came here because we found some good reviews on Yelp, but have to say I was a bit apprehensive about how long it's been since the last review posted for this place.   This restaurant seems to be a family go to place where people just eat and never care to leave a review.   This place a gem! We came in for an early dinner and were surprised by how good their food and drinks are.   I wasn't really found of the butternut squash soup but we were in the mood for trying so we did it.   I do recommend this place for anyone.  Specially if you are looking for food away from Downtown like us.   Enjoy!

reviews.author: Flora T.
reviews.description: A hidden gem! Great food, interesting drinks and friendly and attentive staff. We loved everything we ordered. Food is fresh and tasty. Good atmosphere for either friends' hangout or romantic outing. We had a great time there and will definitely recommend it! We arrived after 9 and could take advantage of their reverse happy hour. We were surprised how small our check was!

reviews.author: Ru L.
reviews.description: Gastropub is what this place is, a place for food beer and good food! The pimento deviled eggs.. oh my were they great and served on a slab of rock, too. I had the beer braised pork and spatzle with a side of coffee rubbed carrots. The food was really good and service was friendly.

reviews.author: Carrie T.
reviews.description: Came here for brunch after church on Sunday. I must shout out Henry because his service was awesome. He was personable, friendly and efficient. His service gets 5 stars (and we made sure his tip showed it). We started with the bacon beignets which were not really like beignets. They were crispy on the outside and more like cake donuts on the inside. Only got like two pieces of bacon in the whole serving.  The food came to the table very room temperature. My father had to send his biscuits and gravy back to reheat (no one wants congealed gravy). My mom and I got the boring breakfast plate. I asked for my eggs over medium and they definitely came fried hard. Also the house cured bacon was bland and extremely dry. My Aunt's chicken cacciatore pasta tasted good and we liked the strawberry pancake we ordered for the table a lot.  Overall, service was the highlight but the brunch options are not worth a second visit.

reviews.author: Nathan F.
reviews.description: Have been to oasthouse before, but not for brunch and there was something for everyone. The service was really good (and timely/efficient) and we enjoyed the covered seating outside. They had a great beer/cocktail/wine selection and had several drafts i had never seen before. The chicken and waffles were really strong, and the chicken was almost like hot chicken which was a pleasant surprise and carried the dish but no complaints there. The carnitas poutine and the Cubano were certainly enjoyed as well

reviews.author: Allison P.
reviews.description: Oasthouse has been my periodic GrubHub treat when my standbys on another delivery service aren't available for several months. What more does one need in life when brie pimento burgers and coffee rubbed carrots with green peppercorn ranch are on the menu? I don't even mind that my average order for one meal is at least 35-40.00 with delivery. Sometimes it's just worth it for something so yummy.   I was excited tonight to share an Oasthouse experience with my daughter and was pretty disappointed at both a mediocre meal and pettiness on my bill. Even though I was happy to spend the 45.00 plus 20.00 delivery charges and tip to reward ourselves after a strenuous and stressful day of work, I felt shortchanged pretty quick when I couldn't even see the pimento on my burger, got an overly dry bun and was charged 2.00 after the fact for some perceived "extra" change to my order.   Whether this was an upcharge because they were out of mashed potatoes (usually substituted for fries since I'm gluten free) and gave me the more expensive brussels sprouts. Or maybe they changed me for the extra pimento I always ask for (#swoon) but didn't get. Since they didn't say what it was for I'm left wondering.   All in all, my highly anticipated Oasthouse indulgence fell kind of flat on a day when I really needed it. I guess nobody's perfect.

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: My girlfriends and I met up here for brunch. They have quite a few patios to choose from, a nice inside section, and a full bar. Cool atmosphere and decent prices for food and drinks. We ordered 2 carafes of mimosas for only $8 each, which I thought was a great deal. They bring out your champagne and orange juice in separate carafes so you can measure out how much you personally want of each, which I appreciated.   I was not blown away by the food, but everything we ordered was still solid. Two of us ordered the all day breakfast plate that came with eggs, uncured bacon, a slice of toast, and breakfast potatoes. Everything was good, simply nothing stood out. The other two people in our party enjoyed their eggs Benedict and strawberries field salad. Good service and she stayed attentive the whole time we were there catching up. Overall, good experience.

reviews.author: Kayla B.
reviews.description: We've eaten here twice for dinner and really enjoyed our meals both times! We also had the same waiter, Henry B., and he was excellent! He was able to give great suggestions for food and drinks. We've had the fried mushrooms (featured) and the Reuben egg rolls for appetizers which were both amazing! For entrees we've had the chicken schnitzel, cheesy meatball sub (featured), and the strawberry fields salad which were really tasty. My personal favorite is the chicken schnitzel. Other reviews mention the drinks being so-so but every drink I've gotten has been quality with the alcohol. The hotter melon was recommended by Henry and was very refreshing. We plan to be back and would recommend!

reviews.author: Juan G.
reviews.description: First time here and to start we were welcomed with amazing staff members.   Our waitress Kayla really made the ordering experience truly as smooth and delightful as possible!!   The food definitely brought a smile to my face with the Bacon beignets, pancakes, salad and poutine as our entrees.   Can't wait to be back next time in Austin!

reviews.author: Adriana O.
reviews.description: First timer here and everything was great! The bacon beignets are perfect... nice flavor and crispy outside crunch. The mimosa carafes are great to share with friends! I love that the juice and alcohol are separate so you can adjust to your liking. I had the strawberry greens salad with chicken and it was refreshing and delicious.  I would recommend for a chill brunch spot on a Saturday! Not too crowded at all and we were seated right away at 11:30. Our server Kayla was great! Service was prompt and they easily made us a mocktail for our non-drinking guest! Will be back next time I come to Austin. :)

reviews.author: Helisse F.
reviews.description: We love Oasthouse! The food is always excellent and we have tried many items on the menu. Henry B was our server and did a fantastic Job. Come eat here and you will NOT be disappointed, in fact, you will want to make this your night out restaurant.

reviews.author: Joyce B.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place near my house in Four Points. The food is always very good and made to order with great ingredients. The service is always excellent, even when they are packed.   Today our server Kayla was engaging and took great care of us.  I'll be back.

reviews.author: Jeanne G.
reviews.description: My husband and I were, once again, delighted with the delicious food and competent service via Megan at a the Oasthouse Kitchen.  I ordered the Truffled Prosciutto Bruschetta, consisting of creamy truffled ricotta, argula, mission figs and local honey topped by a generous dollop of prosciutto.  It was a dreamy combo of textures and flavors.  On the side I had the seasonal tomato soup, thick and creamy.  My husband was briefly disappointed when Megan reported that the ribs were sold out.  However, she recommended the Wagu steak and frites.  The steak arrived warm and beautifully sliced with a giant side of shoestring fries, delicate and just fried to perfection.  We topped off the meal by splitting a peach crumble adorned with vanilla bean ice cream - a desert to die for.

name: Cover 2
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Tuesday, Friday

reviews.author: Ashley N.
reviews.description: My husband and I go here pretty often as it is super close to our place and we love their food! They have a great menu and our favorite thing is the fried pickles! They have rotating specials, soups and flatbreads. The servers and staff are all very friendly and hard workers. I also bring friends here and they have all loved it as well! They have great deals on their happy hour and a good variety of beers and wine that are not crazy overpriced. I have loved everything I have ordered and they have great portion sizes! We usually come for lunch or dinner, but we recently had brunch which was also fabulous. I had the chilaquiles and they were amazing! The portions are also super generous so I've left with leftovers multiple times. If you're a sports person, they have a ton of really nice TVs and always have games on. I am honestly so happy this place is close by and will continue giving them my business! I would also like to add that like many places these days, they have also experienced shortages with staff and when that happens, we have seen the managers out on the floor helping out and also working their butte off! This restaurant has amazing food, service and is such a great place to have a nice dinner, go hang with friends or just pop by for a drink! Thanks for rocking it Cover 2! Oh and the Round Rock location is also awesome as I went their with a group of work friends once they also had excellent service and the food was equally as delicious!!!

reviews.author: Steve B.
reviews.description: When Chief was here bar service was stellar. I have been coming here since it opened. Now bar service is lackadaisical, inattentive, distracted and sub standard.   I like this place. The food is good the beer selection is passable and I can watch any sporting event live or read a book or both. But these two are killing the place for me. Ordered a beer and sat for 20 minutes with no one asking me if I might like to order food. Had to literally flag someone down to order a meal. That is not how this business works.   Wearing a mask under your chin until you walk up to a customer is not how this works either. And the tall one did that all night long. Now looking for a different place to spend an evening eating a meal and enjoying a beer.

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: Horrible service today.  Sat in a booth for over 15 minutes while others came in after me and got their orders taken. Person who had seated me brought me a drink then nothing. Though a minimum of 5 different servers were standing right next to my booth.  I understand a restaurant may be short staffed but limit your seating if you cannot handle it.  I've had the similar experience here multiple times.  Last time I patron any of the restaurants in this local chain.  And "the remedy" after speaking to a manager when I asked for the check for my half drank coke...oh no need to pay for the coke.  FAIL ALL AROUND!

reviews.author: Asha T.
reviews.description: Literally the first visit we had and this last visit were like night and day.   If I EVER come back here it's gonna have to be at the bar. Apparently you get service that way.   Literally just walked in and got sat, was busy due to a UT game no problem. And then we just sit and wait and wait and wait. The supposed waiter for our area literally helped everyone around us and kept skipping us. Idk if it was because we didn't have UT gear on or I was basically the only black person there at the time but ppl that just walked in the door got greeted before we did.   We just got up and left. There's no way the dude in the area didn't know we had not been helped as he purposely kept ignoring the table and was serving EVERYONE around us.   Terrible service.

reviews.author: Missy J.
reviews.description: Love this place! They are so accommodating, even in football Sunday!!! The servers are polite and the manger runs around and works just as hard (love seeing that) all the food I've had is amazing. Great specials daily and weekly, worth a stop anytime but especially for football!  Not pictured but worth it: chili and eggs, giant pretzels, wings and shrimp pasta!!!

reviews.author: Colette B.
reviews.description: I never thought I would describe a restaurant as "disgusting", I have a lot of respect for food .... But our experience was just that! We fancied burgers and thought that a sports bar would serve delicious burgers! What a mistaken idea!! We started with a cup of onion soup: it was edible, not delicious, a little strong on the acid side, but ok. Then came the burgers: a 3mm leather sole burnt to death!! Awful! Horrible!! My husband had to leave the restaurant and was sick in the car park!! The fries were smothered in fat... yak! The waiter on the other hand was a sweetheart!! VERY professional! When I mentioned it wasn't good, he immediately offered to comp them, which he did! I am tempted to say that he had been through a similar situation before, maybe several times!!! He didn't hesitate and didn't offer an alternative: he KNEW the food was bad! Shame on management to allow this to happen! It's a Burger after all, and we are in Texas!! Land of Beef!! Cover 2, I'm afraid you will not see us again!!

reviews.author: Chantel C.
reviews.description: We've lived by cover 2 going on 2 years now and decided Saturday to finally check it out. (Previously came here and was seated but waitress seemed like she was just so busy she couldnt get to us and the vibe was just off? so we walked out) but let me tell you I sure am glad we gave it a second shot because the food was absolutely amazing and service was even better! Can't remember our waiters name but he was above and beyond. Everything came out quickly and tasted perfect... the environment was a plus! We willl back yall :)

reviews.author: Bonsai B.
reviews.description: If I could do 0 stars I would... Sunday at 1500 and it's not too busy.. not sure who out waiters name was because he didn't introduce himself, so we will call him island boy.. black island boy hair cut doesn't give a care in the world...He ignores the tables, continually walking by spaced out.. didn't get any service unless i asked. I even had to ask for the check! Why does he even work, just go home and live off unemployment.. he is the face of this bar/restaurant and I won't be back.. good riddance!

reviews.author: Caryn C.
reviews.description: Horrible service and even worse food. The only thing half way decent were the fries and they were cold. The hostess was condescending and sat us in a high traffic area in front on a tv that a group of 6 were watching and yelling. We had to ask to be moved. We had to ask for our waiter to serve us. We went at a time that was not considered busy or I would've understood. We had to ask multiple times for drink refills. We will not be back.

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Goofy loser waiter ignored us because he's racist. Type who says "canadians". You're black and racist toward other black people. Living like that's not good for your soul you rotten little jerk.  Decent game bar if you sit at the bar. Wings were aight

reviews.author: Shelby L.
reviews.description: We always have a good time here, especially during football season. The food is above average. Bar seating can be limited since everyone wants to sit up there.

reviews.author: Robert F.
reviews.description: Cover 2 off research always hits the spot it's got the best shoe string fries I can't seem to find anywhere else in Austin . Even though they may just be French fries and not a main course there is something so satisfying about them . My favorite dish is the buffalo chicken sliders , I personally get the blue cheese on the side with ranch to dip . These are amazing and have the perfect thin not to thick cut of chicken that's battered nice and crispy but stays juicy tossed in tangy but not spicy buffalo sauce. The bread doesn't take over the sandwich so that's not all you get full on and is super soft . They also have a buffalo chicken salad that has a good amount of chicken if your not wanting a sandwich but need to cure that buffalo craving . I've only had the burgers other than that and they are equally delicious again especially with those shoe string fries that are always crispy .  This place is relaxed and a good place to have a beer while you cool off after a long day or just dining with the family.  The staff is pleasant and the deserts are huge . Well at least the brownie is . If you like bars and burgers are in the area and don't know what to eat stop in and try the buffalo sandwich it's my go to and recommendation for cover 2 . If not that than at least grab a beer and some shoe string fries and relax a minute .

reviews.author: Joan B.
reviews.description: It had been awhile since I'd been at this location. While I love the Cover 3 locations on Anderson Lane and Round Rock, this one has never really measured up. Today I stopped in for lunch and ordered the flat top cheeseburger that comes with Parmesan fries. Should have been a safe bet, right? It came out DRIPPING in grease that tasted truly awful. Even the fries, which are always good, no matter the location, were inedible, as they tasted like they were fried in oil that should have changed long ago. It pains me to leave food that I paid good money for, but that's just what I did after trying to force down a couple more bites I shouldn't have taken. I left 2/3 of the burger and most of the fries on the table. Considered complaining, and might have if the server had even asked how the food was, but she didn't ask, and she had to have noticed how little I had eaten. She just left the check by the barely eaten food.  I rarely send food back to the kitchen, and since this wasn't exactly fine dining, I let it go today. But tonight I'm regretting eating those two or three additional bites I shouldn't have taken. It truly wasn't fit for consumption.

reviews.author: Mia L.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I visit this place the other day and wow! It was so good- we got the giant pretzel to start. When they say giant- boy do they mean it. They're drinks are also very very good and the server was very polite as well.

reviews.author: Robby T.
reviews.description: Normally this place is one of my favorites.   Today come I. At 220pm.  Semi full, wait up front for 5 mins to be greeted.    Then wait 15 mins for a drink.   Only ordered 2 appetizers and wait 35 mins for those.   Mention this to the server and she has a near come apart about being short staffed and it is what it is.     Very disappointing, until manager comes by.   Would give Miranda a raise.   Very nice and helpful.

reviews.author: Andrew M.
reviews.description: So today was my first day in Austin. I searched Yelp. I drove by a number of joints. I even walked through Whole Foods. Alas nothing struck my fancy. Heading back, I swung into Cover2. I'm glad I did.  The greeting, Silvana as server, and the whole support staff weekend terrific.  I started with a cup of French onion soup. It was just a tad too sweet for my taste. I'm also a purist in looking for a single crouton under the  hood (of cheese).   The fries and prime rib sandwich were a pleasant surprise. I will typically keg wrestle you to keep the horseradish sauce off the plate. The sauce here actually was mellowed very nicely and didn't fight the meat. The fries were great! Nothing more need be said.   This was a terrific first meal in a new town. This might become my extended kitchen it was that solid of aa performance!

reviews.author: Pamela M.
reviews.description: Would have been nice to actually eat. Ordered our drinks then watched as our server waited on everyone (even those seated after us) without taking our order. I try to give servers the benefit of the doubt cause maybe they're short staffed but after multiple issues with the same server and seeing tables sat after us putting their orders in and getting their food, I'm getting disappointed with the downhill service at Cover 2.   We received our drinks at 6:45 pm. Left money on the table for the drinks and left the establishment at 7:20 pm after our server ghosted us with empty drinks and no food order placed.

reviews.author: Matt S.
reviews.description: Great place to come watch sports, drink, and eat some food.  Staff here was nice and friendly. food was hot and fresh, I had the franks red hot chicken sliders that they had as a special and was good.  Flatbreads were split between the table and were good as well.   Drink prices are not that bad.  Nice walk to our room from here and was convenient.

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: I stopped by after reading a few Yelp reviews and what a great choice that was. I had the good fortune to sit at the bar and have Miranda take care of me. If I started a bar or a restaurant she would be my first hire (better give her a raise, Doug)!  She's friendly, professional and makes a great martini. The hospitality industry needs more Miranda's!    Now to the place itself. Cover 2 has a nice, open concept with the ubiquitous flat screens located around the bar and restaurant - it is a sports bar, after all.  The people working there are friendly and attentive while the noise level is energetic but not overly loud.    The food.  The Reuben was honestly just okay. The corned beef to Swiss cheese to kraut ratio is off (not enough kraut) and the bread was cooked to the point where it was as stiff as a board.  It tastes okay but the potential for a better sandwich is definitely there.  Ask for fries - they don't automatically come with it.   The fries were good and - just to see for myself - I ate half the Reuben and then ordered the wings.  The buffalo wings are tasty - not the best I've ever had but certainly worth sampling. Pair it with the 512 IPA and you have a winning combination.  Overall I would give Cover 2 a solid 8 on a 1-10 scale. The kitchen gets a 7, the bar an 8 and Miranda a 1o I think my math is right). If you're looking for a good sports bar that's not too sporty this is a solid choice.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: Had a very bad experience last night. We ordered apps that were extremely salty and were told they would come soon as we ordered drinks. The apps came at the same time as our dinner. I ordered crawfish special and let me tell you the worst crawfish I ever had. No flavor in the boil and they gave some sauce on the side which was horrible.

name: Alamo Drafthouse Cinema Lakeline
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Douglas W.
reviews.description: Movie theatre are banning large bags to stop people from being in their own food...  Good thing I have a few Twix up my sleeve!  I had a pretty eventful day but I knew that I wanted to still go catch a movie. I came to a pretty late showing and yet the service was great. Of course you always expect that the end of someone's shift that they would be low on energy but the service was fast friendly. The movie theater was clean the bathrooms are clean and there was plenty of parking.

reviews.author: Amber W.
reviews.description: My husband and I were looking forward to our first movie date in two years due to the pandemic. We went to see Ghostbusters Afterlife the Friday night after the premiere. Everything started out fine: we placed our drink and appetizer order before the show started. Got our mozzarella sticks and they were slightly underdone. Eh whatever, not a huge deal. Our beer and Bavarian Pretzel pizza were good, no complaints. However, the service not so much. On top of the fact our waitress took forever, she accused us of smoking in the theatre. I told her there was a vape cloud that came up on the row in front of us and I never saw anyone go talk to them. So maybe make sure you're accusing the right person next time. THEN our popcorn was burnt and we still got charged for it after letting them know. We'll keep going to Moviehouse in the future.

reviews.author: Jamie B.
reviews.description: Went and saw Free Guy tonight. Great movie. My 9year old puked all over the lobby as we left  The employees were so nice about it! They didn't make me feel bad or guilty or make me clean it up. I am so very grateful for tonights Lakeline employees  At least it wasn't poop?

reviews.author: Elissa S.
reviews.description: My husband and I rented a theater for a special occasion during covid. It wasn't exactly cheap ($150 for the rental, plus tickets and food/drink separately) but we missed movie theaters so much that we sprung for it. It was definitely worth it. The Alamo crew took so many precautions before and during our stay that although I was very anxious about the rental at first, I was able to relax and enjoy the show. Like others have said, all movie theaters are surely suffering right now and we need to support Alamo so that they're here when the pandemic is over. I love this theater chain so much, it'd be devastating for me personally if they were to close.

reviews.author: Daniel W.
reviews.description: Minus one star for every dollar y'all charge for the "convenience fee"   Before paying online make sure you know about this charge!

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: The Alamo is awesome, and we've missed it a ton during the pandemic. But now that we have our vax, we decided to risk a super special outing -- we did a Your Own Private Alamo rental to celebrate a milestone birthday in the family. Just our inner circle, all by ourselves ... with a movie! And popcorn! And freakin' amazing buffalo cauliflower! In public, having our first normal-ish outing in over a year! Seriously, it was fun, and the Alamo took good care of us.

reviews.author: Mahlet A.
reviews.description: This spot was super cute and a great date night choice. The staff was super friendly and efficient while moving around throughout the movie. The drinks were tasty and strong enough. I wish I had known that the seats were so tight together, I would have left some space between myself and the occupants next to me. Other than that it was a nice experience!

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: I'm torn between nostalgia and the elevated level of service (and price) other theatres are offering.  This is classic Alamo.  It's like rediscovering your first car.  Fixed bar-style eating surface in front of the fixed seats, no leg rests or fully reclining seats.  The service was GREAT, albeit we were intentionally at a TERRIBLE horror movie (The Turning) that had maybe 10 people in the cinema with us.  Still, an employee could slack in that situation and they did not.    The screen and sound were good.    There was no lounge in the theater that I saw to relax and have drinks before or after the movie.    And, after many visits to other theatres, it was unusual not to have a button to press for service.  Rather, you physically put your order card up on the table for a server to see when they come by.  I was really concerned about this because I knew how bad the movie was going to be early on and drinks were part of the plan!! lol  But in retrospect, maybe having to physically check on the patrons is what made the service so attentive (I got the drinks I needed to get through the picture -- thank you, Jesus).  So, obviously I'm torn.  It is a retro experience for me having experienced my first dine-in theater at an Alamo. I would go back here again in a heartbeat.  But it is like getting in a classic car and then realizing you actually like modern bucket seats and power steering.  At the same time that classic car was less expensive and still brings a smile to your face.  I'm going to rank based on the model Alamo built and on fulfilling my memories of great service...and I'm looking forward to going back again! :)

reviews.author: Amanda N.
reviews.description: Firstly, we've been coming to this location since it opened, and before that to their old spot off of Lake Creek Pkwy. Secondly, they have the nicest staff, and their food is always delicious! If there's any issue, they handle it quickly and efficiently. They're also super clean, and have been really amazing with COVID protocols. I feel comfortable going back to the movies because of Alamo Drafthouse. Thanks for always going above and beyond!

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: This is a review for the family party movies that Alamo does.   We went to a Family Party on Sunday. This is our second time for a family party and they rock! 45 minutes before the movie they have crafts for the kids (seems like usually 3-4 stations) and then they have an interactive dance or activity at the front of the theater immediately before the movie. It makes the movie an event for the kids.   Now if I could somehow watch a movie I want to see while the kids watched their cartoon!

reviews.author: Matthew C.
reviews.description: My wife and I attended the Lord of the Rings: Fellowship of the Ring 3:00 p.m. showing at Lakeline Alamo on Saturday, March 27. It was our first public outing since last year before Covid-19 struck. We were excited and nervous to venture out, but trusted Alamo's protocols.  We walk into the theater and there is just one guy there, sitting a couple rows from the projector, American flag bandana for a mask sitting around his neck not covering his face, scrolling on his phone. He makes a couple calls and talks loudly, checking on his insurance apparently. He continues to do it halfway through the movie previews. My wife and I are already annoyed. Not a good start.  The movie begins and the guy behind us has been quiet for 10 minutes. Things seem to be turning for the better. That is, until a short while into the movie when he starts making comments aloud. "No!" to Gandalf leaving Frodo. "Asshole!" to Saruman betraying Gandalf. I grit my teeth and exchange glances with my wife as it continues, both of us hoping it subsides.  Nope. The loud asshole decides to keep making his commentary like it's his own personal screening. I finally have had enough of it about an hour into the film and place an order card that read "Please tell the guy behind us to stop talking! He keeps doing it!" The server comes five minutes later, takes it and nods. She does nothing.  Another 30 minutes goes by. This guy's behavior continues. He even plays a video on his phone for all to hear at one point. He's all I can focus on now, my enjoyment of the movie totally ruined. I storm out of the theater determined to get someone to kick him out.  I find a young guy with a pony tail who is clearly a server. I plea my case that this guy needs to go. He seems to take my request seriously and I return, hoping the Alamo's well-known policy of kicking out disruptors will finally be used on this guy ruining our movie.  Well, that wasn't the case. 10, then 20 minutes go by. I didn't see anyone come into the theater to handle it. The pest behind us makes comments aloud less frequently, probably because my wife yelled at him to shut up at one point. While I couldn't blame her for taking it into her own hands, I wanted the Alamo staff to do something about it like I know they should.  In retrospect, maybe it wasn't a bad idea because nothing was done to kick him out as I requested. The movie nears its end and the guy shouts again. Finally, we hear someone behind us address him, apparently letting him off with a warning. After all he had done throughout the course of the film to ruin the movie for us, it was far too little, far too late.  Amazingly, it actually worked that someone talked to him. He shut up for the 10 minutes left in the movie and didn't say anything during the cast reunion piece that followed the credits. So had the staff addressed this nuisance earlier like I wanted, perhaps this outing would have been salvagable. Mind you, I first brought it to the attention of the staff an hour into a THREE HOUR MOVIE. They finally say something to him with only 10-15 minutes left. Completely unacceptable, if you ask me.  Our server tells us shortly after one of her staff finally talked to the guy that she told a manager and that she was sorry the loud patron was like this. He seems "a little 'special,' you know what I mean?" is what she says. Whether that's true or not is frankly irrelevant. You have a policy in place that you remind patrons every single time they visit your theaters. No talking, no texting. Problem with a loud table? Raise an order card and a staff member will address it, eventually asking them to leave without a refund. Had this policy been followed as outlined, he should have been given a warning an hour into the movie and then instructed to leave without a refund 30 minutes later when I pleaded to the staff to take care of it. Case closed. The way it was handled in reality was an absolute joke and insult.  We were happy to attend this screening as our first outing. Now, after this incident, we will no longer give Alamo our business.

reviews.author: beep b.
reviews.description: i placed an order for food delivery, put instructions on how i wanted it, and when my food got here all of my instructions were ignored and in my opinion purposefully made wrong. i think if you're not even going to try to make something the way the person wants it, it becomes aggressive and personal. like what is the problem

reviews.author: Jed B.
reviews.description: This location has stadium seating and comfortable chairs with a smart table design. The Alamo Drafthouse has an excellent beer selection and some tasty food options.. Even for a  vegetarian.  The best part of the experience for me is that people are told to turn off phones and be quiet. No one else is doing this and it is a thoughtful reminder.  Although some people don't quite get it and continue to talk, there was enough attention to keep the majority of chatter box's quite:-)

reviews.author: Tamie F.
reviews.description: I love the Alamo Drafthouse. My go to place to catch a movie. I enjoy the avocado toast and French press coffee when I come to an early movie. Later movies it's the bacon and goat cheese pizza. I appreciate the fact they have beers from local breweries available as well! Of course, who doesn't love the no talking and no texting rule!

reviews.author: Rolando N.
reviews.description: Love coming to this location in the midweek afternoons. It's usually not crowded.   Alamo does cinema the right way.
