Love to get there a half hour early and watch the pre-show entertainment. It's unique, nostalgic, and always funny. None of the advertisement bombardment you get at other theaters.   The food is always excellent   The 2x2 burger is my favorite and I've never been disappointed. It's a 5 star version of the Big Mac. The Colorado steak salad is also a regular favorite.   Drinks are always cold and the buttered popcorn with real butter is ridiculously delicious.   Awesome selection of adult beverages.   Love this place.

reviews.author: Anna C.
reviews.description: My husband and I love coming to Alamo Drafthouse! A couple months ago, my husband and I had a bad experience, to which management was quick to reach out to us to resolve. They went above and beyond to make sure that experience was made up for. My husband and I were so happy and will continue coming to our favorite movie theater here at Lakeline.  Staff really do go beyond expectations and are always making sure you are having a good time.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Went for Dinner and a movie 1/9/19. We were the first in line to get to our seats. It was my first time and my Wife and Sons second time. We were served pretty quickly. We loved the Pizza which was the Meat Pizza. It was hot and fresh. My wife was not a fan of the Chardonnay. My son thought his Pepperoni pizza was great and liked the Milkshake as well. We enjoyed the reserve seating. Just before the movie started we ordered some popcorn and a beer to split.   What cost them a star in my opinion was the Popcorn. It was really cold and without Salt or much Butter and taste like it was made at home. The main thing I like about the Movies is the Popcorn is always unbelievable. This was the opposite and was memorable for the worst reason. The other annoyance was the lack of under the table lighting when the bill arrived during the movie. I tried and quickly gave up so my wife finally figured out what we owed and paid in the dark. Not sure I have a fix just saying this is not good for older people with less then perfect night vision.  Definitely more to like than dislike here. We will be back.

reviews.author: Johnny B.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to come see a movie at the Alamo Drafthouse for almost a decade. Lo and behold, I am on production and me and my crew had a private screening. It was kind of a dream come true.  But I must say, the staff absolutely exceeded my expectations. Mainly Laura and Josiah, not only were they both very accommodating, but there are also very genuine.

reviews.author: Sean C.
reviews.description: This is our default date night spot for the wife and I. We recently purchased the season pass and love it. Their popcorn is seriously the best we have ever had. It's covered in ghee and we never get an un-popped kernel. It's something we crave and will forever compare every other one to.

reviews.author: Cindy M.
reviews.description: I used to love coming here, but have realized that it's just overpriced and uncomfortable all around. The food is not that great, the seats are definitely not comfortable and just too close to other people.   While they have a tempting kids menu, the booster seats make for an uncomfortable experience for the littles too.  The tables are not lit underneath like other locations and the theater is just too small, feeling like we are in a living room minus the comfort.   I just can't warrant a minimum $60 experience here..

reviews.author: Meday P.
reviews.description: I wish the Asian lady who works here quit, only her that makes me don't want to go back especially for pickup. She mostly at the pickup counter. She's not friendly, never smile and short in words, never say nice things like thank you, have a nice day .....after we made the payment/pickup. She's cold and means! She will ask you to show your order on the phone if match with the bag that you are grabbing but the way she did not so friendly.   Others staff is perfect, they're professional and friendly.   Food is good especially the fish dish. Fries as well. Love the new drinks that they are selling on the fridge. But if you use delivery service it won't taste the same.   3 stars because of that Asian waitress, otherwise 5. If manager or owner read this, please consider this waitress. She doesn't have a service mind!! She should find a new job that fit her style. I used to come here at least once every two weeks also order through DoorDash for pickup and sometime delivery, but I hate to see that waitress, so I might stop all.

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: Hadn't been to a BJ's in forever, but it was one of the few sit down spots open after 9pm in the area and we were hungry after a long day of work and travel. We had to wait just a couple of minutes because they were getting a big influx of guest - seems like some sort of dance show had just let out. Gary was our server and even though my favorite pasta has been discontinued (RIP blackened chicken pasta) and they were out of my second choice item (turkey burger) Gary had a great attitude and solid recommendations and solutions to keep the night on track. I ended up getting the half rack rib special with a beer that he recommended to pair and of course everyone was more than happy to share my pizooki. Give it a try, nice staff, quick service, solid food and open late.

reviews.author: Chris Lee O.
reviews.description: Keely is the best! I have been doing curbside service for years and she always gets my order right, calls me by my first name --and is super sweet! Thx you Keely for always taking care of my order. She is definitely detail oriented and customer service friendly!

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: My son and had dinner here and we were both first timers at this location. We both ordered the Nashville Hot Chicken Sandwich with extra pickles. I got mine with mustard, his was plain. I had a side of fries which were delicious and he had a side of the grilled honey sriracha brussel sprouts, which are awesome. Service was fair, and our server, Kelly, didn't split the check correctly, minus one star, and more than half the tables were closed despite having shields between them, minus one star. They have a great food and beer menu and we will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Nika L.
reviews.description: Great customer service, they even sold us for $5 set of glasses with BJ's logo.

reviews.author: Tina A.
reviews.description: Had us wait on a table in a nearly empty restaurant.... But the bar was packed...  It's not about social distancing

reviews.author: Kelsea K.
reviews.description: Wow I see a lot of politically motivated ratings here... how sad!  I like this chain and this was my 1st visit to this location.  We were seated after only a few minutes and I appreciated that they had half of the 2-top center section closed to reduce germ-spread!  Server was new but did a pretty great job getting food and drinks out. Bar was a little slow for how many tables were filled... but food was great and dessert was devoured!   I'll definitely be back!  I really wish the yelp app would stop truncating my photo gallery... I can't even get to my photos from this experience to post them!

reviews.author: Royal B.
reviews.description: Atmosphere 4 Cleanliness 4 Service 5 Food Quality 4 Likelihood to return 5 1-5 (5 Best!) 4.4  My first visit to a BJ's Restaurant.  My first restaurant meal since covid-19, in a dining room.  The service was incredible!  Some of the best I have had in ages.  The food quality was fresh, tasty, good portions.  I don't like the fries they use (good quality and hot, I just don't like "that" french fry.)  We may be moving close to this area, so it may be part of our routine out now and then.  Good job!

reviews.author: Bret B.
reviews.description: I've eaten here before and really enjoyed the product (all the BJs are really good really) but this location has turned into a joke honestly. We've tried to eat here on three occasions in the past month, every time we walk in, maybe 1 in 4 tables is seated. Then they tell us it's going to be a 1-2 hour wait. I'm all about social distancing and being safe during these times but that's ridiculous. It's either bad management unable to staff the location or just an EXTREME overabundance of social distancing. We gave them two chances and the third time we're done. We'll just go ahead and drive to the next nearest one and get seated sooner. Every single couple/group that came in during the 5 minutes we spent there had the same appalled look on their face when they saw the place practically empty and an hour wait.

reviews.author: Sean L.
reviews.description: BJ's was always one of my favorite restaurants, but not this location.  I ordered a family bundle meal directly from their website.  I got a call from the door dash driver a bit later and he said they had no record of my order.  I texted him a photo of my e-receipt and he showed the manager.  Apparently they didn't have the Shrimp Scampi -Tri-Tip Bundle I ordered at this particular restaurant so the order cancelled automatically and I got no notification from the restaurant.  The Door Dash driver had to cancel my order and he said someone from BJ's would be calling me.  They called and said they could have another bundle with a different item ready and cooked in about 15 minutes.  I said ok. that works.    30 minutes later I get a phone call asking when I was coming to pick up the order? I said I ordered delivery, not pick-up. He said, "you have to order on our website to get delivery."  I told him I did the first time.  He just, "Oh".  So I said, "So you are not going to deliver this?" he said he couldn't.  So I just said refund my money and this is the last time I will be going to this store.    You would think that maybe a manager would have called back to apologize or something, but nothing.  I just hope I get my refund.    Good luck with this store!

reviews.author: Lori H.
reviews.description: We have been here numerous times and have not had any problems.  Our arrival started with their webpage no longer accepting the online waitlist, wish I knew before?!  We arrived and then, found out that they had not taken that down reserve ahead of time option, so I reserved a seat for nothing, still waited about 40 minutes.  By the way, you have to be present to get on the waitlist like any other restaurant in town.  When it was time to be seated there probably 5 empty 2 top tables, and they were seating us next to a large party of 10!  Hello, can we move a few tables down?  So we picked another table and sat.  The host came and asked if we would like to move to a booth once it's cleaned as he pointed to the table, never were moved, and the original hostess that sat us brought our silverware and we assumed we were no longer moving.  Waited 15 minutes for our beer after waiting for our server.  Placed our order at 8:25 and got our food within 15-20 minutes, luckily!  By then, we were starving.  Be patient since all dining is lacking employees.  No pics to show since we woofed down our food!

reviews.author: Fatima A.
reviews.description: My favorite day of the week is tuesday. You may be thinking to yourself, "tuesday?? are you serious?? what could be so great about tuesdays and what does that have to do with Bj's?". Well tuesdays are the best day of the week because pizookies are only $3! The only thing that can make $3 pizookie tuesday better is our wonderful waitress Kyla! Kyla was kind, attentive, and accommodating. You can tell she is an extremely hard worker and earns every cent she makes. If you want to spice up your tuesdays, come to bjs and request kyla as your server.

reviews.author: Stephanie C.
reviews.description: Got a delivery via Uber eat. The pizza was smaller than a baby bite of pizza. Charged over $45 for  horrible hot Cesar salad and baby bite pizza. Beware.

reviews.author: Rashaka B.
reviews.description: COVID Superspreaders Restaurant  Stopped by to try $10 burger night.  They do NOT adhere to COVID19 guidelines  Waitresses walking around with masks covering their mouths only or only covering their faces when they approach a table.  They were sitting people at tables without being social distance (6 feet apart).  They had to be above the state limit for in-person dining inside.  As I was leaving, there were 30 people in the waiting area with ZERO social distancing.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: I have always had consistently good food and service here. We have eaten here many times, and although I didn't order it tonight, one of my favorites here is the Jambalaya. It is a little hot for my wimpy tastebuds, so I order it with light cayenne. And it comes out just right. We've always had consistently good food and service.  I suspect some of the more negative reviews may be from those who come during peak hours (which we always avoid).

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: 2pm on a Sunday, and they don't have enough staff to seat people.  Literally half the restaurant is empty, all the tables in the bar are empty, and the hosts are telling the lobby full of people waiting that it's a 45min wait because they don't have waiters for the open areas of the restaurant.  Who ever created a schedule for a weekend afternoon to have this few people working is stupid as hell.

reviews.author: Sarah V.
reviews.description: Just ate here tonight and I am so disappointed. It was just plain bad and there were multiple things incorrect on our meal. Kids pasta came out with no sauce at all. They brought out the alfredo sauce separately when I asked and it was awful, probably straight out of a jar. The croutons in the salad were all burned. Both of the steaks we got were very tough and chewy, although the flavor was not bad on this. The chicken Parmesan had no seasoning. I'm not even exaggerating, I don't think there was anything on it, same with the broccoli that came with it, but the white cheddar mashed potatoes were good. They also brought out another incorrect item, which I wouldn't normally mention because when I pointed it out they did correct it, but I mention it because it just shows more how much of a mess the kitchen is. My server was very friendly and attentive, did not have an issue with service, just quality of food. This meal cost $100 and I'm cringing over it. I wouldn't recommend going and I don't see myself coming back, personally. Which is a bummer because I liked this place! Definitely should have just gone to Longhorn!

reviews.author: Rachel R.
reviews.description: Can you do less than one star?  We walked in on my BIRTHDAY,  we had a horrible day in Austin with trailer trouble.  Finally got our trailer fixed .  Found the nearest restaurant, BJ's Brewhouse.  The manager refused to serve us because of our appearance.  We are normal people who have been to the lake and had our trailer break down.  Not perfect,  not horrible.  She said we were drunk and would not serve us.?  How does a disheveled appearance equal "drunk"?  There were 5 people in our party.  We left went to Longhorn Steakhouse and had a lovely dinner.  Thank you Trevor.  I will never walk into another BJ's Butthouse EVER!

reviews.author: Christine H.
reviews.description: Very very bad service, I'm so sad as my family is from Vegas and we spend a pretty penny at BJ's every week in Las Vegas unfortunately we stopped at this BJ's here in Cedar Park Texas and are very unhappy. The service was horrible and the hostess and waitress were very rude and the manager completely ignored everything.

reviews.author: Elizabeth B.
reviews.description: Called to see what the wait time was on a Friday night and the woman on the line said there's no wait time but it was subject to change. Okay, understandable. My boyfriend (who has a darker skin tone and has dreads as well might I add) and I go in and still, there's no wait time and it was not busy.  The woman at the front says we can sit anywhere near the bar and a server will be right with us. We sit anywhere as she said we could and about 3 servers walk pass by us and we make eye contact with all of them, multiple times, and they still don't serve us and I feel it had to do with our skin tone. Again, it was NOT busy and the servers were tending to all of the other tables but ours. We just got up and left after about 10 minutes of not being acknowledged. Writing this review to give others a heads up that if you have a different skin complexion you may not get served either :) There are much better businesses to support and this establishment is not recommended.

name: Shooters Billiards and Sports Bar
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Wednesday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jip Z.
reviews.description: Came in on a Thursday, some aggressive lady with glasses and bun, answers the door with "Do y'all have ID's?" We said yea and showed ours, then she says "So then talk to this dude at the door"... I walk in and there's a table with some merchandise on it and this little man, asked if we were there for the event? I said "we didn't know there was an event" and then he said it was $25 per person... well we didn't know, we just came for a drink and some parents night out. So I said sorry and we excused ourselves and then this same lady at the front was smoking outside so I said "Sorry, we didn't know it was an event" and she snarkily says "Yeah! it's dwarf wrestling!" Like I should be ashamed of not knowing this. I feel stupid, my bad.... But maybe next time have a sign on the door! We read the entire door and no sign about this, a cover of $10-15 we would pay but we didn't want to do $25 per person, since we had not  arrived for the event. I think if you have an event, try being a bit nicer. Some people are not regulars and just want to come over and you could sell it a bit, instead of making us feel bad for not know about your poorly advertised event.  I still like this bar and I like that people can smoke in doors (although I'm not a smoker) we have enough bars we can go too and this one is for smokers, so I don't have an issue and I know what I'll smell like when I leave.

reviews.author: Connor A.
reviews.description: Don't expect covid protections here. It's a no frills pool hall in Texas. Nobody in the establishment is wearing a mask, including the bartenders and waiters. If that's not a problem for you, then you're in for a good time.   We came in on a Tuesday night and easily found a pool table to ourselves. We opened a tab and had no trouble getting drinks without having to leave our games. The mixed drinks are nothing to write home about, but we had an excellent time drinking and playing pool. We also easily played some table shuffle board. They have computer slots/keno games to gamble with in a shady corner is that's something you're into.   The place was acceptably clean and the staff were all very friendly. Just make sure you have a VALID drivers license regardless of your age! This was place was a good time and I'll definitely be back again in the future.

reviews.author: Kris R.
reviews.description: The music was great, the service was pretty good, I was kind of a put off and that's the reason I wrote this two star review is because of the BS of smoking indoors at this place. When I got home everything smelled like cigarettes. This is completely illegal and just downright nasty. Everybody knows secondhand cigarette smoke is really bad for you so open up a flipping window if you're gonna let people smoke. If you're too lazy to go outdoors to smoke then this place should be regulated by the health department better, this isn't your house, and no one saying you can't do something but it's just nasty and it's really bad for your health right now my throat is on fire because I've been breathing secondhand smoke I don't wanna sound like a whiner or entitled millennial but it secondhand smoke dude and it's nasty.

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: Shooters been a great home for me for 14 years, it has been like my Cheers bar, after a stressful day of work, on my way home I stop in, staff is always friendly, I love the entertainment offered, Golden Tee, pool, sweepstakes, karaoke, bands on weekends. Staff has always been good to me over the years, and have been like family, met many current friends because of Shooters. Never a cover, and probably the best drink prices of any bar.  This place has great potential, but they need to make the best of some of its best assets, especially the use that beautiful patio more for events, music, etc. You should have a solo acoustic artist out there in spring/summer/fall and promote some games on the patio, it just seems as it's used as wasted space currently, and that's a shame.

reviews.author: Paul R.
reviews.description: Stopped by with others for a quick pop as we were beered out from Whitestone's delicious Oktoberfest beer. Bartender was patient with us as we pondered our last cocktail of the day. Notice I said day not evening. We settled on shots (why not??!!). We all received generous pours at a reasonable price.   Shooters is a great sports bar with multiple TVS (they do have the NFL ticket). There are plenty of pool tables and games to keep you occupied. I would definitely come here to watch games but the cigarette smoke stench is too much for me, and I'm a cigar smoker. We visited for about 10 minutes and my clothes stunk of smoke. I wish they would go smokeless like their other venue on 620 or at least add some additional smoke eaters. If you are a smoker it is a 5 star joint... for others 3 makes it AOK and a fair rating.

reviews.author: Jeff D.
reviews.description: Love this bar. Great atmosphere, friendly bar tenders,  and good drink selections. Monika, Shelby, and the entire staff are the best

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: Shooters is the worst bar I've ever been to. Service sucks and the staff was extremely rude and all their glasses were dirty.

reviews.author: Megan L.
reviews.description: Sunday pro football here is the best! $2 zeigenbach and $1.50 cheeseburgers and hotdogs off the grill. Can't beat it! Outdoor seating and smoking inside. Great place to watch football    * they don't have the cheeseburgers and hotdogs outside any longer but still a great place to watch any game you want. Please read reviews and understand it is a smoking bar and if that will make you mad don't come

reviews.author: Toni G.
reviews.description: Two things about this bar. They allow smoking. Which I could have left, I know. Second, if you keep a tab open they automatically add 20% gratuity to your bill! There was only 2 of us. There's nothing posted about this. We were tipping the bartenders as we ordered. So on top of the $32 in tips we gave, we were forced to pay another $23 on our bill. They should have a notice if you plan on keeping your tab open, a gratuity is automatically added. Even for a party of 2. Ridiculous

reviews.author: Sean G.
reviews.description: Unable to show the Texas longhorn game in the ATX is sad.  Drinks where really good and the pool tables where nice.

reviews.author: John T.
reviews.description: Good pool hall in a good location. It's a bit divey, but the prices make it worth it. If you like to hook up with ugly fat chicks or wrinkly smokers, then this is the spot. The Best Western is walking distance, just in case you drank too much.  I don't know if they still do free pool on Monday nights. That's a good chance to work on your game and save a few bucks. But watch out for scumbags. The meth-heads tend to pour in on this night.  Every now and then there's a few tough guys, but every town has 'em.

reviews.author: Jason D.
reviews.description: Really disappointed at how this place has changed. New GM or manager or whatever has no clue on customer service and taking care of people that come in more times than others. And the waitress was rude to a friend after closing out and said "Have fun with your Slut Pants".... Whatever that means..... Really..... Keep it classy CP!!  Fast Eddie's is the place to go if you don't won't the Jerry Springer drama!!

reviews.author: Steven S.
reviews.description: It's a smelly filthy place.   Ridiculous low end pool tables I wouldn't think about playing on.  Go back in the kitchen and look for yourself how filthy it is.   The entire place smells like a wet old homeless person.

reviews.author: Young K.
reviews.description: This is nice and cool place to hang out with friends and family.. dates..cause live music and play pools..also friendly great services from bars and wait staff..i am enjoying and have a great time on my each visit...thanks for all great services to management!!!

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: We went on a friday night and the place was relatively busy. Drinks were good, but the way under staffed for a friday night. The only reason I'm giving it a 4 star is for the fact that our waitress was trying soooo hard. She was running drinks, bar backing, cooking food and bartending. Also not to mention she was the only waitress there. But all in all we had a great time!

reviews.author: Jennifer Y.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out but they have smoking and for me that is a HUGE minus because I believe that such places should keep the environment clean and focused on the pool players.

reviews.author: Manda L.
reviews.description: The bartender, an older gentleman, has been extremely rude on the 3 occasions we have visited this bar.  The bar set up is great, but with rude staff like this why would I want to come back.  Bad service lost you 4 ladies who spend a good amount and tip well....and earned you a bad review.  If your staff is so miserable they cannot give good service, maybe it's time to clean house.

reviews.author: Nickie B.
reviews.description: A-OK place, but be warned you WILL smell like smoke if you come here.  They offer a bar with ample seating, plenty of individual tables for seating, several pool tables, have a stage (that was empty when we visited), have an outdoor patio and an add collection of gambling machines in the back corner.  I am sure it is not real gambling, but the game players certainly looked like they were in Vegas.  Prices are reasonable.  Would not come out of my way to come here, but it is a decent dive bar.

reviews.author: Danny M.
reviews.description: Let me just place some facts here as a ex customer!!   1. Chris is the rudest person there!! He treats everyone really bad and makes you feel like crap! So you go pay to get horrible service from him.   2. If you go gamble be prepared to share the machines with the workers as they are on their shift and serving you drinks as they have their machine on auto play and by that I've only seen one person dong this by the name of Desiree or Mrs Des for short.  Last time I saw her was a few weeks ago when I went after work to enjoy myself for a few drinks and even tho I go alone I do have friends there and she was so occupied playing and asking around if her machine was paying her a lady was complaining about how she hadn't give her her change back. It took her a long time to pay that lady back. It's not the first time I've seen her playing specially when it's slow but busy days won't stop her. Chris and her make a fabulous team as far as proving the worst service!!   3. Misty and the rest of the girls are the best workers there.   Too bad they lost me as a customer and will never spend one cent on that place ever again. Seeing employees playing as they work while others risk their hard worked money was the end of that. I already had enough with Chris being rude when you bother him because it seems that way. Good luck Shooters! This place has gone down hill since the past 6 months or so!!

reviews.author: Amgad E.
reviews.description: this place is terrible. They are racist and horrible. I came here to have a beer and for no reason the bar tender decided I was to leave. I had no problem with leaving as long as he refunded the beer I didn't even take a sip off - except he wouldn't. In fact he called d the cops and lied to them that I was disturbing the peace. I never  been more humiliated and disappointed before... this place is a total trash can for trashy racists

name: BB Rover's Cafe and Pub
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Trey W.
reviews.description: The food is good, pizza is GREAT and revolving beer selections are incredible. The staff is AWESOME and make you feel like you are part of the family. The atmosphere is great too! I definite MUST for any foodie or beer nerd.  Join the 101 club!

reviews.author: Mary S.
reviews.description: Old place, seemed to only have one guy waiting on everyone. He was friendly but frazzled. Never knew what was on the menu, was never offered one.

reviews.author: Arianna M.
reviews.description: Very racist if you aren't white, mostly a lot of older people so it's not that great if you're young and wanting a younger crowd. Also not very well staffed for a place with food and drinks.

reviews.author: Marie H.
reviews.description: Always a great vibe and cold drinks!! Staff is always great, food is always good and beer is always flowing!! Great little spot to have a drink and relax!

reviews.author: Bharath V.
reviews.description: I've been coming here for 20 years.   I know the current environment is a struggle and I'm pulling for small businesses and trying to support them in every way possible. That's why we came here.   After two hours at the establishment, a guy who identified himself as an employee who was there drinking  asked my friend to move from his chair to a bench because he was afraid the chair could break because, in his estimation, the $10 chair couldn't take his weight. After he'd been sitting there for two hours.   So. Completely.  Inappropriate.   I can't believe that this level of tone deaf insensitivity still exists today.   Needless to day I will never be

reviews.author: Adam E.
reviews.description: For three years when I lived in Austin I was a regular here multiple times a week. I know my taste for beer and my expanded knowledge and things I have tried could never be the same without this place.  Great vibe, good pub grub, and an unbelievable and well priced beer selection are the highlights.  I still have my checklist from this place ten years later and miss it direly.  If you are anywhere nearby and you fancy yourself a beer connoisseur you owe it to yourself to stop in and try several beers you've never heard of.  Huge credit to staff for providing great recommendations when you aren't sure where to look or where to start.

reviews.author: Kayla I.
reviews.description: One of my favorite places in Austin. Their soups are great, pizza is the best, burgers are so good and if you can handle unorthodox nachos yummmm I love those too. Don't even get me started how awesome their breakfast is!!!! You get like 3 plates of food for maybe $8 and it's the best! I get their English scramble which is basically a scrambled omlet, patty sausage and biscuits with gravy, I've been eating this same breakfast for over 15 years and it's always just as good as the last.   So why 4 stars? The wait for the food. I worked here for 4 years a decade ago, back then it took 20-30 Min to get food but lately it's been taking closer to an hour.   Seems it's up for sale. I'm praying someone buys it and changes nothing but the kitchen equipment to speed up delivery. I'm just positive with a few changes in service this place will be back to packed. I worked Sundays back in the day, between 11-1 I had a steady stream of tables and would be running to get to everyone, these days we are one of only 3-5 tables. It breaks my heart as everything else beside the wait times here is truly THE BEST!!!!  Favorites: Gumbo, Chicken Chipotle Salad, Chicken Philly Cheesesteak, BBQ pizza, any personal pizza,  Broccoli Cheese Soup, veggie basket (fried veggies) and of course the breakfast!!

reviews.author: Sasha R.
reviews.description: Stars are for beer selection alone. We haven't eaten here in many many years so can't vouch for food quality anymore.  Happy St. Patrick's Day!!

reviews.author: Joel T.
reviews.description: If you don't like neighborhood bars where time (and most daylight) stops at the door then read no further and don't judge pubs like this one.  This pub ticks off two of the must haves for a local bar:  Great beer selection and excellent, friendly people working there.  And it has great food on the menu to boot.  I stumbled on BB Rover's while waiting to meet someone for dinner.  I slipped in among what appeared to be regulars but didn't feel like and interloper at all.  Bartender who is attentive, unobtrusive and knows how to properly poor a Guinness?  Check.  Today's paper on the bar?  Check.  Sports on TV?  Spot on.  Oh, and they have Spaten Lager.  Ka.  Boom.    I saw a sign on the door the business is for sale.  Staff told me it is because the owners are ready to retire but they want the business to continue.  And the bartender says he would be willing to stay.  Keep the atmosphere, beer menu and your bartender, new owners, because it is a recipe for success.

reviews.author: Leila R.
reviews.description: I was supposed to meet someone here who recommended it, but ending up being stood up. However, if you are going to be stood up, then it might as well be at a place that has a decent reuben and stellar beer selection.  Quietly hidden on the backside of a plaze between the 183 N frontage road and Jollyville Rd, I would have never known this place existed. It very much has a that "local dive bar" feel, but the service was quick and courteous and though a bit on the greasy side (but not in an off-putting way) the food, especially for the price, was good. The reuben I got was tasty, the meat was not the best, but for $9 with a side of crispy fries, it was a steal.   The beer selection surprised me here. They have a huge bottle selection with a lot of the usual domestic and local suspects, but what impressed me was their draught offerings. Micro and craft brew offerings abounded and at very reasonable prices, even for the smaller pours.   All in all, glad I stopped in and discovered this place.

reviews.author: Tiana H.
reviews.description: Two stars for having better than average beer.   The bathrooms are horrendous. I literally drove to a Starbucks to pee after walking in. So. Freaking. Gross.  Also their bottle list is not chilled or cellared.

reviews.author: Jason C.
reviews.description: This is a good little pub, theyve been fighting the good fight for years and I can say Ive never had a bad pint there. If you are put off by the location or the strip mall then dont be. I can assure you its always been a good experience.

reviews.author: Alek Z.
reviews.description: A nice little hidden gem of a place. A solid neighborhood pub.  A good friend of mine lives right around the corner and recommended the place, so I met him with my girlfriend. The waitress was extremely attentive and patient with all of my cider questions (I do drink beer, I just prefer cider). Their kitchen is open until 10 pm, I believe, and they serve up some baller onion rings.   It's hidden away on a side street that in 26 years I have never once driven down. But I'm glad I did! It's a chill place.

reviews.author: Jenn F.
reviews.description: Hands down the worst service. Over 45 minutes to get our food. Took about 15 minutes between ordering drinks before they arrived. If you order a sprite, be prepared for a water. And when you tell them that you're ready to leave, your food magically appears. Would never recommend.

reviews.author: Gregory S.
reviews.description: The Food was really good   I ordered the Patty Melt it was awesome  you can stop googling for the best Patty melt because the best is at BB Rovers  it is the TRUE patty melt at a great Price  6.99   they have Lunch Specials as well  the wait person was very nice and Eugene the bartender was very nice   and they stay open till midnight

reviews.author: Justin R.
reviews.description: Second time I have been over here and if it was a bit closer to the house I would definitely be a regular.   1st - the food is surprisingly good. There are lots of options on the menu from the traditional bar food (burgers, pizza) to jambalaya, pastas, and shepard's pie  2nd - staff is always knowledgable and engaging.   3rd - great beer list and appropriate prices. Also have good wine list as well as full bar.   4th - much more of a dive bar than a stuffy bar which is nice to see in Austin!    Go visit this gem in the back of the strip center off of 183.

reviews.author: Amber B.
reviews.description: Great beer selection and pretzels.    Not a huge fan of the other food tho. It's bar food. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

reviews.author: Samuel C.
reviews.description: This is a first rate neighborhood bar.  A long and fine selection of beers.  Good music. (They were playing old metal when I was there.)  A good kitchen. (More on food below).  A nice friendly family atmosphere.  A pool table if you want one ... the normal sports TV .. and there is live music on the right nights (or the wrong nights if you don't like that particular band).  I ordered a barbecue pizza - a local concoction with lots of kielbasa, bbq sauce and a bunch of other meats.  It took a while to come because it was being hand made - and it was not the normal time for pizza.  (The bartender - who was as nice as he could possibly be - suggested the daily special - which was already all made up and could have been in front of me in a nanosecond. The special probably would have been just fine.)  The pizza was an honest non-corporate pizza.   Very thick whole wheat crust with a lot of taste.  Tons and tons of meat.  I ordered the small and the thing was huge.  If you order the large, make sure that you have the Jolly Green Giant and King Kong with you to help you eat it.  The pizza was fine with beer ...  but the superthick honest crust had the side effect of drowning out a lot of the flavors of the toppings.  (there is a reason italians put super-seasoned ingredients like pepperoni, hot sausage and anchovies on pizza. they want the topping to win the battle with the crust.)  so if i ever went back and ordered pizza - i would probably order a model with stronger tasting ingredients.   but i left having drunk well,  having eaten a lot of real home-made food and was basically happy.  My normal preferred bar haunts are places with 48 esoteric rye whiskeys and places that make elaborate cocktails that were invented yesterday.  But for a neighborhood bar, I don't see how you are going to do better than B B Rovers.  So leave your hipster friends at some record launch east of Comal, get your high school friend who lives just west of Anderson Mill and take her to B B Rovers.   You will have a better time than you would have drinking lavender flavored tequila and listening to a rancid new EP.

reviews.author: Tyler P.
reviews.description: Good beer, good company, I didn't try the food but the people where welcoming and attentive! Truly enjoyed my time hear very comfortable environment but could use a cleaner bathroom and better stools but over all best pub I've seen a a long time!

reviews.author: Stoney B.
reviews.description: Really cool vibe! Nice local pub with darts and pool. Very friendly bar staff. Very close to my house so definitely plan on visiting this place more.  The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars is because my experience with their food hasn't been that great. If you are only wanting drinks then this is a 5 star pub!!!

name: Pluckers Wing Bar - Lakeline
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Sunday

reviews.author: Dan K.
reviews.description: It's Pluckers y'all!  This might be my favorite location now because of the patio. (That includes pre-Covid too).  Get the Holy Mac and fried pickles. If you still have room get real food.  Everything on the menu is amazing and worth the calories you'll have to work off the next week.  Pro tip - if getting wings, get them with sauce on the side so they stay crispy.  At least that's what we do!

reviews.author: Voltaire L.
reviews.description: So I walk into the location and it's freezing as i am informing them they seem not to care at all. I am 281lbs and i had to walk out from the bar area because it was way to cold. I walk out shivering! Not one person or staff member cared. They just stated you can just get on a waiting list. Which i did! But where is the common sense l? Its 80 outside and it feels like 67 inside???   Why is this the culture?  Customer: it's freezing in here Lakeline Pluckers: Well do you want to wait for 45mins to an hour?  How is this your business motto? No, ok paying patron we can take your concern seriously and see what can be done. It was so cold the servers glass started to fog up!! What type of weather manipulation is this?   Imagine a cold beer  and its under 66 degrees!! Un comfortable!   I swear if I stayed in that section long enough it would have start snowing. They dont even have to put ice in the drinks for crying out loud.   I also informed staff to address the situation or i will write a review in regards. Just acknowledge its over kill! They literally ignored me! So Pluckers you have two issues at this location the temperature and the fact your staff provides customer service but no customer concerns is a oxy moronic!   They way they duck my concerns rebranding should change name to Duckers!!  Any way wear a sweater, jacket and or bear skin if you going to the bar for wings. If you have any concerns they will kill you with kindness and ignore you with repetition as if you didnt hear them and also voice a concern. Based on my bites rating (check other post)   They get *2 bites and nibble!  Food Beetle

reviews.author: Bobby G.
reviews.description: It's loud and messy (lots of kids) but a great selection of food. The waiter we had was really nice. The young woman greeting us was very welcoming.   Would be nice if they had a quieter area away from screaming kids, though.

reviews.author: Roy C.
reviews.description: Cool sports bar; it gets a little crowded but is part of the ambiance. Food is good, wings are depicted, and the beer is the best part, large size for the thirsty soul

reviews.author: Amy T.
reviews.description: We normally have great food when we come here. Last time I was here we had he blue cheese chicken cobb salad and it is always better here than at the RR location.  Drinks, well I am pregnant so no drinks here for the time being but last time we ordered a michelada she was very confused and was trying to give us the drink with the chicken wing on top. so we had to describe it to her and show her a pic from previous orders in the past and explain multiple time we just wanted the plain michelada no need for the frills - IMO i think it is just the area we were in.

reviews.author: Kaitlin O.
reviews.description: Family has been coming to pluckers for a number of years now and we have never strayed from our order of spicy ranch wings- that's how much we love them. The spiciness of the wings vary a lot though, with sometimes being not spicy at all and others being a bit too spicy. But if you don't want to get too messy eating wings and want a good dry rub, then I highly recommend the spicy ranch. You can also never go wrong with their tater tots or Mac and cheese- tater tots are always fresh and crunchy and the Mac and cheese is nicely baked and cheesy.   Overall, service has always been pretty good and is a great place to come to if you're craving chicken wings and want to watch sports and drink at the same time!

reviews.author: Angel H.
reviews.description: I placed an online order for pickup and mistakenly inputted the wrong pickup time, scheduling it for 2 hours past when I wanted the order; when I called to fix issue, staff was not able to help me. They advised me to cancel the order and replace it on the app. Unfortunately, I did not place the order via an app, and do not have an account, so I was unable to access the order after it was placed. When I called back to let them know was unable to cancel the order on my end, staff were still unable to help me modify my pickup time and said that since the order had not yet been received by their restaurant, the only thing she could do was wait until it came in and cancel the order at that time. She ended the conversation with: you'll get a notification in a few days on your account... (did not listen to the fact that I did not have an account!). Lo and behold, order was never cancelled and I am being charged nearly $50 for an order I never received. Its inexcusable. Staff need better customer service training. I am filing a dispute with my credit card.

reviews.author: Josias C.
reviews.description: I enjoyed my experience. The wait was acceptable. The food well prepared and servers attentive. They came by often the see if I needed refills on drinks or chicken.  They also gave nice little kids package to keep my little one occupied. I could see any game comfortably.

reviews.author: Jay S.
reviews.description: Best service and best pluckers in the Austin area !!! Friendly service and awesome management

reviews.author: Mary A.
reviews.description: There's no doubt about it, Pluckers is my absolute favorite wing joint in the Austin area. Their wings are just the best and their different sauces always satisfy any craving I have - whether that be sweet, savory, spicy, or crying spicy (shout-out fire in the hole!) the wings are big and crunchy and they always have some good cold beer to pair them with! If you're a fan of Micheladas, you'll love them here too! Especially the pickled green beans they add!   Their rewards program is awesome if you're a frequent buyer. You pay $20 and earn 1 point per every $1 spent on food. Once you get to 100 points, you can redeem for $10 off your bill. They also have specials which you can get for free when buying two entrees so really, the membership pays for itself rather quickly!   There's room for improvement in the Service but other than that, I love some Pluckers!

reviews.author: Cassandra S.
reviews.description: Don't come here if you're LGBTQIA+. The hosts and servers will just make snide remarks, discriminate against you, gaslight you for even believing that you're being discriminated against, and will make you feel so uncomfortable. My girlfriend and I didn't even place an order at this Pluckers location after the servers and hosts threw slurs at us underneath their breath. We felt so unwelcome and embarrassed to even exist. If you're cishet, this is the establishment for you. All others outside the norm avoid this location, it'll spare you a traumatic experience. I'll include a picture of our waitlist notification, to prove that we were actually there that night and were in fact in the restaurant when all of this occurred.

reviews.author: Michael A.
reviews.description: Was sat at 4:35, ordered 2lbs of chicken thighs (and was charged for them) as did my fiance (again charged for 2lbs). We waited for an entire hour before telling the waitress we were going to just leave, and of course, the food arrives at that exact moment. Fine we'll eat, even left a good tip. We box our leftovers and come home to weigh the thighs (we track calories and macros). Each thigh was between 3.5 and 4oz each, and we each received 4 thighs. That means we got 1lb each when we were charged for 2 each. I never received a refill on drinks, and it was all around a bad experience. I never leave reviews  but this was horrible. They also mess up curbside orders every single time I've ordered here.

reviews.author: Alan R.
reviews.description: This Pluckers has horrible service.  Several months ago, just as COVID was starting to escalate, we sat in the bar area and I saw the waitress carry my glass by the top.  I complained.  Several times since, when we sat in the bar area the service was horrible. They took forever ttake and deliver our orders, messed up our orders etc...  We decided that the service in the bar area was so bad we didn't want to sit there again.   Tonight, I used the pluckers app to join the wait list. We waited for 10  or 12 minutes. Once we were there the text said we only had three minutes to checkin (way too short in my opinion).. You can wait longer than that in line.   When we got to the host stand they asked us if... we minded sitting in the bar!! ??  My wife, of course, said NO.   The hostess basically rolldd her eyes then told us that she could add us to the waitlist again... At the bottom! ... And it would be another 15 minutes!  We left.  We are now eating at Texas Roadhouse.

reviews.author: Jeremy R.
reviews.description: Good service, good wings, clean dining area, will come back again.  Only complaint is I checked in online but when we arrived they said I wasn't on the list, frustrating seeing other people get a table right away while our family sat outside waiting for 30mins.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: This place was really crowded on a Saturday. We had some time between basketball games and wanted to grab a bite to eat. I have not been to Pluckers in a while and I guess they have changed a few things.  We didnt have a lot if time so we sat outside, it was covered. They had the plastic rolled down and heaters going so it wasn't bad. We were seated close to a heater then they asked us to move because we were too close to an exit? We didn't understand. Either way we were moved away from the heater and closer to other patrons.   We ordered wings, both grilled and fried.  The dry rubs aren't as good to me so I had grilled wings with the buffalo hot sauce.  The staff was just fine, did a good job of refilling drinks, checking in with us, etc.   What they brought out were chicken strips, not wings. I was a little disappointed in this, they were tough and stringy as well. Maybe it is due to Covid, I dont know but I had prepared for wings. Along with these being chicken strips and not wings there was a substandard amount of buffalo sauce on my order.  Overall it was ok, edible and met a basic human need of food but I will wait awhile before going back and check if they have wings or strips before I order.

reviews.author: Clint R.
reviews.description: Total joke. Came in at 3 pm and the place was mostly empty. Get told it's a 30 minute wait for a party of 4. Go into the bar area and get told we can't sit and have a beer on the table tops because those go through the host stand. Can't sit at the bar because we have a kid. Ask the manager if we can just sit and get a beer that we order from the bar while we wait for a table inside and get told no. I have never seen a place that doesn't let people sit at an empty table to order a drink while they wait in a half empty restaurant. We left... I would avoid as the management is clueless and terrible.

reviews.author: Robby S.
reviews.description: Inconsistent at best is how I would describe this pluckers location.  Recent visit on 5/29 both adult "10 wing combos" came out with the wings over cooked   What this location consistently does is over fry the kids meal "chicken bites". They come out hard as a rock and you can't even cut them with a knife.   I really like pluckers but the lakeline location closest to my home has gotten to the point it's worth driving to another location or entirely different establishment.  On a trip to San Antonio recently, I stopped by the pluckers in selma the food was great and really highlighted how bad the lakeline location is in comparison. I guess they don't have to try anymore since there's typically a line out the door

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: It's great to be seated on the patio and no one come to check on you.   I should of looked at the reviews first.  Waited 15 minutes and no one came.  Horrible service.

reviews.author: Karen M.
reviews.description: We order from Plucker's Lakeline often.  Our last order on 11/28/21 was horrible.  The wings were not fresh and seemed like they were probably had been sitting there, sauce thrown on them and heated up.  For the price of $1.85/wing (before taxes) is highway robbery.  Even the fries were not fresh.  We WILL NOT EVER ORDER FROM YOU ALL AGAIN! Very over rated and over priced!!  I'd rather drive a little further and go to Wings N More!  Horrible horrible horrible!  And huge waste of money!!

reviews.author: Brent G.
reviews.description: Nothing changes. So slow and inefficient. Hour wait time only because they have slow workers. Meanwhile there are close to a dozen empty tables. They run around chaotically and can't handle anything. If you sit at the bar high top area you will wait 20+ minutes between food orders and drink refills. They do not bus the tables and bar top. It's a complete mess. Stuff stacks up. Why or how Plucker's corporate hasn't fixed this location yet is mind boggling.   Total incompetence. Food is cold. Food takes forever. Servers ring up extra charges. They forget drinks and napkins, they sneakily upcharge you for 2 wing dipping sauces when 1 is not enough for 10 wings.

reviews.author: Lloyd J.
reviews.description: Total Wine and More has the best selection in the Austin area of every type of alcoholic beverage.   The liquor prices are better than those at other liquor stores/chain stores.  The beer selection is excellent.  The beer prices are competitive, and in most cases slightly lower than HEB and other grocery chains.  It is the best place for champagne, in both selection and price.

reviews.author: Caryn N.
reviews.description: The best place to get that special grown folks drink. The request of Hennessy VSOP came back with a successful win as we patiently waited to see if the kind staff had a bottle in stock!

reviews.author: Nicole F.
reviews.description: Excellent customer service during the COVID-19 pandemic!   I've never purchased alcohol here before, but we were running critically low on supplies during the stay-at-home orders. A friend told me they had curbside at Total Wine and More. I called to confirm there was the ability to have contactless curbside pick up and the person I spoke with was very nice on the phone (even though I assume they are getting an annoying amount of calls during this time).   Placing my order online was extremely easy. The UI was intuitive and was not confusing at all. There were a few points where they reminded you not to pick up your order until you received an email (or text if you opt in) to pick up your order. I appreciated the multiple points of clarity.   Both times we have ordered (once on a Saturday and once on a Thursday), our order was ready within the hour!  Pick up was easy. All you have to do is pull up to the marked, designated spots and send a text to the number on the sign. You have to provide your spot number and name. Once they come out, just hold your ID up to the window. Then they will place your order in your trunk. Easy peasy!   Definitely give this place a try if you're looking for contactless curbside!

reviews.author: Madison B.
reviews.description: They are always fully stocked! I got exactly what I needed and staff's friendly! Clean environment and good service.   Check out my OnlyFans  https://onlyfans.com/itsmattymay

reviews.author: J B.
reviews.description: The order was to come between 6pm and 7pm and there was a big storm. I called the driver and they said they would reattempt delivery because the storm had cleared. I called the store and they said they would reattempt delivery that night with another driver. At 8pm I called again to reconfirm so I didn't have to come in -- and again, I'd get it if they had to cancel, but I just needed heads up.  Minutes before closing, I got an automated email that said it was canceled and there was no call or additional note. I'm very disappointed. I know that they use a delivery service like Uber so it's not all within their control, but what poor customer service to not explain the situation, or to personalize the situation in any particular way beyond a click/cancel. It's wine, so it's not the end of the world, but next time I'll just pop into an H-E-B.

reviews.author: Marlon M.
reviews.description: Great savings on alcohol. Probably the best I've seen. The staff were friendly and assisted me in getting the Hennessy from the the locked glass case. They even provided tasteful suggestions that proved their knowledge of the selection in store. And when I couldn't find the 90 minute IPA I was buying for a friend, they were there to guide me to it.  The check out was painless also as the cashier Susanna was very personable and talked to my wife and I the whole time. She even made me toddler smile and feel a part of the conversation. Great people in this location. Will be back when I'm in Austin.

reviews.author: James W.
reviews.description: Super store indeed !!! Wall to wall beer, wine, and spirits. Very friendly staff took me directly to the two areas I needed to visit to grab some of Mrs. Texas' favorites which will last her a year !!! It was funny as I was driving off, I told my son, I guess liquor stores are essential during this time of uncertainty.

reviews.author: Laurie P.
reviews.description: I was a huge Total Wine fan when I lived in NJ.  I drove an hour + to stock up.  When they opened the Austin store a day before my birthday I was thrilled.   Still the same HUGE selection.  Still Conte Priola Pinot Grigio.  Sadly no Kitchen Sink red blend, but HEB carries it here.  Still fun tastings on the weekends.    Annoying cashier girl who awkwardly scans bottles in my cart despite me wanting to put them on the checkout conveyor thingie.    Overall a 4-5 star experience every time.  But yesterday we had a 10 star experience.  OMGoodness, you just have to find Stephen in the wine area.  He'll ask a few questions and recommend wines based on your tastes.  You will love each of his suggestions.  You will love his stories.  This sparkling wine was named after the granddaughter of the vineyard owner....  yes please.    Best liquor store ever.

reviews.author: Monifa M.
reviews.description: I love Total Wine. When ever I go on a road trip, as was the case with this visit, I stop in and stock up! There was plenty of hand sanitizer available at the entrance. There was a tasting station near the entrance with a nice lady offering samples of Mezcal from behind a plexiglass. We were warmly greeted by every employee we passed and offered assistance. The employees are very knowledgeable about their wines, I just told them the taste I was looking for and they led me right over to the options that matched. There's also a large refrigerated beef room in the back. Checkout was a breeze and our associate was engaging and sweet.

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: This store is always well stocked, clean and the staff is very helpful and courteous.  I was particularly impressed with the way they handled the  COVID mandates;  A sign was on the front door noting masks must be worn, ample hand sanitizers and wipes were readily at the entrance, and the carts are always clean.  From the very beginning of the pandemic, I was always comfortable shopping at Total Wine.  The store is arranged in such a way that although busy, there was plenty of room to social distance, including at check-out.

reviews.author: Rachelle M.
reviews.description: I went here with my brother for our birthday for the first time it's very overwhelming and awesome at the same time! We are not big drinkers but we wanted to celebrate our birthday drinking lol.We saw a $3300 bottle of cognac! The good stuff apparently!They have a huge selection of wines and also offers samples too! Plus they have snacks and cheeses and peanuts.We even bought shot glasses and a wine bottle opener! So far our favorite is the banana cream rum and limoncello! If you have t been here you gotta go! They have something for everyone.We found a California wine we really like from Napa also got a pineapple Rum from Barbados!The selection is unbelievable and I will be back!We didn't even make it to the beer section! They also sell glasses for wine and liquor!

reviews.author: Daniel W.
reviews.description: My fiancé, along with our wedding planner, had a consultation yesterday with Tim for our wedding. It was phenomenal! Tim had several wines and spirits prepped for us to try. He gave us great info on every drink we tried and helped us build a menu that meets our needs, personality, and budget! Tim and Total Wine exceeded our expectations for sure.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: I love this place, the staff is knowledgeable and willing to help. They can be overly serious at times, not rude but not smiles or talkative. The samples are always plentiful and varied.  They have great deals and a huge wide varied selection as well as some high class expensive liquors for refined tastes. They also stock a ungodly amount of small sample, airplane sized bottles of liquor of famous and lesser known types.  They always have several check outside running and lots of neat extra items like gift sets, hangover cures, bottle openers, margarita machines and stuff to create your own bar.   For the holidays they have some unique items such as the moose cup from National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation.  Check it out. I promise you will find new and known drinks and much more besides.

reviews.author: Michelle L.
reviews.description: We just purchased a Keurig Drinkworks Machine.  You put a pod filled with mixer and alcohol and you can have mixed drinks anytime you want.  The problem is living in Texas you cannot buy the pods online from Keurig.  The only stores that carry them in Texas are Total Wine in Houston and Specs in Houston.  I called Specs and the person I talked to was friendly, she knew what I was talking about and said she would look into the distributor and how they could get them in Austin.  I called Total Wine and had to talk to 4 different people, none of whom seemed interested in doing what Specs offered to do.  We place monthly orders with Total Wine for wine and spend a significant amount of money.  Guess we will move our wine purchasing to Specs :(

reviews.author: Jay N.
reviews.description: Luv this store, (have shopped in this chain of stores in other states)Always friendly helpful staff - great selection of wines, spirits cigars and beers -party central, or if you are just looking for a nice bottle of wine for dinner or beer to watch sports with friends. A great concept everything under one roof

reviews.author: Scott M.
reviews.description: Saw them actively discriminating against one of society's most vulnerable groups today. Will not return.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: A shout-out to my friends for inviting me to this. I think they were trying to prove me wrong. Here's what I mean: I'm a wine drinker - a dry, red wine drinker. On occasion, I'll sip an appletini or two. During game night, we were talking about one of our favorite subjects, liquor, and I mentioned not liking cognac. Well, my girl, Nickie, told me I've got it wrong and not to knock it until I've tried it again at this event- hence an invitation to a Hennessy tasting event at Total Wine. Talk about a lovely time! They served food (thank goodness), Hennessy (oh, yeah!), and even gave us recipe cards to try at home - oh, and did I mention the stainless steel martini-shaker? I learned a lot about the origins of this drink and how it's made. It was quite interesting. Everyone was having a good time, and the samples were very yummy. Real yummy! I'm a convert and hate to admit it. I hope my friends don't read this review!

reviews.author: Tori R.
reviews.description: Awful place. Management is extremely rude and discriminatory. Won't get my business again.

reviews.author: John I.
reviews.description: Once again the staff drag a rating down. Is it so hard to be customer-oriented? Well, at this place it is. The employees act like they will run over you so you have to walk defensively. Seriously, it is like customers are invisible and they are running a warehouse because even when they cut you off, and they will, they don't say excuse me. If you are lucky enough to find what you are looking for you will get a great value but then you schlep to the checkout lane and that is hit or miss as well. Well, mostly miss in my experience. Good luck!

reviews.author: Ken M.
reviews.description: Great selection, nice sales associates thought the store... except for the cashiers and "managers".  Cashier refused to honor this coupon that was on a bottle. She then called over a manager (called her Julie, but her name tag said Megan).  The manager said we had to mail in the coupon and absolutely refused to help us any further.  She even pointed to the address on the coupon and walked off like we were illiterate.  But the coupon states it's for the retailer, not the consumer.  If your employees can't even be bothered to care, then I'd rather support a local shop, like Twin Liquors.
